284. Added class BookError and class BookPageContentError to beta.
285. Moved type EntityHungerComponent, EntitySaturationComponent, EntityExhaustionComponent from beta into 2.1.0
286. Moved EntityEquippableComponent properties totalArmor and totalToughness from beta into 2.1.0
287. Class ModalFormDataTextFieldOptions. Field defaultValue type changed from string to minecraftserver.RawMessage | string
288. Field defaultValue type changed from string to minecraftserver.RawMessage | string
289. Fixed choppiness in Player.applyImpulse and Player.clearVelocity for beta
290. Added setFov with CameraFovOptions parameter. This can be used to modify the FOV of the current camera Added class LootTableManager to beta, which allows for generation of loot from entities and blocks
291. Added class LootTableManager to beta, which allows for generation of loot from entities and blocks
292. Added easing options for clearing a custom FOV. Clearing without valid easing values will instantly clear the custom FOV value
293. Adding a new server side biome component surface_builder that will combine the components surface_parameters, frozen_ocean_surface, mesa_surface, swamp_surface, capped_surface, and the_end_surface into one component. Each biome can only use one builder type. The component can be used for world generation settings such as foundation material and sea floor depth.
294. Added "minecraft:humidity" component with "is_humid" this forces a biome to either always be humid or never humid. Humidity effects the spread chance, and spread rate of fire in the biome.
295. Added 'minecraft:partially_frozen' This component will impact the temperature in a frozen biome, causing some areas to not be frozen. Ex: patchy ice, patchy snow.
296. Added the fov_set keyword to the /camera command for changing the camera's field of view. Enabled with the Experimental Creator Camera toggle
297. 'locate structure' command (and similar structure-searching gameplay elements) will now quickly return no result if experimental Custom Biomes have replaced all of the biomes where that structure could appear
298. When loading a chunk that used a removed custom biome, the removed biome is now replaced with the dimension's default biome, which is Ocean in the overworld
299. max_distance_from_center now parses horizontal and vertical values separately in an object while supporting horizontal only with parsing as a constant, the vertical value is now optional and defaults to having no limit.
300. Changed structure definitions folder from worldgen/jigsaw_structures to worldgen/structures.

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/38581287884557-Minecraft-1-21-100-Bedrock

1.21.93/94.title: Minecraft - 1.21.93/94 (Bedrock)
1.21.93/94.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.21.93/94 (Bedrock)**__
> Another small hotfix (1.21.94) is being rolled out.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed an issue that caused entities in some Marketplace packs to revert to their vanilla behaviors
2. Fixed a bug causing packs in world templates to disappear ( MCPE-222906 )
3. Added music disc "Lava Chicken" by Hyper Potions Drops when defeating a baby Zombie riding a Chicken (Chicken Jockey)
4. Drops when defeating a baby Zombie riding a Chicken (Chicken Jockey)
5. Split-screen players on PlayStation and Switch can now access their player data (e.g. inventory) created in 1.21.80 and earlier ( MCPE-222048 )
6. Slightly reduced the emissive intensity of Torches, Redstone Torches, Soul Torches, and Soul Lanterns in Vibrant Visuals ( MCPE-222020 )
7. Fixed parent_setup not running with the correct context, which caused animation issues in some packs
8. Glowing text on Signs no longer gets overly bright when looked at directly in Vibrant Visuals
9. Fixed performance degradation when a Happy Ghast is leashed close to the ground ( MCPE-222147 )
10. Air friction is now only applied to Boats when they are leashed ( MCPE-222298 ) Boats are still prevented from orbiting the player when leashed Boats once again retain momentum when moving off ledges
11. Boats are still prevented from orbiting the player when leashed
12. Boats once again retain momentum when moving off ledges
13. Fixed issue where the player was not able to move the camera while using the interact buttons on touch devices ( MCPE-220353 )
14. Added a new condition passenger_of_entity that allows checking which vehicle entity type is being ridden by the damaged entity that is dropping loot Like damaged_by_entity , allows specifying an entity_type field to check against when deciding which entry in a loot table to select
15. Like damaged_by_entity , allows specifying an entity_type field to check against when deciding which entry in a loot table to select
16. Added a new condition is_baby that allows checking if the entity that is dropping loot is a baby

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/37810171798029-Minecraft-1-21-93-94-Bedrock

1.21.92.title: Minecraft - 1.21.92 (Bedrock)
1.21.92.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.21.92 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released to address a few issues with the 1.21.90 release. Please continue to report and upvote any bugs you find atbugs.mojang.com.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed an issue that could cause split-screen players to always show as Guests on Xbox ( MCPE-222048 )
2. Fixed an issue that could cause players to get disconnected from multiplayer worlds when attempting to add split-screen players
3. Projectile tolerance margin is now incremented based on the total time active in the world ( MCPE-220496 ) Previously, projectile tolerance margin was expanded for every flight tick Now, projectile tolerance margin is expanded for every active tick, regardless of projectile travel state
4. Previously, projectile tolerance margin was expanded for every flight tick
5. Now, projectile tolerance margin is expanded for every active tick, regardless of projectile travel state
6. Items that are less than 16 pixels in width or height now render properly again
7. Custom skyboxes in texture packs will now render on non-Vibrant Visuals settings ( MCPE-221318 )
8. Fix to restore original behavior where null components in entity definition files were allowed to parse and load correctly

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/37486954069645-Minecraft-1-21-92-Bedrock

1.21.90.title: Minecraft: Bedrock Edition 1.21.90 - Chase the Skies
1.21.90.md:
__**Minecraft: Bedrock Edition 1.21.90 - Chase the Skies**__
> Experience the joy of soaring above the Overworld with our Chase the Skies drop! This drop not only brings an exciting flying mount to Minecraft but opens up the skies for exploring, building – and more. Raise your ghastling with care and it'll let you soar with friends above the clouds once fully grown. Build high into the sky, leash a caravan of camels together, uncover a new music disc, find wandering friends with the Player Locator bar, and more. Players on Bedrock Edition can also soak in breath-taking views with Minecraft's biggest official visual refresh – Vibrant Visuals. Are you ready to begin a skyward adventure? Play today!

**Fixes:**
1. Can be found in the Nether in Nether Fossil structures
2. Can be crafted with 1 Soul Sand Block and 8 Ghast Tears
3. When waterlogged it undergoes 3 states over about 20 minutes until it spawns a Ghastling mob
4. Makes sounds and shows particles depending on state
5. If mined during the waterlogging, it will revert to its “dry” state regardless of what state it has reached during waterlogging
6. Will revert states back to its initial “dry” state when it is taken away from being waterlogged, using the same time scale
7. Piglins can give Dried Ghast Blocks when bartered with
8. Added new achievement "Stay Hydrated!"
9. Spawns from a Dried Ghast block that has continuously been waterlogged for about 20 minutes
10. After spawning, the Ghastling will try and follow: Players within a 16-block radius or An adult, non-aquatic passive mob (and some neutral mobs) within a 16-block radius
11. Players within a 16-block radius or
12. An adult, non-aquatic passive mob (and some neutral mobs) within a 16-block radius
13. If no player or suitable mob is close around the Ghastling will idle around within 32 blocks from its home position (where it spawned or was last interacted with)
14. Can be tempted and fed using Snowballs
15. Will grow up into a Happy Ghast after about 20 minutes (or faster if fed Snowballs)
16. Can be summoned using the command: /summon happy_ghast ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ minecraft:spawn_baby
17. Spawns from a Ghastling after about 20 minutes (or faster if Ghastling is fed Snowballs)
18. Can be equipped with a harness and then be mounted by up to 4 players
19. Tempted by Snowballs and Harness. Harness tempting only works if the Happy Ghast is unharnessed
20. Has no panic behavior when taking damage
21. Cannot be bred
22. Slowly regenerates health, with regeneration speeding up during rain, snow or when flying at the same height as clouds are rendered
23. The first player that mounts the Happy Ghast will control it, sitting in front of the Happy Ghast, just above its face
24. When a player mounts, the goggles on the Happy Ghast go down to cover its eyes, indicating that it can now be controlled
25. Other players who mount after the pilot is mounted, are placed in slots on each side of the Happy Ghast, starting clockwise from the “pilot” player
26. Pressing crouch button dismounts the player on top of the Happy Ghast
27. If the Happy Ghast detects players on top of it, it then ceases all movement and aligns to the closest cardinal horizontal direction
28. This happens regardless of it having a harness equipped or not
29. 3rd person camera is moved back when player is mounted on the Happy Ghast
30. When there are no players mounted or walking on the Happy Ghast, the goggles go up and the Happy Ghast starts to roam around the home position
31. If players dismount midair, the Happy Ghast will descend towards the ground before it resumes roaming
32. Cannot enter Boats
33. Idles around within 64 blocks from its home position (where it spawned or last was interacted with)
34. If wearing a harness, the Happy Ghast idles closer to the home position (within 32 blocks)
35. The Happy Ghast will try to stay close to blocks when roaming on its own
36. Crafted out of 3 Leather, 2 Glass Blocks and 1 Wool Block, the Harness will have the same color as the Wool Block used when crafting
37. Can be re-dyed
38. Can only be equipped on a Happy Ghast
39. Allows up to 4 players to mount the Happy Ghast
40. Can be removed from the Happy Ghast using Shears but only when no players are mounted
41. The Locator Bar is a new UI element on the Player HUD that displays the direction of other Players in the World
42. When there are multiple Players in a World, the Locator Bar will appear on-screen for each Player, replacing the Experience Bar. The Player Level number will still be visible as before above the Locator Bar
43. The Locator Bar will display colored indicators when the camera is facing within 120 degrees towards another Player. If another Player is 30 degrees above or below the camera's viewport (the screen) an up or down arrow will be displayed
44. Crouching will hide the Player, preventing their indicator from appearing on the Locator Bar of other Players
45. Players in Spectator Mode are not visible on the Locator Bar
46. A Mob Head or a Carved Pumpkin will similarly hide Players from the Locator Bar when worn in the head slot.
47. Using a Potion of Invisibility will also hide players from the Locator Bar
48. We are making Saddles craftable and generally making it easier to remove them from mobs by using Shears. We have also added Leather to some loot tables instead of Saddles
49. Saddles can now be crafted with 3 Leather and 1 Iron Ingot
50. Recipe popup happens when a player picks up their first Leather
51. Monster Room chests
52. Ancient City chests
53. Desert Pyramid chests
54. Jungle Pyramid chests
55. Stronghold altar chests
56. Attaching a leashed entity to another entity and using Shears to cut leashes now take precedence over other interactions Example: Attempting to shear a leashed Sheep will now un-leash it instead of shearing it
57. Example: Attempting to shear a leashed Sheep will now un-leash it instead of shearing it
58. Leash break distance is now calculated between the centers of the two entities' collision boxes, aligning with the rest of the leash physics calculations
59. Using a Firework Rocket to boost while flying with an Elytra now causes leashed mobs to unleash
60. Entities can now be leashed to a pre-existing Leash Knot by interacting with it
61. Players can retrieve entities tied to a Leash Knot by interacting with it
62. To leash an entity to another entity, the player must: Have the entity already leashed to themselves Sneak and interact with the target entity while holding the leash
63. Have the entity already leashed to themselves
64. Sneak and interact with the target entity while holding the leash
65. Leashed entities can now be "stolen" by leashing them again, transferring ownership to the player
66. If re-leashing an entity would result in immediate leash snapping due to distance, the re-leashing cannot be done
67. To prevent erratic behavior when leashed to each other, Llamas that are leashed no longer attempt to form caravans
68. A leashed entity cannot be leashed to itself
69. Baby mobs can only be leashed one way - to another entity; they cannot have other mobs leashed to them
70. Known issue: When two mobs are connected, it results in the lead being rendered with an erroneous y-axis offset and appearing below one of the mobs
71. When leashed to a Happy Ghast, Horses, Camels, Donkeys, Mules, Boats, Chest Boats, and Sniffers now adjust their position gradually over time, aligning smoothly with their leash holder when suspended mid-air
72. In all other cases, entities align to the direction they are being pulled and no longer behave erratically when suspended mid-air
73. Mid-air friction now applies to Boats just like any other entity, meaning they can no longer orbit the player or behave excessively bouncily
74. The distance at which leashes break has been increased to 12 blocks, except for the Happy Ghast, which has a leash break distance of 16 blocks
75. When dragged on the leash, leashed objects will now orient themselves towards the leasher
76. The distance between centers of entities bounding boxes, rather than their feet is used to determine the distance between two leashed entities
77. Boats and large leashable mobs that cannot fit in a Boat (Horses, Donkeys, Mules, Camels, and Sniffers) when leashed to a Happy Ghast are rendered with four leashes instead of one
78. In this configuration, the harnessed Happy Ghast also features a custom rope layer wrapping around it
79. Shears can now be used on leashed entities to unleash them, removing both incoming and outgoing leash connections
80. Shears can now be used to remove Leash Knots
81. Players cannot cut other players' leashes
82. Dispensers can now use shears to unleash leashed entities
83. Saddles, Horse Armor, Harnesses, and Carpets can now be removed from the mobs they can be equipped on by using Shears
84. Saddles, Horse Armor, Harnesses, and Carpets cannot be removed by using Shears while the mob has a rider
85. Saddles, Horse Armor, Harnesses, and Carpets cannot be removed by using Shears while the player is sneaking
86. Saddles cannot be removed from Ravagers using Shears
87. Dispensers with Shears cannot remove Saddles, Horse Armor, Harnesses, or Carpets equipped on mobs
88. Removing Saddles, Horse Armor, Harnesses, and Carpets using Shears now plays custom sounds
89. Added the following new music tracks by Amos Roddy to Cherry Groves, Forest, Desert, Grove, and Lush Cave Biomes: Below and Above Broken Clocks Fireflies Lilypad O's Piano
90. Below and Above
91. Broken Clocks
92. Fireflies
93. Lilypad
94. O's Piano
95. Added a new Music Disc with the track "Tears" by Amos Roddy
96. The Ghast now drops the "Tears" Music Disc when killed by a Fireball deflected by a Player
97. Vibrant Visuals is Minecraft's biggest official visual enhancement - delivering a dazzling cosmetic upgrade with a new modern graphics pipeline and an array of visual improvements. Sunrises are more vivid, water reflects, forests become shaded, and more!
98. Vibrant Visuals preserves what makes Minecraft uniquely special - pixelated shadows, caustics, and reflections have been carefully crafted to preserve and enhance Minecraft's signature blocky style
99. With updated textures for blocks, items, and more that decide how different light sources interact with them, builds will become more vivid and visually interesting!
100. Updated art settings and post-processing effects tie the visuals together in a signature Minecraft way
101. As a cosmetic enhancement to the game, Vibrant Visuals does not impact Minecraft's gameplay, meaning you can play on Realms with friends whether they have Vibrant Visuals enabled or not (Realms subscription sold separately. Multiplayer functionality will require platform specific online subscriptions, also sold separately)
102. Made Vibrant Visuals the default graphics mode for supported devices
103. To switch to Vibrant Visuals on Xbox One, Xbox One S, PlayStation 4, and some Android devices, players need to select "Vibrant Visuals" in the Video menu using the Graphics Mode drop-down. Performance may degrade for these devices.
104. Customized atmospherics, color grading, fog and lighting for the End, the Nether, the Overworld dimensions and a variety of biomes in Vibrant Visuals Temporarily reverted weather-related changes to sky color in Vibrant Visuals while some issues are sorted out.
105. Temporarily reverted weather-related changes to sky color in Vibrant Visuals while some issues are sorted out.
106. Added MERS texture support for Signs in Vibrant Visuals
107. Added new texture assets for a variety of trims, particles, spawn eggs, water and the dark oak boat in Vibrant Visuals
108. Updated the appearance of metals for a variety of block textures in Vibrant Visuals
109. Updated the Cave Vines, Chorus Flower, Pumpkin, Firefly Bush and a variety of other plant textures in Vibrant Visuals.
110. Updated the Bee, Dolphin, Ghast, Pig Saddle and Strider textures in Vibrant Visuals
111. Updated a variety of MERS textures in Vibrant Visuals Made Glass Blocks more reflective Tweaked metallics on Cauldrons and Ancient Debris Tweaked emissives on Eyeblossom Fixed an issue with Leather armor having a stripe of emissive across the texture Added emissive to the Ender Crystal Block to match item icon Added MERS textures for Happy Ghast and Harnesses Adjusted the Glow Lichen block emissive
112. Made Glass Blocks more reflective
113. Tweaked metallics on Cauldrons and Ancient Debris
114. Tweaked emissives on Eyeblossom
115. Fixed an issue with Leather armor having a stripe of emissive across the texture
116. Added emissive to the Ender Crystal Block to match item icon
117. Added MERS textures for Happy Ghast and Harnesses
118. Adjusted the Glow Lichen block emissive
119. Fixed water not being rendered on the opposite side of clouds in Vibrant Visuals ( MCPE-203239 )
120. Reduced ghosting of waterfalls from camera movement when volumetric fog is enabled in Vibrant Visuals. ( MCPE-204062 )
121. The Night Vision effect now brightens the scene more consistently across brightness settings with Vibrant Visuals enabled ( MCPE-201809 )
122. Volumetric fog no longer becomes suddenly bright when the player moves towards a block light in Vibrant Visuals ( MCPE-201984 )
123. The back faces of transparent items held in hand, like Stained Glass, are no longer visible in Vibrant Visuals
124. Clouds no longer have a pink or yellow tint, during sunrise and sunset respectively, in Vibrant Visuals
125. Fixed an issue in Vibrant Visuals where black boxes sometimes appeared on End Portals when using TAAU at a non-native resolution ( MCPE-212398 )
126. Fixed a bug in Vibrant Visuals where materials with certain properties rendered black
127. Updated the clouds texture
128. Item bobbing will no longer stagger when the amount of days is high ( MCPE-190647 )
129. Entering pause while breaking a block will reset the breaking animation ( MCPE-191029 )
130. The local player's vehicle will now always be eligible for rendering, no matter the orientation of the model compared to the render bounding box
131. the_end_light_flash sound effect now triggers when the light flashes in The End dimension in Vibrant Visuals
132. Crimson and Warped Roots cannot be lit on fire or burn anymore ( MCPE-80066 )
133. Fixed issue where Jungle Leaves did not become transparent when setting all leaf types to be transparent ( MCPE-110630 )
134. Dispensing a Lava Bucket on waterlogged blocks no longer empties the bucket without placing Lava ( MCPE-178295 )
135. Maximum Beacon beam height is now 2048 ( MCPE-190223 )
136. Beacon now renders from any loaded chunk in worlds versioned 1.21.90 and higher
137. Fixed Sculk Vein block looking small and elongated when held or in an item frame
138. Text to speech will select an appropriate voice if available when changing in-game language on Android, iOS, and Win10
139. Fixed a bug where players could hear sounds played with /playsound even if they were in a different dimension than the one the sound was played in ( MCPE-184566 )
140. The camera default command will now properly reset third person camera view offset values
141. The /controlscheme command no longer requires the "Experimental Creator Camera" toggle
142. Fixed a crash that would sometimes occur when using Command Blocks
143. Fixed an issue where swapping item slots during an attack against a mob would re-select the original item slot used during the attack instead of staying on the new inventory slot item
144. Fixed entering the water while sprinting from double tapping forward no longer automatically enters the swimming state ( MCPE-216867 )
145. Repositioned the teleporting point when using an End Gateway to not be too close to a cliff edge, if possible. As a result, End island portals that teleport the player outside of the map border will no longer kill the player ( MCPE-174465 ) ( MCPE-174465 )
146. Fixed issue where sprint jump attacking would sometimes remove all of the player's momentum ( MCPE-189501 )
147. Fixed a bug where hitting blocks while swimming would cause players to slow down too much ( MCPE-201832 )
148. Using a custom equippable block item in creative mode will no longer duplicate the item and equip it; it will simply place the block in the world
149. Added a painting of a good boy by artist Sarah Boeving
150. Gamertags are now used on all platforms to identify players in cross-platform multiplayer games
151. The Trident is now grouped with other tools/weapons in the Creative inventory ( MCPE-181002 )
152. Mace with Wind Burst enchantment once again launches players as high as it does on Java Edition ( MCPE-185829 )
153. The recipe for Leads has been updated to no longer require a Slime Ball
154. Now the Mooshroom Spawn Egg uses its own colors and no longer has two pixels that are the same as the Cow Spawn Egg texture
155. Spore Blossoms destroyed by water are now dropped as items ( MCPE-127677 )
156. The size of the Blaze and Breeze spawn eggs have been reduced to better match the mobs' in-game size ( MCPE-217634 )
157. Fixed inconsistent pixels on the Pale Oak Boat and Pale Oak Boat with Chest items to match other boat items
158. The Green Harness item no longer uses the Gray Harness texture when Vibrant Visuals is enabled
159. Piglin Brutes will now despawn properly on peaceful difficulty ( MCPE-88837 )
160. Mobs will no longer clip through blocks sometimes when viewing them at a distance when they auto step up a block
161. Shadows are no longer rendered for entities that are riding a vehicle, unless said vehicle is invisible ( MCPE-200797 )
162. Pigs saddled by hand no longer drop two saddles when killed (All pigs saddled by hand between 1.21.70 and now will still drop their duplicated saddles on death)
163. Increased attack range for Blaze from 16 to 48 blocks to match its target detection range ( MCPE-35647 )
164. Increased Blaze attack sound distance to 32 to match Java Edition
165. Fixed bug where Ghasts could not move while shooting fireballs ( MCPE-201849 )
166. Slimes and Magma Cubes no longer jump twice when finding or losing their targets ( MCPE-114701 )
167. Fixed a bug where Magma Cubes and Slimes could still damage players briefly after dying ( MCPE-166394 )
168. Now the Cold Cow variant has the correct mirroring of its horn texture
169. Flying mobs no longer make footstep sounds when moving close to the ground
170. Ghasts can no longer spawn in areas that are too small, preventing suffocation on spawn
171. Spiders and Cave Spiders can once again spawn with a Stray rider in cold biomes ( MCPE-89549 )
172. Spiders and Cave Spiders can once again spawn with a Wither Skeleton rider in the Nether ( MCPE-89549 )
173. Horses, Donkeys, and Mules can now be fed carrots to heal, grow, and improve their temper
174. Happy Ghast can now be pushed by other mobs even while being ridden, except when made immobile by a player standing on it
175. Fixed a bug where Parrots imitating a Drowned used Zombie sounds
176. Fixed a bug where Parrots imitating a Wither Skeleton used Skeleton sounds ( MCPE-174857 )
177. Sound files for breaking and placing Grass blocks are now slightly louder
178. Leashing, unleashing, collecting leashed mobs, and leashing mobs to other mobs now play custom sounds
179. Fence knots now play a sound when destroyed, either by being punched or when all their leashed entities are gone ( MCPE-21743 )
180. Music will now fade normally when leaving a world if game pause is disabled ( MCPE-212932 )
181. Updated the frequency and location of various ambient block sounds
182. Dead Bush ambient sounds now have a slightly increased chance of playing
183. Ambient Sand sounds no longer require sky access to play, have a slightly decreased chance to play, and can now play in all biomes
184. Terracotta block no longer triggers ambient Sand sounds
185. Sand blocks no longer trigger ambient wind sounds
186. Short Dry Grass blocks and Tall Dry Grass blocks can now trigger ambient wind sounds when above 2 Sand/Red Sand or Terracotta blocks
187. Terracotta blocks no longer trigger ambient wind sounds
188. Projectiles now have a tolerance margin that changes over time ( MCPE-201608 ) Previously, all projectiles had a fixed 0.3 blocks tolerance margin added to the collision Now, all projectiles start with no margin for the first two ticks of their flight After that, the target margin will expand by 0.05 blocks per tick until it reaches the target margin of 0.3 blocks This allows for more precise collision on targets close to the shooting player or entity, while still allowing for some collision leeway for targets further away
189. Previously, all projectiles had a fixed 0.3 blocks tolerance margin added to the collision
190. Now, all projectiles start with no margin for the first two ticks of their flight
191. After that, the target margin will expand by 0.05 blocks per tick until it reaches the target margin of 0.3 blocks
192. This allows for more precise collision on targets close to the shooting player or entity, while still allowing for some collision leeway for targets further away
193. Realm owners can now choose to require members to opt into the Timeline in order to play on the Realm To turn this feature on, go to Realms Stories --> Settings and enable "Require opt in to Timeline" The feature can be turned on and off at will While the feature is on, Realm members who have not opted in will remain members of the Realm, but will not be able to play until they opt in If a Realm member who previously opted in chooses to opt out, they will not be able to play on the Realm until they opt in again Realm owners will be able to play on the Realm regardless of whether they have opted in
194. To turn this feature on, go to Realms Stories --> Settings and enable "Require opt in to Timeline" The feature can be turned on and off at will
195. The feature can be turned on and off at will
196. While the feature is on, Realm members who have not opted in will remain members of the Realm, but will not be able to play until they opt in If a Realm member who previously opted in chooses to opt out, they will not be able to play on the Realm until they opt in again
197. If a Realm member who previously opted in chooses to opt out, they will not be able to play on the Realm until they opt in again
198. Realm owners will be able to play on the Realm regardless of whether they have opted in
199. On the Realm tab, the 'Options' button has been replaced with two buttons: 'Settings' takes the user to a Realm Settings page where the user can edit their worlds or make other adjustments to their Realm 'Add friends' takes the user to a page where they can manage members of their Realm and add new ones
200. 'Settings' takes the user to a Realm Settings page where the user can edit their worlds or make other adjustments to their Realm
201. 'Add friends' takes the user to a page where they can manage members of their Realm and add new ones
202. The effect radius of Splash Potions is now calculated based on the distance to the bounding box of the target instead of their position ( MCPE-201604 )
203. Fix a crash in split-screen mode when a player would destroy a chest or book an other player had open
204. Fixed an issue where a resource pack error could be encountered when transferring between servers that use different versions of the same resource pack

212. Fixed an issue where only changing the access of PlayStation friends to your world would not be saved when exiting the menu
213. To maintain feature parity with the flat world presets in the Java Edition, the Snowy Kingdom flat world preset has been updated to use a snow layer instead of a snow block ( MCPE-194367 )

309. Fixed a bug with the minecraft:geometry component where the full block geometry identifier minecraft:geometry.full_block was being ignored for several behaviors, including: Mob spawning (mobs with custom spawn rules can now spawn on blocks using full block geometry) Chest obstruction (blocks with full block geometry will now obstruct Chests) Grass and Farmland survival (Grass and Farmland will turn into Dirt with a block using full block geometry above them) Nylium survival (Nylium will turn into Netherrack with a block using full block geometry above it) Vine growth (Vines will now spread to blocks using full block geometry) Breathability (Mobs and actors can no longer breathe in blocks using full block geometry)
310. Mob spawning (mobs with custom spawn rules can now spawn on blocks using full block geometry)
311. Chest obstruction (blocks with full block geometry will now obstruct Chests)
312. Grass and Farmland survival (Grass and Farmland will turn into Dirt with a block using full block geometry above them)
313. Nylium survival (Nylium will turn into Netherrack with a block using full block geometry above it)
314. Vine growth (Vines will now spread to blocks using full block geometry)
315. Breathability (Mobs and actors can no longer breathe in blocks using full block geometry)

Added the "minecraft:leashable_to" component: Allows players to leash entities to the owner entity, retrieve those already leashed, or free them using shears Players can leash entities to the owner entity by sneaking and interacting while having entities leashed to themselves The "can_retrieve_from" field determines whether players can retrieve entities leashed to the owner entity

347. Added new fields to the "minecraft:leashable" component: "can_be_cut": Determines whether players can cut both incoming and outgoing leashes by using shears on the entity "spring_type": A "presets" subfield that defines the type of spring-like force pulling the entity toward its leash holder Available values: "bouncy": Simulates a highly elastic spring that never reaches equilibrium if the leashed entity is suspended mid-air "dampened": Simulates a dampened spring attached to the front of the leashed entity's collision that reaches equilibrium if the entity is suspended mid-air and aligns with its movement direction. "quad_dampened": Simulates four dampened springs connected to the center of each side of the entity's collision that reaches equilibrium if the entity is suspended mid-air and gradually aligns with the leash holder over time "rotation_adjustment": A "presets" subfield that adjusts the rotation at which the entity reaches equilibrium

492. Custom components v2 experiment no longer required to use custom components v2
493. Custom components v2 is available in JSON versions 1.21.90 and higher
494. "minecraft:custom_components" deprecated in 1.21.90
495. Fix for incorrect normals and/or crashes when holding certain items in hand with Vibrant Visuals enabled
496. Fixed issue with the player_relative control scheme that made it really hard to travel directly forward or directly backwards
497. Fixed an issue where the player's head would sometimes jitter when using certain control schemes
498. Fixed the default control schemes for all cameras
499. Fixed the minecraft:follow_orbit camera not having the correct control scheme in its allow list
500. Fixed the camera_relative_strafe control scheme
501. Deprecated align_target_and_camera_forward . Use control_scheme to switch between control schemes instead
502. "minecraft:rideable" component's "dismount_mode" is now correctly applied when passengers are forced to dismount by the "minecraft:behavior.float" goal
503. Added the ability to data-drive some of the Vibrant Visuals / Deferred Graphics related settings per biome. Creators can provide multiple versions of atmospherics, color grading, lighting and/or water configurations as long as each has a unique identifier and file name. The reserved JSON names for each group of settings (e.g., lighting/global.json) will continue to function as before. Creators can utilize the minecraft:atmosphere_identifier , minecraft:color_grading_identifier , minecraft:lighting_identifier , and minecraft:water_identifier in Client Biome JSONs to connect particular rendering settings to a given biome. Note that certain parameters, such as tone mapping operators, caustics and wave simulation on/off cannot be customized per biome at this time. Parameters will be spatially blended as players move between biomes. See updated Creator Documentation for more details
504. Particles rendered without the "minecraft:particle_appareance_lighting" component are now rendered as expected in Vibrant Visuals
505. Removed ';' debug feature for toggling graphics modes
506. Recalibrated all emissive values in MERS textures in Vibrant Visuals
507. Update shadow configurations for "Favors Performance" targets on all Xbox platforms in Vibrant Visuals mode
508. Update Volumetric configs for "Prefers Performance" targets on Xbox One and Xbox One X in Vibrant Visuals mode
509. Reduced the intensity and speed of the caustics animation in Vibrant Visuals
510. Fixed an issue where the screen would render black on Xclipse GPUs running Android 15 with Vibrant Visuals ( MCPE-203972 )
511. Increased emissive intensity and adjusted tone mapping parameters in Vibrant Visuals.
512. Added temperature grading settings to the color grading JSON files for Vibrant Visuals. Schemas must specify a format version of 1.21.90 to access this new setting New temperature object added to color_grading enabled set to true or false controls if temperature grading is enabled type set to either white_balance or color_temperature controls the type of grading applied white_balance uses the temperature value to adjust the camera's white point. Lower temperature values will cause the scene to appear more blue color_temperature is the inverse of the white balance operation. Lower temperature values will cause the scene to appear more red temperature sets the temperature in kelvin Example: ... "color_grading": { "temperature": { "enabled": true, "type": "color_temperature", "temperature": 6500.0 } } ...

This allows for blocks to configure how they should react when moved by a Piston "movement_type" (Required): Specifies how the block should react when moved by a piston "push_pull": Will allow a block to be pushed by a Piston/Sticky Piston and pulled by a Sticky Piston (e.g. Grass) "push": Will allow a block to be pushed by a Piston/Sticky Piston (e.g. Glazed Terracotta) "immovable": Will not allow a block to be pushed or pulled by a Piston/Sticky Piston (e.g. Bedrock) "popped": Will pop a block when pushed by a Piston/Sticky Piston (e.g. Leaves) "sticky" (Optional): Specifies how the block should handle adjacent blocks when moved by a Piston "none": Default. Will not add any additional behavior "same": Will move adjacent blocks along with it when moved by a piston. It will not move different blocks with "sticky": "same" (e.g. A Honey Block can move another Honey Block but not a Slime Block) NOTE: This field only works when used with "movement_type": "push_pull" "format_version": "1.21.90", "minecraft:movable": { "movement_type": "push_pull", "sticky": "same"

1.21.81/82.title: Minecraft - 1.21.81/82 (Bedrock)
1.21.81/82.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.21.81/82 (Bedrock)**__
> Another small hotfix (1.21.82) is being rolled out on Windows.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed a crash that could occur when loading a world with a high number of custom blocks
2. Fixed an issue where Vibrant Visuals (Experimental) would sometimes apply to worlds that do not correctly support it
3. Fixed an issue that could cause pixelated distortion on specific iOS devices ( MCPE-218490 )
4. Fixed a bug where hitting blocks while swimming would cause players to slow down too much ( MCPE-201832 )
5. Fixed a crash that could occur when loading a world with leashed entities in it
6. Fixed a crash that could occur after activating "SplashPotChange" and "LingeringPotChange" resource packs ( MCPE-217599 )
7. Fixed bug where block custom component event beforeOnPlayerPlace was not using read only privilege. Due to V1.X.X of scripting releasing without read only privilege, the fix is now only applied to V2.X.X and higher versions of scripting
8. "minecraft:leashable" component values can once again be updated at runtime via component groups
9. "minecraft:leashable" presets are now re-evaluated every tick instead of only when the entity is leashed

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/36539685655053-Minecraft-1-21-81-82-Bedrock

1.21.80.title: Minecraft - 1.21.80 (Bedrock)
1.21.80.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.21.80 (Bedrock)**__
> 

**Fixes:**
1. In the Advanced tab of the Create New World screen, enable Flat World to access flat world presets Classic Flat Tunnelers' Dream Water World Overworld Snowy Kingdom Bottomless Pit Desert Redstone Ready
2. Classic Flat
3. Tunnelers' Dream
4. Water World
5. Overworld
6. Snowy Kingdom
7. Bottomless Pit
8. Desert
9. Redstone Ready
10. Fixed an issue where Text To Speech wasn't working on Android Fire Tablet devices
11. Fixed an issue where all sound in Windows stops working after 40-41% loading ( MCPE-175138 )
12. Music and sounds will no longer play once the save and exit button is pressed ( MCPE-190632 )
13. Fixed Wolf spawning sounds not using the appropriate sound variants ( MCPE-190576 )
14. Fixed credits music not playing if entering credits from the settings menu while game is paused. ( MCPE-190625 )
15. The ambient sounds for Sand block, Dead Bush block and Terracotta block can now play ( MCPE-194677 )
16. Sapling "age_bit" no longer regresses after an unsuccessful growth attempt, preventing nearby Observers from activating incorrectly ( MCPE-190286 )
17. Fix ambient occlusion issue for non 1x1x1 blocks When a block around any of these smaller non 1x1x1 blocks is broken, the AO computation is correctly applied to the face in the direction of that broken block. Previously the wrong face could be seen getting lightened/darkened. A list of blocks affected: stairs, walls, gates, buttons, cakes, plates, fences, anvil, grindstone, hopper, bell, lectern, eggs, brewing stand
18. When a block around any of these smaller non 1x1x1 blocks is broken, the AO computation is correctly applied to the face in the direction of that broken block. Previously the wrong face could be seen getting lightened/darkened.
19. A list of blocks affected: stairs, walls, gates, buttons, cakes, plates, fences, anvil, grindstone, hopper, bell, lectern, eggs, brewing stand
20. Flowers now have the same random offset range and values as Java
21. Bamboo, Hanging Roots, Mangrove Propagule, and Nether Sprouts now have the same random offset range and values as Java Edition
22. Coral Fans and Coral Plants now have the same random offset range and values as Java Edition
23. Double tall plants, like sunflowers, now have the same random offset range and values as Java Edition
24. Pointed Dripstone, Tall Grass, and Dry Grass now have the same random offset range and values as Java Edition
25. Basalt can be created if the soul soil is placed last after the lava and blue ice are already in place again ( MCPE-194008 )
26. Empty open Bundle icon now renders correctly when Bundles are tapped with Touch Controls
27. Fixed an issue that caused the wrong sized player model to show when using custom skins ( MCPE-189739 )
28. Players will no longer pass through Blocks placed around x or z coordinates that are a power of 2. (Example 256, 512, 1024 ...) ( MCPE-173843 )
29. Removed access to Virtual and Mixed Reality gameplay.
30. Fixed server client desync issue during portal travel on Realms ( MCPE-188731 )
31. Added 'music_definition' field to 'minecraft:biome_music' component in client_biome json files to control the music played in the biome. The default music will be determined by the dimension if the biome_music component or music_definition property is left off. An empty string can be used if the biome is intended to be silent
32. Fixed an issue where the player would momentarily lay under or beside a Bed when going to sleep
33. Deepslate Redstone Ore once again lights up after interacting with it ( MCPE-191381 )
34. Deepslate Redstone Ore no longer stays infinitely lit up after interacting with it ( MCPE-136864 )
35. When respawning from death while gliding or swimming players will now have the correct collision ( MCPE-189554 )
36. Fixed a bug that a player can sprint in water faster than swimming
37. Changed Elytra so that while gliding, using a firework will only be used as a boost even if placed on a block
38. Fixed an issue where using a Firework with Elytra in another block like Sugar Cane would result in rubberbanding ( MCPE-191595 )
39. Trail ruins now generate at the same location in Mutated Birch Forests between Java and Bedrock on the same world seed
40. Enabled Filter Profanity toggle on PlayStation, Nintendo, and Xbox platforms.
41. Fixed a bug where most usable items could not be used while targeting a Mob Spawner ( MCPE-58999 )
42. Mangrove Roots can now be used as fuel in Furnaces ( MCPE-155605 )
43. Fixed an issue where adding items to a slot in a Chest while it is being updated by a Hopper might remove the items ( MCPE-166390 )
44. Fixed a bug where named Slimes and Magma Cubes lose their names when splitting ( MCPE-14975 )
45. Creakings no longer despawn on world reload ( MCPE-190845 )
46. Parrots can now imitate Phantoms, Zoglins, Guardians, Ravagers, Pillagers, and Blazes ( MCPE-164404 )
47. Wither Skeletons and Zombified Piglins can now walk in lava ( MCPE-46806 )
48. Farm animal spawn eggs used in the Mangrove Swamp biome will now spawn the same variants of Chicken, Cow, and Pig as seen in the Java Edition ( MCPE-190750 )
49. Mobs no longer have difficulty inflicting recurring hits when very close to non-moving players ( MCPE-189535 )
50. Camels no longer spawn in spaces that are too small for them ( MCPE-190700 )
51. Farmer villagers no longer occasionally get stuck when collecting grown crops ( MCPE-166344 )
52. Fixed Evoker legs not moving when walking ( MCPE-191193 )
53. Fixed a crash when clicking several times while trying to upload a world to an inactive Realm slot
54. Realms Server Hosting Region Preference Selection: Added a new "Advanced" tab to the Realms settings screen where Realm owners can select which datacenter region they would like to host their Realm in Options include a list of regions, or allowing the Realms service to automatically select the best region for the Realm owner or the first player to join the Realm in a given session Note that this selection is a preference only and due to server capacity, your Realm may be hosted in a different region than selected and in that case, the next closest region to your preference will be selected Added a message during joining a Realm to indicate which server region your Realm is assigned to for that session For more information on Realms regional server hosting, read this detailed article: Improved Realms Regional Support | Minecraft

60. Fixed a bug where players could still craft unknown recipes when dolimitedcrafting game rule was enabled ( MCPE-186699 )
61. Fixed a bug that occasionally caused an error when creating a Realm on an empty slot
62. Fixed a crash that could sometimes occur when certain foliage textures fail to load
63. Fixed an issue that caused a crash while generating chunks
64. Fixed bugs causing marketplace addon content to sometimes not load in a world

66. Potion of Slowness IV (standard, splash, lingering) is no longer separated from other slowness potions in Creative Menu ( MCPE-101923 )

71. Added modal to handle Not Enough Disc Space error in Edit World screen, Resource Packs tab
72. Fixed "Download all missing packs" button not working under specific conditions
73. Fixed a bug where the bed screen would display the wrong message when sleeping during a thunderstorm ( MCPE-190178 )
74. Stopped main menu background rotation when entering new player flow
75. Stopped main menu background rotation and logo text movement when the "screen animations" option is disabled.
76. Worlds are no longer missing from the Storage menu
77. Bundle tooltip no longer sometimes renders as if having a different amount of items
78. Adding "Manage Storage" button if download fails due to lack of space with instructions on what needs to be cleared out.

80. Auto clearing the download cache on startup if it detects that it is running out of space.
81. Fixed an issue which prevented the escape keyboard shortcut from working in certain scenarios on the death screen
82. Bundle slot selection using gamepad right stick no longer skips slots when playing in split screen

85. Bundle UI now correctly disappears when interacting with Inventory tabs in Pocket UI
86. Fixed a bug where the game would be unresponsive for a short while after leaving the bed screen.
87. Add magic crit particles for enchanted weapons, to better match the Java edition ( MCPE-18704 )
88. Cut Sandstone Slabs can now be crafted in the Stonecutter using Cut Sandstone ( MCPE-42734 )
89. Cut Red Sandstone Slabs can now be crafted in the Stonecutter using Cut Red Sandstone ( MCPE-42734 )
90. Totem of Undying now gives the same 45 second regeneration as Java ( MCPE-90716 )
91. Shears now consume durability when used on Beehives and Bee Nests with full Honey level ( MCPE-63995 )
92. Shields now take durability damage from explosions ( MCPE-121484 )
93. The maximum amount of Raw Rabbits dropped from Rabbits is now increased by 1 for each level of Looting ( MCPE-47125 )
94. Iron Axe with Efficiency I now always generates in a Chest inside Woodland Mansion's tree-chopping room ( MCPE-109048 )
95. Enable the "Drop 2 2025" experimental toggle to test out these new features!
96. Can be found in the Nether in Nether Fossil structures
97. Can be crafted with 1 Bone block and 8 Ghast Tears
98. When waterlogged it undergoes 3 states over about 20 minutes until it spawns a Ghastling mob
99. Makes sounds and shows particles depending on state
100. If mined during the waterlogging, it will revert to its "dry" state regardless of what state it has reached during waterlogging
101. Will revert states back to its initial "dry" state when it is taken away from being waterlogged, using the same time scale
102. Spawns from a Dried Ghast block that has continuously been waterlogged for about 20 minutes.
103. After spawning, the Ghastling will try and follow:
104. Players within a 16-block radius or
105. An adult, non-aquatic passive mob (and some neutral mobs) within a 16-block radius If no player or suitable mob is close around the Ghastling will idle around within 32 blocks from its home position (where it spawned or last was interacted with).
106. Can be tempted and fed using Snowballs
107. Will grow up into a Happy Ghast after about 20 minutes (or faster if fed Snowballs)

178. spawnEntity method of Dimension no longer supports using a spawn event inside the identifier parameter. SpawnEntityOptions interface now has an optional string member spawnEvent?: string for specifying a spawn event to be sent to the entity when it is spawned. Please update any existing usages of spawn events inside identifier to instead use this new spawnEvent option. For example: spawnEntity("minecraft:horse<minecraft:ageable_grow_up>", {x:0, y:0, z:0}) should become spawnEntity("minecraft:horse", {x:0, y:0, z:0}, {spawnEvent: 'minecraft:ageable_grow_up'})

The "minecraft:rideable" component now has three new additional fields: "dismount_mode" defines where riders are placed when dismounting the entity: "default", riders are placed on a valid ground position around the entity, or at the center of the entity's collision box if none is found "on_top_center", riders are placed at the center of the top of the entity's collision box "on_rider_enter_event", defines the event to execute on the owner entity when an entity starts riding it "on_rider_exit_event", defines the event to execute on the owner entity when an entity stops riding it

The "minecraft:rideable" component's Seat definition now has two additional fields: "third_person_camera_radius" can be used to set a different camera radius when in third person or third person front camera. The value needs to be in the range [1.0, 64.0]. Value 0.0 is ignored. "camera_relax_distance_smoothing" adds springiness to the camera movement when the camera moves back to its radius after being pushed closer to the player by and obstacle. A higher value means a stiffer spring. The value needs to be in the range [1.0, 32.0]. Value 0.0 is ignored.

The "minecraft:leashable" component now support multiple presets: A list of presets can be defined in the new "presets" field Each preset determines how the entity behaves when leashed to another entity A preset is selected when the entity is leashed and remains active until it is leashed to something else The first preset whose "filter" conditions are met will be applied If no presets match, a default configuration is used instead The following fields are now part of each preset: "filter": Defines the condition that selects this preset out of all the presets upon leashing "soft_distance": Distance at which the spring effect begins "hard_distance": Distance at which the leash stiffens "max_distance": Distance at which the leash breaks "can_be_stolen": Determines if a player can steal the leashed entity using a Lead

306. minecraft:behavior.float_wander has been updated with new fields: navigate_around_surface : enables the usage of a new algorithm to find random positions to navigate to. The new algorithm aims to find random positions in the vicinity of solid (i.e. non-Air and non-liquid) blocks, and if that fails will fall back to finding a random position in the vicinity of the current dimension's surface level. additional_collision_buffer : makes sure there are no blocks present in an inflated area around the target position. allow_navigating_through_liquids : allow the mob to have target positions inside liquids surface_xz_dist : the distance in the horizontal directions to look for nearby surfaces. Only valid when navigate_around_surface is true. surface_y_dist : the distance in the vertical directions to look for nearby surfaces. Only valid when navigate_around_surface is true.

If false, it will choose target position without considering home restrictions. preferred_actor_type : The type of actor to prefer following. If left unspecified, a random actor among those in range will be chosen. filters : If non-empty, provides criteria for filtering which nearby Mobs can be followed. 368. Added AsyncPlayerJoinBeforeEvent Added beforeEvents.asyncPlayerJoin , AsyncPlayerJoinBeforeEvent , and AsyncPlayerJoinBeforeEventSignal to allow creators to delay players joining the world. AsyncPlayerJoinBeforeEventSignal.subscribe is different than other events because the callback it accepts returns a promise. Once the promise is resolved, the player will join the world, or if the promise is rejected the player will be disconnected without joining the server. The player will be at the loading screen while the promise is pending.

403. New field "condition" added to the culling rules schema. It provides more control over which neighbor blocks will trigger a face or part to be culled. The supported values are "default", "same_culling_layer", "same_block" and "same_block_permutation". "default" will pass the condition if the neighbor block is full and opaque All conditions are an extension of "default", meaning a full and opaque neighbor will always be a passing condition, before the extended "same_*" condition is checked "same_culling_layer" will pass the condition if the neighbor block shares the same "culling_layer" as the block being occluded, defined in the geometry component If either of the culling layers being compared is "minecraft:culling_layer.undefined", the condition will never pass "same_block" will pass the condition if the neighbor block has the same identifier "same_block_permutation" will pass the condition if the neighbor block has the same identifier and is the exact same permutation Additionally, the feature is currently only usable behind the "upcoming creator features" toggle.

1.21.72.title: Minecraft - 1.21.72 (Bedrock)
1.21.72.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.21.72 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released to address a few more important issues since the 1.21.70 release. Please continue to report and upvote any bugs you find atbugs.mojang.com.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed several crashes that could occur during gameplay
2. Sea Pickles no longer replace blocks when being placed on a partial block
3. Fixed an issue that could cause renamed Book & Quill to become blank ( MCPE-194195 )
4. Fixed some cases of players' locations being massively rewound during long server stalls

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/35674713271949-Minecraft-1-21-72-Bedrock

1.21.71.title: Minecraft - 1.21.71 (Bedrock)
1.21.71.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.21.71 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released to address a few issues with the 1.21.70 release. Please continue to report and upvote any bugs you find atbugs.mojang.com.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixes flashing screen on certain devices when loading a world at the end of the progress screen ( MCPE-190555 )
2. Fixed an issue that prevented buttons for external links from working correctly on iOS devices
3. Fixed mobs playing their death animation twice as quickly as they should have ( MCPE-191525 )
4. Fixed client and server desynchronizing on entities the client erroneously thought were dead

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/35325099799821-Minecraft-1-21-71-Bedrock

1.21.70.title: Minecraft: Bedrock Edition 1.21.70 - Spring to Life
1.21.70.md:
__**Minecraft: Bedrock Edition 1.21.70 - Spring to Life**__
> The Spring to Life drop brings more reasons to explore both near and far! Warm winds have swept across biomes, bringing new mob variants, ambient sounds, and lush plants for you to discover. Befriend fluffy pigs, marvel at glittering firefly bushes, listen out for whispers of sand, and delight in a blooming Overworld humming with new beginnings. Play the Spring to Life drop in Minecraft now!

**Fixes:**
1. The Bush is a new type of decorative block that can be found in small patches in the following biomes: Plains Windswept Hills Windswept Gravelly Hills Windswept Forest River Forest Birch Forest Old Growth Birch Forest

13. Spawns Firefly particles that fly around it when in darkness
14. Illuminates the area around it
15. Using Bone Meal on a Firefly Bush places a new Firefly Bush next to it if possible

169. Enabled earning Achievements while playing in a world with Add-Ons applied.
170. Placing a block in liquid, and then placing another block next to your first block in liquid will no longer replace your second placed block for a moment, causing you to fall into the liquid
171. Structure Blocks no longer briefly change textures when placed ( MCPE-185531 )
172. Sea Pickles can now be placed on any block with center support ( MCPE-116152 )
173. Barrier blocks will no longer prevent chunks rendering behind them ( MCPE-153515 )
174. Fixed a crash that would sometimes happen when entities with an excessively large hitbox entered liquid
175. Fixed blocks using the minecraft:destructible_by_mining component with item_specific_speeds defined flickering during their block breaking animation ( MCPE-188401 )
176. Fixed trigger rate of Redstone powered Droppers and Dispensers ( MCPE-189895 )
177. Warped and Crimson Fungi no longer z-fight ( MCPE-190389 )
178. Fixed a mismatch between server and client when continuously building that caused orientation sensitive blocks to sometimes change to the wrong block
179. Using Riptide while standing in shallow water will once again launch the player as if they weren't standing in water. ( MCPE-188795 )
180. Players fall momentum is no longer reset after exiting and re-entering the world ( MCPE-188490 )
181. Fixed an issue where destroying and picking up a Shulker box would make it appear invisible in the inventory until world reload
182. Fixed a bug where using items with a use duration (fishing rods, food, potions, etc...) and changing slots would force your slot back to the original slot
183. Fixed an issue where attacking a mob while sprint jumping would remove all player momentum ( MCPE-189501 )
184. Fixed an issue where laggy players fighting would occasionally not be able to hit each other ( MCPE-190552 )
185. Fixed an issue where Player's collision box would sometimes be incorrect after using a bed ( MCPE-190604 )
186. Bundles no longer become empty after being held by an Armor Stand ( MCPE-190093 )
187. Fixed a crash that would occur on Xbox if you pressed "Cancel" in the Xbox UI when converting a world or importing a world from Retail to Preview
188. In Server Authoritative movement, when Players receive a movement correction it will use the current Player speed instead of a generic one, this should give a better experience.
189. In Server Authoritative movement, when Players receive a downward movement correction it will now use gravity acceleration, this should give a better experience.
190. In Server Authoritative movement, the Player will not constantly bop up and down if flying state change during small loss of connection with the server.
191. Removing experimental files cold_taiga, cold_taiga_hills, and cold_taiga_mutated from behavior packs. These files were only loaded with the custom biomes experiment enabled, and this change does not remove the biomes themselves.
192. In Server Authoritative movement, when Player is corrected, the movement will not have easing anymore. This is a better feel, as can be seen with upward, repeating, Pistons
193. Fixed typos in music definitions and sound definitions that were causing the wrong music to play for soulsand valley, desert mutated, and jungle mutated biomes.
194. Fixed an issue where chunks weren't saving properly on older worlds
195. Enabled Filter Profanity toggle on mobile platforms.
196. Fire overlay will no longer animate while the game is paused ( MCPE-188464 )
197. Blocks will no longer play their animations while the game is paused ( MCPE-188459 )
198. Held items are no longer displayed incorrectly when the game is paused ( MCPE-190218 )
199. Hand position should remain the same while the game is paused ( MCPE-190290 )
200. Foxes now take damage from lava, and not only fire ( MCPE-56926 )
201. In the 1.21.80.21 Preview changelog we mentioned that mobs related to MCPE-190466 will be unaffected in this release. We have made every effort to make sure of this, but there's a possibility that these mobs may become invisible after the update. If this happens we believe the change will be reversible and the mobs will just be invisible and not lost completely - please keep us updated at bugs.mojang.com .
202. In Realms Stories, changed online indicator (green dot in corner of player image) to represent general online status rather than whether the user is playing in that specific Realm. In Members tab, added "Playing on Realm" status for users currently playing in that specific Realm. Added "Online members" filter that shows users playing on Realm.
203. Fixed Random Tick Speed and Respawn Radius settings resetting to default values ( REALMS-11759 )
204. Fixed "Reset Random Tick Speed" button not working when editing an existing world on Realms
205. Fixed ability to remove Realm members that are not friends of the Realm owner
206. Fixed ability to rejoin Realm with Hardcore world via invite link
207. Pause when alone: you can pause when you are alone in a local world owned by yourself.
208. Un-pause when joined: your game will un-pause if someone joins you.
209. Join notification: a notification will inform you that someone else has joined and that your game has resumed. The notification includes the option to takes you right back to the game, perfect if you are deep in a menu. Note: The game will NOT pause if you are playing on a Realm, server or when playing with a friend on your local server.

Added the "minecraft:is_collidable" component This component allows other mobs to have vertical and horizontal collisions with the component's owner For a collision to occur, both mobs must have a "minecraft:collision_box" component This component can only be used on mobs and enables collisions exclusively between mobs Please note that this type of collision is unreliable for moving mobs It is recommended to use this component only in scenarios where the mob remains stationary Collidable behavior is closely related to stackable behavior While the "minecraft:is_collidable" component governs how other mobs interact with the component's owner, the "minecraft:is_stackable" component describes how an entity interacts with others of its own kind

Variants has a "map" field which contains key-value pairs of a variant identifier and the sound events it overrides. When playing a sound for an entity we first try to calculate their variant and see if that variant overrides the sound event, if not we play the sound form the base entity. 478. applyKnockback method now takes a VectorXZ parameter for the knockback horizontal force (which includes the strength/magnitude), as well as a vertical strength parameter. To convert from V1, you should normalize your previous direction vector and multiply it by the old horizontal strength value. Vertical strength is the same as before.
479. EffectType getName method now always returns the minecraft: namespace prefix along with the name
480. getName method now always returns the minecraft: namespace prefix along with the name
481. Effect typeId property now always returns the minecraft: namespace prefix along with the name
482. typeId property now always returns the minecraft: namespace prefix along with the name
483. minecraft:air item has been removed (it is still a valid block)
484. Promises are now flushed along with after events and system tasks
485. system.waitTicks() now can accept an argument bounds of 0 minimum to run this tick
486. Added a GraphicsMode enum and Player.graphicsMode to query a player's current graphics mode on the server.
487. Added system.isEditorWorld property into @minecraft/server in beta
488. BlockLocationIterator Added isValid(): boolean method to beta. This method checks if the iterator as been invalidated by modifying the underlining block volume.
489. Added isValid(): boolean method to beta. This method checks if the iterator as been invalidated by modifying the underlining block volume.
490. BlockMapColorComponent API has been added to beta
491. TintMethod enum has been added to beta
492. Early execution changes in version @minecraft/server 2.0.0-beta The following RegistrationBuilder methods can now be called in early execution batch maxAttempts maxTicks padding required requiredSuccessfulAttempts rotateTest setupTicks structureName tag register function can now be called in early execution registerAsync function can now be called in early execution
493. The following RegistrationBuilder methods can now be called in early execution batch maxAttempts maxTicks padding required requiredSuccessfulAttempts rotateTest setupTicks structureName tag
494. batch
495. maxAttempts
496. maxTicks
497. padding
498. required
499. requiredSuccessfulAttempts
500. rotateTest
501. setupTicks
502. structureName
503. tag
504. register function can now be called in early execution
505. registerAsync function can now be called in early execution
506. Fixed a bug where the typeid property of the Effect class was being translated based on your language option.
507. Raised the limit for Lore Entry length from 50 to 1000 and the number of lines from 20 to 100 when using ItemStack.setLore
508. Added three new methods to Player . These Entity Overrides are only applied to the target Player . Changes are not applied until the next tick and will not apply to other players. setPropertyOverrideForEntity : Overrides an Entity Property on the target Entity to the provided value. This property must be client synced. removePropertyOverrideForEntity : Removes the override of the specified Entity Property on the target Entity. clearPropertyOverridesForEntity : Removes all overrides of any Entity Properties on the target Entity.
509. setPropertyOverrideForEntity : Overrides an Entity Property on the target Entity to the provided value. This property must be client synced.
510. removePropertyOverrideForEntity : Removes the override of the specified Entity Property on the target Entity.
511. clearPropertyOverridesForEntity : Removes all overrides of any Entity Properties on the target Entity.
512. Added query.graphics_mode_is_any to Molang which accepts any of the following parameters: simple , fancy , deferred , raytraced . These parameters are all graphics modes that are available in the settings menu.
513. The minecraft:map_color component underwent a schema change It is now a JSON object with two fields "color" and "tint_method". "color" is a required string field expecting an HEX representation of the RGB, prefixed with a # character. "tint_method" is a string field that multiplies the color with a predefined tint. Supported values are "none, "default_foliage", "birch_foliage", "evergreen_foliage", "dry_foliage", "grass" and "water". the old schema format is still supported for convenience. Examples: "minecraft:map_color": { "color": "#ABCDEF", "tint_method": "grass" } or "minecraft:map_color": { "color": "#ABCDEF" } or "minecraft:map_color": "#ABCDEF"
514. It is now a JSON object with two fields "color" and "tint_method".
515. "color" is a required string field expecting an HEX representation of the RGB, prefixed with a # character.
516. "tint_method" is a string field that multiplies the color with a predefined tint. Supported values are "none, "default_foliage", "birch_foliage", "evergreen_foliage", "dry_foliage", "grass" and "water".
517. the old schema format is still supported for convenience. Examples: "minecraft:map_color": { "color": "#ABCDEF", "tint_method": "grass" } or "minecraft:map_color": { "color": "#ABCDEF" } or "minecraft:map_color": "#ABCDEF"
518. The minecraft:material_instances component supports an optional "tint_method" field in its instance definitions "tint_method" is a string field that multiplies a face color with a tint computed with the biome the block is in. Supported values are "none, "default_foliage", "birch_foliage", "evergreen_foliage", "dry_foliage", "grass", and "water". Held block-items are tinted as if they were in the "plains" biome. Example: "*": { "texture": "minimal", "render_method": "opaque", "tint_method": "water" }
519. Supported values are "none, "default_foliage", "birch_foliage", "evergreen_foliage", "dry_foliage", "grass", and "water". Held block-items are tinted as if they were in the "plains" biome. Example:
520. "tint_method" is a string field that multiplies a face color with a tint computed with the biome the block is in. Supported values are "none, "default_foliage", "birch_foliage", "evergreen_foliage", "dry_foliage", "grass", and "water".
521. Held block-items are tinted as if they were in the "plains" biome. Example:
522. Exposed the Block component minecraft:destruction_particles as a JSON object. This represents the particles used when the Block is destroyed There is two fields for it: "texture" is a required string field to set the texture used by the particles "tint_method" is an optional string field that multiplies the texture color with a predefined tint. Default to "none". Supported values are "none", "default_foliage", "birch_foliage", "evergreen_foliage", "dry_foliage", "grass" and "water". Block format before 1.21.70 will be upgraded to have the component added using the texture from the "down" or "*" of the minecraft:material_instances component if present and "none" for tint_method. This was the old behavior. Block format from 1.21.70 without the component will not be upgraded and uses the invalid texture Examples: "minecraft:destruction_particles": { "texture": "my_particles_texture", "tint_method": "grass" } or "minecraft:destruction_particles": { "texture": "my_particles_texture" }
523. There is two fields for it:
524. "texture" is a required string field to set the texture used by the particles
525. "tint_method" is an optional string field that multiplies the texture color with a predefined tint. Default to "none". Supported values are "none", "default_foliage", "birch_foliage", "evergreen_foliage", "dry_foliage", "grass" and "water".
526. Block format before 1.21.70 will be upgraded to have the component added using the texture from the "down" or "*" of the minecraft:material_instances component if present and "none" for tint_method. This was the old behavior.
527. Block format from 1.21.70 without the component will not be upgraded and uses the invalid texture Examples: "minecraft:destruction_particles": { "texture": "my_particles_texture", "tint_method": "grass" } or "minecraft:destruction_particles": { "texture": "my_particles_texture" }
528. Removed the Experimental Third Person Cameras toggle and added an Experimental Creator Camera Features toggle for all future experimental cameras
529. Removed unused experimental json field peaks_factor from minecraft:mountain_parameters in the behavior pack biome file

1.21.62.title: Minecraft - 1.21.62 (Bedrock)
1.21.62.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.21.62 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released to address a few issues with the 1.21.60 release. This update will be rolling out to the various platforms as they become available throughout the day - thank you for your patience!

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed an issue where attacking a mob while sprint jumping would remove all player momentum ( MCPE-189501 )
2. Fixed an issue where laggy players fighting would occasionally not be able to hit each other ( MCPE-190552 )
3. Fixed an issue where Player's collision box would sometimes be incorrect after using a bed ( MCPE-190604 )
4. Trying to craft a Bundle while holding a Bundle with a Bundle inside of it now correctly crafts a Bundle instead of only consuming ingredients ( MCPE-190550 )
5. Fixed an issue that could preventing joining a Realm through the Friends drawer
6. Exposed a new parameter for dedicated server when in server-auth-with-rewind. This will make the server more strict on entity interactions. Look in server.properties for more information on what these do server-authoritative-entity-interactions-strict default to false and can be set to true. Will affect Entity interaction acceptance.
7. server-authoritative-entity-interactions-strict default to false and can be set to true. Will affect Entity interaction acceptance.
8. Command Block hover name is now shown in GUI messages generated from commands ( MCPE-190606 )

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/34543756347021-Minecraft-1-21-62-Bedrock

1.21.61.title: Minecraft - 1.21.61 (Bedrock)
1.21.61.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.21.61 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released to address a few issues with the 1.21.60 release. This update will be rolling out to the various platforms as they become available throughout the day - thank you for your patience!

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed an issue that could cause players to see an error message when attempting to join their Realm
2. Keep Inventory is back to being a cheat on all difficulties. ( BDS-19921 )
3. Touch controls: Fixed a bug where a player could stay moving diagonally after opening a menu ( MCPE-190308 )
4. Fixed a crash that would occur while loading or creating a project in the editor due to custom blocks accessing material instances before they were loaded.
5. Hoglins and Zoglins can now be consistently hit by projectiles again
6. Fixed an issue where the Lectern would randomly tick and emit a Redstone signal

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/34397126341389-Minecraft-1-21-61-Bedrock

80. Torchflowers, Pitcher Plants, Open Eyeblossoms and Closed Eyeblossoms now increase the probability of a nearby Sapling growing into a tree with a Beehive
81. Fixed a crash that could occur when teleporting back into a chunk where a block entity was destroyed ( MCPE-178461 )
82. Lily Pads no longer flicker when seen from afar ( MCPE-91452 )

89. The Creaking Heart now has an additional state for when it is in a valid configuration but unable to spawn a Creaking due to it being daytime
90. Eyeblossoms now open when the moon starts rising, and close when the moon has completely set
91. Big Dripleaf blocks can no longer be placed on top of Pale Moss blocks
92. Fixed a crash that could occur when destroying a Creaking Heart
