Each Trial Spawner category will only use one mob for the entire structure when generated, and these mobs are randomized for each Trial Chamber For example, one Trial Chamber might only spawn Zombies, Cave Spiders and Strays, while another might only spawn Slimes, Silverfish and Skeletons The exceptions to this are some Trial Spawners in unique rooms which always spawn Breezes
57. For example, one Trial Chamber might only spawn Zombies, Cave Spiders and Strays, while another might only spawn Slimes, Silverfish and Skeletons
58. The exceptions to this are some Trial Spawners in unique rooms which always spawn Breezes
59. An item that can only be obtained from Trial Spawners
60. Trial Keys do not currently have any functionality
61. Added the Armadillo
62. The Armadillo is a neutral mob
63. Drops Armadillo Scutes periodically
64. Drops Armadillo Scutes when brushed
65. Spawns in Savannas
66. Favorite food is Spider Eyes
67. When an Armadillo detects a threat, it rolls up Threats are: Players who are sprinting Players on a mount or in a vehicle Undead mobs It does not roll up if it is fleeing, in water, in the air, or if being led When an Armadillo is rolled up it does not walk, cannot eat, and will not be tempted by food It continues to scan for threats, and if there are no threats detected for 3 seconds, it will unroll
68. Threats are: Players who are sprinting Players on a mount or in a vehicle Undead mobs
69. Players who are sprinting
70. Players on a mount or in a vehicle
71. Undead mobs
72. It does not roll up if it is fleeing, in water, in the air, or if being led
73. When an Armadillo is rolled up it does not walk, cannot eat, and will not be tempted by food
74. It continues to scan for threats, and if there are no threats detected for 3 seconds, it will unroll
75. Can be used to craft Wolf Armor
76. Dropped by Armadillos
77. Dispensers can be used to brush Armadillo Scutes off Armadillos
78. Using Wolf Armor on an adult tamed Wolf will equip the armor on the Wolf Only a Wolf's owner can put Wolf Armor on their tamed Wolf, and with this in mind, Dispensers cannot put Wolf Armor on Wolves
79. Only a Wolf's owner can put Wolf Armor on their tamed Wolf, and with this in mind, Dispensers cannot put Wolf Armor on Wolves
80. Using Shears on a Wolf that is wearing armor will make it drop the armor Only a Wolf's owner can shear a Wolf Armor from it, and with this in mind, Dispensers cannot remove Wolf Armor from Wolves
81. Only a Wolf's owner can shear a Wolf Armor from it, and with this in mind, Dispensers cannot remove Wolf Armor from Wolves
82. Wolf Armor gives the same protection as Diamond Horse Armor
83. If a Wolf dies while wearing armor, it will drop the armor
84. Fixed a variety of crashes that could occur during gameplay
85. Fixed a rare crash that could occur with the “Seven Seas” achievement
86. Fixed a crash that could occur when players placed or destroyed any block and then selected Save & Quit with Ray Tracing enabled
87. Fixed a crash that could occur in the Play menu whilst looking at Realms
88. Fixed a bug that could cause infinite loading while joining a Realm
89. Added more informative error messaging in case world exports fail due to external OS issues ( MCPE-41898 )
90. Improved delay between 100% loaded and when the main menu appears on console platforms
91. The "You Need A Mint" achievement can now only be unlocked by collecting Dragon's Breath ( MCPE-177409 )
92. Fixed certain cases that caused players to take unexpected fall damage when performing interactions at specific heights like 62 ( MCPE-168518 )
93. Reintroduced a fix for players sometimes taking unexpected fall damage while building blocks while standing on them ( MCPE-120140 )
94. Fixed some cases where players could take unexpected fall damage near ledges that they were visibly not falling off of ( MCPE-120140 )
95. Fixed the issue that prevented the inventory from being navigated when using only a keyboard on mobile
96. Fixed the issue prevented stack splitting from being used when using a keyboard in touch mode
97. Fixed an issue that could inflict unexpected fall damage in certain cases when building blocks while moving ( MCPE-120140 , MCPE-175791 )
98. Players no longer fall through the block they stand on when switching to Spectator Mode and back ( MCPE-170522 )
99. Players are no longer slowed down if they touch the ground while flying in Creative mode ( MCPE-176365 )
100. If the game is closed while changing dimensions, players will no longer be placed in unexpected positions when re-entering the world ( MCPE-173386 )
101. Horses, Donkeys, and Mules now take fall damage when controlled by a player, except for worlds targeting base game versions before 1.20.60 ( MCPE-107031 )
102. Fixed an issue that made Boats clip through blocks when placed
103. Fixed some Villagers not having their skins match their professions ( MCPE-105457 )
104. The scattering of Experience Orbs released while fishing has been reduced ( MCPE-170540 )
105. Experience Orbs no longer collide with mobs ( MCPE-87711 )
106. Zoglins can no longer spawn in Peaceful difficulty and will despawn if the difficulty is switched to Peaceful ( MCPE-79480 )
107. Bees no longer take damage when moving through Sweet Berry Bushes ( MCPE-114689 )
108. Wolves can now spawn on both Snow and Top Snow within Grove biomes ( MCPE-147656 )
109. Container blocks triggered with Redstone (e.g. Hopper, Dispenser) can now be interacted with consistently when powered by a fast Redstone clock
110. Frosted Ice blocks no longer leave water in the world when mined with a Silk Touch tool
111. Turtle Egg, Frogspawn, Coral, and Coral Fan no longer spawn double the particles when mined
112. Beehive and Bee Nest can no longer be Silk Touched by an Enchanted Book with Silk Touch
113. Destroying a Bed through the bottom block now properly clears the spawn point
114. Ice, Packed Ice, Frosted Ice and Top Snow now send vibrations when mined
115. Pistons pushing, pulling, or destroying blocks no longer risk teleporting surrounding players towards the world's origin ( MCPE-175206 )
116. Villagers who were mistakenly assigned to the same Bed or workstation as others will now actively seek out a new Bed or workstation ( MCPE-176528 )
117. Pufferfish no longer inflate and deflate repeatedly when a player is at a specific distance from them
118. Mobs that have partial blocks (e.g. Trapdoors, Slabs, etc.) specified as part of their list of blocks to avoid in their Navigation Component should now avoid them properly
119. The limitations on which blocks can be replaced by Dark Oak and Acacia trees now also apply to their branches, not just their trunks ( MCPE-177484 )
120. Top Snow placed at generation time now also covers Tall Grass and flowers ( MCPE-142321 )
121. Wither Roses now damage mobs every 0.5 seconds, instead of every 2 seconds ( MCPE-55878 )
122. Containers being cloned no longer keep their container screens open or cause crashes
123. Fixed pixel shading on the Double Chest and Double Trapped Chest lids ( MCPE-169495 )
124. Fixed issue where eating an Apple would not slow down player movement ( MCPE-176556 )
125. Renamed "Scute" to "Turtle Scute"
126. Players can now consume Suspicious Stew even when their hunger bar is full ( MCPE-122491 )
127. Banner items of identical colors now consistently stack together, whether or not they have previously been placed in the world as blocks ( MCPE-43391 )
128. Fixed a bug where the hotbar disappeared when exiting out of the customize touch controls screen with a non-touch controller input
129. Fixed incorrect block lighting after exiting water with the "Improved Input Response" option enabled ( MCPE-175727 )
130. The loading screen now displays three categories of tips based on player progression
131. Added an unread post count indicator to the Realms Feed button on the Play screen and slots screen
132. A bug making the "technical details" button on resource packs not leading to the technical details screen has been fixed
133. Fixed a bug where certain chat messages would briefly be incorrectly shown on the new death screen
134. In horizontal split screen, the second player can now navigate to the profile screen and both players can now see each others' character changes
135. Fixed a bug that kept the previewed item on the paper doll even after navigating back using the sidebar in Character Creator
136. Fixed Beacon UI buttons going outside the window on smaller resolutions ( MCPE-173649 )
137. Items from the inventory have the durability bar adjusted so it matches the one from the hotbar ( MCPE-128532 )
138. Adjusted cost text in the Pocket Anvil UI to match the classic version ( MCPE-101740 )
139. Updated the information about Conduits in the Encyclopedia ( MCPE-65038 )
140. Added Netherite as a block type in the Encyclopedia’s Beacon tab ( MCPE-175929 )
141. Last highlighted button will not get pressed when the window regains focus anymore ( MCPE-170377 )
142. Not enough storage space on Nintendo Switch now has a clearer message about the platform only allowing for 2GB of storage per user account ( MCPE-36670 )
143. Updated Add-On templates for 1.20.60 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation are available to download at aka.ms/MCAddonPacks
144. Decorated Pots now support the use of loot tables
145. Renamed json to water_splash_manual.json in resource_packs\vanilla\particles ( MCPE-176784 )
146. Require block_id for each block in the StartGamePacket blockProperties
147. Send "material" for vanilla data-driven blocks in the StartGamePacket blockProperties. "block_id" is also moved to the "vanilla_block_data" object
148. Containers being cloned over no longer keep their container screens open and no longer cause crashes
149. Changing the brightness_gamma value for blocks now darkens the block correctly ( MCPE-167836 )
150. Added a "drop_item_slot" field to the "interact" component, which allows to specify an inventory slot to remove and drop items from
151. "behavior.breed" now interrupts navigation on stop for content using engine version 1.20.60 or higher
152. Updated listed values for the Vanilla "orientation" block state in documentation to no longer be boolean values
153. /me /say /title /tell Reduced max length for output message to 512 characters

158. Added a CursorPropertiesChangeAfterEvent to notify Editor script when the cursor properties are changed
159. Wandering Traders can now correctly display custom entity spawn eggs in their trade menus ( MCPE-170184 )
160. The "minecraft:geometry.full_block" identifier for the "minecraft:geometry" block component has been added The "minecraft:geometry.full_block" identifier provides a centered 1x1x1 cube geometry When combined with a material_instances component with "render_layer": "opaque", it enables rendering-only capabilities previously included in the "minecraft:unit_cube" component including: Occludes both vanilla and custom neighboring full blocks Culls faces that neighbor vanilla and custom neighboring full blocks to improve rendering performance Added content error logging to help creators identify content that hits or exceeds the state bit/permutation count per block ( MCPE-177045 )
161. The "minecraft:geometry.full_block" identifier provides a centered 1x1x1 cube geometry
162. When combined with a material_instances component with "render_layer": "opaque", it enables rendering-only capabilities previously included in the "minecraft:unit_cube" component including: Occludes both vanilla and custom neighboring full blocks Culls faces that neighbor vanilla and custom neighboring full blocks to improve rendering performance

164. Culls faces that neighbor vanilla and custom neighboring full blocks to improve rendering performance
165. Added content error logging to help creators identify content that hits or exceeds the state bit/permutation count per block ( MCPE-177045 )
166. Biome JSON files no longer support inheriting fields from other Biome JSON files. If this affects any content those files should be updated by manually copying the desired JSON text
167. Biome tags in JSON files are now specified under a "minecraft:tags" component, in a "tags" array, rather than as loose JSON objects, for files with a format_version of 1.20.60 or higher
168. Added the ability for data-driven blocks to remove faces in the geometry when abutting a full and opaque block. A new field has been added to the Block Geometry Component, which references a new Culling .json file (found in the resource pack block_culling directory) that sets up culling rules for the tessellated geometry
169. Unrecognized fields in component item JSON will now give a warning to the content log in format versions 1.20.60 and higher
170. The "entity_sensor" component now supports multiple "subsensors":
171. "event", "require_all", "minimum_count", "maximum_count", "range" and "event_filter" are now individually configurable fields of each subsensor
172. Subsensors also have a new "cooldown" field, which defines how often each subsensor should sense for entities
173. All these changes require a "format_version" of 1.20.60 or higher
174. The "interact" component now supports the additional "entity_act" value for the "vibration" field
175. Entity event response run_command has been renamed to queue_command and has been released out of experimental. Commands run via queue_command may be deferred until the next tick. If the entity is removed before the command is run, the command will not execute. Content using run_command under experimental will still work for now but the experimental feature is now considered deprecated
176. Added an "interact_filters" field to the "ageable" component, which allows to specify conditions on when the actor can be fed
177. "behavior.follow_parent" now interrupts navigation on stop for content using engine version 1.20.60 or higher

180. Added the "emit_vibration" entity event response, which allows the entity to emit a vibration having the entity itself as its source The "vibration" field allows to specify the vibration to be emitted The allowed values are "shear", "entity_act", and "entity_interact"

295. Property typeId no longer returns undefined for empty slots, but instead throws an InvalidContainerSlotError
296. Added function hasItem - Returns whether the slot contains an item
297. Added function getCanPlaceOn - Returns an array of block identifiers that the item can be placed on
298. Added function getCanDestroy - Returns an array of block identifiers that the item can destroy when used
299. runJob() and system.clearJob() Added runJob and clearJob for optimizing long running tasks using JavaScript generators. runJob takes a generator function and returns a jobId . See documentation for usage examples
300. Added runJob and clearJob for optimizing long running tasks using JavaScript generators. runJob takes a generator function and returns a jobId . See documentation for usage examples
301. @minecraft/server.BlockPermutation Moved getState and withStates APIs from beta to stable
302. Moved getState and withStates APIs from beta to stable
303. Fixed issue where ActionFormData buttons could not be clicked if there were more than 255 buttons in the form
304. The "minecraft:unit_cube" block component has been deprecated. Using it in content marked 1.20.60 and beyond will provide a content error Using content marked prior to 1.20.60 will have their "minecraft:unit_cube" block component upgraded to a "minecraft:geometry" block component with a "minecraft:geometry.full_block" identifier, but will maintain backwards compatibility with all behaviors
305. Using content marked prior to 1.20.60 will have their "minecraft:unit_cube" block component upgraded to a "minecraft:geometry" block component with a "minecraft:geometry.full_block" identifier, but will maintain backwards compatibility with all behaviors
306. Added ScriptBiomeTypes and ScriptBiomeType to allow Scripting API to enumerate the BiomeRegistry
307. Added a findClosestBiome function to Dimension to find the closest biome of a specified type, to a given position in the world
308. The block component "minecraft:random_ticking" is now functional again
309. Changed cooldown query slot IDs to be required for container slots with more than one index, logging content errors if not provided cooldown_time(slotName,slotId) cooldown_time_remaining(slotName,slotId) is_cooldown_type(cooldownName,slotName,slotId)

1.20.51.title: Minecraft - 1.20.51 (Bedrock)
1.20.51.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.20.51 (Bedrock)**__
> A hotfix is now available for Minecraft: Bedrock Edition that resolves some issues introduced with the latest update.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed a crash that could occur when playing on Realms
2. Items no longer have the possibility of duplicating after switching selecting slots while using them ( MCPE-177351 , MCPE-177353 , MCPE-177355 )
3. All owned and unowned emotes should now appear within the Emotes section of Dressing Room
4. Fixed an issue where the PlayStation Plus requirement prompt was not shown when joining multiplayer games ( MCPE-177309 )
5. The block component "minecraft:random_ticking" is now supported again

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/22353117046541-Minecraft-1-20-51-Bedrock

1.20.50.title: Minecraft - 1.20.50 (Bedrock)
1.20.50.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.20.50 (Bedrock)**__
> The latest Minecraft update brings a brand new look for bats, smashable pots, and some new experimental features like the crafter block. Let’s take a look at the highlights!

**Fixes:**
1. The Bat has a brand new look
2. Improvements to Decorated Pots, like the ability to place items inside and smash them with projectiles
3. New experimental features from the upcoming 1.21 update, including the Crafter and new Copper blocks
4. The ‘How to Play’ screen has been completely revamped into the ‘Encyclopedia’ screen
5. A wealth of fixes, improvements, and technical changes
6. Decorated Pots now store up to a single stack of items
7. Hoppers, Hopper Minecarts, and Droppers can now insert and/or extract items from Decorated Pots
8. Comparators can now read the number of items in Decorated Pots
9. Players can interact with Decorated Pots to insert items into them
10. Decorated Pots have no user interface and need to be broken to retrieve or discover their content
11. Player interactions with Decorated Pots cause Decorated Pots to wobble and emit a vibration of frequency 11
12. Decorated Pots can be smashed by projectiles, which cause them to shatter and drop their content
13. Increased the maximum stack size of identical Decorated Pots to 64
14. The Bat now has a new look, thanks to an updated model, animations, and texture
15. Completely remodeled the "How to Play" screen and created a new "Encyclopedia" screen
16. Fixed various spelling mistakes
17. Removed obsolete references to "Old world"
18. Added missing references to Netherite related items ( MCPE-90770 , MCPE-165370 )
19. Vindicators and Evokers can no longer be spawned in a Peaceful world ( MCPE-124736 )
20. Added the Crafter block to the game
21. Crafter can be crafted with Redstone Dust, Iron Ingots, Crafting Table, and Dropper
22. Crafter uses distinct particles when crafting
23. Crafter has distinct sounds for crafting and failing
24. Crafter has a blast resistance of 3.5
25. A Comparator connected to a Crafter now outputs a signal that is equal to the amount of non-empty slots plus disabled slots
26. Moving items into crafter from Hopper or Dropper distributes them evenly instead of first filling the first stack
27. Powering Crafter with Redstone signal makes it craft and output the item
28. The Copper family of blocks has been expanded, including: Chiseled Copper Copper Grate Copper Bulb Copper Door Copper Trapdoor Oxidized and waxed variants of all the above
29. Chiseled Copper
30. Copper Grate
31. Copper Bulb
32. Copper Door
33. Copper Trapdoor
34. Oxidized and waxed variants of all the above
35. Crafted with 2 Cut Copper Slabs of a shared oxidation level
36. Can be crafted in the Stonecutter
37. A new type of decorative block unique to the Copper family
38. Crafted with 4 Copper Blocks of a shared oxidation level Can be crafted in the Stonecutter
39. Can be crafted in the Stonecutter
40. Properties: Transparent and allows light to pass through Mobs cannot suffocate inside them Cannot conduct Redstone Hostile mobs cannot naturally spawn on them
41. Transparent and allows light to pass through
42. Mobs cannot suffocate inside them
43. Cannot conduct Redstone
44. Hostile mobs cannot naturally spawn on them
45. A light-emitting block that can toggle its light emission through Redstone pulses
46. Oxidizes like other Copper blocks, and emits less light the more oxidized they are Copper Bulb: Light level 15 Exposed Copper Bulb: Light level 12 Weathered Copper Bulb: Light level 8 Oxidized Copper Bulb: Light level 4
47. Copper Bulb: Light level 15
48. Exposed Copper Bulb: Light level 12
49. Weathered Copper Bulb: Light level 8
50. Oxidized Copper Bulb: Light level 4
51. When placed, its light is off by default While the Copper Bulb is unpowered, it will toggle its light on or off when it receives a Redstone pulse Copper Bulb light will stay on even when the Redstone source is removed until it receives another Redstone pulse to toggle it off
52. While the Copper Bulb is unpowered, it will toggle its light on or off when it receives a Redstone pulse
53. Copper Bulb light will stay on even when the Redstone source is removed until it receives another Redstone pulse to toggle it off
54. A Redstone crystal will glow in the center of Copper Bulbs while it is powered by a Redstone signal
55. Comparators will read a signal strength of 15 if the Copper Bulb's light is on
56. Does not conduct Redstone power
57. Can craft 4 Copper Bulbs with: 3 Copper Blocks of a shared oxidation level 1 Blaze Rod 1 Redstone Dust
58. 3 Copper Blocks of a shared oxidation level
59. 1 Blaze Rod
60. 1 Redstone Dust
61. Copper variants of Doors and Trapdoors that can oxidize over time and be waxed
62. Works like wooden Doors in that they can be opened and closed with interaction as well as Redstone
63. Crafted with Copper Blocks of a shared oxidation level
64. Tuff has been expanded to have its own family of blocks, including: Stair, Slab, Wall, and Chiseled variants Tuff Bricks with Stair, Slab, Wall, and Chiseled variants Polished Tuff with Stair, Slab, and Wall variants
65. Stair, Slab, Wall, and Chiseled variants
66. Tuff Bricks with Stair, Slab, Wall, and Chiseled variants
67. Polished Tuff with Stair, Slab, and Wall variants
68. All Tuff variants can be crafted in the Stonecutter and Crafting Table
69. Fixed an issue where experimental Librarians never sold the highest level of their common enchantments ( MCPE-174861 )
70. A Sticky Piston pulling a retracting Sticky Piston that is pulling a player and another block no longer crashes the game ( MCPE-175790 )
71. Fixed a bug where the screen would freeze when uploading a world template to a Realm
72. The maximum render distance in Realms can be adjusted via backend updates. Expect an increase to the maximum render distance on Realms in the next week
73. Players can now download worlds larger than 1GB from Realms on Xbox
74. Improved handling of unexpected errors during world export and better error messaging is now provided ( MCPE-41898 )
75. You can now launch Minecraft directly into a Realm using a link, even when the game isn't running Example link: minecraft://connectToRealm?realmId=<ID number>
76. Example link: minecraft://connectToRealm?realmId=<ID number>
77. Phantoms will no longer miss players who are gliding
78. Decreased the likelihood of players spawning above Leaves
79. Suspicious Sand no longer generates in Cold Ocean Ruins ( MCPE-173492 )
80. Fixed an issue where players couldn't block with a Shield after releasing to use an item that had left their inventory ( MCPE-171346 )
81. Witches spawned via spawn eggs now join raids and throw potions at raiders
82. Raid mobs can now join existing raids
83. Mobs that grow up to be adults and are too large to fit inside Boats will now jump out ( MCPE-171870 )
84. Leads will no longer break if a leashed mob is not in the same chunk as the leash holder upon reloading a world ( MCPE-157182 )
85. Mobs on fire no longer spread fire to their target when holding something in their main hand
86. The calculations to determine whether a mob can attack a player or other mobs have been changed. Previously a mob's horizontal width was used to determine their attack reach and their height had no effect. The area where a mob can attack is now their bounding box extended in horizontal directions The mobs affected by this change are Axolotl, Bee, Blaze, Cave Spider, Dolphin, Drowned, Enderman, Endermite, Fox, Hoglin, Husk, Iron Golem, Panda, Piglin, Piglin Brute, Pillager, Silverfish, Skeleton, Spider, Stray, Vindicator, Warden, Wither Skeleton, Wolf, Zoglin, Zombie, Zombie Pigman, and Zombie Villager The new reach calculation is the attacking mob's bounding box extended by 0.8 blocks horizontally. If this extended box overlaps the target's bounding box, then the attack can reach This change does not affect the reach of players
87. The mobs affected by this change are Axolotl, Bee, Blaze, Cave Spider, Dolphin, Drowned, Enderman, Endermite, Fox, Hoglin, Husk, Iron Golem, Panda, Piglin, Piglin Brute, Pillager, Silverfish, Skeleton, Spider, Stray, Vindicator, Warden, Wither Skeleton, Wolf, Zoglin, Zombie, Zombie Pigman, and Zombie Villager
88. The new reach calculation is the attacking mob's bounding box extended by 0.8 blocks horizontally. If this extended box overlaps the target's bounding box, then the attack can reach
89. This change does not affect the reach of players
90. Horizontal End Rod hitboxes are now rotated correctly ( MCPE-171597 )
91. Chorus Flowers can now be destroyed by any projectile, which will no longer disappear after impact ( MCPE-176184 )
92. Sneaking in water is now possible with touch controls ( MCPE-167218 )
93. Touch input used for the Leave Boat button no longer continues to register input ( MCPE-168574 )
94. Fixed an issue where the player could enter touch control customization without having touch controls ( MCPE-175530 )
95. Inventory option states such as the all/craftable toggle and selected inventory tab are now saved between sessions ( MCPE-175159 )
96. The loading screen now displays 3 categories of tips based on player progression
97. Added a game rule to turn off recipe unlocking messages
98. Recipe unlocking notifications no longer speed up when unlocking a lot of items
99. The search bar inside of the inventory is now aligned with the rest of the UI ( MCPE-174298 )
100. Added Menu Cancel as a remappable action and set Mouse Back button as its default
101. Fixed tips display for custom vehicles from Marketplace packs when using touch controls with a joystick
102. The Xbox On-Screen Keyboard now moves to a different position if it's in front of the text user is inputting ( MCPE-170831 )
103. Fixed grammatical error in Magma death message ( MCPE-64168 )
104. Updated death message when killed by a Bed explosion in the Nether ( MCPE-123604 )
105. Made the hotbar less transparent ( MCPE-31014 )
106. Added background dimming on screens that didn't have it ( MCPE-168598 )
107. Fixed an issue where the border around the 'Creator' tab in Settings would not be highlighted ( MCPE-169617 )
108. The classic skins info popup now sends you to the correct settings page ( MCPE-175854 )
109. Updated Add-On templates for 1.20.50 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation are available to download at aka.ms/MCAddonPacks
110. Removed CraftingEventPacket
111. Improved some of the common scripting error messages to provide better context and information
112. Added a Clear button to the content log screen
113. Fixed unreliability around is_alive on Server
114. Blocks with the "minecraft:cardinal_direction", "minecraft:facing_direction", or "minecraft:block_face" states as part of the "minecraft:placement_direction" or "minecraft:placement_position" BlockTraits are rotated/mirrored properly by Structure Blocks
115. Structure Void blocks once again prevents interaction with blocks and entities placed behind them ( MCPE-175237 )
116. "planks" block is now split into unique instances "oak_planks", "spruce_planks", "birch_planks", "jungle_planks", "acacia_planks", "dark_oak_planks"
117. Commands will still work with "planks", however, "planks" block will not be suggested
118. "stone" block is now split into unique instances: "stone", "granite", "polished_granite", "diorite", "polished_diorite", "andesite" and "polished_andesite"
119. When a particle emitter is added to an entity but particles simulate in world, particles now correctly collide with the world
120. Renamed "minecraft:use_duration" to "minecraft:use_modifiers" and added a "movement_modifier" parameter in json format versions 1.20.50 and higher
121. Deprecated "minecraft:chargeable" in json format versions 1.20.50 and higher. Use "minecraft:use_modifiers" instead for "movement_modifier" behavior
122. Deprecated "on_dig" event triggers from "minecraft:digger" in format versions 1.20.50 and higher
123. Added a content warning for when the camera is placed outside of the player's chunk radius
124. Added "minecraft:behavior.melee_box_attack" behavior which functions the same as "minecraft:behavior.melee_attack" but uses bounds based attack reach calculations The reach_multiplier attribute is removed and replaced with box_increase Reach is calculated by increasing the bounds of the attacking mobs in the xz-plane by box_increase blocks to create an "attack box". If the attack box intersects with the target's bounds the attacking mob can reach it

1.20.41.title: Minecraft - 1.20.41 (Bedrock)
1.20.41.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.20.41 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released to address some issues that were introduced with the 1.20.40 update.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed a crash that could occur when joining a Realm after doing other things for a while
2. Fixed a crash that could occur when joining Featured Servers
3. Fixed a crash on Amazon devices when the player had a prior Realms purchase and the Realm had not been created yet
4. Fixed a possible soft lock when performing different actions within Marketplace
5. Fixed searching, filtering, and sorting only displaying the first row of results when using the search feature inside the Marketplace
6. World type filters now apply properly when using search filters in the Marketplace
7. Fixed an issue with not being able to upgrade from the demo to full version on PlayStation

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/20938188181517-Minecraft-1-20-41-Bedrock

1.20.40.title: Minecraft - 1.20.40 (Bedrock)
1.20.40.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.20.40 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released, bringing several changes to the game! Here are the highlights:

**Fixes:**
1. Experimental: Rebalanced several Villager trades
2. Updated and improved several in-game sounds
3. Tweaked the splash sounds when entering and leaving water
4. Buckets can no longer pick up liquids for a few ticks after they've been placed
5. Changed the default value of the Respawn Radius in the Advanced Settings to 10
6. Falling from a great height while in a Boat no longer deals fall damage ( MCPE-152753 )
7. Fall damage is now absorbed by the entity that lands on the ground when mounted and passed on to passengers if the mount dies
8. Goat Horns can now be heard up to 256 blocks away ( MCPE-153254 )
9. Tweaked the boss bar HUD color ( MCPE-43591 )
10. Flowing Lava and Water mixing mechanics now match Java Edition ( MCPE-41103 )
11. Closing the inventory of Boat, Raft, or Minecart with Chest now emits vibrations
12. Zombified Villager curing time is now randomized between 3 and 5 minutes, to match Java Edition
13. Zombified Villagers now have the correct biome overlays ( MCPE-172377 )
14. Witches now target players within a 16 block distance
15. Sheep that have been sheared previously and have since grown back wool will now drop wool on death ( MCPE-99972 )
16. Camels can no longer dash while in Lava or Water
17. Iron Golems no longer spawn naturally in 2-block-high spaces where they would start suffocating ( MCPE-173006 )
18. Iron Golems and Snow Golems now have a crumbling-like particle effect when they are created
19. Cartographers no longer offer exploration maps as a trade item when not in the overworld
20. Guardians and Elder Guardians now make flopping sounds when on land ( MCPE-26929 )
21. Wither Skeletons now have their own unique sounds ( MCPE-174857 )
22. Updated the sound that’s played when Wither Skeleton Skulls are placed on top of Note Blocks
23. The sound for picking up items is now played when using the ‘/give’ command
24. Stray Cats now play a sound when begging for food
25. Changes to Bottles ( MCPE-157918 ) Bottles now emit sounds when filling from Water Blocks Pouring water or potions from a Glass Bottle into a Cauldron emits the appropriate sound Filling a Glass Bottle with Water or Potion from a Cauldron now emits the appropriate sound Drinking from a Glass Bottle now emits the appropriate sound
26. Bottles now emit sounds when filling from Water Blocks
27. Pouring water or potions from a Glass Bottle into a Cauldron emits the appropriate sound
28. Filling a Glass Bottle with Water or Potion from a Cauldron now emits the appropriate sound
29. Drinking from a Glass Bottle now emits the appropriate sound
30. Changes to water splash sounds ( MCPE-174524 ) The ambient sounds for entering exiting water is now played only when actor is submerged below eye-level in water, matching Java Edition The splash sound for entering water has been updated to match Java Edition
31. The ambient sounds for entering exiting water is now played only when actor is submerged below eye-level in water, matching Java Edition
32. The splash sound for entering water has been updated to match Java Edition
33. Most master-level Armorers buy Iron Blocks (and pay very well for them)
34. Chainmail armor is exclusively sold by the secret Jungle and Swamp Armorers
35. The Savanna Armorer sells cursed diamond armor at reduced prices
36. The Taiga Armorer can swap one piece of diamond armor for another
37. Ancient Cities: Mending
38. Mineshafts: Efficiency (I to V)
39. Pillager Outposts: Quick Charge (I to III)
40. Desert Temples: Unbreaking (I to III)
41. Jungle Temples: Unbreaking (I to III)
42. Fixed several crashes that could occur during gameplay
43. Fixed a crash that could occur when running in the Archold room in the Spellrune Marketplace map
44. Fixed a crash related to tessellation of water blocks
45. Fixed an issue where the game would lock up if a mob would move on a block with 0 friction ( MCPE-173073 )
46. Players are no longer affected by Arrow effects if the Arrow is blocked ( MCPE-52904 )
47. Villages in the End and Nether are no longer saved to the Overworld ( MCPE-85954 )
48. Players can no longer sometimes clip through blocks when gliding with Elytra into blocks ( MCPE-73307 )
49. Buckets can no longer pick up liquids for a few ticks after they've been placed ( MCPE-100598 ) This should help make placing and retrieving liquid in a quick succession far more consistent as well as help players that are using a water bucket to quickly avoid fall damage
50. This should help make placing and retrieving liquid in a quick succession far more consistent as well as help players that are using a water bucket to quickly avoid fall damage
51. Fixed an issue where moving slowly on Soul Sand would sometimes cause the player to not receive the Soul Speed movement speed ( MCPE-173155 )
52. Players can no longer sometimes clip through blocks when flying in Creative Mode and spamming the sneak button ( MCPE-172785 )
53. Fixed a bug where the Sniffer ended digging as soon as item was created, not at the end of the specified dig duration
54. Camels no longer appear to slide when walking ( MCPE-169666 )
55. Camels no longer move their legs when standing still ( MCPE-172846 )
56. Camels no longer dash indefinitely when in Lava ( MCPE-172369 )
57. Mobs no longer receive fall damage when falling into a 1 block deep water pool ( MCPE-173094 )
58. Rabbits can once again eat partially and fully grown Carrot crops ( MCPE-131980 )
59. Fixed a bug where the wrong side of Signs would sometimes be edited ( MCPE-169067 )

63. Lightweight mobs and entities wearing Leather Boots once again sink into the top layer of Powder Snow when falling from a height of more than two and a half blocks

195. “ behavior.timer_flag 3 ”: Fires an event when this behavior starts, then waits for a duration before stopping. 1.20.32.title: Minecraft - 1.20.32 (Bedrock)
1.20.32.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.20.32 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released to address some issues that were introduced with the 1.20.30 update.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed “§” text modifiers overwriting text when next to a line break on iOS ( MCPE-174480 )
2. Fixed an issue that caused the keyboard to become unresponsive when placing multiple Signs successively ( MCPE-175072 )
3. Buttons and some other non-full blocks once again prevent Spiders and other mobs from spawning on them and on adjacent blocks ( MCPE-175119 )
4. Fixed purchased content not transferring to a Microsoft account when logging in for the first time
5. You may experience a crash when a player dies while playing splitscreen multiplayer on PlayStation with the Immediate Respawn game rule enabled. This will be resolved in an upcoming update.

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/20077082600077-Minecraft-1-20-32-Bedrock

1.20.31.title: Minecraft - 1.20.31 (Bedrock)
1.20.31.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.20.31 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released to address some issues that were introduced with the 1.20.30 update.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed a crash that could occur when playing in splitscreen multiplayer
2. Fixed a crash that could occur when opening the Realms Plus page
3. Fixed a crash that could occur on PlayStation when opening the control center or a controller notification appeared on screen
4. Improved server performance when Villagers are grouped together ( MCPE-175100 )
5. Fixed an issue that caused Marketplace to become inaccessible after leaving the game on for extended periods of time
6. Fixed issues with @minecraft/server-ui dependencies failing to load with newer versions of the @minecraft/server module

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/19819587578893-Minecraft-1-20-31-Bedrock

1.20.30.title: Minecraft - 1.20.30 (Bedrock)
1.20.30.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.20.30 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released, bringing several changes to the game! Here are the highlights:

**Fixes:**
1. Updated “You died” experience
2. Players can now crawl under single block gaps
3. A new "Recipe Unlocked" notification will now tell you when you've found a new crafting material
4. Increased the amount of Diamond Ore found in the deepest parts of the world
5. Adjustments to block destroy times and explosion resistance values
6. Fixes to over 100 community reported issues
7. The Crawling experimental toggle has been removed and Crawling under 1 block gaps is now fully implemented into the game
8. Updated the camera interpolation rate when crawling to match Java Edition ( MCPE-170841 )
9. Fixed some scenarios where crawling was not correctly being triggered on the server ( MCPE-171225 )
10. Recipe Unlocking is no longer an Experimental Feature, but can still be turned on and off per world
11. You can now enable Recipe Unlocking on the Create New World screen ( MCPE-172956 )
12. The command for unlocking recipes has been updated. The autosuggestion to give a player a recipe now says "player: target" instead of "victim: target" ( MCPE-172402 )
13. ‘Recipe unlocked’ message is no longer visible on the pause menu ( MCPE-171112 )
14. Stained Glass Pane recipe now gets unlocked when obtaining any dyes ( MCPE-171118 )
15. Recipes unlocked notification now fit text in different languages and no longer bleed out of the screen ( MCPE-171141 )
16. Command line auto-complete has been added for recipe unlocking. Useful when you want to see what recipes you can unlock ( MCPE-171086 )
17. The order of command inputs was changed to be the same as on Java Edition ( MCPE-171098 )
18. Recipe Unlocking Game Rule Added an optional game rule for limited crafting. The game rule is only relevant when recipe unlocking is enabled. When set to "true" it prevents players from crafting recipes they have not yet unlocked. It is off by default and can only be modified through the "/gamerule" command.
19. Added an optional game rule for limited crafting. The game rule is only relevant when recipe unlocking is enabled. When set to "true" it prevents players from crafting recipes they have not yet unlocked. It is off by default and can only be modified through the "/gamerule" command.
20. The recipe book search has been updated when playing in Survival mode with the following changes: The search will only match the beginning of any word in the item's name. For example, searching for "tor" will now show Tor ch and Redstone Tor ch but not Daylight Detec tor ) Search will now work better together with the Recipe Unlocking system - recipes that haven't been unlocked will show up in search results.
21. The search will only match the beginning of any word in the item's name. For example, searching for "tor" will now show Tor ch and Redstone Tor ch but not Daylight Detec tor )
22. Search will now work better together with the Recipe Unlocking system - recipes that haven't been unlocked will show up in search results.
23. This change will enable experienced players to find items they are looking for (even if it hasn't been unlocked yet) while not overwhelming new players with recipes they aren't yet ready for.
24. These changes are planned for both Bedrock and Java Edition, but they are still being tweaked and we definitely want to hear your feedback! Send us your thoughts at aka.ms/MinecraftRecipeSearch
25. Added the ‘playerssleepingpercentage’ gamerule, allowing night to be skipped when the specified percent of players logged into a world are sleeping ( MCPE-114425 ) A zero or a negative value will only require one player to sleep to skip the night When set to over 100, the night cannot be skipped
26. A zero or a negative value will only require one player to sleep to skip the night
27. When set to over 100, the night cannot be skipped
28. We have adjusted the breaking times of 188 blocks to match Java Edition and our intended design. Some blocks couldn't be changed yet for technical reasons and Obsidian was left unchanged because we're still deciding what breaking speed it should have. Bringing more blocks to parity makes it easier for our team to keep both versions up to date. We also hope it will be easier for the community to make and share guides that work for all players on all platforms. The full list of block breaking times and changes can be found at the very end of this changelog
29. The full list of block breaking times and changes can be found at the very end of this changelog
30. Wandering Trader now trades Cherry Saplings ( MCPE-171521 )
31. Villagers are now prevented from gaining a profession when sleeping ( MCPE-81790 )
32. Fixed an issue where beginning to swim while hitting the sneak button could cause the sneak button to be held down until swimming ends ( MCPE-130070 )
33. Potions are no longer thrown backwards when looking up ( MCPE-138995 )
34. Formation of ice and snow is now controlled by random tick
35. Fence Gate icon model in UI and Item Frames now match the Fence Gate Block ( MCPE-44296 )
36. Pillager Outposts can now generate in Cherry Grove biomes ( MCPE-173323 )
37. Fixed a bug that caused the Raid boss bar to automatically deplete to zero when a village was defeated ( MCPE-161438 )
38. Witches now throw healing and regeneration potions at raiders during village raids
39. Fixed a bug that caused players to not be able to crawl under Slabs when standing on Top Snow ( MCPE-170994 )
40. Top Snow is now in parity with Java Edition and each layer has a different height ( MCPE-60024 )
41. Tweaked Shulker Box Redstone signals to match parity with Java Edition
42. Fence Gate icon model in UI and Item Frames now match the Fence Gate Block ( MCPE-44296 )
43. Missing Thorns damage sound has been added, and is played when appropriate ( MCPE-37335 )
44. Anvils now emit the proper sounds when broken, stepped on, fallen onto, etc. ( MCPE-33286 )
45. Skeletons and Drowned now play sounds when firing Arrows and Tridents, respectively ( MCPE-50609 )
46. Trident Channeling sound is now played when entities are hit ( MCPE-43402 )
47. Empty Maps now emit the appropriate sound when players draw them
48. Nether Portals now emit the Glass breaking sound when their Obsidian frame is broken ( MCPE-94722 )
49. Loyalty Tridents returning to players now play their sound at the player's position ( MCPE-43831 )
50. Big Dripleaf Blocks now play the correct sound when their tilt is reset ( MCPE-123488 )
51. Conduits now play their deactivation sound when deactivated ( MCPE-128117 )
52. Respawn Anchor Blocks now correctly play their ambient sounds ( MCPE-136484 )
53. Pigs now emit sounds when transformed into Zombified Piglins ( MCPE-169557 )
54. Using Shears to carve Pumpkins now produces a carving sound like in Java Edition
55. Hoglins now have their own sound when transforming into Zoglins ( MCPE-87379 )
56. Sound is now consistently played when an item is dropped into Lava ( MCPE-96015 )
57. Sound is no longer played sometimes when Netherite items are dropped into Lava ( MCPE-95872 )
58. Snow Golems now play a sound when they throw Snowballs ( MCPE-119083 )
59. Husks now play sounds when converting to Zombies underwater
60. Player entities now play the appropriate sounds when entering/exiting water ( MCPE-132511 )
61. This update includes experimental changes to the Wandering Trader and Librarian Villager trades. You must turn on this experiment in the Experiments Menu if you want to test the new trades.
62. We are trying out these changes to rebalance the villager trade system and make it more fair and fun for everyone. However, these changes are not yet final, and they will stay as experimental features while we continue to work on them. We still need your feedback to help us improve and decide, so please continue to let us know what you think of the new trades, what you like and dislike, and what suggestions you have at aka.ms/VillagerTradingFeedback .
63. Before these changes, players could get any Village enchantment from any Librarian. A novice Librarian could sell the best enchantment in the game! For some players, this felt too random and made trading feel overpowered when compared to using the Enchanting Table or searching for Enchanted Books in structures.
64. With the new rules, Librarians from different biomes sell different enchantments. Master Librarians are guaranteed to have a special enchantment which is different in each Village biome.
65. Players will have to work towards getting the best trades instead of relying on random chance. We hope this makes Librarian trading more interesting and skilful, while also revealing some clues about their history of each Village type through the enchantments that are sold there.
66. Librarians from different biomes now sell different Enchanted Books
67. Master Librarians with full XP are guaranteed to sell a special enchantment, which is different in each Village biome
68. This means that players must visit all seven Village biomes to get the full set of Villager enchantments
69. There are two secret Village biomes where Villages do not generate A player must build these Villages to access their trades!
70. A player must build these Villages to access their trades!
71. Some enchantments have been removed from Village trading and must be found in other ways
72. Some players felt that the Wandering Trader had unfair prices and didn't sell many useful items. We have lowered their prices, added more trades, and increased the amounts available. The Wandering Trader will also now buy useful items from players, so it's possible to help them on their journey by giving them supplies even if you don't feel like buying anything.
73. As this is an experiment, we would really appreciate your feedback as work continues and to help us decide on the future direction for Villager trades!
74. Wandering Traders now have lower prices and have a higher amount of each item in stock
75. Wandering Traders now sell Logs
76. Wandering Traders can now buy many items, instead of only selling
77. Increased the amount of Diamond Ore found in the deepest parts of the world. Our goal is to make it more rewarding to mine for Diamonds in the Deepslate layers
78. Fixed a crash when entering a world with a corrupted saved chunk ( MCPE-164634 )
79. Fixed a crash that could occur when the game lost focus while entering a world
80. Addressed ‘Out of Storage’ errors and texture corruption on Xbox in large worlds ( MCPE-163050 )
81. Fixed missing low disk space warning on Xbox
82. Fixed an issue with Local Network games not connecting in certain circumstances on Nintendo Switch
83. Fixed server becoming unresponsive when players were surrounded by Ghasts stuck in lava columns ( MCPE-119093 )
84. Placing one item of an item stack into a full stack of the same item no longer causes the game to crash
85. The game no longer crashes due to running out of rendering resources while entering a world through the End Portal back to the Overworld ( MCPE-139021 )
86. Fixed worlds downloaded from Realms not loading packs correctly
87. Improved mouse input to be more responsive when used on Xbox ( MCPE-163671 )
88. Breath meter now refills when swimming with head above water ( MCPE-170969 )
89. The third-person camera will no longer clip through terrain when near Water or Lava
90. Fixed Creative Mode players not being ignited when standing in fire
91. The player no longer gets forced into sneak or crawl in Spectator Mode ( MCPE-170907 )
92. The player now gets forced out of sneak/crawl when riding ( MCPE-170870 )
93. The player no longer gets forced into sneak or crawl during the Riptide animation
94. Entering flight mode in Creative Mode will now correctly cancel Elytra gliding ( MCPE-171797 )
95. Projectiles now sink into Top Snow just like mobs do
96. Third-person camera now passes through Glass, Glass Panes, and Iron Bars ( MCPE-85429 )
97. Third person camera no longer clips through Snow, Mud, and Soul Sand, preventing x-ray exploits ( MCPE-168854 )

1.20.15.title: Minecraft - 1.20.15 (Bedrock)
1.20.15.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.20.15 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released to improve stability of the game.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed a top crash that could occur during gameplay
2. Fixed a bug related to some packs not being available to purchase successfully from the Marketplace

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/18588428772365-Minecraft-1-20-15-Bedrock

1.20.12.title: Minecraft - 1.20.12 (Bedrock)
1.20.12.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.20.12 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released to address some issues that were introduced with the 1.20.10 update.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed resource pack crashes with launch of 1.20.10
2. Fixed a crash that could occur on iOS
3. Fixed connection stability related to "Abandoned connection closed" errors

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/17690571678605-Minecraft-1-20-12-Bedrock

1.20.10.title: Minecraft - 1.20.10 (Bedrock)
1.20.10.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.20.10 (Bedrock)**__
> A new Minecraft update is ready to play! Since releasing the Trails & Tales update, the team has been hard at work on even more improvements to the game. Here are just a few of the highlights:

**Fixes:**
1. Players can now sneak under 1.5 block gaps
2. Shovels are no longer needed to craft Boats
3. Many more actions now emit vibrations detected by Sculk Sensors
4. Fixes to over 50 community-reported issues
5. Player’s hitbox height now reduces to 1.5 blocks while sneaking Sneaking will automatically be initiated while stuck in a gap of less than 1.8 blocks Sneaking will lower the player camera height respective of these changes Sneaking now requires enough space to stand in order to exit sneaking Players will transition from swimming to sneaking if they are unable to stand up but would be able to sneak
6. Sneaking will automatically be initiated while stuck in a gap of less than 1.8 blocks
7. Sneaking will lower the player camera height respective of these changes
8. Sneaking now requires enough space to stand in order to exit sneaking
9. Players will transition from swimming to sneaking if they are unable to stand up but would be able to sneak
10. Players are no longer able to sneak while riding ( MCPE-170613 )
11. Players will no longer suffocate when short sneaking in certain scenarios
12. Players will no longer suffocate when riding on a Camel in 2 block gaps ( MCPE-166451 )
13. Players will no longer be pushed slightly when short sneaking is by being pushed by a block ( MCPE-166411 )
14. Fixed many interactions where being forced into sneaking acted the same as holding the sneak button ( MCPE-170610 )
15. Items dropped by storage entities are now centered inside the nearest block ( MCPE-160189 )
16. Shovel has been removed from Boat recipe
17. Barrel recipe has been modified to use Planks instead of Sticks
18. The Cobweb to String recipe has been removed
19. Fixed a bug where Zombie Villager did not drop given item after curing ( MCPE-163670 )
20. Added the ability to crawl behind the Short Sneaking and Crawling Experimental toggle
21. Created new player crawling animation
22. Players will now begin crawling when in a 1 block gap, similar to sneaking
23. Crawling is the same speed as sneaking
24. Players will automatically stand up or begin sneaking if they leave the 1 block gap
25. Players will begin swimming if they enter water while crawling, or vice-versa
26. Player's model is now centered around their hitbox when swimming ( MCPE-122663 )
27. Players will now always spawn projectiles from the camera position when sneaking, swimming, or gliding
28. Players will now spawn particle effects when eating in the correct position if they are sneaking, swimming, or gliding
29. Loyalty Tridents will always return to the player's camera
30. Players will no longer be stuck inside Cauldrons or Composters when crawling inside with a Trapdoor ( MCPE-170836 )
31. The paper doll will now show up properly when crawling
32. Fixed an issue where gliding or swimming could sometimes give the player an incorrect bounding box ( MCPE-170882 )
33. Recipe unlocking – now in Bedrock! Added recipe unlocking as an experiment Collect materials to unlock relevant recipes A notification will tell you when you've found a new crafting material Picking up an item teaches you how to craft that item. Great for when a friend gives you a tool you haven’t crafted before We’d love to hear what you think of this feature, so please send us your feedback at aka.ms/MCRecipeUnlocks
34. Added recipe unlocking as an experiment
35. Collect materials to unlock relevant recipes
36. A notification will tell you when you've found a new crafting material
37. Picking up an item teaches you how to craft that item. Great for when a friend gives you a tool you haven’t crafted before
38. We’d love to hear what you think of this feature, so please send us your feedback at aka.ms/MCRecipeUnlocks
39. Fixed the "Communication Error" message appearing when leaving a Local Network game as the host on Nintendo Switch
40. Reduce cases where players might see 'Unable to connect' errors due to 'Expired Auth from Discovery' ( MCPE-170814 )
41. Camera position is now used for audio system listening and ambient sounds Previously the player position and rotation were sometimes used for audio listening This effectively flips audio panning when using 'third person front' camera perspective
42. Previously the player position and rotation were sometimes used for audio listening
43. This effectively flips audio panning when using 'third person front' camera perspective
44. Farmer Villagers will now interact with Torchflower Seeds and Pitcher Pods. They can pick up the seeds and plant them, but they will not harvest the Torchflower or Pitcher Crop ( MCPE-169758 )
45. The sound played when a Camel is dashing is no longer played repeatedly ( MCPE-164064 )
46. Fixed issue with Jump Boost effect not affecting Magma Cubes ( MCPE-54294 )
47. Fixed Boats on Ice disappearing when Client-Side Chunk-Generation was enabled ( MCPE-169313 )
48. Mobs are back to normal despawn rate during night ( MCPE-170208 )
49. Camels now play a walking animation when taking damage while standing still ( MCPE-166566 )
50. Sniffer can no longer dig up seeds in the air
51. Mobs no longer continue to freeze without Powder Snow if there is a Powder Snow block near the west and north side ( MCPE-169453 )
52. Polished Basalt and Chiseled Deepslate can no longer be replaced by Sculk during world generation
53. Polished Deepslate can now be replaced by Sculk during world generation ( MCPE-160238 )
54. Decorated Pots crafted with at least one Sherd now have a hover tooltip displaying the Sherd and Brick ingredients
55. Players without permission to open/close containers can no longer interact with Chiseled Bookshelves
56. The correct sound effect is now played when removing an enchanted Book from Chiseled Bookshelf ( MCPE-168119 )
57. Chiseled Bookshelf slot interactions are now symmetrical ( MCPE-164801 )
58. Cauldron water texture is now the correct version ( MCPE-170427 )
59. Note Block on top of Soul Soil now produces the Harp sound instead of the Snare sound
60. Shovel can no longer mine Packed Mud as fast as Pickaxe ( MCPE-161207 )
61. Placing blocks on Top Snow and Tall Grass while moving side to side will no longer cause them to stack up continuously ( MCPE-162785 )
62. Suspicious Gravel and Suspicious Sand blocks now display correctly on Maps
63. Mushrooms are now able to spawn on fallen tree trunks ( MCPE-138333 )
64. Conduit now has the correct lighting when placed on ground ( MCPE-169732 )
65. Fixed black pixels being generated on maps when Client-Side Chunk Generation was enabled
66. Shield no longer clips inside the Armor Stand model while in the riposte pose
67. Placing, rotating, or removing an item in an Item Frame or in a Glow Item Frame now emits vibrations ( MCPE-166741 )
68. Charging a Respawn Anchor now emits vibrations ( MCPE-157409 )
69. Scraping or applying wax to blocks of the Copper block set now emits vibrations
70. Switching a Daylight Detector to an Inverted Daylight Detector, or vice-versa, now emits vibrations
71. Adding food to a Campfire now emits vibrations
72. Adding or removing a Music Disc to a Jukebox now emits vibrations
73. Mud turning into Clay now emits vibrations
74. Harvesting Sweet Berries now emits vibrations
75. Placing an Eye of Ender in an End Portal Frame now emits vibrations ( MCPE-155372 )
76. Bees now emit vibrations when entering or exiting a Beehive or a Bee Nest ( MCPE-156199 )
77. Interacting with a Composter now emits vibrations ( MCPE-156199 )
78. Attaching or detaching a Lead from a Fence now emits vibrations ( MCPE-156199 )
79. Attaching or detaching a Lead from a mob now emits vibrations ( MCPE-156199 )
80. Dying a Sheep now emits vibrations ( MCPE-156199 )
81. Picking Glow Berries now emits vibrations ( MCPE-156199 )
82. Farmland turning into Dirt now emits vibrations ( MCPE-156199 )
83. Using a Spawn Egg on a Monster Spawner now emits vibrations ( MCPE-156199 )
84. Silverfish merging with blocks now emit vibrations ( MCPE-156199 )
85. Using a Hoe on Rooted Dirt now emits vibrations ( MCPE-156199 )
86. Using a Shovel to create Dirt Paths now emits vibrations ( MCPE-156199 )
87. Placing a Door now emits vibrations
88. Planting seeds in Farmland now emits vibrations
89. Updated the contrast ratio of the close button in realms feed menu
90. Updated the contrast ratio of the New Post header banner
91. An error message is now shown when attempting to upload a cross-platform restricted world to Realms, instead of uploading a corrupted world
92. The focus indicator no longer auto selects the Find Friend button when the Members tab is selected
93. Improved the Xbox on-screen keyboard experience, including better positioning, updating fields with typed input, and no more screen dimming while on screen keyboard is open ( MCPE-156575 )
94. Added a toggle to all platforms enabling extra-large GUI scaling beyond what the GUI slider allows
95. Text-to-speech now reads item names when selecting items in the hotbar
96. Added support for detecting Brazilian Portuguese as the preferred system language on Nintendo Switch
97. Horse and Donkey jump bar, and camel dash bar, now scale properly to the experience bar ( MCPE-156444 )
98. Changed the Pause Menu disconnection text to be platform agnostic
99. Fixed an issue that caused the inventory to get locked up after auto placing ( MCPE-46795 )
100. Imported worlds now get their last played date modified to the time they were imported
101. Reordered the gamepad tooltips for UI screens so that the buttons align with the same side as a controller
102. Default chat duration is now set to 10 seconds while default toast notification duration remains at 3 seconds
103. Improved handling of simultaneous mouse clicks, triggering each individual associated action/response
104. Fixed issues with unresponsive or laggy input when using mouse together with a controller ( MCPE-167447 )
105. Text-to-speech now reads "Slash button" when hovering over the "/" button in the chat screen
106. Fixed issues with highlighted blocks and mob shadows appearing through the Pumpkin head overlay on Switch
107. Rendering of snow or rain is now based on camera position instead of player position
108. Shields no longer flicker when held in both hands on RTX
109. Fixed sleep and camera fade effect not covering the screen until after first-person rendering happens
110. Underwater and fog effects are now based on camera position rather than player position
111. Fancy Leaves setting is now applied immediately and will no longer cause x-ray effect ( MCPE-123608 )
112. Fixed player capes not properly flapping when moving forward but looking sideways (fixed for real this time!) ( MCPE-153446 )
113. Updated Add-On templates for 1.20.10 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation are available to download at aka.ms/MCAddonPacks
114. Note for Linux users: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (Bionic Beaver) will reach End of Standard Support in 2023. Accordingly, the Linux Minecraft Dedicated Server will also raise its minimum target Ubuntu version to 20.04 LTS (Focal Fossa) in a later 1.20 update (exact release to be determined). Minecraft server operators using Ubuntu are encouraged to prepare for this transition by updating their deployments to 20.04 LTS as soon as possible.
115. Fixed invalid entries in allowlist.json causing a crash ( BDS-18133 )
116. Invalid JSON objects within the entity component "minecraft:behavior.nearest_attackable_target" will no longer crash the game ( MCPE-168129 )
117. Fixed a crash that could occur when running the “go_and_give_items_to_noteblock” goal
118. Fixed a crash that could occur when attempting to change a mob’s scale while it was colliding with blocks ( MCPE-170645 )
119. Added deprecation error message for the part_visibility component (the bone_visibility field in the geometry component should be used instead, see block documentation for more information)
120. Fixed an issue where adding a minecraft:peek component to a custom entity would cause the game to crash
121. /time query command will now return the correct day and time of day when the absolute time is negative
122. Executing the " inputpermission set " command will now output a message to the chat with the results ( MCPE-168368 )
123. Executing the " inputpermission set " command will now result in an error if it does not affect any players
124. Command positions will now use the current position/rotation when running mcfunctions via execute
125. Fixed issue where some execute commands stopped working on Realms ( MCPE-169974 )
126. The " hasitem " target selector argument now counts items held with the cursor ( MCPE-152002 )
127. Commands will still work with "concrete", but "concrete" won't be suggested in the command prompt, rather the new names will "concrete" block is now split into unique instances, namely "white_concrete", "orange_concrete", "magenta_concrete", "light_blue_concrete", "yellow_concrete", "lime_concrete", "pink_concrete", "gray_concrete", "light_gray_concrete", "cyan_concrete", "purple_concrete", "blue_concrete", "brown_concrete", "green_concrete", "red_concrete", and "black_concrete"
128. This can safely be used on any handle to a native object before accessing or using the object, to ensure the underlying object still exists and is valid to use Block (checks the block is a valid position in bounds and the containing chunk is loaded & ticking) Container (checks the relevent container inventory exists and is valid) Effect (checks the owning entity is valid and the effect exists on that entity) ScreenDisplay (checks the owning player is valid) ScoreboardObjective (checks the objective entry exists and is attached to a valid scoreboard) Entity (checks that the entity exists in the world. Will return true if the entity is dead) Player SimulatedPlayer (Note simulated players do not automatically get removed from the world, so isValid will return true long after they are dead) ContainerSlot (checks the item context is valid: Container exists in the world, such as the owning entity, and the slot is within the container bounds) Already existed as a read-only property, changed to a method for consistency

1.20.1.title: Minecraft - 1.20.1 (Bedrock)
1.20.1.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.20.1 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released to address some issues that were introduced with the 1.20 update.

**Fixes:**
1. Improved the reliability of unlocking achievements on Nintendo Switch ( MCPE-163948 )
2. Boats now retain the ability to carry passengers when a world is upgraded to Trails & Tales ( MCPE-169772 ) Boats that were affected by this bug can once again carry passengers
3. Boats that were affected by this bug can once again carry passengers
4. Fixed a bug that caused Pressure Plate's deactivation delay to be inconsistent ( MCPE-171429 )

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/16921792287757-Minecraft-1-20-1-Bedrock

1.20.0.title: Minecraft - Trails & Tales - 1.20.0 (Bedrock)
1.20.0.md:
__**Minecraft - Trails & Tales - 1.20.0 (Bedrock)**__
> The Trails & Tales Update brings your stories to life! Ride a camel with a companion to find archeological sites or a cherry grove. Hatch a sniffer egg to bring it back from extinction. Create playable mob sounds, craft with bamboo, trim your armor, and hang your signs. Write and store your books in the chiseled bookshelf, because every story matters!

**Fixes:**
1. Added a craftable Brush item
2. Added Suspicious Sand and Suspicious Gravel Suspicious Sand can be found in Desert Temples, Desert Wells and Warm Ocean Ruins Suspicious Gravel can be found in Cold Ocean Ruins and Trail Ruins These fragile blocks are hard to spot and easy to destroy, so be careful! Brushing Suspicious Sand or Suspicious Gravel with a Brush will extract objects that were buried long ago
3. Suspicious Sand can be found in Desert Temples, Desert Wells and Warm Ocean Ruins
4. Suspicious Gravel can be found in Cold Ocean Ruins and Trail Ruins
5. These fragile blocks are hard to spot and easy to destroy, so be careful!
6. Brushing Suspicious Sand or Suspicious Gravel with a Brush will extract objects that were buried long ago
7. Added the Trail Ruins, a buried structure from a lost culture Four types of Armor Trim Templates can be found here Trail Ruins can be found in Taigas, Snowy Taigas, all Old Growth forest biomes, and Jungles A new music disc can be found by brushing suspicious blocks in this structure When put in a Jukebox, "Relic" by Aaron Cherof is played
8. Four types of Armor Trim Templates can be found here
9. Trail Ruins can be found in Taigas, Snowy Taigas, all Old Growth forest biomes, and Jungles
10. A new music disc can be found by brushing suspicious blocks in this structure When put in a Jukebox, "Relic" by Aaron Cherof is played
11. When put in a Jukebox, "Relic" by Aaron Cherof is played
12. Added Pottery Sherds Pottery Sherds have pictures on them A total of 20 sherds have been distributed between the 5 Archaeology sites: Desert Wells, Desert Temples, Cold Ocean Ruins, Warm Ocean Ruins, and Trail Ruins They cannot be crafted, and are only found by brushing Suspicious Sand or Suspicious Gravel
13. Pottery Sherds have pictures on them
14. A total of 20 sherds have been distributed between the 5 Archaeology sites: Desert Wells, Desert Temples, Cold Ocean Ruins, Warm Ocean Ruins, and Trail Ruins
15. They cannot be crafted, and are only found by brushing Suspicious Sand or Suspicious Gravel
16. Crafting four Pottery Sherds together will create a Decorated Pot with a picture on each side
17. Brick items can be used instead of Pottery Sherds in the Decorated Pot recipe The sides that were made from Brick items will not have pictures
18. The sides that were made from Brick items will not have pictures
19. Smash a Decorated Pot with any block-breaking tool to break it apart and get the Pottery Sherds back Hitting the pot with bare hands, silk touch tools, or any other item will drop an intact pot instead
20. Hitting the pot with bare hands, silk touch tools, or any other item will drop an intact pot instead
21. Crafted Decorated Pots with at least one pattern have a hover tooltip displaying the Sherd & Brick ingredients
22. Added a new Cherry Grove biome, with pretty cherry blossom trees The biome can be found in the mountains, in similar places as Meadows
23. The biome can be found in the mountains, in similar places as Meadows
24. Added a new Cherry wood set, with all the corresponding wooden things you can craft from it
25. Pink particles fall from beneath Cherry Leaves
26. Added a new Pink Petals block with lots of pink flowers on the ground Each Pink Petal block can contain up to 4 petals Using Bone Meal on it increases the number of petals Placing a Pink Petal into an already placed block increases the number of petals Drops the number of petals in the block when mined Updated the seed picker with a Cherry Grove biome option
27. Each Pink Petal block can contain up to 4 petals
28. Using Bone Meal on it increases the number of petals
29. Placing a Pink Petal into an already placed block increases the number of petals
30. Drops the number of petals in the block when mined
31. Updated the seed picker with a Cherry Grove biome option
32. Added a new Bamboo wood set, with all the corresponding wooden things you can craft from it
33. Block of Bamboo can be crafted from 9 Bamboo and can be stripped like other wood logs
34. Bamboo Planks crafted from Block of Bamboo yield only 2 planks compared to 4 for wood logs
35. Added a new "Mosaic" plank variant that is unique to Bamboo called the Bamboo Mosaic It can be crafted with 1x2 Bamboo Slabs in a vertical strip You can craft Stair and Slab variants of Bamboo Mosaic Bamboo Mosaic blocks cannot be used as a crafting ingredient where other wooden blocks are used, but they can be used as fuel
36. It can be crafted with 1x2 Bamboo Slabs in a vertical strip
37. You can craft Stair and Slab variants of Bamboo Mosaic
38. Bamboo Mosaic blocks cannot be used as a crafting ingredient where other wooden blocks are used, but they can be used as fuel
39. Added a unique Bamboo Raft and Bamboo Chest Raft which can be crafted like normal boats, but with Bamboo Planks They function the same as ordinary boats, but have a unique look to them
40. They function the same as ordinary boats, but have a unique look to them
41. Hanging Signs are a more expensive version of normal Signs Crafted with 2 chains and 6 stripped logs of your preferred wood type Crafting results in 6 Hanging Signs
42. Crafted with 2 chains and 6 stripped logs of your preferred wood type
43. Crafting results in 6 Hanging Signs
44. Can be hung up in the following ways: Underneath a block that can provide support in the center, like a full block or a fence Attached to the solid side of a block Attached to the side or underneath another Hanging Sign
45. Underneath a block that can provide support in the center, like a full block or a fence
46. Attached to the solid side of a block
47. Attached to the side or underneath another Hanging Sign
48. Unlike normal Signs, they cannot be placed directly on the ground without support from the side or above However, Hanging Signs that have a horizontal bar will not pop when the supporting block is removed
49. However, Hanging Signs that have a horizontal bar will not pop when the supporting block is removed
50. Sign text can now be edited after being placed in the world This can be done by interacting with the Sign Signs with non-text chat components can not be edited
51. This can be done by interacting with the Sign
52. Signs with non-text chat components can not be edited
53. Both sides of the Sign can now have separate text and colors, allowing for further customization options By default, a Sign will prompt you to input the front side's text when placed To apply text to the back-side, you must walk to the other side and interact with that face to edit it
54. By default, a Sign will prompt you to input the front side's text when placed
55. To apply text to the back-side, you must walk to the other side and interact with that face to edit it
56. Signs can now also be waxed with Honeycomb, preventing any further edits to its text
57. It is no longer possible to use Ink Sac, Glow Ink Sac, or Dyes if the Sign text is empty ( MCPE-133778 )
58. The Sniffer is the mob vote winner of Minecraft Live 2022
59. Sniffers are passive, friendly mobs
60. Sniffers sniff the air and occasionally dig for seeds, which produces a Torchflower Seed or a Pitcher Pod item
61. Sniffers can only dig grass and dirt-like blocks
62. Sniffers can be tempted by, and bred with Torchflower Seeds
63. Can be found by brushing the Suspicious Sand of Warm Ocean Ruins
64. When two Sniffers breed they do not immediately spawn a Snifflet; instead, a Sniffer Egg is dropped

154. Sculk Sensors and Calibrated Sculk Sensors now have three phases: Inactive, Active, and Cooldown
155. The default phase is Inactive This phase lasts indefinitely until the block receives a vibration During this phase, the block is able to listen to nearby vibrations until one has been scheduled
156. This phase lasts indefinitely until the block receives a vibration
157. During this phase, the block is able to listen to nearby vibrations until one has been scheduled
158. When a scheduled vibration is received, the block switches to the Active phase This phase lasts 30 game ticks for Sculk Sensors, and 10 game ticks for Calibrated Sculk Sensors During this phase, the block stops listening to nearby vibrations, wiggles its tendrils, and emits a Redstone signal and light
159. This phase lasts 30 game ticks for Sculk Sensors, and 10 game ticks for Calibrated Sculk Sensors

161. After the Active phase has finished, the block switches to a Cooldown phase This phase lasts for 10 game ticks During this phase, the block keeps wiggling its tendrils, but no longer emits a Redstone signal nor light Finally, once this phase is finished, the block will switch back to the Inactive phase
162. This phase lasts for 10 game ticks
163. During this phase, the block keeps wiggling its tendrils, but no longer emits a Redstone signal nor light
164. Finally, once this phase is finished, the block will switch back to the Inactive phase

312. Added PlacementDirection and PlacementPosisition BlockTraits The PlacementDirection trait can enable the "minecraft:cardinal_direction" and/or "minecraft:facing_direction" states on a block. "minecraft:cardinal_direction" is a four value string state ["north", "south", "east", "west"] that describes what cardinal direction the player was facing when they placed the block. "minecraft:facing_direction" is a six value string state ["down", "up", "north", "south", "east", "west"] that describes what direction the player was facing when they placed the block. Values for these states are set when the block is placed. The PlacementPosition trait can enable the "minecraft:block_face" and/or "minecraft:vertical_half" states on a block. "minecraft:block_face" is a six value string state ["down", "up", "north", "south", "east", "west"] that describes what face the block was placed on. "minecraft:vertical_half" is a two value string state ["bottom", "top"] that describes whether the block was placed in the upper or lower half of a block position. Values for these states are set when the block is placed. Can access all states associated with BlockTraits through the "block_property" Molang queries and "set_block_property" event responses. Note: Use of BlockTraits in JSON is currently behind the "Upcoming Creator Features" toggle

System Events Further separation of events into distinct before* and after* handling, with some restrictions on the execution of state updates in a before event: All before events moved from world.events into world.beforeEvents property . The "before" prefix has been removed. Functions that alter world state are prohibited in before event callbacks. Read-only methods and properties are allowed. Set methods are limited to the event object itself. Any use of restricted methods and properties will throw an exception. For example, system.events.beforeWatchdogTerminate is now considered a "before" event. Functions that alter world state are prohibited in before event callbacks. Read-only methods and properties are allowed. Set methods are limited to the event object itself. Any use of restricted methods and properties will throw an exception For example, system.events.scriptEventReceived is now considered an "after" event. After event callbacks are executed in a deferred manner. Using /scriptEvent something will queue script to execute at a later point
328. Further separation of events into distinct before* and after* handling, with some restrictions on the execution of state updates in a before event:
