1.19.83.title: Minecraft - 1.19.83 (Bedrock)
1.19.83.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.83 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released to address some issues that were introduced with the 1.19.80 update.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed several crashes that could occur during gameplay
2. The inventory cursor no longer snaps to a random spot when flicking the left thumbstick ( MCPE-169176 )
3. Fixed custom textures that override ‘minecraft’ blocks with aux metadata as a list of textures
4. Several fixes to custom spawn eggs ( MCPE-170184 ) Re-enabled use of aux value to refer to custom eggs in commands for game versions 1.19.80 and beyond, eg. "/give @s spawn_egg 1 654" Re-enabled use of Molang queries for the item's data field in recipes for game versions 1.19.80 and beyond, eg. { "item": "spawn_egg", "data": "query.get_actor_info_id('namespace:actor')" } Re-enabled use of "set_actor_id" in loot tables when refering to custom spawn eggs for game versions 1.19.80 and beyond
5. Re-enabled use of aux value to refer to custom eggs in commands for game versions 1.19.80 and beyond, eg. "/give @s spawn_egg 1 654"
6. Re-enabled use of Molang queries for the item's data field in recipes for game versions 1.19.80 and beyond, eg. { "item": "spawn_egg", "data": "query.get_actor_info_id('namespace:actor')" }
7. Re-enabled use of "set_actor_id" in loot tables when refering to custom spawn eggs for game versions 1.19.80 and beyond

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/15837147699853-Minecraft-1-19-83-Bedrock

1.19.81.title: Minecraft - 1.19.81 (Bedrock)
1.19.81.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.81 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released to address some issues that were introduced with the 1.19.80 update.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed a crash with the ‘/tell’ command (and some other commands) that could occur on Realms
2. Fixed an issue with Purchase buttons loading infinitely on Featured Servers
3. Fixed Featured Server offers not displaying the “Show More” button

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/15270678197133-Minecraft-1-19-81-Bedrock

1.19.80.title: Minecraft - 1.19.80 (Bedrock)
1.19.80.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.80 (Bedrock)**__
> It’s time for a new quality-of-life update containing a variety of changes, fixes, and experimental features! Let’s jump into the highlights:

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed multiple crashes that could occur during gameplay
2. Added settings to adjust item enchantment glint strength and speed
3. Take an early look at cherry blossom trees, armor trims, and more with experimental features
4. Fixes to over 40 community-reported issues
5. The ability to sneak under 1.5 block gaps is now behind the “Short Sneak” toggle. Enable the toggle to continue to test out the feature while we continue polishing it
6. Player’s hitbox height now reduces to 1.5 blocks while sneaking Sneaking will automatically be initiated while stuck in a gap of less than 1.8 blocks Sneaking will lower the player camera height respective of these changes Sneaking now requires enough space to stand in order to exit sneaking state Players will transition from swimming to sneaking if they are unable to stand up but would be able to sneak
7. Sneaking will automatically be initiated while stuck in a gap of less than 1.8 blocks
8. Sneaking will lower the player camera height respective of these changes
9. Sneaking now requires enough space to stand in order to exit sneaking state
10. Players will transition from swimming to sneaking if they are unable to stand up but would be able to sneak
11. Introducing the Cherry Grove biome, with pretty Cherry Blossom trees. You can find it in the mountains, like Meadows
12. It has a new flower, Pink Petals, as ground cover, which can be crafted into Pink Dye
13. Pigs, Rabbits, Sheep, and Bees spawn there
14. Comes with a new wood set for the Cherry Blossom trees
15. Added the Trail Ruins, a buried structure from a lost culture
16. Added Suspicious Gravel block, which has the same characteristics as Suspicious Sand
17. Added Suspicious Sand to Warm Ocean Ruins
18. Added Suspicious Gravel to Cold Ocean Ruins
19. Added 16 new Pottery Shards (Now 20 Pottery Shards in total) These have been distributed between the five Archaeology sites: Desert Wells, Desert Temples, Cold Ocean Ruins, Warm Ocean Ruins, and Trail Ruins
20. These have been distributed between the five Archaeology sites: Desert Wells, Desert Temples, Cold Ocean Ruins, Warm Ocean Ruins, and Trail Ruins
21. You can now visually customize your armor with a variety of unique trims at the Smithing Table
22. Armor Trims are purely visual with no gameplay benefits, and can only be applied to Helmets, Chestplates, Leggings, and Boots All trim patterns are visually the same on an armor's item icon, but the color will still change based on the trim material To check which trim pattern a piece of armor has, you can hover over it in the inventory
23. All trim patterns are visually the same on an armor's item icon, but the color will still change based on the trim material
24. To check which trim pattern a piece of armor has, you can hover over it in the inventory
25. An Armor Trim has two properties: a pattern and a material The pattern is defined by the Smithing Template used to apply the trim, and represents the visual pattern of the trim The material is defined by what ingredient you used to apply the trim, and represents the color of the trim
26. The pattern is defined by the Smithing Template used to apply the trim, and represents the visual pattern of the trim
27. The material is defined by what ingredient you used to apply the trim, and represents the color of the trim
28. The viable ingredients you can use to define the color of your Armor Trim are the following: Iron Copper Gold Lapis Emerald Diamond Netherite Redstone Amethyst Quartz
29. Iron
30. Copper
31. Gold
32. Lapis
33. Emerald
34. Diamond
35. Netherite
36. Redstone
37. Amethyst
38. Quartz
39. Smithing Tables have been redesigned into a workstation for physical equipment upgrades and modifications
40. Alongside slots for combining a piece of equipment and materials, there is now a required slot for an item type called Smithing Templates
41. Smithing Templates define what type of upgrade you will be making to equipment It specifies both what type of items you can upgrade, and which ingredients are valid to customize the upgrade There are currently two categories of Smithing Templates: Armor Trim and Netherite Upgrade
42. It specifies both what type of items you can upgrade, and which ingredients are valid to customize the upgrade
43. There are currently two categories of Smithing Templates: Armor Trim and Netherite Upgrade
44. Armor Trim Smithing Templates can be found all throughout the world, and each of the following structures contain their own unique Smithing Template: Pillager Outpost: Sentry Armor Trim Desert Pyramid: Dune Armor Trim Shipwreck: Coast Armor Trim Jungle Temple: Wild Armor Trim Ocean Monument: Tide Armor Trim Ancient City: Ward Armor Trim Woodland Mansion: Vex Armor Trim Nether Fortress: Rib Armor Trim Bastion Remnant: Snout Armor Trim Stronghold: Eye Armor Trim End City: Spire Armor Trim Trail Ruins: Wayfinder Armor Trim, Raiser Armor Trim, Shaper Armor Trim, Host Armor Trim Ancient City: Silence Armor Trim
45. Pillager Outpost: Sentry Armor Trim
46. Desert Pyramid: Dune Armor Trim
47. Shipwreck: Coast Armor Trim
48. Jungle Temple: Wild Armor Trim
49. Ocean Monument: Tide Armor Trim
50. Ancient City: Ward Armor Trim
51. Woodland Mansion: Vex Armor Trim
52. Nether Fortress: Rib Armor Trim
53. Bastion Remnant: Snout Armor Trim
54. Stronghold: Eye Armor Trim
55. End City: Spire Armor Trim
56. Trail Ruins: Wayfinder Armor Trim, Raiser Armor Trim, Shaper Armor Trim, Host Armor Trim
57. Ancient City: Silence Armor Trim
58. Smithing Templates are found in Chests in their respective structure, except for the Ocean Monument. Instead of finding it in Chests, Elder Guardians sometimes drop a Smithing Template when defeated
59. Some Armor Trim Smithing Templates are rarer than others, so be on the lookout for them to impress your friends!
60. Smithing Templates are consumed when used to upgrade an item in the Smithing Table
61. You can craft a copy of a Smithing Template in the Crafting Table with 7 Diamonds + 1 block of material that the template is made out of + 1 Smithing Template, which will output 2 of the same Smithing Template
62. Netherite equipment crafting now also requires a Netherite Upgrade Smithing Template
63. Netherite Upgrade Smithing Templates can be found randomly in all Bastion Remnant chests, and there is a guarantee of 2 in every Treasure Room Bastion Remnant
64. This change was made for a variety of reasons: Increases the time players utilize Diamond equipment before Netherite Make Netherite equipment a more significant achievement in the game's progression Adapts Netherite more naturally into the new Smithing Table crafting system
65. Increases the time players utilize Diamond equipment before Netherite
66. Make Netherite equipment a more significant achievement in the game's progression
67. Adapts Netherite more naturally into the new Smithing Table crafting system
68. A new variant of Sculk Sensors which allows you to filter vibrations based on their frequency level. They are not found naturally and can only be crafted
69. They can be crafted with 1 Sculk Sensor and 3 Amethyst Shards in the Crafting Table
70. One side of the Calibrated Sculk Sensor can receive a Redstone signal as input The strength of that Redstone signal is the only vibration frequency the Sculk Sensor will listen to
71. The strength of that Redstone signal is the only vibration frequency the Sculk Sensor will listen to
72. Blocks of Amethyst have a new behavior when placed adjacent to Sculk Sensors
73. If that Sculk Sensor receives a vibration, the Block of Amethyst will re-emit its frequency as a separate vibration at its location
74. This behaviour is called Vibration Resonance, and allows players to move vibration frequencies across long distances without having to recreate the vibration naturally
75. Signs have improved customization options
76. Sign text can now be edited after being placed in the world This can be done by interacting with the Sign
77. This can be done by interacting with the Sign
78. Both sides of the Sign can now have separate text and colors, allowing for further customization options By default, a Sign will prompt you to input the front side's text when placed To apply text to the back-side, you must walk to the other side and interact with that face to edit it
79. By default, a Sign will prompt you to input the front side's text when placed
80. To apply text to the back-side, you must walk to the other side and interact with that face to edit it
81. Signs can now also be waxed with Honeycomb, preventing any further edits to its text
82. Renamed and enchanted weapons are now displayed in respawn and chat windows with color when a player is killed by an entity using it ( MCPE-162679 )
83. Weighted Pressure Plates now produce the same sound as in Java Edition ( MCPE-164912 )
84. Removed the character limit for scoreboard objective names and objective display names ( MCPE-165064 )
85. Melons and Pumpkins can now grow onto Mud, Podzol, Rooted Dirt, and Muddy Mangrove Roots
86. Nylium blocks are now grouped with Netherrack in the Creative inventory ( MCPE-163587 )
87. Armor Stands now vanish with no sound effects when killed with the /kill command ( MCPE-159136 )
88. Slightly decreased Panda collision box to match Java Edition
89. Slightly increased Polar Bear collision box to match Java Edition
90. Shipwreck supply chests are no longer missing Moss Block as loot ( MCPE-168376 )
91. Mobs will once again take damage when standing on an incomplete block next to a Campfire ( MCPE-167479 )
92. Fixed several crashes that could occur during gameplay
93. Fixed a bug where invalid Banner Patterns were causing players in render distance to crash
94. Fixed a bug where Command Blocks could cause actors within a level chunk to freeze
95. Fixed a crash that could occur when opening the My Packs tab with a broken pack ( MCPE-165806 )
96. Fixed the player moving in the wrong direction after exiting a container screen while using a gamepad ( MCPE-121565 )
97. Players can no longer sneak while flying ( MCPE-166834 )
98. The player’s camera no longer appears inside blocks when sprint and swim are held ( MCPE-166565 )
99. Fixed animation transition between swimming and walking ( MCPE-166769 )
100. The Health Boost effect will no longer fully replenish the player's health after the effect runs out ( MCPE-165434 )
101. Fixed ambient cave sounds to no longer play when the player enters or loads into The End ( MCPE-141493 )
102. Mobs can now enter a Boat only if they are smaller than the Boat itself
103. Villagers will now generate green particles when a successful trade is completed
104. Mobs no longer play the player eat sound when fed breeding materials
105. Turtles can now enter Boats and Boats with Chest ( MCPE-65719 )
106. Hoglins, Polar Bears, and Spiders can no longer enter Boats and Boats with Chest ( MCPE-161197 )
107. Fixed experience orb position desync after teleport ( MCPE-59584 )
108. Villagers will now wake up in a valid position and will not phase though blocks ( MCPE-142544 )
109. Mangrove, Bamboo, and Polished Blackstone buttons are no longer visible on maps
110. Flowers are once again displayed immediately when placed inside a Flower Pot
111. Nether Portals can now replace blocks other than just air when being generated. This includes blocks such as Grass and Snow layers ( MCPE-162272 )
112. Light Blocks can no longer have their light levels changed in Survival or Adventure modes ( MCPE-138868 )
113. Campfire sounds are now louder and clearer ( MCPE-122296 )
114. Sponges no longer emit water drop particles underwater ( MCPE-122138 )
115. Fixed an issue where colored wool became white wool after been loaded from worlds prior to 1.17 ( MCPE-168684 )
116. Potions no longer have an enchantment glint, due to it obscuring the color of the potion contents
117. Cooking Chorus Fruit in a Furnace will now generate experience ( MCPE-68127 )
118. A glint strength slider that adjusts how transparent the visual glint is on enchanted items has been added to the Accessibility Settings
119. A glint speed slider that adjusts how fast the visual glint shimmers across enchanted items has been added to the Accessibility Settings
120. Focus indicator is now automatically visible on menu items while using a keyboard
121. Text-to-speech no longer reads previously selected items after moving to new one
122. Text-to-speech no longer gets stuck on reading accessibility tab while the user switches between different tabs
123. Added a header and title for the inventory tab in inventory screen while using Pocket UI
124. Updated look of sign in and sign up screens
125. Increased the spacing between headers in the Settings screen to increase readability
126. Touchpad scrolling now matches the operating system's scroll direction
127. Feedback button on the pause menu will now prompt the user with a modal before redirecting to the browser
128. Corrected toggle navigation in Edit World menu while using gamepad or keyboard that were previously skipped
129. Halved the default visibility of the glint on enchanted items, which can now be modified in the Accessibility Settings ( MCPE-167814 )
130. Fixed an issue where unnecessary black boxes appeared in VR while around partial blocks
131. Fixed the issue where multiple light sources (such as Torches) were incorrectly emitting white light in RTX ( MCPE-166947 )
132. Boots do not z-fight anymore when worn by a player
133. The "leg" and "belt" parts of Leggings do not z-fight anymore when worn by a player
134. Capes no longer flash red when getting damaged ( MCPE-105347 )
135. Fixed a visible gap in Hopper model ( MCPE-55122 )
136. Fixed alignment of the output slot of Crafting Table ( MCPE-143255 )
137. Going into lava in third person view no longer causes the camera to turn black ( MCPE-166861 )
138. A Wishlist has been added to select players for testing so that players can save things to purchase at a later time
139. This feature is still in testing and, for now, will only be available for select players
140. Look for this icon in Marketplace:
141. Fixed an issue that prevented players on PlayStation 5 from purchasing a Realms Plus trial
142. Added the ability for members to update the Realm server version, meaning that the Realm owner will not need to log on to update
143. Added D-pad navigation in the Realms feed screen popup
144. Added keyboard navigation in the Realms feed screen popup
145. Fixed a bug where players would be stuck if they added a resource pack to an expired Realm and clicked the exit button
146. Fixed a bug where content packs applied to a world in a Realm slot were applied to another world in another slot in the same Realm
147. Fixed a bug where content packs applied to a world is unintentionally unapplied when joining a world
148. Fixed an extra Cancel button displaying on mobile file download dialog
149. Added a link to Microsoft Privacy Statement in the world upload dialog
150. Added new touch and hold Stack Splitting for precision selection of the items in a single slot
151. Fixed an issue where items could get stuck in the Crafting Table when using touch input
152. If the player is underwater and Auto-Jump is enabled, as they approach a block that is 1 level higher than the current level, they will rise. This also allows auto-jumping out of water onto land
153. Updated Add-On templates for 19.80 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation are available to download at aka.ms/MCAddonPacks
154. For behavior packs using version 1.19.80 and above, recipes no longer accept a Molang query for the item's data field, instead use the item's full name, eg. use { "item": "namespace:actor_spawn_egg" } instead of { "item": "spawn_egg", "data": "query.get_actor_info_id('namespace:actor')" }
155. Fixed an issue that caused the InteractComponent to not work correctly while sneaking ( MCPE-168449 )
156. The /execute command now displays an appropriate error message when there is an error in the second or subsequent subcommand target selector ( MCPE-164304 )
157. Provide auto-complete support for block states
158. Added two new overloads to the summon command: /summon [spawnPos : x y z] facing <position: x y z> [spawnEvent: string] [nametag: string] /summon [spawnPos : x y z] facing <lookAtEntity: target> [spawnEvent: string] [nametag: string]
159. /summon [spawnPos : x y z] facing <position: x y z> [spawnEvent: string] [nametag: string]
160. /summon [spawnPos : x y z] facing <lookAtEntity: target> [spawnEvent: string] [nametag: string]
161. Fixed an issue where the paste button in the Command Block UI would remember extra presses from failed pastes ( MCPE-163705 )
162. For worlds using game version 1.19.80 and above, acquiring a custom spawn egg through a command can only succeed with their full name rather than with an aux value, eg. "/give @s namespace:actor_spawn_egg"
163. "fence" block is now split into unique names, "oak_fence", "acacia_fence", "birch_fence", "dark_oak_fence", "jungle_fence", and "spruce_fence"
164. Commands will still work with "fence", but only new fence name will be suggested in the command prompt
165. Removed requirement for blockState argument(s) when using other optional args in /fill /setblock and /clone ( MCPE-167959 )
166. Implemented the "inputpermission" command, which allows for setting the player's camera or movement as enabled or disabled Syntax: /inputpermission set <target: player> <permission: camera | movement> <state: enabled | disabled>
167. Syntax: /inputpermission set <target: player> <permission: camera | movement> <state: enabled | disabled>
168. Implemented the "haspermission" target selector, which allows for selection based on player permission levels
169. item_interact_finish game event now has a vibration frequency of 2 instead of 14
170. item_interact_start is no longer considered a detectable vibration
171. Reeling a fishing rod now emits projectile_shoot vibration
172. Added "lose_target" field to projectile data to specify if an entity should unselect its target after shooting the projectile
173. Added a new Transformation component for blocks to support rotation, scaling and translation. The component can be added to the whole block, and/or to individual block permutations. Eg.
174. Transformed geometries still have the same restrictions that non-transformed geometries have, eg. a maximum size of 30/16 units
175. Chance information types used in tree feature JSONs for some trunks and foliage now allow 0 as the chance (values like 0.0001 were allowed, but not 0)
176. Form promises are now rejected using typed errors, vs. strings as used previously
177. Created new entity filter "is_raider" to determine if subject is part of a raid
178. Added "cooldown" field to target descriptors in "minecraft:behavior.nearest_attackable_target" goal
179. Deprecated minecraft:part_visibility block component
180. Added bone_visibility behavior to minecraft:geometry block component
181. Added function getTags(): string[] - Returns all tags for the item
182. Added function hasTag(tag: string): boolean - Returns true if the item has the specified tag
183. This component is used to manipulate the equipment of mobs and players. To use it, call getComponent('equipment_inventory')
184. Added function getEquipment(equipmentSlot: EquipmentSlot): ItemStack | undefined - Returns the item in the given equipment slot
185. Added function getEquipmentSlot(equipmentSlot: EquipmentSlot): ContainerSlot - Returns the container slot for the given equipment slot
186. Added function setEquipment(equipmentSlot: EquipmentSlot, itemStack?: ItemStack): void - Sets the item in the given equipment slot
187. The ItemDurabilityComponent now works with all damageable items, not just custom items
188. Removed property damageRange
189. Setting damage will now throw an exception if it is outside of the range [0, maxDurability]
190. In the map WDW Magic Kingdom, the carts on the Big Thunder Mountain, Snow White and the Seven Dwarves, and Space Mountain rides now properly align with the invisible Minecart they are attached to
191. Blocks can now optionally (via a setting in StartGamePacket) use a hashed value for their network IDs. This hashed value is independent of all other blocks and remains stable across future releases
192. Updated specific GameTest exceptions to be thrown as GameTestError error objects
193. Added two new commands: /gametest stopall - Used to manually stop all tests while they are running /gametest runsetuntilfail - Used to run a set of tests but will automatically stop if any of the tests fail
194. /gametest stopall - Used to manually stop all tests while they are running
195. /gametest runsetuntilfail - Used to run a set of tests but will automatically stop if any of the tests fail

1.19.73.title: Minecraft - 1.19.73 (Bedrock)
1.19.73.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.73 (Bedrock)**__
> An update has been released to fix several issues that addresses a few issues that occurred since the release of 1.19.70.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed several crashes that could occur during gameplay
2. Fixed a crash that could occur with Command Blocks using teleport commands
3. Fixed a bug where the player's aim height was not adjusting correctly when sneaking ( MCPE-167559 )
4. The first player in a splitscreen game will no longer have their input interrupted by other players opening up a container or inventory screen ( MCPE-168610 )
5. Fixed an issue where Ghast volume and volume distance were too low ( MCPE-168324 )
6. Fixed duplicate tooltips appearing when selecting item in the inventory while using touch controls ( MCPE-166866 )

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/14410802894477-Minecraft-1-19-73-Bedrock

1.19.72.title: Minecraft - 1.19.72 (Bedrock)
1.19.72.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.72 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released for PlayStation consoles that fixes an issue with Realms purchases since the release of 1.19.70.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed an issue that prevented purchasing or renewing Realms on PlayStation

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/14147067613197-Minecraft-1-19-72-Bedrock

1.19.71.title: Minecraft - 1.19.71 (Bedrock)
1.19.71.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.71 (Bedrock)**__
> An update has been released to fix several issues that addresses a few issues that occurred since the release of 1.19.70. As of March 20, 2023, this update is now available on all supported platforms!

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed an issue that could cause the game to get stuck at 66% when loading at launch ( MCPE-168284 )
2. Fixed a crash that could occur at launch on iOS
3. Fixed player names not appearing through the environment and behind walls ( MCPE-168269 )
4. Fixed a bug that caused the text on Signs not to be displayed with ray tracing enabled on PC ( MCPE-167638 )
5. Fixed an issue where players would load incorrect data when loading a local game after connecting to a server or Realm ( MCPE-164765 )
6. Players are now prompted with the option to enable text-to-speech, if supported, on first startup

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/14069543270797-Minecraft-1-19-71-Bedrock

1.19.70.title: Minecraft - 1.19.70 (Bedrock)
1.19.70.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.70 (Bedrock)**__
> The latest Minecraft update has arrived! This release brings several quality of life improvements to the game, changes to horse breeding, plus early versions of Archaeology and the Sniffer as new experimental features from the upcoming 1.20 update. Let’s see what’s inside!

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed multiple crashes that could occur during gameplay
2. When breeding horses, the baby horse now has a chance of being better than its parents in speed, jump strength, and health
3. Improvements to player emotes
4. Take an early look at archaeology and the sniffer mob with experimental features
5. Fixes to over 30 community-reported issues
6. Emote usage now appears in chat
7. The emote wheel now has four slots with an improved interface
8. Quick emoting with new hotkeys
9. Easier sorting of emotes
10. Creating a new character now automatically applies four default emotes
11. Fixed an issue where night could not be skipped if one or more players were on the death screen
12. Eating and drinking animations are now always centered, regardless of screen aspect ratio
13. Breeding horses can now produce random variants ( MCPE-129071 )
14. When breeding horses, the baby Horse now has a chance of being better than its parents in speed, jump strength, and health. This change is intended to make Horse breeding a viable way of getting great Horses, if a player starts with good parents and puts in enough time and Golden Carrots
15. Horses cannot be pushed over Fences covered by Carpets anymore ( MCPE-164717 )
16. Ghasts’ sound volume will now fade the further they are from the player ( MCPE-35222 )
17. Villagers will now emit anger particles when hit by a player outside of a village
18. Fixed a bug where Zombified Piglins would spawn in the Nether in light levels above 11
19. Minecarts can now eject mobs into liquid blocks ( MCPE-120078 )
20. Witches will now drink a Fire Resistance Potion when standing on a Campfire
21. Bells that are connected to multiple blocks no longer drop when one block is broken
22. Note Block sound attenuation over a distance is now linear ( MCPE-164935 )
23. Impact sounds of projectiles on Amethyst blocks and clusters are now audible
24. Dead Bush will now drop Sticks when broken with any tool except Shears, even those with the Silk Touch enchantment. Vines will drop nothing in the same situation ( MCPE-163246 )
25. Added the Brush item
26. Added the Decorated Pot block
27. Added four Pottery Shards (Arms Up, Skull, Prize, and Archer)
28. Added the Suspicious Sand block
29. Added Suspicious Sand to the Desert Temple
30. Added Suspicious Sand to the Desert Well
31. The Brush is a craftable item you can use to brush things
32. Pottery Shards have pictures on them. They cannot be crafted and must be found in the world. Hint: you will need a Brush! By crafting four of these together you can create a Decorated Pot with a picture on each side.
33. You can also use Brick items instead of Pottery Shards in the crafting recipe. The sides that were made from Brick items will not have pictures.
34. Smash a Decorated Pot with any block-breaking tool to break it apart and get the Pottery Shards back! Or hit it with your fist to pick up the pot without breaking it.
35. Desert Temples and Desert Wells now contain Suspicious Sand. This fragile block is hard to spot and easy to destroy, so be careful!
36. If you manage to find the Suspicious Sand and brush it with your Brush, you will extract objects that were buried long ago.
37. We're giving you an early look at these Archaeology features. We want to spend more time developing them. Please let us know where you think we can improve or expand!
38. The Sniffer is the mob vote winner of Minecraft Live 2022 and the first [HS1] extinct mob brought to life and added to the game
39. Sniffers cannot be tempted or tamed
40. Sniffers are passive friendly mobs
41. Sniffer sniffs in the air and occasionally dig for seeds
42. The Torchflower seed can be planted on farmland and grows into a flower
43. The seed can be used to breed two Sniffers
44. The full-grown flower can be harvested and replanted but can also be crafted into a dye
45. Fixed an issue where simultaneously pressing the "Mine" and "Place" button on any input device while targeting a Structure Block could cause the game to crash ( MCPE-155689 )
46. Fixed a crash on Nintendo Switch when attempting to log in while set to local network mode
47. Fixed a crash that could occur when entering a 1.7.1.0 world in 1.8 or above ( MCPE-165564 )
48. The player's crosshair now properly mines/interacts with items in front of them while swimming/gliding, rather than 1 block above their position ( MCPE-57257 )
49. Players no longer take rapid damage when touching damaging blocks ( MCPE-165347 )
50. Projectiles shot while swimming/gliding no longer spawn from above the player's position ( MCPE-31896 )
51. Items dropped while swimming/gliding, manually or on death, no longer spawn from above the player's position ( MCPE-31896 )
52. Fixed a bug where an Allay holding a Lead wasn't able to be leashed unless the player held a full stack of 64 Leads in hand
53. Parrots will no longer shake while on a player riding a Horse that is turning mid-jump
54. Fixed a bug causing global entities (e.g. Ender Dragon and projectiles) to stop rendering when out of normal entity render distance ( MCPE-161136 )
55. Sounds from all Button types and Lever are now controlled by "Blocks" slider in Audio Settings ( MCPE-166420 )
56. Redstone source can now power a single block from different sides at the same time ( MCPE-163651 )
57. Destroying Mangrove Log or Mangrove Wood now properly cause leaves to decay
58. End Crystals occupying the same space as a block will no longer cause that block to disappear
59. Players are now able to place top Slabs in blocks that are only partially blocked by an entity ( MCPE-155016 )
60. Players can no longer see through partial blocks when sneaking or riding in third person ( MCPE-156273 )
61. Composter now always consumes an item when becoming full ( MCPE-162020 )
62. Importing experimental blocks into a non-experimental world using the Structure Block will now correctly place unknown blocks, which are not interactable
63. Error messages about building outside the world height limits no longer appear when simply interacting with blocks at the world height limits from certain angles ( MCPE-152935 )
64. Fixed a bug where Observers would not detect changes due to corrupted data ( MCPE-150506 )
65. Hoppers now pull in items from above them through all blocks that have a lower height than a full block ( MCPE-55824 )
66. Crossbows now shake while charging arrows ( MCPE-152952 )
67. Spawn eggs for Snow Golem, Wither, and Trader Llama now appear correctly in the inventory and hotbar
68. Written Books can now be moved in the inventory even when the player has identical Written Books
69. Updated the How to Play screen with information on new touch controls
70. Changing input modes from Gamepad to Touch while an item is selected will return the selected to the inventory or drop it
71. Fixed an issue on the Furnace screen where double-tapping the output window caused other slots to become unselectable ( MCPE-164589 )
72. Fixed a bug where stack splitting was automatically initiated on the first slot when opening a small Chest
73. Allowed left and right D-pad buttons to keep input when the forward button is pressed ( MCPE-155199 )
74. Added the leave Boat button when the player falls from a height within in the Boat ( MCPE-158489 )
75. Fixed an issue that prevented players from removing equipped armor by tapping on an item or block in the Creative inventory ( MCPE-165790 )
76. Tweaked the keyboard interaction on Android devices for text input fields
77. Fixed an issue where the "Mine" tooltip was appearing when targeting a block with a Trident in Creative game mode ( MCPE-44846 )
78. Navigating right with controller left stick on the Marketplace sidebar now collapses it
79. Added a new 'Marketplace' icon to the Marketplace screen sidebar
80. Ocean Explorer, Woodland Explorer, and Treasure Maps now show the proper icon in the inventory ( MCPE-163464 )
81. Fixed a bug where mouse scrolling on the Friend Options dropdown would not scroll the dropdown contents
82. Resolved an issue where graphical elements of the Sign-In/Sign-Up screen could extend beyond the bounds of the dialog container
83. When starting a new world in Pocket UI, removed the "Press Open Chat to open chat" message for players with text-to-speech turned off
84. Double-clicking on the Furnace output slot will no longer drop the item ( MCPE-165079 )
85. Fixed a bug where moving the player or camera with a controller while text-to-speech for UI was turned on would cause the narrator to say "X of Y"
86. Fixed a bug where the Edit World screen couldn't be opened for a world if the corresponding world directory had a space in it ( MCPE-166763 )
87. The loading screen no longer flickers when entering the Nether in immersive VR mode
88. The swap item animation now plays when switching hotbar items of the same type with the same durability
89. Phasing through blocks in third person view no longer makes the camera zoom in and out towards the player’s head ( MCPE-160467 )
90. End Gateways can no longer be used in Spectator Mode ( MCPE-165689 )
91. Added a Sign In button on the Realms screen if player is not yet signed in
92. Fixed the issue that the "Find Friends" button and the "Close Realm" buttons would be autofocused when the "Members" or "Subscription" tab was clicked
93. Fixed a bug where players were not able to create another world on Realms if the first Create World on Realms attempt was interrupted
94. Fixed a bug where players could see duplicate applied packs with unknown titles the first time they entered the Realms settings screen
95. Resetting a Realms World now correctly updates the World settings
96. Removed the Close button in the Play on Realm popup dialog when using controllers
97. Updated the reset/replace world confirmation text to make it clearer what each function does
98. Fixed the world list not updating with a new Realm immediately after accepting an invite
99. In Realms Settings->Members, the dropdown '...' menu can now be open/closed with the Enter key and navigated with arrow keys
100. Updated Add-On templates for 1.19.70 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation are available to download at aka.ms/MCAddonPacks
101. Behavior packs with scripts can now be removed from worlds
102. Item loot table conditions are no longer ignored in-game when used inside functions ( MCPE-164582 )
103. Carrots now display the proper name in item tooltips when used in can_place_on and can_destroy item components ( MCPE-160838 )
104. In JSON formats 1.19.70 and later, blocks fail to load if the "condition" field in Block Permutations is not a valid Molang string
105. Crafting Table component no longer appends "tile." when defaulting to use block name for crafting table label

Removed support for field "data" in commands /clone, /execute, /fill, /setblock and /testforblock beyond version 1.19.70, eg. /setblock ~ ~ ~ minecraft:wool 1 will only have its equivalent /setblock ~ ~ ~ minecraft:wool ["color":"orange"] supported Here are some additional examples[JW1] [JW2] [JW3] : /setblock ~~~ green_wool [] [] is equivalent to the old 0 /setblock ~~~ wood ["wood_type": "oak"] /setblock ~~~ coral ["dead_bit" : true , "coral_color" : "blue" ] /setblock ~~~ coral_fan ["coral_fan_direction" : 1, "coral_color" : "pink"] /setblock ~~~ wool ["color": "blue"] /fill ~ ~ ~ ~5 ~5 ~5 gold_block [] replace air More information about commands can be found at learn.microsoft.com/minecraft/creator/commands

320. The following blocks now have an inventory component: Barrel Beacon Blast Furnace Brewing Stand Dispenser Dropper Furnace Hopper Jukebox Lectern Smoker
321. Barrel
322. Beacon
323. Blast Furnace
324. Brewing Stand
325. Dispenser
326. Dropper
327. Furnace
328. Hopper
329. Jukebox
330. Lectern
331. Smoker
332. Added method matches(blockName: string, properties?: BlockProperties): boolean which is used to match a block with optional states against a BlockPermutation
333. Added method withProperty(name: string, value: boolean | number | string): BlockPermutation ; which returns a new block permutation with a given property set to a specific value. Throws if the provided data cannot be resolved as a valid block permutation
334. Added function static resolve(blockName: string, properties?: BlockProperties): BlockPermutation which resolve a BlockPermutation from a block name and optional states. Throws if the provided data cannot be resolved as a valid block permutation
335. Updated methods getProperty and getAllProperties to return values directly instead of wrapped into class objects. Example code:
336. Added new class to expose BlockPropertyType
337. Added new class to track "definitional" data about block properties. This is how you can find which values are valid for each block property
338. Released block properties and permutations out of experimental in JSON formats 1.19.70 and higher
339. Added a content warning when loading world with more than 65536 custom block permutations. Custom block permutation counts are logged in debug log

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/13857979785613-Minecraft-1-19-70-Bedrock

1.19.63.title: Minecraft - 1.19.63 (Bedrock)
1.19.63.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.63 (Bedrock)**__
> 

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed an issue that was causing continuous freezes when playing on Nintendo Switch ( MCPE-166760 )
2. Fixed a crash that could occur when playing on iOS devices
3. Fixed a bug where the Edit World screen couldn't be opened for a world if the corresponding world directory had a space in it ( MCPE-166763 )
4. Improved navigation of the “My Content” Marketplace screen when using a controller

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/13374653039501-Minecraft-1-19-63-Bedrock

1.19.62.title: Minecraft - 1.19.62 (Bedrock)
1.19.62.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.62 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update is available that addresses some issues that have occurred since the release of 1.19.60.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed a crash that could occur during gameplay
2. Fixed a crash on Nintendo Switch when attempting to login while set to local network mode
3. Fixed a crash that occurred upon creating a world from a template on Realms
4. Fixed servers being unable to set custom classic skins on players
5. Fixed the “Player has changed their skin” message being spammed on dedicated servers when custom skins were disabled
6. Fixed the cursor returning to the top of certain rows on Marketplace pages after going to the next tab in any row with a gamepad

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/13186434849805-Minecraft-1-19-62-Bedrock

1.19.60.title: Minecraft - 1.19.60 (Bedrock)
1.19.60.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.60 (Bedrock)**__
> It's time for a new update to Minecraft Bedrock Edition! This time, we're focusing on quality of life improvements with quite a few fixes to the game, including over 70 bugs reported by the community. There's also a nice amount of Vanilla parity tweaks and some new experimental features to test out! For the tech savvy players and creators, we have quite a few improvements on the technical side as well. Dive into the full changelog below for the full scoop and happy crafting!

**Fixes:**
1. Added new Spawn Egg items for Ender Dragon, Iron Golem, Snow Golem, and Wither mobs, which can be obtained using commands
2. Polar Bear Spawn Egg colors have changed to distinguish it from the Ghast Spawn Egg
3. Vex hitboxes are now vertically centered with their models
4. Vex and Allay now sit properly in Boats and Minecarts ( MCPE-164441 )
5. Fixed Vex texture disparity between Bedrock and Java ( MCPE-164227 )
6. Slimes and Magma Cubes no longer spawn in spaces that are 2 blocks tall or less ( MCPE-46540 )
7. Glow Squid now emit particles when spawned outside of water
8. Using a Saddle on a tamed Horse, Donkey, or Mule now results in it being equipped ( MCPE-83815 )
9. Using Horse Armor on an unarmored, tamed Horse now results in it being equipped ( MCPE-163336 )
10. Using a Carpet on a tamed Llama now results in it being equipped ( MCPE-163336 )
11. Dispensers can now equip Saddles and Horse Armors to tamed Horses
12. Dispensers can now equip Saddles and Chests to tamed Mules and Donkeys
13. Dispensers can now equip Carpets and Chests to tamed Llamas
14. Dispensers can now equip Saddles to Pigs and Striders
15. Shears in a Dispenser now only shear one Sheep at a time
16. Shears in a Dispenser can now shear Snow Golems and Mooshrooms
17. The Wandering Trader no longer has a chance to offer duplicate Seed trades ( MCPE-161780 )
18. Endermen, Skeletons, and Wither Skeletons now only spawn at light level 7 and below (instead of 11 and below) in the Nether ( MCPE-163701 )
19. Updated the Skeleton/Zombie Horse's and Donkey/Mule's saddle and chest textures
20. Villagers will now ensure that rain can pass through the block above them before launching Fireworks when celebrating after a raid victory ( MCPE-152386 )
21. Axolotls no longer tick their dry out timer when unloaded ( MCPE-131041 )
22. Husks can now fit in a two blocks high space and baby Husks in a one-high space ( MCPE-105369 )
23. All mobs are now able to path through Wither Roses ( MCPE-159212 )
24. Crimson and Warped block sets now have a unique set of sounds
25. Campfires do not set players and mobs on fire anymore, but still inflict damage ( MCPE-98931)
26. Campfires do not destroy Minecarts and Boats anymore ( MCPE-109489 )
27. Bamboo plant placement now behaves the same way as Java Edition; it will no longer grow by clicking on the side of a Bamboo plant with a Bamboo item in-hand ( MCPE-99587 )
28. Bamboo sapling no longer replaces double plants when placed ( MCPE-99806 )
29. Pumpkins and Melons can now grow on Mycelium and Moss blocks ( MCPE-125932 )
30. The Sculk Shrieker block's shriek sound can now be heard at the longer distance of 32 blocks ( MCPE-163989 )
31. Respawn Anchor no longer retains its charges if mined with Silk Touch or picked ( MCPE-145682 )
32. Beacon effect particles are now transparent ( MCPE-17679 )
33. Conduit effect particles are now transparent ( MCPE-93728 )
34. Redstone Dust now emits a sound when placed on the ground ( MCPE-65423 )
35. Wooden Doors, Iron Doors, Wooden Trapdoors, Iron Trapdoors and Fence Gates now use the same opening and closing sounds as Java Edition
36. Updated Pressure Plates to have different sound pitches based on their behaviour to match Java Edition
37. Added a unique click sound for Wooden Buttons to match Java Edition
38. Changed Frogspawn map color to match Java Edition ( MCPE-159715 )
39. Change Bed block map colors to match Java Edition ( MCPE-40709 )
40. Changed various blocks’ Map colors to appear correctly match Java Edition ( MCPE-19228 )
41. In addition to experimental features added in 19.50 , several new experimental features are now playable from the upcoming 1.20 update!
42. Enable the “Next Major Update” toggle in world settings to enable this content
43. These features are a work in progress and are still in active development. The design and functionality of these features will likely change before they’re released
44. Please remember: Worlds that have used experimental toggles will always be flagged as “Experimental”. We recommend keeping these experimental worlds as separate copies from your main saves. More information can be found in this article
45. When placing a Mob Head on a Note Block, that Note Block will now play one of the ambient sounds of that mob when played by a player or powered by Redstone!
46. Piglins will now drop their heads when killed by a charged Creeper!
47. Placing the Piglin Head on a Note Block will play one of the Piglin's ambient sounds
48. The Piglin Head will flap its ears when powered by Redstone on worn by a player!
49. Added Block of Bamboo, which can be crafted from 9 Bamboo
50. Added Stripped Block of Bamboo, which can be obtained by using an Axe on a Block of Bamboo
51. Both Block of Bamboo and Stripped Block of Bamboo can be crafted into 2 Bamboo Planks
52. Fixed a potential crash when gliding through an End Gateway
53. The game no longer crashes when killing an entity with invalid conditions, functions, or pools entries in its loot table ( MCPE-164623 )
54. Fixed multiple crashes that could occur when players died while affected with Withering
55. Fixed a crash on Xbox when the Edit World Button on the Select World Screen had quick successive selections
56. Fixed a bug that caused players to desync from multiplayer games if they saved and quit after dying and rejoining a game ( MCPE-162630 )
57. Fixed a bug causing players’ hitboxes and nameplates to be unaligned when rejoining a world after dying and returning to menu without respawning ( MCPE-162630 )
58. Raids now trigger properly when the player with bad omen enters a village while riding/gliding ( MCPE-152774 )
59. Fixed an issue where players could fall out of moving blocks when pushed upwards ( MCPE-163725 )
60. Fixed an issue where night was being incorrectly skipped if the last player in a game was in the Nether or End
61. A player entering the Nether or End will now trigger a night skip if all players left in Overworld are sleeping
62. Fixed a bug where dropping an item and sleeping at the same time would cause the server to hang ( MCPE-162989 )
63. Orbs spawned within the same block will merge and combine XP values until orb limit is reached
64. Entities no longer disappear when sent through End Gateways ( MCPE-164985 )
65. Ravagers are now able to attack when standing on various partial blocks like Mud ( MCPE-162483 )
66. Vex now use a separate charging animation when empty-handed ( MCPE-164490 )
67. Vex now render offhand items
68. Fixed the Vex being incorrectly lit in dark surroundings
69. Players can no longer see through terrain by riding a Horse, Mule, or Donkey at the edge of a 2-block-tall space
70. Villagers will now take damage from lightning bolts on Peaceful difficulty, like other mobs
71. Tropical Fish no longer use surface density limit when spawning underground ( MCPE-157485 )
72. Evokers now play a ‘sit’ animation when riding a mount or vehicle ( MCPE-43778 )
73. Entities no longer get pushed out by Doors activated by Redstone signals ( MCPE-158971 )
74. Using the Pick Block functionality on Fern and Grass now selects the correct item in the inventory instead of the first one between them
75. Using the Pick Block functionality on Acacia Leaves and Dark Oak Leaves now selects the correct item in the inventory instead of the first one between them
76. Hoppers no longer fail to collect items when trying to pull in multiple item types ( MCPE-38963 )
77. Prevent Pistons from re-creating moving blocks that were destroyed mid-move
78. Blocks that require supporting blocks now appear properly on a Map when placed on partial blocks or above air ( MCPE-159713 )
79. Scaffolding now displays particles and produces vibrations when the block under it is destroyed ( MCPE-163738 )
80. Stone Walls are now placed correctly in a line when continuously placing them
81. Levers now produce the same sound effect as Stone Buttons ( MCPE-163335 )
82. Fixed item degradation when rapidly attacking mobs ( MCPE-157150 )
83. Fixed an issue that prevented some Tripwire Hooks from being valid trades when trading with a Fletcher Villager ( MCPE-108195 )
84. Ender Pearls will no longer teleport a sleeping player ( MCPE-161189 )
85. Fixed a bug that prevented items from moving indirectly between Creative Mode inventory and players' extended inventory in Pocket UI ( MCPE-164479 )
86. Fixed a problem where the touch d-pad's forward button was not functional when holding the strafe left/right button ( MCPE-155199 )
87. The inventory tab will now reset its hover state if the player uses a second input method and hover on another tab
88. Fixed a bug where players couldn’t interact with toast notifications in Joystick and Crosshair touch controls
89. The pressing direction of the build button in touch controls will now be visually clicked down instead of up when being pressed ( MCPE-162026 )
90. Fixed an issue where players could not remove items by clicking on the inventory items in Classic profile ( MCPE-162124 )
91. The touch focus circle has been reactivated with the new touch controls (not in Crosshair mode)
92. Resolved an issue that pressing the inventory button could interact with the world instead of opening the inventory on some devices ( MCPE-154499 )
93. Fixed an issue that players couldn’t scroll the inventory screen when one row was appearing off-screen ( MCPE-159870 )
94. Added several levels of intervals for repeat crafting when holding on the crafted items
95. Removed the camera movement delay when the player swiped from the attack and build buttons in crosshair mode
96. Fixed inventory screen touch interactions not working properly on Nintendo Switch
97. The correct tip for dismounting Boats and Minecarts now appears when not using classic touch controls
98. Toast notifications can now be swiped away on touch devices in-game
99. Touch Control settings section is no longer visible on Xbox
100. Highlight selection no longer highlights the entire card for transparent objects like saplings
101. V-sync settings are now properly configured in options (non-ARM devices) ( MCPE-110006 )
102. The new Create New World screen is now available for text to speech users. We'd be happy to receive your feedback on it here: aka.ms/cnwnarration
103. Fixed text to speech enumeration for world on the Play screen, select language in settings screen, select controls in settings screen, and friends in invite friends screen when there are a large number of items in the list
104. Fixed a bug where the mouse cursor was visible and is no longer usable to control the player camera on the HUD screen after exiting the menu screen with a touch while moving the mouse around
105. Fixed text being slightly off-centered to the left for Furnace, Blast Furnace, and Smoker screens ( MCPE-151597 )
106. Feedback button on the main menu will now prompt the player with a modal before redirecting to their web browser
107. Fixed an issue where text fields would not regain focus after being deselected with a gamepad ( MCPE-153842 )
108. Text fields are no longer deselected with second click on them once they are selected
109. Fixed an issue where user interface elements on the Achievements screen and the new Create New World screen didn't properly trigger sound effects ( MCPE-163722 )
110. Added a missing error screen that displays when attempting to create a world with too little available disk space
111. Fixed the quality of the Mojang Studios logo loading screen on Xbox ( MCPE-163036 )
112. Removed extra space around the "open chat" message that appears when entering a world ( MCPE-162700 )
113. Fixed an issue that caused the Wandering Trader's trade window to show a profession ( MCPE-162576 )
114. Resource packs will now be applied to the world after navigating to another screen before creation
115. Fixed an issue where some resource packs prompted an error after being downloaded
116. The screen will no longer automatically turn off while a world is loaded when playing on Android devices
117. Updated splash screen to be consistent between Android 12+ devices and older devices ( MCPE-151413 )
118. Fixed controller input sometimes getting stuck when a controller was disconnected on Android devices
119. The UI no longer flickers on Android when the on-screen keyboard appears ( MCPE-142356 )
120. New Realm button on the two player Realm info screen now activates correctly
121. Added a highlight to Realms terms and agreements checkbox when the UI is hovered
122. Redirect players back to the world selection screen if they choose to leave on the Download Resource Packs prompt
123. Fixed a bug where the option "Require players to accept resource packs to join" did not reflect the actual state ( REALMS-10799 )
124. Fixed erroneously showing previously applied packs on Realms settings screen after a Realm reset
125. Updated error message for failing to join an owned Realms server that is out of date. New messaging now describes the issue and provides steps to resolve issue
126. Updated Add-On templates for1.19.60 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation are available to download at aka.ms/MCAddonPacks
127. Fixed a crash that could occur when teleporting players to other dimensions using commands ( MCPE-164940 )
128. Fixed a crash that could occur when using the “instant_despawn” component
129. Fixed a crash that could occur when loading actors
130. Added a content error for the condition that custom blocks with permutations or properties fail to load in non-experimental worlds for JSON formats 1.19.60 and onwards
131. Ensure Block Permutation Conditions cannot have side effects (i.e. 'math.random', 'math.random_integer', and variable assignment)
132. Released BlockSelectionBoxComponent outside of experimental toggle in json formats 1.19.60 and higher
133. Released BlockDisplayNameComponent outside of experimental toggle in json formats 1.19.60 and higher
134. Ensure Block Permutation Conditions can only use 'query.block_property' Molang Query
135. Fixed albedo color arrays in texture sets for custom blocks ( MCPE-163622 )
136. Renamed and converted all Smithing Table recipes to use the newly introduced “minecraft:recipe_smithing_transform” recipe format
137. Updated particles documentation with descriptions of new materials and included example particles in the example resource pack
138. Executing the ‘/say’ command via the new execute syntax now displays the entity’s name that produced the message ( MCPE-161450 )
139. When teleporting a group of leashed mobs using "/tp @e" a far enough distance away to unleash them, all mobs now get properly unleashed ( MCPE-159617 )
140. Fixed a bug causing players to not wake up when teleported while sleeping ( MCPE-162346 )
141. Running ‘/execute if|unless score’ on a player that doesn’t have a score set will now return false ( MCPE-156279 )
142. ‘/execute if|unless score’ no longer accepts selectors that can return multiple entities (ie. @e, @a)
143. Fixed a bug where the @initiator selector would not work with the Upcoming Creator Features experiment enabled ( MCPE-164727 )
144. Released BlockPlacementFilterComponent outside of experimental toggle in JSON formats 1.19.60 and higher
145. Expanded "minecraft:shooter" component to define multiple projectiles that can specify different projectile definitions and condition filters
146. Exposed more fields to shooter component to allow for more projectile customization such as throw power, sounds, and whether the attack is a magic attack
147. Projectiles that teleport their owner will no longer do so while their owner is sleeping ( MCPE-161189 )
148. Added "inventory" as a possible "domain" value for the "has_equipment" filter, which allows to check for items stored in the actor's inventory
149. Added an "equip_item_slot" field to the "interact" component If set, an item held by the player will be equipped to the specified slot upon successful interaction If an item is already present in the specified slot, it will be moved to the player's inventory Equipping an item removes it from the player's inventory, unless the player is in Creative Mode
150. If set, an item held by the player will be equipped to the specified slot upon successful interaction
151. If an item is already present in the specified slot, it will be moved to the player's inventory
152. Equipping an item removes it from the player's inventory, unless the player is in Creative Mode
153. Players now respond correctly to speed changes using the minecraft:movement component
154. Created new actor filters "on_fire", "on_hot_block", "target_distance", and "actor_health"
155. The "celebrate_survive" AI behavior will now consider the highest rain passable block in addition to sky visibility before firing Fireworks
156. The "move_outdoors" AI behavior will now consider the highest rain passable block in addition to sky visibility when searching for a place to consider as being outdoors
157. Exposed new data parameters for the "trade_with_player" AI behavior to specify such things as the conditions that need to be met for the goal to start and the max distance the mob can be from its trading player before exiting the goal
158. Fixed a bug causing particles with collision and "expire_on_contact" to not expire when collided
159. Added support for mixed color blending on particle effects
160. Added new Molang query.is_local_player to allow detection of the current player
161. Fixed a bug where dividing any value in Molang by a dynamically determined negative variable resulted in a division by a positive (absolute) value instead This is a Molang Versioned Change that only takes effect for Molang expressions in packs that use a min_engine_version of 1.19.60 or higher
162. This is a Molang Versioned Change that only takes effect for Molang expressions in packs that use a min_engine_version of 1.19.60 or higher

240. Added read-only property damageSource: EntityDamageSource - Gets information about the damage source
241. EntityDamageSource Added property cause: EntityDamageCause - Gets the damage cause Added property damagingEntity?: Entity - Gets the damaging Entity Added property damagingProjectile?: Entity - Gets the damaging projectile Entity Added function applyDamage(amount: number, source?: EntityDamageSource): boolean - Applies damage to the Entity and returns the result of the operation
242. Added property cause: EntityDamageCause - Gets the damage cause
243. Added property damagingEntity?: Entity - Gets the damaging Entity
244. Added property damagingProjectile?: Entity - Gets the damaging projectile Entity
245. Added function applyDamage(amount: number, source?: EntityDamageSource): boolean - Applies damage to the Entity and returns the result of the operation
