1.19.51.title: Minecraft - 1.19.51 (Bedrock)
1.19.51.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.51 (Bedrock)**__
> Update on Dec. 14, 2022:This update is now available on all supported platforms!

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed a crash that could occur during gameplay
2. Pistons can no longer recreate moving blocks that were destroyed mid-move
3. Horses can no longer be pushed over Fences with Carpets on top ( MCPE-164717 )
4. Touch control selection screen will no longer appear on Nintendo Switch
5. Fixed the Structure Block screen so the Y value field can properly be accessed with just the keyboard ( MCPE-164148 )
6. The "minecraft:variable_max_auto_step" component has a new property "controlled_value" This property will override "base_value" when a mob with "minecraft:input_ground_controlled" is being controlled by the player "jump_prevented_value" will have precedence over both other values
7. This property will override "base_value" when a mob with "minecraft:input_ground_controlled" is being controlled by the player
8. "jump_prevented_value" will have precedence over both other values

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/11394437843341-Minecraft-1-19-51-Bedrock

1.19.50.title: Minecraft - 1.19.50 (Bedrock)
1.19.50.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.50 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released for Minecraft, bringing Spectator Mode fully into the game! For players using touch controls, you’ll find some new control schemes to make gameplay on your device much better. A new cast of default character skins have been added and the Vex have received a makeover. There’s a lot to explore so dive into the full changelog below.

**Fixes:**
1. When cheats are enabled, players can go in and out of Spectator Mode using the Personal Game Mode option in World Settings or the '/gamemode spectator' command
2. Spectators have a reduced HUD that does not show the crosshair, hotbar, XP, health, hunger, or armor
3. Players’ inventory, health, held items, etc, are unchanged when switching in and out of Spectator Mode
4. Spectators are always flying and cannot be grounded
5. Spectators pass through solid blocks and entities without collision
6. Spectators can see out of solid objects when inside blocks
7. Spectators cannot take damage and are not affected by any blocks, mobs, items, portals, or effects
8. Spectators cannot use items or interact with blocks or mobs
9. Spectators cannot open their inventory or interact with block screens, like Chests or Furnaces
10. Spectators cannot be seen by mobs or other players, except other players in Spectator Mode Spectators appear as a transparent floating head to other players in Spectator Mode
11. Spectators appear as a transparent floating head to other players in Spectator Mode
12. Spectators are not needed to sleep to pass the night
13. When playing in first person perspective, spectators do not see their arm or held item
14. Spectators generate chunks, if they fly to new chunks
15. Spectators do not spawn any mobs
16. Non-persistent mobs around spectators will check for distance to any non-spectators when deciding if they should despawn
17. Commands can select and act on spectators
18. New touch controls are now enabled on touch devices by default
19. Players can choose between "Joystick & tap to interact", "Joystick & aim crosshair", or "D-Pad & tap to interact"
20. New characters have joined Steve and Alex! These character skins can be selected in the Dressing Room
21. Updated the model and texture of the Vex
22. The Vex retains a slightly larger hitbox to make it easier to fight
23. While playing tag, baby Villagers will now run at a quicker speed that matches Java Edition
24. Wooden Doors, Iron Doors, Wooden Trapdoors, Iron Trapdoors, and Fence Gates now use the same opening and closing sound effects as Java Edition
25. Updated Pressure Plates to have different pitches based on their behaviour to match Java Edition
26. Added unique button click sound for Wooden Buttons to match Java Edition
27. Crimson and Warped block sets now have a unique set of sounds
28. Chiseled and Cut Red Sandstone now have smooth undersides ( MCPE-20006 )
29. Projectiles landing on Mud will no longer shake repeatedly ( MCPE-153744 )
30. Amphibious mobs no longer have trouble pathfinding around Mud Blocks ( MCPE-153961 )
31. Mud and Soul Sand Block bounding boxes now matches their visual bounding boxes for when a player places the blocks ( MCPE-162252 )
32. Lily Pads now pop with sound and particles when run into by a Boat ( MCPE-65138 )
33. Most blocks destroyed from lack of support now have visual particles, audio effects, and cause vibration events
34. Coral Fans can no longer be placed on the side of Slab blocks ( MCPE-116986 )
35. Coral Fans can now survive on top of solid transparent blocks like Glass ( MCPE-112407 )
36. Fixed a bug where placed Light Blocks were invisible even while selecting a Light Block
37. Open container, Command Block, or Structure Block screens now close when players enter Spectator Mode
38. Spectator Mode now appears on the list of Personal Game Modes in Settings ( MCPE-156688 )
39. Allays no longer throw items to spectators ( MCPE-162873 )
40. Introducing the next major update experimental toggle! Enable the “Next Major Update” toggle in world settings to enable this content
41. These features are a work in progress and are still in active development. The design and functionality of these features will likely change before they’re released
42. Please remember: Worlds that have used experimental toggles will always be flagged as “Experimental”. We recommend keeping these experimental worlds as separate copies from your main saves. More information can be found in this article
43. Added the Bamboo family of blocks as a wood type and use for Bamboo
44. Added Bamboo Raft
45. Added Camels, which can spawn in desert villages
46. Two players can ride Camels together
47. Camels are tall animals and riders are high enough off the ground, out of range from mob melee attacks
48. Camels can walk and sprint, or dash with a short burst of speed
49. Camels randomly sit down for short periods of time and flick their ears about
50. A new, chiseled variation of the Bookshelf
51. Can store Books, Book and Quills, and Enchanted Books
52. Holds up to 6 Books. Keeps the stories and lore of your world safe
53. Comparators can detect the last book placed/removed. Perfect for hiding secrets in your spooky library
54. A new type of Sign that can be placed beneath and on the side of blocks
55. Hanging Signs are available for all wood types
56. Hanging Signs can also be placed under narrow blocks with center support, like Fences
57. Fixed several crashes that could occur during gameplay
58. Fixed a crash that could occur when navigating down in the Villager screen with the keyboard
59. Fixed an issue where game would crash when Ender Dragon breath attack hadn't hit blocks or fell into the void ( MCPE-161204 )
60. Navigating through the Recipe Book when the player had items that contain mobs in their inventory (like Bees in Beehives) no longer causes significant drops in performance ( MCPE-146462 )
61. Reduced server lag with items going in and out of Hoppers ( MCPE-68796 )
62. Fixed frame rate dropping when hovering over item slots on the Creative inventory screen ( MCPE-162277 )
63. Fixed a crash that would occur if Education Edition items were rendered without the Education Edition toggle turned on ( MCPE-161587 )
64. Fixed a crash that could occur when actors with a non-player owner went through End Portals
65. Fixed a crash that could occur when loading into some Marketplace worlds on low memory devices ( MCPE-161866 )
66. When stuck inside a block, players will now be pushed towards the nearest open area
67. Maps corrupted by black pixels can now be repaired by revisiting corrupted areas. Previously affected maps can now be repaired by holding in main or off hand ( MCPE-162421 )
68. Fixed a bug that could cause the player to teleport back to a portal after exiting it ( MCPE-157494 )
69. Fixed a bug that could cause players to get stuck on the "Building Terrain" screen when changing dimensions ( MCPE-158215 )
70. Fixed improper LevelChunk blending when upgrading pre-1.18 worlds ( MCPE-162480 )
71. Fixed Xbox controller thumbstick deadzone and sensitivity ( MCPE-162847 )
72. Increased Enderman follow range from 32 to 64 ( MCPE-35306 )
73. Jump Boost now consistently affects mobs ridden by players ( MCPE-45823 )
74. Slow Falling now consistently affects mobs ridden by players ( MCPE-126604 )
75. Fixed an issue where breeding mobs with applied effects would result in the offspring having the effect bonuses permanently applied ( MCPE-81890 )
76. Fixed Bat resting location being offset when at negative world height
77. Armor Stands now drop their offhand item upon destruction ( MCPE-158228 )
78. Fixed a bug that caused the Ender Dragon to not load if the world was saved and loaded while it was alive ( MCPE-156528 )
79. Dirt Path and Farmland collision are now one pixel lower ( MCPE-12109 )
80. Players now sink in Soul Sand and Mud blocks ( MCPE-154973 )
81. Sugar Cane will now break on next random tick when its water source is removed ( MCPE-162351 )
82. Piston arms now extend more smoothly ( MCPE-155987 )
83. Blocks attached to Pistons now move more smoothly ( MCPE-146597 )
84. Huge Fungus blocks will no longer replace partial blocks when growing from Nylium ( MCPE-65661 )
85. Fixed an issue where an entity at coordinate 0,0,0 prevented Pressure Plates from being placed ( MCPE-161377 )
86. Fixed blocks flickering when moved by Pistons ( MCPE-15268 )
87. Fixed an issue where signs would not play a placement sound when placed ( MCPE-65423 )
88. Bubble columns are now properly generated above underwater Magma Blocks
89. Swimming above Mud blocks no longer causes the screen to get blocked ( MCPE-153737 )
90. Freshly crafted tools and armor now work the first time they are used ( MCPE-161151 )
91. Weapons, tools, and armor can now be dropped from the players inventory the first time after being renamed ( MCPE-162132 )
92. Fixed issues with Book & Quill not able to be signed and closed ( MCPE-163325 )
93. Fixed a bug where fully charged items were lost when going through a portal ( MCPE-55279 )
94. Using the Anvil to enchant or fix items will no longer rename items unintentionally ( MCPE-154453 )
95. Fixed a bug where Slimes and Magma Cubes could break Shield durability every tick ( MCPE-119451 )
96. Fixed a bug where Pufferfish could break Shield durability every tick ( MCPE-143689 )
97. Re-enabled the new stack splitting functionality for touch devices
98. "Split Control" option will only appear in Classic control mode and only affect the Classic control scheme
99. Fixed an issue where hotbar slots could not be touched in Crosshair and Touch control schemes in certain situations
100. Scrolling the inventory screen is easier as the dwell time has been increased to 180 milliseconds (was 120 previously). The dwell time is the length of time an item must be held before a drag action begins
101. Untangled the connections between "Lock Joystick", "Joystick Always Visible", and "Joystick Visible When Unused"
102. Added toggle "Delayed Block Breaking (Creative Only)" in Touch Settings to control this functionality
103. Fixed an issue where double tapping touch control buttons can be difficult on high refresh rate screens ( MCPE-156351 )
104. Improved the way that button presses and camera movements work in tandem in the new Touch Controls
105. Action buttons now show up when in a Boat while using Crosshair mode ( MCPE-159376 )
106. Fixed the Dismount button in the new touch control schemes appearing blurry ( MCPE-156722 )
107. Fixed an issue which prevented items from being discarded in the extended Creative Mode inventory by dropping them on another item ( MCPE-162124 )
108. Fixed an issue with touch controls when swimming and charging a Bow, Crossbow, or Trident no longer launch the weapon immediately ( MCPE-136625 )
109. Fixed an issue where joystick gestures were stopped if your finger overlapped with the hotbar ( MCPE-159870 )
110. Resolved an issue where players couldn't interact with the hotbar in some resource packs with the new touch controls ( MCPE-157748 )
111. The sprint and descend buttons in Crosshair Mode now have the same colour as other buttons ( MCPE-156740 )
112. Resolved an issue where quickly tapping "Ascend" and "Descend" would cancel flying in the new touch controls. Going forward, double tapping "Descend" is how flying is cancelled ( MCPE-162240 )
113. Status icons now follow the screen safe zone when in touch mode
114. Adjusted status icons to form in one row across width of screen when in touch to account for new touch controls
115. Removed the action delay from Attack and Interact buttons ( MCPE-158143 )
116. When the joystick is unlocked, the draggable range has been changed to be the same as the when the joystick is locked. In both modes, if auto-sprinting is enabled, it will start when the joystick is dragged slightly above the background. The auto-sprint will disengage if the joystick control is subsequently moved back into the joystick background area
117. A tap gesture will now fire a charged Crossbow. Previously, it was necessary to hold the gesture for 400ms before the bolt would fire
118. Fixed an issue where players couldn't drag/drop on the Anvil screen
119. Applied ambient light to blocks moved by Pistons ( MCPE-136928 )
120. Mob shadows now render properly on Android devices using certain GPUs ( MCPE-155354 )
121. Added D3D12 support for Intel Integrated/Dedicated Graphics for compatible drivers
122. Shortened text when uploading worlds and add-ons so it fits in the dialog prompt
123. You will no longer get an error message when joining a Realm that has been empty for several minutes
124. Added a new Mobile Data Blocked screen on Android/iOS when mobile data is available but disabled in-game and Wi-Fi is not connected
125. Players can now rebind the copy coordinate keys with Full Keyboard Gameplay and the Enable Copy Coordinate UI settings enabled ( MCPE-163082 )
126. Fixed a bug where the boss bar name would not update when the boss name changed until the bar was reloaded by the player
127. Fixed a bug on the Pocket UI Inventory screen where items could not be dropped back into the inventory in Creative Mode
128. Fixed a bug on the Pocket UI Inventory screen where the ‘Craftable/All’ toggle could only be changed in the Search tab but not in any other tab
129. On Xbox, camera movement with mouse no longer changes mouse position when the inventory screen is reopened ( MCPE-162890 )
130. Text color for a selected item stack count is now white instead of yellow
131. Changed the error handling of copying worlds to display a modal pop-up instead of a toast notification
132. Fixed a bug causing the HUD to not rotate with the player's direction while riding in a Boat in VR
133. Changed the color of the description text for the “Allow mobile data for online play” option to be more readable ( MCPE-162459 )
134. Fixed a contrast issue of the little arrow in dropdown components on hover, the unselected toggle components and the toggle/sliders in chat settings
135. Updated Add-On templates for19.50 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation are available to download at aka.ms/MCAddonPacks
136. Structure Blocks can now import structures from ‘.mcstructure’ files on Windows
137. Actor (Entity) Properties are no longer experimental (This includes Molang queries and property filters, but not Permutations)
138. Fixed a crash that would occur if the texture_index of a spawn egg was out of bounds. Now a content log error will be presented instead
139. Min/Max distance values in sound events now only affect the sound event and not all events using the same sound ( MCPE-154376 )
140. Added client-side-chunk-generation-enabled toggle to server.properties
141. Fixed an issue where changing the subpack of Resource Packs that have subpacks would not apply changes until the game was restarted ( MCPE-162002 )
142. Recipes that have the same inputs but have different outputs will now display content errors (excludes Crafting Table and Stonecutter recipes)
143. Removed the Upcoming Creator Features requirement for the new execute command syntax
144. Version 1.19.50 is now required to run the new command syntax
145. Creators currently using the new execute command syntax in command blocks will have to go modify those command blocks in order to update those commands
146. Creators currently using the new execute command in behavior packs will need to change the min engine version to 1.19.50
147. The previous execute command syntax can still be used by using version 1.19.40 or less
148. Using the '/enchant' command to apply the same level of enchantment no longer results in a higher level being applied ( MCPE-153204 )
149. Fixed an issue where hasItem wouldn't correctly detect an item with a data value if hasItem wasn't provided a data value ( MCPE-162460 )
150. Running '/execute as' from Command Blocks no longer inherits rotation from entity ( MCPE-162680 )
151. Fixed a bug where Chain Command Blocks would not activate when Delay in Ticks was greater than 0
152. Running ‘/execute align xyz entity’ now produces a command error instead of crashing ( MCPE-162733 )
153. Released BlockCollisionBoxComponent outside of experimental toggle in JSON formats 1.19.50 and higher
154. Released BlockCraftingTableComponent outside of experimental toggle in JSON formats 1.19.50 and higher
155. The Crafting Table UI now updates when a block changes to a permutation with a different “minecraft:crafting_table” block component
156. Removed the functionality of the “minecraft:breathability” block component. Component will have no effect on the custom defined block
157. Blocks using the "minecraft:placement_filter" component now produce particles, sounds and vibrations events when they are removed due to their placement condition failing
158. "input_ground_controlled" no longer implies increased auto step when controlled by player. The "variable_max_auto_step" component can be used instead. To have consistency with previous versions, use "base_value": 1.0625 and "jump_prevented_value": 0.5625
159. Added server property 'enable-lan-visibility' to disable the explicit LAN discovery by clients. This will prevent unexpected port conflicts when running multiple dedicated servers on a single host. Clarified port use in server logs and made error messaging more clear ( BDS-1094 )
160. Exposed new data parameters for the "minecraft:offer_flower" AI behaviour to specify such things as the time that the mob offers the flower for, the chance that the goal will start, and the dimensions of the AABB used to search for a mob to offer a flower to
161. The "minecraft:offer_flower" AI behavior can now be used by any mob, not just the Iron Golem
162. The "minecraft:offer_flower" AI behavior will now search through all mobs in the specified range rather than just the closest one, meaning that this goal has the potential to be used more consistently than before
163. Exposed new data parameters for the "minecraft:take_flower" AI behavior to specify such things as the conditions to be met to start the goal, the min and max wait times before taking the flower, and the dimensions of the AABB used to search for a mob to take a flower from
164. The "minecraft:take_flower" AI behavior can now be used by any mob, not just baby Villagers
165. Fixed has_property to return 1 when a property exists and 0 when not, rather than the opposite of that
166. Fixed velocity property not returning correct values in certain situations ( MCPE-152715 )
167. Added function canPlace - Returns if it is valid to place the desired block type or block permutation at a specified location (and optional face of the block)
168. Added function trySetPermutation - Attempts to place the desired block permutation at a location by first checking canPlace
169. Entity Removed function runCommand . Consider runCommandAsync as an alternative
170. Removed function runCommand . Consider runCommandAsync as an alternative
171. Dimension Removed function runCommand . Consider runCommandAsync as an alternative
172. Removed function runCommand . Consider runCommandAsync as an alternative
173. Converted BlockRaycastOptions to an interface
174. Converted EntityEventOptions to an interface
175. Converted ScoreboardObjectiveDisplayOptions to an interface Location type updated to IVec3
176. Location type updated to IVec3
177. Vector add - updated a and b arguments to accept an IVec3 interface type cross - updated a and b arguments to accept an IVec3 interface type distance - updated a and b arguments to accept an IVec3 interface type divide - updated a argument to accept an IVec3 interface type lerp - updated a and b arguments to accept an IVec3 interface type max - updated a and b arguments to accept an IVec3 interface type min - updated a and b arguments to accept an IVec3 interface type multiply - updated a argument to accept an IVec3 interface type slerp - updated a and b arguments to accept an IVec3 interface type subtract - updated a and b arguments to accept an IVec3 interface type

189. The first module to release is @minecraft/server as version 1.0.0. The APIs included with this are listed below: Non-beta APIs like those included in the @minecraft/server 0.0 module do not require the Beta APIs experiment to be turned on, and will be more stable over time This initial API set is narrow, but we intend to add more APIs into non-beta modules over the coming months

1.19.41.title: Minecraft - 1.19.41 (Bedrock)
1.19.41.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.41 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update is available that addresses some issues that have occurred since the release of 1.19.40.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed choppy performance after resuming due to incorrectly presented frames on Xbox Series X|S consoles ( MCPE-155879 )
2. Fixed the brightness of the night sky when enabling RTX ( MCPE-162445 )
3. Players can once again spread items across an inventory grid when holding the "Place One" button with a controller ( MCPE-163625 )
4. Fixed an issue where players couldn’t scroll through the contents of Chests with touch controls ( MCPE-163619 )
5. Fixed multiple issues related to joining Realms

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/10358531624973-Minecraft-1-19-41-Bedrock

1.19.40.title: Minecraft - 1.19.40 (Bedrock)
1.19.40.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.40 (Bedrock)**__
> As always, we appreciate all your help and input, please report any new bugs atbugs.mojang.comand leave your feedbackfeedback.minecraft.net.

**Fixes:**
1. Getting killed by a renamed weapon now produces a death message with the item name
2. Getting killed by a mob with a renamed weapon now produces a death message with the item name ( MCPE-162055 )
3. The Roofed Forest, Savanna Mutated, and Birch Forest biomes use the correct grass colors ( MCPE-34936 )
4. Mobs no longer spawn within the bounds of an Ancient City ( MCPE-153524 )
5. Sweet Berries can now be planted on Farmland ( MCPE-99632 )
6. Changed bubble column strength to match Java Edition ( MCPE-158858 )
7. Scaffolds now burn at a more correct rate, 1/4 of an item ( MCPE-42949 )
8. Wither Skeletons can now spawn inside of Wither Roses ( MCPE-110127 )
9. Decreased the amount of hunger used while swimming to match Java Edition ( MCPE-154452 )
10. Ravagers can now be hurt by Evoker Fangs
11. Increased Ravager collision box size to match Java Edition ( MCPE-142171 , MCPE-45531 )
12. Increased Ravager speed to match Java Edition ( MCPE-48145 )
13. Librarian Villagers can now offer Enchanted Books with Curse of Vanishing and Curse of Binding ( MCPE-84906 )
14. Players swimming above Mud will not have their screen covered ( MCPE-153737 )
15. Projectiles landing on Mud will not repeatedly shake ( MCPE-153744 )
16. Amphibious mobs no longer have trouble pathfinding around Mud Blocks ( MCPE-153961 )
17. Spectators no longer drop XP orbs when killed ( MCPE-160245 )
18. Spectators no longer reset their player level when killed
19. Water fog is no longer removed for players in Spectator Mode ( MCPE-161105 )
20. Spectator players no longer play sounds when entering/exiting bubble columns ( MCPE-161536 )
21. Shulker bullets no longer follow Spectators ( MCPE-162069 )
22. Spectators are now invisible to normal players
23. If a player is in Spectator Mode and other non-spectating players are present on the server, the spectating player won't affect mob despawning anymore
24. If there are only spectating players on the server, mob despawning is now put on hold
25. Fixed a crash when using spawn eggs in peaceful worlds on PlayStation 4 Edition
26. Fixed a crash that could occur when an animated structure was loading from a Structure Block and the player left a dimension via portal ( MCPE-132561 )
27. Fixed a bug which caused the game to crash when loading an Arrow with an unrecognized data value ( MCPE-157983 )
28. Fixed a potential crash source in explosions
29. Fixed a crash that could occur when leaving a split screen session
30. Fixed an issue with Marketplace bundle prices not showing as free after purchasing
31. Added a Clear Cache button in Storage Settings for all platforms. This button clears contents of Marketplace folders (but not worlds) and might help alleviate issues downloading content ( MCPE-54531 )
32. Fixed an issue where Wither effect damage would be reduced by armor ( MCPE-159407 )
33. Keyboard players can now sprint when moving diagonally ( MCPE-144702 )
34. Grove biome is now classified as "cold" and Villagers spawned there will be the snow variant ( MCPE-147834 )
35. Fixed fall damage accumulating while the player is in a Trapdoor block at the top of a bubble column ( MCPE-158858 )
36. Fixed an issue causing player to move in the wrong direction after turning using VR snap camera movement ( MCPE-152443 )
37. Baby Villagers will again accept flowers from Iron Golems
38. Guardians are no longer able to float in the air ( MCPE-33641 )
39. Enabled tamed mobs that follow the player to follow the player through End Portals
40. Fixed an issue where Drowned could change held items when attacking ( MCPE-40288 )
41. Fixed a bug where mobs with a long hit range could hit players through walls ( MCPE-55790 )
42. Fixed a bug which caused Boats to disappear when pushed through a portal ( MCPE-161563 )
43. When a mob is a passenger in a Boat, neither the Boat nor the mob are allowed to change dimension ( MCPE-154919 )
44. NPCs can now have no name, hiding the nametag above their head
45. Falling blocks no longer break when landing on double Slabs ( MCPE-159921 )
46. Huge Fungus stems no longer replace partial blocks when growing from Nylium ( MCPE-65661 )
47. Water texture on some waterlogged blocks no longer renders too bright when placed under other blocks ( MCPE-76949 )
48. Fixed an issue which caused Redstone to output the wrong signal strength in certain configurations ( MCPE-81981 )
49. Fixed several issues related to Sticky Pistons being used near world build limits ( MCPE-96088 )
50. Breaking the block below a Snow-covered Flower now makes the Flower drop instead of the Snow Layer ( MCPE-61609 )
51. Fixed Beacon block suddenly disappearing when seen from a distance
52. The book of an Enchanting Table now properly faces a nearby player ( MCPE-29924 )
53. Temporarily reverted the changes to Dirt Path and Farmland collision changes, as well as Soul Sand and Mud blocks sinking while we iron out some bugs
54. Reverted the change that caused Arrows and Tridents to stop moving ( MCPE-162085 )
55. Fixed an issue with screen position on Android devices ( MCPE-159703 )
56. Removed the “Clear Account Sign in Data” button from the Settings menu from non-Switch platforms, as it is only intended to function on Nintendo Switch ( MCPE-129704 )
57. Fixed a bug where usernames could be above max size ( MCPE-152884 )
58. To make finding the right thing in Settings easier, the Profile screen has been split into two new sections: General and Account
59. Ensured proper text-to-speech support for the revamped death screen
60. Fixed a bug where achievements would be disabled for some world templates
61. Fixed a bug in Pocket UI where items could be dropped in the dark-grey areas around the item grid in the Crafting Table screen
62. Fixed a bug in Pocket UI where items could be dropped in the dark-grey areas around the item grid in the inventories for the Horse, Mule, Donkey, and Llama
63. Fixed a bug where the death screen message was visible when the Show Death Message game rule was set to false
64. Fixed an issue where players couldn't drag/drop or select items from the equipment page
65. Changed the color of the text descriptions for the 'Darkness Effect Strength' and 'Notification Duration' accessibility options to a lighter shade to make them more readable ( MCPE-162047 )
66. Fixed a bug where death messages were sometimes too long to fit on screen ( MCPE-156550 )
67. Fixed the crafting screen search string not saving correctly
68. Fixed an issue with the durability bar missing on inventory screens on Xbox ( MCPE-162063 )
69. Fixed a bug where the sign in button on Create New World didn't work on some platforms
70. The copy coordinates gamepad tooltip now uses the correct icon depending on the platform ( MCPE-162654 )
71. Shortened text when uploading worlds and add-ons so it fits in the dialog
72. Fixed a problem where custom add-on packs could not be applied properly in Realms settings, as well as fixed a crash during pack uploading ( REALMS-10655 )
73. Unlocalized text no longer appears when connecting to a Realm with an outdated client
74. Fixed a bug where items could not be removed from the hotbar by moving them onto other items in Creative Inventory on mobile devices
75. Fixed an issue where the stack splitting progress bar was not aligned on touch mode
76. Adjusted layout of the touch toolbar and status effect icons based on user feedback
77. Fixed a bug that prevented scrolling through the Village trade list on mobile devices
78. When the auto-jumping feature is enabled, the player will now automatically jump out of water when moving toward a block on land
79. In Creative Mode while using touch input with Action Buttons off, the delay for breaking the first block has been increased to 800 milliseconds. This reduces the chance of breaking a block by accident
80. Added support for dragging and dropping with touch gestures in the inventory
81. Double tapping 'descend' now toggles off flight in Joystick touch control modes
82. Updated the positioning of status effects for Pocket UI
83. The inventory button for touch devices is now reset to its default appearance after closing the inventory
84. Fixed an issue where players couldn't swap unstackable items with touch controls
85. Improved the images for the three control schemes in the touch settings menu
86. Updated Add-On templates for 1.19.40 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation, are available to download at aka.ms/MCAddonPacks
87. We have released custom block geometry in this version of Minecraft. This means that anyone can make a custom block with their own custom geometry and textures WITHOUT turning on the Holiday Creator Features experimental toggle in settings
88. For more information and a list of documentation and tutorials, visit the Custom Block Geometry article on minecraft.net
89. Fixed a crash that could occur when using the hasItem selector and specifying a negative value for the item's data ( MCPE-152314 )
90. Implemented the has_property , int_property , bool_property , float_property , and enum_property actor behavior filters
91. Added flag is_hidden_in_commands in menu_category to control whether or not a block can be used in commands
92. Release BlockGeometryComponent out of experimental in JSON formats 1.19.40 and higher
93. Release BlockMaterialInstancesComponent out of experimental in JSON formats 1.19.40 and higher
94. Renamed minecraft:block_light_filter component to minecraft:light_dampening
95. Renamed experiment GameTest Frameworkto Beta APIs
96. The now-renamed Beta APIsexperiment is still needed to access all beta APIs, including core Minecraft APIs and GameTest APIs
97. Fixed a bug where EntityHurtEvent would not fire on player death
98. Entity Updated target property to be read-only Fixed an issue where UI forms would not mark their cancelled field correctly
99. Updated target property to be read-only
100. Fixed an issue where UI forms would not mark their cancelled field correctly
101. Converted EntityQueryScoreOptions to an interface
102. Converted EntityRaycastOptions to an interface
103. Converted ExplosionOptions to an interface
104. Converted MusicOptions to an interface
105. Converted SoundOptions to an interface
106. Removed built-in GameTest Behavior Packs
107. Implemented the "/execute facing" and "/execute facing entity" commands
108. Implemented the "/execute align" command
109. Fixed a problem with teleports appearing to fly the target to the new location instead of being instant
110. Added the 'replace block' overload to the /loot command
111. Implemented the "/execute rotated " and "/execute rotated as" commands
112. Added the ability to set a custom block with a specific custom block property using the /setblockcommand
113. Copying a bubble column with the /clone command no longer results in invisible water ( MCPE-153903 )
114. Added new overload to the /summon command that adds rotation arguments New overload is /summon [ spawnPos : x y z] [yRot: float] [xRot: float] [spawnEvent: string] [nametag: string]
115. New overload is /summon [ spawnPos : x y z] [yRot: float] [xRot: float] [spawnEvent: string] [nametag: string]
116. Previous overload '/summon [ spawnPos : x y z] [spawnEvent: string] [nametag: string]'
117. Temporarily disabled the rotation for the /summon command while a bug is worked on
118. Fixed a rotation issue when a Command Block executes 'execute facing' and 'execute rotated' ( MCPE-162256 )
119. Implemented the '/execute in' command
120. Implemented the ‘/execute anchored <eyes|feet>’ command
121. minecraft:direction is no longer exposed as a data-driven blockProperty. Blocks throw a content error when the "minecraft" namespace is used
122. Added support for recipes to use item tags directly instead of item names Added new item tags Converted several recipes from code into their own recipe files Added several recipes using the new tags to override many old, item specific recipes (these still exist for backwards compatibility): barrel, beehive, bookshelf, bowl, brewing_stand, campfire, cartography_table, chest, composter, crafting_table, daylight_detector, fire_charge, fletching_table, furnace, grindstone, jukebox, lectern, loom, noteblock, painting, piston, shield, smithing_table, smoker, soul_campfire, soul_torch, stick, stone_axe, stone_hoe, stone_pickaxe, stone_shovel, stone_sword, torch, tripwire_hook, wooden_axe, wooden_hoe, wooden_pickaxe, wooden_shovel, wooden_sword Custom Items, tags, and block tags now work correctly with the minecraft:digger component ( MCPE-155786 )
123. Added new item tags
124. Converted several recipes from code into their own recipe files
125. Added several recipes using the new tags to override many old, item specific recipes (these still exist for backwards compatibility): barrel, beehive, bookshelf, bowl, brewing_stand, campfire, cartography_table, chest, composter, crafting_table, daylight_detector, fire_charge, fletching_table, furnace, grindstone, jukebox, lectern, loom, noteblock, painting, piston, shield, smithing_table, smoker, soul_campfire, soul_torch, stick, stone_axe, stone_hoe, stone_pickaxe, stone_shovel, stone_sword, torch, tripwire_hook, wooden_axe, wooden_hoe, wooden_pickaxe, wooden_shovel, wooden_sword
126. barrel, beehive, bookshelf, bowl, brewing_stand, campfire, cartography_table, chest, composter, crafting_table, daylight_detector, fire_charge, fletching_table, furnace, grindstone, jukebox, lectern, loom, noteblock, painting, piston, shield, smithing_table, smoker, soul_campfire, soul_torch, stick, stone_axe, stone_hoe, stone_pickaxe, stone_shovel, stone_sword, torch, tripwire_hook, wooden_axe, wooden_hoe, wooden_pickaxe, wooden_shovel, wooden_sword
127. Custom Items, tags, and block tags now work correctly with the minecraft:digger component ( MCPE-155786 )
128. Implemented new is_baby actor filter that returns true when the subject entity is a baby
129. Fixed "bool_property" filters that didn't specify a "value"
130. Fixed an issue with Iron Golems that prevented mobs with the minecraft:take_flower AI behavior to use the goal
131. Exposed new data parameters for the minecraft:play AI behavior to specify such things as the duration the goal stays active, the chance to start the goal, the range to search for a friend, and the follow distance to stay within when playing with a friend

1.19.31.title: Minecraft - 1.19.31 (Bedrock)
1.19.31.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.31 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update is available that addresses some issues that have occurred since the release of 1.19.30.

**Fixes:**
1. As of October 5, 2022, players on the Xbox versions of Minecraft will begin receiving an update that improves game performance, alongside a few other changes. You can read more about this in our FAQ Article
2. Under Settings > (Controls) > Touch there is a new toggle entitled, Enable New Touch Controls Schemes. When toggled ON, a new Interaction Model dropdown menu will appear, allowing players to use the new Touch scheme, the new Crosshair scheme, or the original Classic scheme.
3. Fixed several crashes that could occur during gameplay
4. Fixed terrain on Maps getting replaced with black pixels ( MCPE-162421 )
5. Fixed a bug that unbound the Inventory key when using the Full Keyboard Gameplay toggle
6. Fixed players sometimes spawning under the obsidian platform and falling into the void after entering an End Portal for the first time after the 1.19.30 update on Realms ( MCPE-162482 )

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/9621393741325-Minecraft-1-19-31-Bedrock

1.19.30.title: Minecraft - 1.19.30 (Bedrock)
1.19.30.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.30 (Bedrock)**__
> As always, we appreciate all your help and input, please report any new bugs atbugs.mojang.comand leave your feedbackfeedback.minecraft.net.

**Fixes:**
1. Modified the Fireball entity's collision box to match Java Edition
2. The Enchanting Table now produces a sound when enchanting an item
3. Amethyst blocks no longer produce sound when jumping off them
4. Fixed the bottom texture of the Melon block to match the top texture ( MCPE-31035 )
5. The item stack popup animation will now only play when a new item is added to the stack ( MCPE-23995 )
6. Fixed an issue where Light Blocks would be removed when placing an Armor stand over them ( MCPE-151856 )
7. Changed some structures names in the /locate command to have underscores, like in Java Edition (e.g. ancientcity -> ancient_city); the old names will still work but will not show up in the autocomplete
8. Fixed an issue where Boats with Chests would not drop the Chest's contents when destroyed by the /kill command ( MCPE-160186 )
9. Eating a Stew will now leave the empty Bowl in the slot it was eaten from ( MCPE-56367 )
10. Drinking a Potion will now leave the empty Glass Bottle in the slot you drank it from rather than the first empty inventory slot ( MCPE-26436 )
11. Oak and Mangrove Fence Gates are now flammable ( MCPE-160098 )
12. Fixed Hoglin and Zoglin hitbox size and hit range to match Java Edition ( MCPE-65424 )
13. Increased Sculk Shrieker and Sculk Sensor generation rates in Deep Dark and Ancient Cities to better match Java Edition ( MCPE-153525 )
14. Modified the Cat's head position while sitting to match Java Edition ( MCPE-46668 )
15. If a Villager has a Nametag, it is now displayed along with their trade tier ( MCPE-152644 )
16. Capes are no longer rendered while in Spectator Mode ( MCPE-156929 )
17. Spectator players in Lava Cauldrons no longer display the burning animation ( MCPE-160331 )
18. Players in Spectator Mode are no longer affected by the Powder Snow fog effect ( MCPE-156683 )
19. Sadly, any leashed animals will not follow spectators anymore ( MCPE-157065 )
20. Players in Spectator Mode no longer emit particles while sprinting ( MCPE-160397 )
21. Spectator players with status effects applied no longer emit particles ( MCPE-160398 )
22. Endermen no longer become angry at players in Spectator Mode ( MCPE-156742 )
23. Players in Spectator Mode can no longer interact with Sculk Sensors by swimming in water or lava ( MCPE-153879 )
24. Players switching into Spectator Mode will unhook any fishhooks attached to them
25. Players in Spectator mode can no longer be pushed by explosions ( MCPE-156687 )
26. Powder Snow no longer emits particles when spectators move through it ( MCPE-153876 )
27. Big Dripleaf no longer tilts when touched by players in Spectator Mode ( MCPE-156686 )
28. Players in Spectator Mode now keep their inventories and equipped items on death ( MCPE-156681 )
29. Spectators can no longer attract mob's attention when holding their favorite food ( MCPE-153882 )
30. The /testfor command can now target spectators ( MCPE-158042 )
31. The Spectator game mode can no longer be entered via the /gamemode 6 command, only via /gamemode spectator
32. Spectators using touch controls can no longer break Boats and Minecarts ( MCPE-158307 )
33. Parrots sitting on a player's shoulder now hop off when entering Spectator Mode
34. Animals and mobs with follow_owner behaviour no longer follow Spectators
35. Animals and mobs with find_mount behaviour no longer try to mount Spectators
36. Spectator Mode players won't have cold feet and now the Frost Walker enchant does not affect water
37. Pufferfish no longer react to nearby spectators
38. Fixed a bug that rarely caused the Villager's bounding box to become desynced with the server when sleeping
39. Fixed a bug causing an occasional crash when loading players in beds
40. The game no longer crashes when browsing Marketplace
41. Fixed a crash that could occur when resuming the game on Xbox
42. Fixed a bug where deleting cloud synced worlds would not delete the cloud version of the world when the player deletes the world locally
43. Fixed PlayStation 4 audio stuttering issues while framerate is low ( MCPE-158902 )
44. Fixed a crashing issue related to undyed Shulkers
45. Most common Marketplace connection issues will now automatically resolve themselves when conditions improve without needing to restart Minecraft ( MCPE-155025 )
46. Fixed performance issues when Striders are being ridden by baby Striders ( MCPE-146478 )
47. Fixed a crash that would occur on some devices when loading in worlds with texture packs applied ( MCPE-160800 )
48. Fixed a crash when uploading a world with no name using "Play on Realm" button
49. Music is now included in the mobile app and no longer has to be downloaded from Marketplace
50. Fixed issue where player would see inside of Top Snow when diving into it while wearing Elytra
51. Fireballs can no longer travel through portals to prevent an issue where they could become permanently stuck ( MCPE-160938 )
52. Pressing the Ctrl and Alt keys together will no longer make the Alt key get stuck down
53. Endermen no longer get angry at Creative players ( MCPE-42977 )
54. Fixed a bug causing Leads to break with Allays after the owner player changes dimensions ( MCPE-158955 )
55. The Goat's ram animation was modified to slowly lower their head when preparing to ram ( MCPE-129477 )
56. Reduced the Enderman's teleport range to 32x32x32 to ensure that it cannot despawn itself by teleporting ( MCPE-152268 )
57. Allays and Bees should no longer get stuck on Lanterns or other low hanging objects ( MCPE-155777 )
58. EDU Toggle: NPC names default to only being displayed while looking at them
59. Mud Brick Slab can now be placed as a top slab via commands ( MCPE-157852 )
60. Banners now spawn correctly in newly generated structures ( MCPE-160696 )
61. Coral Fans now look identical when placed facing North, West, East, and South ( MCPE-125311 )
62. White Glazed Terracotta is no longer missing from the Creative Mode inventory and is once again accessible through commands
63. Seagrass and Kelp are no longer classified as Coral Decorations in the Creative Mode inventory ( MCPE-44034 )
64. Fixed a bug where some blocks that require a supporting block (for example Carpet or crops) did not appear on Maps when placed on a non-full block or above an air block ( MCPE-159713 )
65. Iron Bars are no longer missing from the Creative Mode inventory and are once again accessible through commands ( MCPE-160253 )
66. Piston's animation when extending and retracting is now smooth ( MCPE-155987 )
67. It is no longer possible to get an aged Sapling in the inventory by block-picking
68. Fixed dropped items getting stuck at the edge of flowing water ( MCPE-157167 )
69. When on fire, the fire overlay no longer clips through held items ( MCPE-147776 )
70. Mangrove, Crimson, and Warped Planks can now be used to repair Shields ( MCPE-158940 )
71. Fixed a regression where an undamaged tool, such as Pickaxe, when name changed on an Anvil, would fail to work correctly when used for the first time ( MCPE-152637 )
72. Fixed a bug where the name tag background was slightly offset ( MCPE-160254 )
73. Fixed a UI bug where enchanted leather items would have parts of the texture not displaying the glint animation ( MCPE-98929 )
74. Added new disconnection error messages to better highlight the area in which the disconnection occurred
75. Character Creator offers in Marketplace will no longer lose their thumbnail images upon exiting the Dressing Room
76. Added a Retry button to the Xbox cloud sync prompt
77. Item stacks now are merged together after assigned tick threshold
78. Added a missing settings button on packs in the updated Create New World screen
79. Added a new disconnection error message - "Unable to connect, please restart your client"
80. Fixed an issue causing messages with non-unicode characters to have incorrect spacing
81. NPC names now default to only being displayed while looking at them
82. The arrow within the crafting Pocket UI now fits appropriately without any clipping issues
83. The "Cannot connect to Marketplace” error will no longer be erroneously read by the Text-To-Speech reader
84. Raid bar no longer becomes stuck after breaking Beds to cancel a raid ( MCPE-152851 )
85. Under Settings > (Controls) > Touch there is a new toggle entitled, Enable New Touch Controls Schemes. When toggled ON, a new Interaction Model dropdown menu will appear, allowing players to use our new Touch scheme, our new Crosshair scheme, or the original Classic scheme.
86. Player textures and UI elements should no longer turn pink after playing for an extended period time on highly populated servers ( MCPE-105487 )
87. Fixed an issue where certain water textures with waterlogged blocks displayed the wrong texture ( MCPE-156281 )
88. Fixed an issue with flowing Lava and Water textures not animating on some iOS devices
89. Sky in The End dimension will no longer look like static upon entry while it is raining in the Overworld ( MCPE-148843 )
90. Updated Add-On templates for 1.19.30 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation, are available to download at aka.ms/MCAddonPacks
91. Added keyboard shortcuts that allow players to copy either their current coordinates or the coordinates of a block Control + Alt + C is the default for copying current coordinates Control + Alt + X is the default for copying coordinates of selected block Needs the "Enable Copy Coordinate UI" enabled in Creator settings
92. Control + Alt + C is the default for copying current coordinates
93. Control + Alt + X is the default for copying coordinates of selected block
94. Needs the "Enable Copy Coordinate UI" enabled in Creator settings
95. Numerical actor properties (float and integer) will now always clamp their values into the range of values specified
96. minecraft:instant_despawn no longer affects players
97. Command selector now gets the same position for the player that the command origin player position gets
98. Fixed a bug where the text-to-speech feature would read the entire "My Content" page, both highlighted and non-highlighted items
99. Non-Parrot mobs on a player's shoulder will now adjust their position when the player crouches ( MCPE-153996 )
100. Enables creators to add geometry up to 0.875 units outside of the regular block unit cube on any one side
101. Fixed a bug where some custom items (from Creator Features packs), after being used, were duplicated upon player's death ( MCPE-128897 )
102. Added server property ‘disable-custom-skins’ to block untrusted skins on a server wide level
103. Text to Speech no longer ignores the volume setting on startup
104. Clarified the documentation for equipment_count to indicate it only counts equipped armor, and how to query for held items ( MCPE-136134 )
105. Limit which queries can be used in Actor Property-related Molang expressions. Property defaults can only use query.had_component_group and set_property can only use property and query.has_property
106. BlockDisplayNameComponent will no longer append 'tile.' and '.name' to given display names and in turn, will display their given raw strings if no appropriate localization can be found
107. Added a paste button to the Command Block screen
108. Added a waterlog field to the /structure command and the load tab of Structure Blocks to allow players to properly waterlog a structure when it's being placed under water
109. The "/execute at" command now properly executes filters from the specified 'at' position ( MCPE-156283 )
110. The "/execute if block" command now displays integer values for block positions ( MCPE-156285 )
111. Fixed a bug where a "%" was prepended to player names in the chat output of "/scoreboard players reset" ( MCPE-151389 )
112. Attempting to kill a player in Creative Mode using the "/kill" command now displays a message informing the player that it cannot be done ( MCPE-16732 )
113. Fixed a bug where function length would return undefined
114. Added function lengthSquared - Returns the squared length of the vector
115. Added stackOverflow as a possible WatchdogTerminateReason for the beforeWatchdogTerminate event
116. IRawMessage - Interface object representing a message
117. rawtext : (string | IRawMessage)[] - (optional) A list of text objects used to build a message
118. text : string - (optional) A string containing plain text to display directly. Only valid when used as a sub member in a parent rawtext or with member
119. translate : string - (optional) String representing a translation identifier to translate text in the player's selected language
120. with : (string | IRawMessage)[] - (optional) A list of text object arguments used to fill values in the translate text. Ignored when translate is not present
121. say(string | IRawMessage) - Used to broadcast a message to all players
122. tell(string | IRawMessage) - Send a message to a player
123. Fixed a bug where Dynamic Properties would not persist when using worlds hosted on Bedrock Dedicated Server or Realms
124. Pack dependencies on native modules can be declared using the module name without the need to specify a UUID, using the “module_name” attribute. The module name matches the import statement (e.g., “mojang-minecraft”)
125. Removed mojang-gametest module version 0.1.0; packs using "mojang-gametest" specific APIs must be updated to use GameTest version 1.0.0-beta
126. The "mojang-gametest" module 1.0.0-beta requires "mojang-minecraft" module 1.0.0-beta
127. Removed usage of minecraft:unwalkable block component and added block creative group and category to the block description
128. setVelocity will now throw an exception when called on player types
129. Renamed class Items to ItemTypes
130. Add a content error when default or set_property expressions include side-effects, such as Molang variable assignment
131. Commands Added new sub-command /script watchdog exportstats - Exports a file containing memory usage and object handle statistics Can now switch hotbar slots while targeting a block while in a Boat ( MCPE-156814 ) The '/execute at' and '/execute as' commands will now execute at the correct relative rotation ( MCPE-156277 ) '/execute at @e run kill @e' no longer crashes the game when there are items on the ground Added chat output when entities are skipped by "/ride summon_ride no_ride_change" ( MCPE-129486 ) Added function getAll(): ItemTypeIterator - Returns an iterator of all available item types
132. Added new sub-command /script watchdog exportstats - Exports a file containing memory usage and object handle statistics
133. Can now switch hotbar slots while targeting a block while in a Boat ( MCPE-156814 )
134. The '/execute at' and '/execute as' commands will now execute at the correct relative rotation ( MCPE-156277 )
135. '/execute at @e run kill @e' no longer crashes the game when there are items on the ground
136. Added chat output when entities are skipped by "/ride summon_ride no_ride_change" ( MCPE-129486 )
137. Added function getAll(): ItemTypeIterator - Returns an iterator of all available item types
138. Memory Watchdog script-watchdog-memory-warning - Produces a content log warning when the combined memory usage exceeds the given threshold (in megabytes). Setting this value to 0 disables the warning. (default = 100) script-watchdog-memory-limit - Saves and shuts down the world when the combined memory usage exceeds the given threshold (in megabytes). Setting this value to 0 disables the limit. (default = 250) Increased slow code warning threshold from 2 ms to 6 ms
139. script-watchdog-memory-warning - Produces a content log warning when the combined memory usage exceeds the given threshold (in megabytes). Setting this value to 0 disables the warning. (default = 100)
140. script-watchdog-memory-limit - Saves and shuts down the world when the combined memory usage exceeds the given threshold (in megabytes). Setting this value to 0 disables the limit. (default = 250)
141. Increased slow code warning threshold from 2 ms to 6 ms

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/9272494067469-Minecraft-1-19-30-Bedrock

**Fixes:**

__**Minecraft - 1.19.21 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update has been released to address a few issues that have occurred since the release of 1.19.20.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed several crashes that could occur during gameplay
2. Fixed an issue that caused Villagers’ professions to not reflect in their clothing ( MCPE-160475 )
3. Fixed a bug where graphical artifacts appear while playing on some devices ( MCPE-160491 , MCPE-160758 , MCPE-160451 )
4. Fixed a bug where the names hovering above mobs were slightly offset ( MCPE-160254 )
5. Fixed an issue that caused some blocks on Marketplace worlds to appear as “update blocks” on Realms
6. Paid emotes can no longer be equipped for free

1.19.20.title: Minecraft - 1.19.20 (Bedrock)
1.19.20.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.20 (Bedrock)**__
> They say that variety is the spice of life, which is why I am enjoying this enormous glass of milk alongside this week’s update! We have lots of different treats in store for you, like plenty of parity fixes and an endless jar of chili mayo. OK, maybe the last one just applies to yours truly unless the rest of you also spilled your condiments on your keyboard. As always, we appreciate all of your help and input, please report any new bugs atbugs.mojang.comand leave your feedbackfeedback.minecraft.net.

**Fixes:**
1. Added the updated Create New World screen on Nintendo Switch
2. Added support for middle mouse click on iOS
3. Zombies now have a 10% chance to be able to break doors on hard difficulty ( MCPE-79636 )
4. Implemented new Marketplace error screen art and messaging
5. Timeout when connecting to a multiplayer game has been reduced from 180 to 90 seconds
6. D-Pad Left can now be held down again to move the cursor left in menus ( MCPE-155976 )
7. Instantaneous effects (Potions, Tipped Arrows) can no longer be applied to dead mobs and players
8. ‘So Below’ music track now plays in Basalt Deltas ( MCPE-70890 )
9. Redesigned the menu toggle switches to make it easier to distinguish between the on and off states
10. Due to an unexpected crashing issue, we have had to temporarily revert the fix for MCPE-105487 , which can cause textures to turn pink after playing for long periods of time on a server This means that this bug may continue to occur until we have a solution. Thank you for your patience while we continue to work on this important issue – we hope to have it finally fixed as soon as possible!
11. This means that this bug may continue to occur until we have a solution. Thank you for your patience while we continue to work on this important issue – we hope to have it finally fixed as soon as possible!
12. The game no longer crashes when browsing the Marketplace
13. Fixed a crash related to Spawn Eggs ( MCPE-159302 )
14. Prevent client/server portal travel desync on low render distance settings ( MCPE-158167 )
15. Fix potential crash when returning to the Overworld from the Nether or The End
16. The game no longer crashes when entering Coin Starter Bundle Screen
17. Fixed bugs where client state can get out of sync with server if using an item is cancelled or failed
18. Improved the performance of the locate biome command to mitigate stalls on the server while searching for a biome that is far away ( MCPE-157609 )
19. Fixed a crash that could occur when connected devices, like gamepads, were missing
20. Fixed a crash that was caused by a Villager changing its profession while trading. The Trade screen will now close if the Villager changes professions mid trade
21. Fixed a crash that could occur when Pistons were extending or retracting near moveable blocks and Arrows
22. Fixed a crash when exploring multiple categories in Marketplace on Xbox and PlayStation
23. Fixed a crash that could occur when teleporting and killing an entity in the same tick
24. The Wandering Trader's spawning now matches Java Edition and it will no longer spawn in water, lava, or underground ( MCPE-46911 )
25. Fixed a bug where Bows could fail to shoot an Arrow the first time they were used, this also affected Crossbows and with throwing Tridents ( MCPE-159467 )
26. Fixed a bug that caused the new Wild Update music to not play in the Wild Update biomes when in Creative mode
27. Fixed an issue that prevented fisherman Villagers from offering to buy Boats at max level
28. The secret door that leads to the Redstone room in the center of an Ancient City now opens/closes properly ( MCPE-156718 )
29. Lava in Buckets will no longer disappear when failing to be placed or dispensed into partial blocks ( MCPE-50664 )
30. Fixed an issue where enchantments on ranged weapons on mobs were not being applied ( MCPE-113623 )
31. Fixed volume level of Amethyst step chime sound when walked on by a mob
32. Fixed an issue where some items with durability would fail to be created from the Creative inventory
33. Ancient Cities have more frequent Sculk Patch generation ( MCPE-154229 )
34. Player no longer takes damage from entering a Nether portal if it is placed at Y=-21 or below ( MCPE-154888 )
35. Fixed an issue where scores on scoreboards were not being ordered properly ( MCPE-141427 )
36. Fixed a bug where fishing hooks would drop loot when killed with the /kill command ( MCPE-142329 )
37. Player’s Soul Speed is now properly activated and de-activated on Soul Sand ( MCPE-157152 )
38. Fixed a bug causing health_boost to display incorrect health values, causing the player to turn invisible and unable to interact with the world on dying
39. When trading, the Villager plays the correct sound based on the item in the input slot ( MCPE-152555 )
40. Skulls in Ancient Cities now better match the orientation they have in Java Edition ( MCPE-153547 )
41. Enable event filters in the root definition to be evaluated independent of sequence or randomize when a format_version of 1.19.20 or higher is specified
42. Fixed issue with health boost extra life not staying ( MCPE-153504 )
43. Polar Bears no longer panic when attacked
44. Tadpoles flopping while on land now more closely match Java Edition and fishes in speed ( MCPE-154316 )
45. Piglins will now stop attacking if the player puts on Gold Armor ( MCPE-65516 )
46. Jobless Zombie Villagers are no longer unable to ride Minecarts or Boats ( MCPE-76831 )
47. Ravager is now able to destroy Mangrove Leaves, Azalea, Azalea Leaves, Cave Vines, Dripleaves, Spore Blossoms, and Hanging Roots ( MCPE-156551 , MCPE-125322 )
48. Releasing a bucketed custom mob now spawns the correct type of mob
49. Fixed the order in which a bucketed mob is created when released, which means any Actor Properties on it will load correctly
50. Allays can now pick up and drop items at their owner when in a Boat ( MCPE-156377 )
51. Allay can now always pick up dropped Scaffolding blocks ( MCPE-157512 )
52. Allay now correctly stops dancing when music from Jukebox ends
53. Allays now look at targets such as players ( MCPE-158222 )
54. Fish do not shake anymore when placed in an isolated water block
55. Fixed a bug that caused Wolves to spawn red when summoned with entity_born or on_tame events
56. Fixed a bug that could cause Witches to stop spawning. The Witch Hut structure is now set as a surface spawner for Witches ( MCPE-60552 )
57. The Ender Dragon can no longer destroy Crying Obsidian, Respawn Anchor, Light, Deny, Allow, Border, and Jigsaw blocks ( MCPE-158343 )
58. Fixed a bug causing baby mobs with the minecraft:behavior.sleep goal to have a shrunken hitbox ( MCPE-46040 )
59. Allays and Bees are now less likely to get stuck in non-full blocks ( MCPE-155777 )
60. Wardens can now detect a player sneaking on top of a Sculk Sensor ( MCPE-155804 )
61. Warden can now let itself fall up to 20 blocks down, instead of just 3 ( MCPE-158304 )
62. Allays can now pick up armor pieces with a different durability than the one they are holding ( MCPE-158339 )
63. Entities that die completely now have their data removed from world file ( MCPE-155283 )
64. Fixed a bug which could cause mobs to not load into the world if their saved y-position was greater than or equal to 25
65. Removed "Wood" from the names of Mangrove Wood Planks, Stairs, and Slabs ( MCPE-156791 )
66. Twisting Vines and Weeping Vines with no support now pop even when the random ticking speed is set to 0 ( MCPE-69305 )
67. Hanging Mangrove Propagules no longer drop a Propagule item when silk touched if not at max growth ( MCPE-156821 )
68. Muddy Mangrove Roots can now be placed sideways ( MCPE-153721 )
69. Hanging Mangrove Propagule no longer changes color when certain blocks are placed nearby ( MCPE-156570 )
70. End Portal Frame Block is now named "End Portal Frame" instead of "End Portal" ( MCPE-76821 )
71. Amethyst Block has been renamed to "Block of Amethyst" ( MCPE-125821 )
72. Mangrove Log, Mangrove Wood, and Stripped Mangrove Wood can now be used to craft a Campfire with Charcoal ( MCPE-157271 )
73. Campfires can once again be stacked correctly ( MCPE-159398 )
74. Fixed a bug where Pistons sometimes did not drop the Piston item when broken by the arm ( MCPE-158314 )
75. Sounds of the Smithing Table when a Villager is working are now the same as sounds when the player uses the table ( MCPE-79716 )
76. Bells can no longer catch on fire or be destroyed by fire
77. Mangrove and Azalea Leaves no longer prevent tree growth ( MCPE-154980 )
78. If two vibrations are emitted at the same time, Sculk Sensors will now react to the closest one ( MCPE-155793 ) If two vibrations are emitted at the same time and at the same distance, Sculk Sensors will now react to the one with the highest frequency
79. If two vibrations are emitted at the same time and at the same distance, Sculk Sensors will now react to the one with the highest frequency
80. Sculk Sensors now detect a Creeper exploding with a frequency of 15
81. Sculk Sensors now detect an End Crystal exploding with a frequency of 15 ( MCPE-153733 )
82. Sculk Sensors now detect a Fish being let out of a Bucket with a frequency of 12
83. Sculk Sensors now detect a TNT being fired out of a Dispenser with a frequency of 12
84. Vibration particles are now always oriented towards the target Sculk Sensor ( MCPE-156648 )
85. Sculk Catalysts now play the blooming sound effect when blooming ( MCPE-153562 )
86. Sculk Catalysts do not spread Sculk anymore on players' death if the Keep Inventory gamerule is set to True ( MCPE-157884 )
87. Sculk Catalysts do not get covered in Sculk Veins anymore if a mob dies on top of them
88. Sculk Catalyst now blooms when a mob with no experience dies next to it
89. Sculk Sensors can now also detect Bees, Chickens, Allays, Phantoms, and Ender Dragons flying ( MCPE-153725 , MCPE-154055 )
90. Sculk Sensors can now emit the whole range of Redstone signal strengths, based on the distance a vibration has been emitted at. Previously, the output was either 1, 15 or even
91. Sculk Sensors no longer detect Boats staying still in water ( MCPE-155368 )
92. Reduced Sculk Catalyst experience drop from 20 to 5
93. Sculk Patch Features can now be placed on additional block types ( MCPE-156669 )
94. Fixed bug causing FOV to stutter when sprinting while the player has a speed effect applied
95. With data-driven block tessellation, geometry box pivot-base rotation now rotates around the correct pivot point
96. Fixed x-ray vision when Top Snow falls on top of player so it now behaves as a solid block when Top Snow covers player's vision ( MCPE-150709 )
97. Fixed an issue with RTX on Windows where point lights were unintentionally accumulated for emissive blocks ( MCPE-159485 , MCPE-159488 )
98. The Toggle Perspective hint now shows the player’s assignment instead of the default assignment
99. Saddled Pig's tooltip changed to "Ride" instead of "Mount"
100. Added content warnings for large icons for texture tessellation (e.g. objects in hand)
101. Fixed an issue where players were not able to hover over UI elements inside a scroll view if a portion of it fell outside of the view when using mouse + keyboard on iOS. This was a result of the scroll view auto focusing onto the nearest non-clipped element
102. Hover text for can_place_on blocks for items in inventory is now in a consistent order between game saves ( MCPE-153516 )
103. Removed the controller settings tab for Oculus
104. Goat Horn sound is now placed in the Jukebox/Note Blocks sound category in Settings ( MCPE-154885 )
105. Fixed the Add Server feature not saving IPV6 addresses ( MCPE-66233 )
106. Updated the Realms Plus FAQ to clarify that all Bedrock platforms can purchase Realms Plus ( MCPE-157869 )
107. Fixed an error where creating a new Realm would navigate out to the Play screen instead of returning to the Create New World screen
108. The Realms feed screenshot button is now available for VR platforms
109. Removed emotes functionality while in Spectator Mode
110. Player can now place blocks where spectator is hovering
111. Players now have their hands back when they are holding a map when they have one item in offhand and one in main hand, curious how they held it without hands...
112. Spectators’ heads are now properly rendered as semi-transparent
113. Character Creator head items (hats, hoods, helmets, etc.) are now properly rendered semi-transparent while in Spectator mode
114. Capes and animated back items are no longer rendered while in Spectator mode ( MCPE-156929 )
115. Spectators can no longer use or get affected by portals ( MCPE-156684 )
116. Updated Add-On templates for19.20 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation, are available to download at aka.ms/MCAddonPacks
117. Fixed a Disconnect Packet vulnerability used to crash Bedrock Server
118. Blocks with their render_method component set to double_sided now have their back faces properly rendered
119. Limit the number of elements in the conditionsfield of the minecraft:part_visibility to 64
120. Renamed minecraft:aim_collisionblock component to minecraft:selection_box
121. renamed the 'minecraft:block_light_emission' component to 'minecraft:light_emission' and changed its accepted value type from float to int
122. Renamed 'minecraft:destroy_time' to 'minecraft:destructible_by_mining' and restructured the component to be either defined as a boolean or as an object
123. Setting the component to true will give the block the default destroy time and setting it to false will make the block indestructible by mining
124. Setting the component as an object will let users define the number of seconds needed to destroy the block with base equipment
125. Changed the minecraft:frictioncomponent to represent friction of block instead of movement
126. Removed the component minecraft:unwalkable
127. Renamed 'minecraft:explosion_resistance' to 'minecraft:destructible_by_explosion' and restructured the component to be either defined as a boolean or as an object Setting the component to true will give the block the default explosion_resistance and setting it to false will make the block indestructible by explosion Setting the component as an object will let users define the resistance of the block to a base explosion
128. Setting the component to true will give the block the default explosion_resistance and setting it to false will make the block indestructible by explosion
129. Setting the component as an object will let users define the resistance of the block to a base explosion
130. Added /tagsfromitem and /itemswithtag commands which output the tags associated with an item and vice versa
131. Added a new dedicated server property, "chat-restriction", that can be modified in the "server.properties" file to restrict the chat for all players connecting to the server. The property's possible values are "None", "Dropped", and "Disabled". See the default file for more information
132. Server developers can now see checksums of the block registry from the server and client to check for mismatch (search "Block Registry Checksum" in the output logs and compare)
133. Added a server property disable-player-interaction which informs clients that they should ignore other players when interacting with the world
134. Modified the json entity file so that it also contains projectile damage in addition to the explosion and fire damage ( MCPE-153740 )
135. Items with the item_lock component can no longer be placed in Item Frames or Armor Stands ( MCPE-138479 )
136. Added Content Errors for when there are too many properties on the actor (more than 32) or when a string enum name is too long (more than 32 characters)
137. Added new Molang had_component_group to allow calculating appropriate default values from previously saved entity data
138. Renamed 'actor_property' and 'has_actor_property' Molang queries to 'property' and 'has_property' . Also renamed 'set_actor_property' to 'set_property'
139. Update 'set_property' to only allow changing properties on the local actor rather than some other target
140. Restored ability to use a Molang expression string for default values of Actor Properties (These are primarily useful for random starting values)
141. Performance Watchdog Added a performance watchdog that monitors GameTests for slow-running scripts Executing a slow-running script will result in content log warnings Additionally, long script hangs (more than 3 seconds in a single tick) will result in an exception Added new properties to propertiesfor watchdog configuration on Dedicated Server script-watchdog-enable- Enables the watchdog (default = true) script-watchdog-hang-threshold- Sets the watchdog threshold for single tick hangs (default = 3000 ms) script-watchdog-spike-threshold- Sets the watchdog threshold for single tick spikes (default = 100 ms) script-watchdog-slow-threshold- Sets the watchdog threshold for slow scripts over multiple ticks (default = 2ms) Updated mojang-minecraft-uiforms to respond when the client was unable to show a modal form Renamed isCanceledfield to canceled Added cancelationReasonfield Added FormCancelationReasonenum ScoreboardObjectiveDisplayOptions Added 'ScoreboardObjectiveDisplayOptions' class Added read-only property 'Objective: objective' Added read-only property 'ObjectiveSortOrder: sortOrder' Scoreboard Added function 'removeObjective(objectiveId: string | Objective): void' - Untracks an objective Added function 'addObjective(objectiveId: string, displayName: string): Objective' - Creates and objective to be tracked, identified with objectiveId and displayed on the screen with displayName Added function 'getObjectiveAtDisplaySlot(displaySlotId: string): ScoreboardObjectiveDisplayOptions' - Gets objective and sort order contained in the DisplayObjective slot specified by displaySlotId Added function 'setObjectiveAtDisplaySlot(displaySlotId: string, ScoreboardObjectiveDisplayOptions : scoreboardObjectiveDisplayOptions): Objective' - Accessible from getComponent("sign")on sign blocks BlockSignComponent Added read-only property text: string- Gets the sign text System Events Added event beforeWatchdogTerminate - Shuts down the server when a critical scripting exception occurs (e.g. script hang). Can be canceled to prevent shutdown Added enum WatchdogTerminateReason - Specifies the reason for watchdog termination Added new properties to properties for watchdog configuration on Bedrock Dedicated Server script-watchdog-enable-exception-handling - Enables watchdog exception handling via the events.beforeWatchdogTerminate event (default = true) script-watchdog-enable-shutdown - Enables server shutdown in the case of an unhandled watchdog exception (default = true) script-watchdog-hang-exception - Throws a critical exception when a hang occurs (default = true)
