1.19.11.title: Minecraft - 1.19.11 (Bedrock)
1.19.11.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.11 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update is available on Minecraft to address some issues since the release of version 1.19.10.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed a bug that could cause mobs to not load into the world if their saved y-position was greater than or equal to 25
2. Fixed incorrect texture rending of players when using RTX on Windows ( MCPE-156577 )
3. Fixed incorrect texture rendering of some mobs, like Horses, when using RTX on Windows ( MCPE-132747 )
4. Fixed an issue that prevented Command Blocks from saving if a Command Block Alias wasn’t provided while playing on Realms
5. Fixed a bug where suspended accounts could not play local worlds or navigate the menus on Xbox platforms

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/7803469757581-Minecraft-1-19-11-Bedrock

1.19.10.title: Minecraft - 1.19.10 (Bedrock)
1.19.10.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.10 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update is now available for Minecraft, featuring allay duplication, locate biome command capabilities, and a swath of new improvements.

**Fixes:**
1. When an Allay hears a Jukebox playing, it will do a dance animation
2. If the Jukebox stops playing, or if the Allay gets too far away from the Jukebox, it will stop dancing
3. If the Allay is given an Amethyst Shard while dancing, it will play a small amethyst sound, make a heart, and duplicate into another Allay
4. After duplication, both Allays will have a 5-minute cooldown before being able to duplicate again
5. Expanded the '/locate' command into locate structure and locate biome
6. The Trader Llama now has its own spawn egg
7. Added the player's cause of death to the death screen
8. Music is now included in the game files on iOS, so players no longer need to be download the music pack from the Marketplace
9. Added Bluetooth mouse and keyboard support on iOS
10. Fixed a crash that could occur when Boats are unloaded from the world
11. Fixed a crash that could occur when a Wither is loaded into the world
12. Fixed a crash that could occur in multiplayer when a player left the game while changing dimension
13. Fixed a crash that could occur when a Fishing Rod was cast through dimension-changing portals ( MCPE-154161 )
14. Fixed a crash that could occur when players died while affected with Withering
15. The game no longer crashes when entering the Coin Starter Bundle screen
16. Loading a world no longer takes a very long time when having the Holiday Creator Features experimental toggle enabled
17. Players are no longer pushed by Doors as they close ( MCPE-154734 )
18. Items now stack properly in the offhand when inventory is full ( MCPE-34959 )
19. Equipping items in armor slots through inventory screen now produces sounds ( MCPE-46939 )
20. Players can now hear each other equipping items in armor slots
21. Fixed a bug where players could take fall damage when walking around on Scaffolding at certain heights (even when not actually falling) ( MCPE-154779 )
22. Fixed a bug that reset the player's vertical camera angle upon entering a Boat ( MCPE-152762 )
23. Advanced Pick Block now copies the items inside when used on a Boat with Chest ( MCPE-153410 )
24. Resistance effect is no longer one level weaker than it should be ( MCPE-156012 )
25. Haste I will now properly increase the player's mining speed ( MCPE-102237 )
26. Conduit Power I now grants the effect of Haste I instead of Haste II
27. Fixed an issue with extra health from Health Boost not persisting after exiting the world ( MCPE-153504 )
28. Container entities like Boat with Chest can now be opened on mobile devices without crouching if all the seats are occupied
29. The player no longer endlessly jumps after entering a Boat while holding down the jump button ( MCPE-155774 )
30. Fixed a bug causing player hitboxes to not reset if they die while swimming ( MCPE-155232 )
31. Fixed an issue where new users given Operator permissions by default were not able to use operator commands
32. Fixed an issue where worlds that gave Operator permissions to new players only gave Member permissions
33. Removed the Vanilla Experiment and Wild Experiment toggles, since they no longer have any active experimental content
34. Fixed a bug where upgrading old worlds could result in water columns below y=0
35. Mangrove Swamps are now denser to more closely match Java Edition ( MCPE-153748 ) There is still work to be done to increase the density of Mangrove trees in water
36. There is still work to be done to increase the density of Mangrove trees in water
37. Grass blocks in Mangrove Swamps now have Dirt blocks underneath them ( MCPE-155414 )
38. Clay patches now correctly generate in Mangrove Swamps
39. Campground structures now generate correctly in Ancient Cities ( MCPE-156084 )
40. Updated Ancient City structures to match Java Edition
41. Sculk Vein feature can now generate within the same height-span as the Sculk Patch feature ( MCPE-156074 )
42. Fixed issues with mobs disappearing after going through Nether portals ( MCPE-155678 )
43. Fixed a bug causing tamed mobs to disappear when they go through a Nether portal in a multiplayer world ( MCPE-88322 )
44. Villagers now spawn as Swamp Villagers in Mangrove Swamp ( MCPE-153731 )
45. Villagers will now flee from Zoglins ( MCPE-74974 )
46. Parrots are once again poisoned by Cookies ( MCPE-151671 )
47. The Trader Llama now has the correct name displayed when opening its inventory ( MCPE-47165 )
48. Fixed a bug that prevented Trader Llamas from becoming aggressive towards entities that attack the Wandering Trader ( MCPE-94996 )
49. The Wandering Trader will now flee from Zoglins
50. The Wandering Trader will now drink Milk to clear its Invisibility effect ( MCPE-44605 )
51. Fixed a bug causing riding passengers to stop riding when reloaded if they were across chunk borders
52. Breaking a Boat with Chest or Minecart with Chest will now anger nearby Piglins ( MCPE-153393 )
53. Fixed entities disappearing when importing worlds converted from legacy console editions of Minecraft
54. Fixed a bug where Slimes would no longer spawn in flat worlds made before 1.18 ( MCPE-119396 )
55. Fixed a bug where failed Slime spawn attempts would reduce the spawning rates of other mobs ( MCPE-153502 )
56. Wither now breaks Obsidian when attacked by players ( MCPE-64630 )
57. Wither no longer breaks surrounding blocks after a shorter delay than intended after being attacked
58. Entities entering Nether portals exit in same relative position and rotation to the portal ( MCPE-139835 )
59. Edited health points of Cod, Pufferfish, Salmon, and Tropical fish to be 3, matching Java Edition
60. Shulker projectile now adds effect "Levitation" instead of "Levitation II" on hit
61. Tadpoles now grow up into Temperate Frog in Meadow, and into Cold Frog in Deep Dark
62. Frogs no longer lay Frogspawn on shallow, flowing water ( MCPE-152559 )
63. Allays can now follow players through Nether portals ( MCPE-155678 )
64. Taking a stackable item from an Allay now correctly adds this item to existing stacks ( MCPE-153540 )
65. Taking a stackable item from an Allay no longer cause item duplication
66. Allay pickup range is changed from 64 to 32 blocks to match Java Edition ( MCPE-251766 )
67. Allay now retains information about the vibration it is reacting to through save and load
68. Items held by Allays now glow in darkness ( MCPE-153533 )
69. Warden can now path through lava ( MCPE-153582 )
70. Warden can now pass through water ( MCPE-153602 )
71. Warden is no longer pushable while emerging or digging
72. If the Warden is in liquid when attempting to despawn, it will not do the digging animation, instead it will just despawn without any animation/sound ( MCPE-155706 )
73. Warden now always chases a nuisance after it roars at it
74. Warden now increases its anger towards an attacking nuisance by 100 anger for each attack
75. There are no longer graphical artifacts from the Warden’s emerge or dig particle effects ( MCPE-153580 )
76. Warden's hurt animation no longer differs between Bedrock Edition and Java Edition ( MCPE-153967 )

1.19.2.title: Minecraft - 1.19.2 (Bedrock)
1.19.2.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.19.2 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update is available for Minecraft that addresses some issues that have occurred since the release of 1.19.0.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed several crashes that could occur during gameplay
2. Fixed a bug on certain flat worlds where below-0 terrain was accidentally being removed on level load, if there was bedrock at y=0 ( MCPE-156679 , MCPE-156698 )
3. Mobs that teleport through a Nether portal with a destination above y=128 will no longer have their position adjusted to 128 ( MCPE-155465 )

1.19.0.title: Minecraft - The Wild Update - 1.19.0 (Bedrock)
1.19.0.md:
__**Minecraft - The Wild Update - 1.19.0 (Bedrock)**__
> Set your sights for adventure, wander aimlessly, or seek out something new in The Wild Update!

**Fixes:**
1. Tread carefully in the deep dark or risk waking a warden
2. Climb to the top of a mangrove tree and leap through the swamps with Frogs
3. Find allays to help gather items
4. Added several new music tracks to enjoy during gameplay
5. Fixed over 40 bugs, issues, and parity changes
6. In the depths of the Overworld, you will find one of the scariest biomes in all of Minecraft. Buried undergound, especially at the bottom of mountainous regions, this area is filled with sculk blocks, ancient structures, loot chests, and one, single, solitary mob. To navigate the deep dark, you need to sneak, use Silk Touch, and above all else – don’t wake the warden!
7. The only mob that spawns in the deep dark is none other than the warden. The warden will only make an appearance if its slumber is disturbed, which means that brave explorers must sneak around very quietly. Quick movements risk setting off a sculk sensor that trigger a sculk shrieker. If you have the misfortune of hearing it pierce through the silent shroud of the deep dark, it’s time to get out. Even though the warden can’t see, this doesn’t slow it down but works to its advantage. The warden can sniff out any intruders and uses vibrations to detect their exact location.
8. There are five different types of sculk blocks to be found in the deep dark. If you want to mine them, you will need to stay stealthy and use Silk Touch. The sculk block is a great decorative block thanks to its atmospheric glow. The sculk sensor is a redstone block that detects vibrations, so walk carefully or use a wool block to muffle your steps. The sculk catalyst spreads sculk around it and sculk veins generate around patches of sculk that spawn from the sculk catalyst. Finally, the sculk shrieker is possibly the most dangerous block of all since it will summon the warden if you’re not careful!
9. The recovery compass is the solution for finding the way back to the last location you died. Loot chests in ancient cities to discover echo shards and craft one for yourself!
10. Towering trees, wide roots, small saplings, and muddy terrain make up the new mangrove swamps. Found in areas with high temperatures and high humidity, this new swamp also introduces mangrove trees and mud blocks, bringing a wide range of new materials to craft builds inspired by the beauty of the Overworld!
11. Mangrove trees introduce a brand-new type of wood block to build with, the logs can be crafted into planks, stairs, buttons, slabs, fences, doors, signs, and pressure plates. You can also craft with the mangrove tree’s leaves, roots, and small saplings called propagules!
12. Mud can be found all over mangrove swamps and crafted with wheat into packed mud! Use it to craft a variety of mud brick blocks including stairs, slabs, and walls. This block is also renewable by using a water bottle on dirt, so there is no risk of running out of mud. Placing Mud above a block that has pointed dripstone underneath will eventually turn the mud block into clay!
13. Frogs feed on small slimes, breathe on land and in water, and lay eggs called frogspawn. The eggs will hatch and turn into tadpoles, making this the first mob that isn’t bred from a smaller version of itself! There are three different types to discover – temperate frogs, warm frogs, and cold frogs – so getting your hands on all three means that you will need to travel through the Overworld!
14. These luminous blocks come in three different variants depending on which frog type produces it. If you want to light up your base with ochre, verdant, or pearlescent froglights, you will need to figure out a way to feed a frog a very small magma cube!
15. The winner of the Minecraft Live 2021 Mob Vote is flying into Minecraft! Instantly recognizable by its luminous blue sheen, you won’t lose this mob once you find it. Hand it an item and it will pick up matching items it finds in the world. It loves music and will drop items if it hears a note block playing nearby. The allay spawns in pillager outposts and woodland mansions and is waiting for you to set it free!
16. The Wild Update makes it possible for you to craft a boat with a chest on it, which is convenient since there are plenty of new blocks to bring back from your new adventures!
17. Dropped by goats that ram into hard blocks and can be used to make a variety of sounds! Can you find all eight variants?
18. Added new music by Lena Raine and Samuel Åberg
19. Music Disc 5 Unlike other discs, it can only be obtained by finding and crafting nine disc fragments together These disc fragments can be found rarely in ancient city chests
20. Unlike other discs, it can only be obtained by finding and crafting nine disc fragments together

25. With Our Powers Combined! - Have all 3 froglights in your inventory
26. Sneak 100 - Sneaking next to a Sculk Sensor without triggering it

101. The recipes for Minecart with Chest/Hopper/TNT are now shapeless
102. Fixed a bug where the Trident, Bow, Spyglass and Crossbow would not render when picked up by a Fox ( MCPE-135346 )
103. Fixed a bug causing z-fighting to occur on bottom of player’s head while wearing a Skull ( MCPE-149125 )
104. Each Minecart variant (Chest/Hopper/TNT) drops itself as a single item when broken, instead of splitting into two items (such as Chest and Minecart)
105. Fixed an issue that caused Leads to render on top of Glass ( MCPE-145764 )
106. Fixed a bug causing the fire animation to flicker when the player is standing in a Lava Cauldron while in Creative mode ( MCPE-148999 )
107. Fixed an issue that could cause severe visual glitches when using emotes more than once ( MCPE-155049 )
108. Fixed graphical corruption issues on Android devices ( MCPE-155509 )
109. Minor changes have been made for Xbox players when switching accounts while the game is open. See this article for details
110. Shift-clicking items will once again combine items of same type into a stack ( MCPE-153992 )
111. Added settings to change duration of notifications
112. The "Submit Feedback" button is now described as a link by Text-To-Speech
113. Added appropriate messaging when there is no internet connection on Xbox devices
114. Fixed enchantment option on Pocket UI Profile not being displayed
115. Fixed a bug where items could be dropped by clicking in the dark gray area of the left side of player inventory when using Furnace, Blast Furnace, Smoker, Enchant Table, Grindstone, Brewing Stand, Anvil, Beacon, and Smithing Table
116. Players can now sign in with a QR code on Nintendo Switch and PlayStation consoles
117. Featured Servers message text is no longer centered
118. "Controller lost connection" prompt will now be shown after the world generation screen if a controller was disconnected while on that screen
119. Updated Add-On templates for 1.19.0 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation, are available to download at aka.ms/MCAddonPacks
120. Fixed a crash when loading a Behavior Pack with non-JSON object in entity components, component_groups, and "add"/"remove" events ( MCPE-151377 , MCPE-151380 )
121. Fixed a crash that could occur when attempting to render blocks that rely on biome data
122. Fixed a crash when attempting to access a null entity
123. Fixed a crash in variant related to thrown potions and invalid potion IDs
124. Avoid crashes on certain devices when parsing Molang expressions with many OR or AND operators
125. Volume instances are now stored in the world, persisting between play sessions
126. Limit path strings and localized ID strings in data-driven blocks to 256 characters
127. Limit the length of crafting tag strings in CraftingTableComponent to 64 characters
128. Limit the number of elements in the material_instances field of the BlockMaterialInstancesComponent to 64
129. Limit the number of elements in the conditionsand block_filter fields of the BlockPlacementFieldComponent to 64
130. Updated documentation for originand size fields of the minecraft:block_collision and minecraft:aim_collision components
131. Set stack limit for brewing station result slot to 1, as to avoid getting input stacks being overwritten when the brew is complete
132. Tied consume animation to consume duration
133. Content errors for data-driven blocks improved to log resource pack, file, and block identifier
134. Limit length of the minecraft:geometry field of BlockGeometryComponent to 256 characters
135. Updated documentation for specific string types "Localization String", "Path String", and "Identifier String"
136. The '/spreadplayers' command will now avoid more hazardous locations
137. Reload command will now discover new function and script files
138. When a Command Block clones itself twice with the '/clone' command, the cloned Command Block will now activate on the first try ( MCPE-122188 )
139. Command selectors now correctly identify players by name instead of their name tag
140. Title commands fired before a client was done joining will now show instead of being ignored
141. Added the 'replace entity' overload to the '/loot' command
142. Fixed an issue with teleporting an entity to a chunk that has not been loaded since before 1.18.30 would result in the loss of that entity
143. Enabled the Windows Dedicated Server console to read UTF-16 encoded Unicode input ( BDS-3791 )
144. Entities that use KnockbackRoarGoal can once again properly use entity filters to determine damage
145. Actor properties can now be applied to player entities. Updated network protocol version to support this ( MCPE-129628 )
146. Actors using movement prediction will once again teleport smoothly
147. Added in a check to prevent an actor that is a passenger from being ridden by the vehicle it is on, preventing an infinite loop looking for the root vehicle ( MCPE-133774 )
148. Exposed new data parameter "can_sleep_while_riding" for "minecraft.behavior.sleep". If set to false, the goal will not start if the mob is riding
149. The is_moving filter now returns the correct value when an actor is moving
150. Added a target_block_filters to " behavior.move_to_block " and " is_waterlogged " filter test to prevent mobs from moving to blocks underwater ( MCPE-153783 )
151. Updated fog JSON schema to allow distance fog settings to use negative value as 'fog_start'. Allowing nearby blocks to also be tinted with fog color
152. Added adjustable fog effect that can expand or shrink over time. Users will get the sense of eyes adjusting when going into water
153. Added new data-driven Item component minecraft:chargeable - Allows the item to be charged (like Apples or Bows) when the use action button is held on_complete - Trigger executed when the items use duration has been completed
154. Avoid clearing temp Molang variables during hand rendering
155. Added function rotateVector - Rotates a vector relative to the GameTest structure rotation
156. Removed constraint on maximum travel distance from GameTest structure for SimulatedPlayer.
157. Entity Added function setRotation(degreesX: number, degreesY: number) - Sets the rotation of the Entity Added read-only property rotation: XYRotation - Gets the rotation of the Entity Removed property bodyRotation - Note: Use rotation.y instead
158. Added function setRotation(degreesX: number, degreesY: number) - Sets the rotation of the Entity
159. Added read-only property rotation: XYRotation - Gets the rotation of the Entity
160. Removed property bodyRotation - Note: Use rotation.y instead
161. XYRotation Renamed class PitchYawRotation to XYRotation Renamed property pitch to x Renamed property yaw to y
162. Renamed class PitchYawRotation to XYRotation
163. Renamed property pitch to x
164. Renamed property yaw to y

New events: Added event buttonPushEvent - fires when a button is pushed Added event events.projectileHit - Fires when a projectile hits a Block or Entity Added event events.itemStartUseOn - Sent when the player first interacts with a block Added event events.itemStopUseOn - Sent when fire if the block is successfully interacted with and the block has changed - such as when grass is turned to a path with a Shovel Added event events.itemStartCharge – Sent when the player first starts using a charging/animated item Added event events.itemCompleteCharge - Sent when the item has completed its charge action Added event events.itemReleaseCharge - Sent when the user has finished using the item and released the build action Added event events.itemStopCharge - Sent either when the player has finished an items use cycle or when the player has released the use action with the item ItemStartUseOnEvent Added read only property buildBlockLocation - The result build block position. Useful for determining where a block was placed Added member player?: Player to the LeverActivate event - The player that activated the lever

1.18.31.title: Minecraft - 1.18.31 (Bedrock)
1.18.31.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.18.31 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update is available for Minecraft that addresses some issues that have occurred since the release of 1.18.30.

**Fixes:**
1. Introducing Spectator Mode experimental toggle. Players can now try out an early development version of Spectator Mode For now, we will not be accepting bug reports related to Spectator Mode since its current implementation is very early in development and subject to change
2. For now, we will not be accepting bug reports related to Spectator Mode since its current implementation is very early in development and subject to change
3. Fixed several crashes that could occur during gameplay
4. Fixed an exploit with improperly gaining XP through Furnaces ( MCPE-152227 )
5. Teleporting entities into unloaded chunks no longer deletes them
6. Fixed the screen turning black when reloading RTX worlds ( MCPE-152645 )
7. Fixed textures of distant blocks appearing grainy, warped, and distorted when playing on Android devices ( MCPE-141316 )
8. Fixed flowing water and lava textures not appearing correctly on iOS devices
9. Fixed various framerate hitches, particularly impacting less powerful mobile devices ( MCPE-142934 )
10. Mobs can no longer spawn on Buttons ( MCPE-153897 )
11. Fixed an issue where repeatedly saving and reloading specific chunks would result in delayed chunk loading, performance issues, and game instability ( MCPE-154110 , MCPE-154278 )
12. Fixed an issue that prevented worlds from being opened after updating to version 1.18.30
13. The "Sound of Music" achievement now unlocks when requirements are met
14. Fixed issues with Marketplace not opening on Nintendo Switch ( MCPE-154120 )
15. Fixed an infinite loading screen that could occur when making purchases in Marketplace

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/5842521639693-Minecraft-1-18-31-Bedrock

1.18.30.title: Minecraft - 1.18.30 (Bedrock)
1.18.30.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.18.30 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update is now available for Minecraft, featuring a swath of new improvements:

**Fixes:**
1. An updated Create New World experience will gradually be rolled out to players starting today
2. Worlds can now be created with 64-bit seeds
3. Many changes to improve damage and hunger calculations
4. New Experimental Features to try like the Deep Dark and Warden
5. Too many bug fixes and quality of life improvements to list!
6. We are cleaning up expired Realms that have been collecting dust. Realms that have been canceled for more than 18 months will be deleted. Find out more at aka.ms/expired-realms-update
7. The new Minecraft Bedrock rendering engine, RenderDragon, is now live on Android, iOS, Switch, and Windows 10 UWP x86 builds! Consolidating onto our new graphics engine will allow us to continue investing in future performance and stability improvements, as well as exciting new features for Minecraft!
8. This technical update shouldn't impact gameplay or experience, but if you run into any new issues, please file feedback so the team can investigate
9. Worlds can now be created with 64-bit seeds (-9223372036854775808 to 9223372036854775807). These seeds can be used between Bedrock Edition and Java Edition to produce the same world ( MCPE-144994 , MCPE-148168 )
10. Non-numeric seed UI inputs now produce the same seeds as Java Edition
11. Acacia Trees now grow Leaves on every branch below Y = 0 ( MCPE-151386 )
12. Tweaked hunger depletion rate to better match Java Edition ( MCPE-56031 ) Players can now properly lose hunger when sprinting or swimming Players lose significantly less hunger when jumping Exhaustion rates can now be tweaked in Behavior Packs
13. Players can now properly lose hunger when sprinting or swimming
14. Players lose significantly less hunger when jumping
15. Exhaustion rates can now be tweaked in Behavior Packs
16. Players flying in Creative mode are no longer pushed by liquid current ( MCPE-84592 )
17. Shulkers now have a chance to spawn another Shulker when hit by a Shulker projectile ( MCPE-104826 )
18. When a mob picks up an item, the item can now be seen slightly "pulled" towards the mob right as it picks it up. This matches the behavior of Java Edition
19. Drowned can no longer spawn where the block light level is above 0 ( MCPE-150148 )
20. Bees no longer become angry when Beehives are destroyed by Silk Touch ( MCPE-83550 )
21. Untamed Wolves can now be leashed ( MCPE-82050 )
22. Mobs can no longer spawn on Campfires ( MCPE-152770 )
23. The Ravager now targets and attacks the Wandering Trader ( MCPE-44606 )
24. Mobs spawned from a Dispenser are now persistent ( MCPE-110521 )
25. Falling blocks once again have full-block hitbox
26. Changed block tick rates for Cactus, Chorus Flower, Crops, Grass, Pointed Dripstone, and Saplings to match Java Edition ( MCPE-145612 )
27. Cauldrons now only fill with water and lava by Dripstones that are below water and lava source blocks
28. TNT blocks now correctly move in a random X/Z direction once lit
29. Glow Lichen no longer generates hanging in the air inside Strongholds ( MCPE-123448 )
30. Glow Lichen now correctly checks for the face of the block they are attached to be a full block
31. Glow Lichen can now be attached to Leaves
32. Blocks such as Glow Lichen, Torches, and Redstone can no longer be placed on or attached to Brewing Stands
33. Blocks such as Glow Lichen, Torches, and Redstone can now be placed on or attached to Trapdoors, depending on their state
34. Azaleas and Lily Pads are now broken by flowing water ( MCPE-152040 )
35. The player's arm no longer twitches while charging a bow ( MCPE-148486 )
36. Nether Brick, Iron/Gold Nuggets, Red/Brown Mushroom Blocks, and Chorus Plant/Flower Blocks can no longer be used as fuel in Furnaces ( MCPE-114216 )
37. Water and Lava Buckets can now be used on waterlogged blocks, such as Light Blocks or Big Dripleaves ( MCPE-148392 )
38. Improved accuracy of damage calculations
39. Fixed some issues where damage invulnerability wasn't being applied properly
40. The camera now shakes the same way it does in Java Edition when the player receives damage ( MCPE-118510 )
41. Fixed an issue where the Protection enchantments mitigated too much damage. This has been changed to match Java Edition ( MCPE-113191 )
42. Absorption Hearts no longer stay yellow while under the Wither effect ( MCPE-131852 )
43. Added armor toughness
44. Diamond Armor and Netherite Armor now have a toughness value of 2 and 3 respectively
45. Tweaked armor reduction calculation to account for toughness
46. Netherite Armor will now reduce more damage than Diamond Armor
47. Lowered the amount of knockback resistance granted by Netherite Armor ( MCPE-109408 )
48. Punching deals less damage now, to better match the Java Edition ( MCPE-152713 )
49. Damage is now calculated more accurately by properly calculating and storing partial damage for larger damage
50. Mobs across higher and lower difficulties had their damage adjusted slightly accordingly
51. Mobs with knockback resistance (e.g. Ravager or Zoglin) now receive less knockback when hit by an Iron Golem
52. Armor and protection reduction calculations have been made more accurate
53. Dragon's Breath attack now properly deals damage ( MCPE-94317 )
54. Protection Enchantment now properly works on most damage types ( MCPE-40651 )
55. Landing on a Stalagmite is now properly considered fall damage ( MCPE-151192 )
56. Blaze Fireball will deal knockback on impact ( MCPE-82421 )
57. Blaze fireballs, Fang attack damage, and Shulker bullets now deal consistent damage across all difficulties
58. Small Magma Cubes do slightly more damage, from 2 to 3 on normal
59. Spiders deal slightly less damage, from 3 to 2 on normal ( MCPE-94878 )
60. Baby Zoglins deal slightly less damage, from 1 to 0.5 on normal
61. Baby Hoglins now attack players for 0.5 damage on normal ( MCPE-152577 )
62. Skeleton melee attack does slightly less damage, from 3 to 2 on normal
63. Wolves deal slightly more damage, from 3 to 4 on normal
64. Fixed an issue that was causing entities to not be protected from fire damage by the Fire Resistance effect
65. Fixed a desync issue that could sometimes cause health to regenerate only visually
66. Updated Villager trade tables for Armorer, Cleric, Fisherman, Shepherd, Toolsmith, and Weaponsmith to match Java Edition Fishermen Boat trades now change wood type based on Villager biome type Clerics now offer Glowstone instead of Glowstone Dust Weaponsmith enchanted Iron Sword trade moved to Novice Armorer Diamond trade moved to Journeyman
67. Fishermen Boat trades now change wood type based on Villager biome type
68. Clerics now offer Glowstone instead of Glowstone Dust
69. Weaponsmith enchanted Iron Sword trade moved to Novice
70. Armorer Diamond trade moved to Journeyman
71. Villagers no longer share Seeds and Beetroot Seeds
72. Cartographers now always unlock Woodland Explorer Map trade ( MCPE-152725 )
73. Fixed an error where Journeymen Clerics would offer Glowstone Dust instead of Glowstone Blocks ( MCPE-57524 )
74. Farmer Villagers can now use Bone Meal on crops and can turn excess Seeds into Bone Meal at their Composter ( MCPE-74079 )
75. Dimly lit and eerie, the Deep Dark is sure to strike fear into the hearts of even the bravest players
76. Wander the halls of these long-abandoned structures in the Deep Dark depths to uncover relics long forgotten
77. The horror of the Deep Dark! A creature with no eyes, roughly resembling the Sculk that can be found throughout the Deep Dark, the Warden is an unstoppable force of nature that inhabits this biome
78. A new variety of blocks that can be found in the Deep Dark
79. A new mob effect unique to the Warden and Sculk Shrieker, which will afflict players with the effect when nearby
80. Lowers the gamma down at an equivalent of “Moody” while having this effect
81. Allays will collect all the surrounding items that match the item they are holding
82. Allays will like a player who hands them an item and will bring the items they collect to their liked player
83. Function similarly to Minecart Chests, but in Boats instead, so you can take a journey on the water and carry your things with you
84. Dropped when a Goat with at least one horn rams these blocks: Stone, Packed ice, Iron Ore, Copper Ore, Emerald Ore, or any kind of wood log from the Overworld
85. Attacks with Axes towards a raised Shield will disable the Shield for 5 seconds
86. This update contains early functionality for Spectator Mode – a much-wanted feature we're adding to Minecraft: Bedrock Edition. This will launch after the upcoming 1.19 update has shipped, but we’ll be testing it further in upcoming Betas and Previews. We recommend not relying on this in-development feature, which was not meant to be included in the release. We won't be accepting bug reports related to Spectator Mode until our first iteration is released, as the feature is likely to change during development.
87. Teleporting entities into unloaded chunks removes them from the world. This will be fixed in an upcoming update
88. Players are unable to invert the camera Y-axis when playing with touch controls. This will be fixed in an upcoming update
89. Fixed a crash that could occur during gameplay
90. Fixed a crash that could occur when uploading corrupted worlds to Realms
91. Fixed a crash that could occur upon leaving the Zooming menu in the Dressing Room
92. Fixed a crash that could occur when hovering over the search bar in the crafting menu when playing with a controller
93. Fixed a crash that could occur on Android devices when suspending or resuming the app
94. Fixed a crash that could occur when stopping a Bedrock Dedicated Server ( BDS-16742 )
95. Fixed an issue where the Mending enchantment would not always correctly consume XP Orbs to repair ( MCPE-120119 )
96. Players in Visitor Mode can no longer break Paintings and Minecarts ( MCPE-132869 )
97. Teleporting vertically beyond the visibility distance now loads terrain correctly ( MCPE-150021 )
98. Fixed a bug where the player could switch to gliding when riding in certain scenarios ( MCPE-147904 )
99. Crouch (sneak) state is now reset when player dies to avoid getting stuck in crouch state after respawning
100. The player's position when rejoining a world will remain the same if they quit while in lava ( MCPE-124219 )
101. Players can now fly down through Ladders and other climbable blocks such as Vines in Creative mode without stopping ( MCPE-82480 )
102. Fixed a Furnace exploit where items could be duplicated if the output slot was selected ( MCPE-152411 )
103. Fire that existed before the Fire Tick game rule is enabled will continue to spread again ( MCPE-140396 )
104. Vertical field of view is no longer halved in horizontal split screen, making items such as Book & Quill easier to view when playing in split screen
105. Fixed tick range check excluding chunks that were actually in range
106. Fixed duplicate End Crystals spawning on top of End Spikes ( MCPE-147817 )
107. Improved surrounding terrain for structures such as Villages during world generation ( MCPE-145659 )
108. Fixed underwater lava lakes not turned into Obsidian during world generation ( MCPE-128022 )
109. Villagers no longer avoid Zombified Piglins ( MCPE-94102 )
110. Fixed an issue where Villagers did not hold the item they would trade when presented with Emeralds by the player ( MCPE-150303 )
111. Mobs are now able to path over Azalea blocks ( MCPE-129373 )
112. Mobs are now able to path over Dripleaf blocks and properly pathfind on top of them, when not fully tilted
113. Mobs are now able to path over Pointed Dripstone blocks and properly pathfind on top of them ( MCPE-133270 )
114. Mobs can now move properly on top of solid partial blocks, like Bells, Brewing Stands, and Enchanting Tables
115. Mobs can now jump from high enough solid partial blocks to full ones at a higher position
116. Mobs can now jump over fences if they are standing on an adjacent slab or on another block high enough
117. Mobs can now move through less than half-block tall Top Snow even when the ceiling, if any, is as tall as the mobs themselves ( MCPE-148355 )
118. Fixed a bug in the Glow Squid's texture where the glow map in the alpha channel was incorrect, causing patches of non-glowing texture to be seen ( MCPE-117507 )
119. Fixed an issue where players could not access a Villager's trades while holding a spawn egg ( MCPE-76153 )
120. Fixed an issue where Witches spawned during Village raids could despawn during the raid ( MCPE-149883 )
121. Cod, Salmon, Pufferfish, Tropical Fish, and Dolphins once again spawn in deep variants of ocean biomes ( MCPE-150191 )
122. Fixed Fangs from Evoker spells not being spawnable in blocks with no bounding boxes
123. Changed the spawning logic for Iron Golems and Cats to make it easier for them to spawn in roofed areas, like underground villages ( MCPE-142292 )
124. Fixed an issue where some large mobs in Marketplace maps could get stuck
125. Shulkers no longer like to occupy the same block as another Shulker ( MCPE-43972 )
126. Shulkers now prioritize attaching to neighboring block faces before trying to teleport away
127. Shulkers now stay attached to the current attached blockface if it is valid, instead of switching to upright position
128. Fixed a lighting bug where light level 1 incorrectly dropped to 0 when placing blocks in light level 1 with multiple light sources ( MCPE-151266 )
129. TNT no longer disappears when ignited with the 'TNT Explodes' game rule disabled and the 'Fire Spreads' game rule enabled ( MCPE-82485 )
130. Gravity affected blocks now fall on Top Snow when placed above it instead of hovering over it ( MCPE-151407 )
131. Fixed an issue with resource drops occasionally remaining black after breaking and placing a block quickly in its place
132. Top Snow no longer clips with the block beneath when falling
133. Fixed an issue where interacting with the Bell while holding a chargeable item would not continuously ring it ( MCPE-56968 )
134. Fixed an issue where projectiles would 'bounce' off of Bells in strange ways ( MCPE-47847 )
135. Removed water from the extra-block when placing an Amethyst cluster ( MCPE-148394 )
136. Scaffolding can no longer be placed without support on y=0 ( MCPE-150765 )
137. Observers placed facing Double Chests no longer send out a Redstone pulse when reloading/re-entering a chunk
138. Save Structure Blocks now correctly detect Corner Structure Blocks at negative Y levels ( MCPE-151511 )
139. Breaking a layer of snow placed in the same block as a flower no longer destroys the flower ( MCPE-151512 )
140. Custom armor can now be equipped with the "Use" button when different armor is already equipped ( MCPE-125323 )
141. Fixed an issue that caused some emotes to have unintended rotations when near the end of their animation ( MCPE-134328 )
142. Fixed a case where ray tracing resources would be destroyed prematurely on level exit from an RTX-enabled world
143. Fixed the stage 3 carrot texture not showing up in-game, due to an incorrect filename ( MCPE-152175 )
144. Fixed a bug where the Shield blocking animation stopped playing smoothly after blocking once ( MCPE-149838 )
145. Fixed the crosshair disappearing when Outline Selection for blocks is disabled
146. Players that are on fire now render fire in front of the player on the inventory screen regardless of in-game camera perspective ( MCPE-147777 )
147. Fixed a highlight effect on Leather Armor appearing on paper dolls when using higher anti-aliasing ( MCPE-75321 )
148. Added an option in Video Settings to toggle anti-aliasing on the Nintendo Switch ( MCPE-123352 )
149. Fixed the loading screen when suspending and resuming the game while playing split-screen on Nintendo Switch
150. Increased line spacing on the "Realms Plus subscription has expired" screen
151. Chat changes: Control + Backspace will now erase the whole word before the caret Control + Delete will now erase the whole word after the caret Control + Left Arrow will now move the caret to the beginning of the word before the caret Control + Right Arrow will now move the caret to the beginning of the next word after the caret
152. Control + Backspace will now erase the whole word before the caret
153. Control + Delete will now erase the whole word after the caret
154. Control + Left Arrow will now move the caret to the beginning of the word before the caret
155. Control + Right Arrow will now move the caret to the beginning of the next word after the caret
156. When first opening the inventory screen in Pocket UI, we now default to the "Craftable" tab on the left-hand side, and the crafting grid on the right-hand side
157. Removed the question mark button on the Pocket UI inventory screen
158. Accessing the recipe book from the Inventory screen now only shows items that can be crafted from that screen's 2x2 crafting grid
159. Players can now use auto-move to equip or unequip armor in Crafting Table's menu while in Pocket UI ( MCPE-148970 )
160. Updated generic controller face button icons on mobile devices
161. Fixed a bug where the label above the inventory screen crafting grid in Pocket UI would get truncated in some languages
162. Fixed an issue in Pocket UI where items could be dropped unintentionally in blocks with custom UIs, and resized those screens to allow for dropping items on the sides instead
163. Improved contrast on multiple UI elements
164. Fixed an issue with the screen reader looping on the Play screen when you had a Realms invite
165. Download popup no longer flickers when closed
166. Added warning popup on Marketplace pages when attempting to equip skin pack skin while character creator item is equipped
167. Fixed issue where info and buttons did not appear for downloaded skin packs ( MCPE-152216 )
168. Updated Add-On templates for 1.18.30 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation, are available to download at aka.ms/MCAddonPacks
169. With the release of RenderDragon for Android, iOS, Nintendo Switch, and Win10 UWP x86, HAL will no longer be available on these platforms. We know the community has found ways to build shaders on top of HAL and with this change, these shaders will no longer function. We understand that this is a valuable feature for players and the creator community, and we are working on how we may be able to deliver this sort of creative capability to players and creators in an officially supported way. While we have nothing to share right now, look out for more details in the future.
170. Important! In this release, we are removing the Additional Modding Capabilities experiment. This experiment contained experimental JavaScript APIs launched in 2018 – and with this removal, JavaScript within worlds associated with this API will no longer function. GameTest Framework – a separate JavaScript API – should not be impacted, nor should behavior pack/resource pack type add-ons more broadly.
171. You can read more about this via this article .
172. A world with "StorageVersion" 8 or lower will be increased to 9 and have its "RandomSeed" upgraded from using only the lower 32 bits of a 64-bit number to using the full 64-bit range while still representing the same number. This is only relevant for negative 32-bit seeds, which need a sign bit extension
173. The world loading screen now shows progress when loading ticking areas marked for preload
174. Experimental: Volume definitions are now stored and read from Behavior Packs instead of being part of the level directory
175. Experimental: Added an optional "mob_amount" parameter to the Damage Event Response that specifies a unique damage amount when used by mobs
176. Due to engine limitations, "minecraft:geometry" data used for blocks with the Holiday Creator Features experimental toggle are now restricted to only allow geometry in the [0,0,0] to [15,15,15] space. Any blocks loaded from Behavior Packs that exceed this limit will render as the info_update block and show a content error in the log
177. The Interact component now has two new fields, GiveItem and TakeItem, specifying if it is possible to give/take items from an entities main hand slot. Taking the item also drops the inventory of the mob
178. Removed preventsjumping component from data-driven blocks
179. Removed BlockImmovable , BlockBreakOnPush , and BlockOnlyPistonPush components from data-driven blocks
180. Limited the number of elements in the crafting_tags field of CraftingTableComponent to 64
181. Biome-specific fog settings can once again be defined
182. Fixed actor definition identifiers not being recognized if the item or block name contains "."
183. Mobs that are riding a boat, for example, can no longer use JumpToBlockGoal ( MCPE-150750 )
184. Custom mobs with a format version lower than 1.18.20 and using the minecraft:behavior.knockback_roar component will parse like before if it contains an extra field that the engine didn't expect
185. Fixed an issue in the Knockback goal where the incorrect owner was being passed into the filter evaluate function
186. Weapon events are now correctly applied when the weapons are used by mobs ( MCPE-118692 )
187. JumpToBlock behavior is now correctly affected by JumpBoost mob effect ( MCPE-137432 )
188. Fixed a case where experimental BlockCollisionComponents did not allow partial specification
189. Rotation when riding a mob that has a locked rotation will no longer unexpectedly snap to one side when that mob is rotating
190. Fixed an issue that would cause commands to affect players in all dimensions ( MCPE-152218 )
191. Added the "hasitem" filter for target selector of entities. This allows the player to target entities based on the items that have in their inventory or are wearing
192. Added '/tickingarea' command preload overload
193. The '/tickingarea' command no longer modifies areas from entities with the tick_world component
194. Entities must now be loaded for an area to be considered fully loaded and ticking
195. Added a new '/volumearea ' command to create, remove, and list volumes in the world
196. Using '/playanimation' command now properly plays animations on the paper doll and inventory character ( MCPE-137353 )
197. Correct error output is now displayed when attempting to use the '/loot' spawn command when passing in the position of an unloaded area and there is 0 loot to drop
198. Added '/loot ' command insert loot and insert kill overload
199. Exposed new data parameter "calculate_new_path_radius" for GoHomeGoal. This is for specifying a distance in blocks that the mob is considered close enough to the end of the current path. A new path will then be calculated to continue toward home
200. Added Knockback Height Cap value to KnockbackRoarGoal
201. JSON format for events sent from websocket server and Code Builder APIs updated to hierarchical JSON format instead of flat format
202. Less useful properties removed with block and item IDs moved to newer name-based format instead of numerical format
203. Agent-based commands in websockets moved to new "action:agent" format, and all commands are now queued and include unique ids to correlate responses
204. Any future breaking changes to websocket and Code Builder APIs will now result in the "protocolVersion" being incremented
205. Molang expressions inside animation scripts for actor resource definition (pre_animation and initialize) that contain capital letters are properly evaluated now with format_version 1.18.20 or higher
206. Clarified documentation for query.is_item_name_any that the slot index is required when there is more than one slot, i.e. the hotbar
207. Fixed Logical AND to evaluate before Logical OR, and for comparison operators to evaluate before equality operators This is a Molang Versioned Change that only takes effect for Molang expressions in packs that use a min_engine_version of 1.18.20 or higher For example, A && B || C now evaluates as (A && B) || C and A < B == C > D now evaluates as (A < B) == (C > D)
208. This is a Molang Versioned Change that only takes effect for Molang expressions in packs that use a min_engine_version of 1.18.20 or higher
209. For example, A && B || C now evaluates as (A && B) || C and A < B == C > D now evaluates as (A < B) == (C > D)
210. Added ActionFormData/ModalFormData/MessageFormData types in the mojang-minecraft-ui namespace. Documentation is available on the Minecraft Creator documentation site .
211. Removed 'Minecraft' and 'GameTest' imports; please use 'mojang-minecraft' and 'mojang-gametest'

1.18.12.title: Minecraft - 1.18.12 (Bedrock)
1.18.12.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.18.12 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update is available for Minecraft: Bedrock Edition that addresses some issues that have occurred since the release of 1.18.10.

**Fixes:**
1. Improved the smoothness of player movement ( MCPE-152176 )
2. The pause menu's "Invite to Game" button is now always enabled on Realms
3. Fixed issue where ratings count and offer tiles were not visible in the Marketplace
4. Fixed an issue with experience being granted when moving items from the hotbar in the furnace UI screens ( MCPE-152227 )
5. Fixed a crash that could occur when launching the game on PlayStation while connected with Remote Play ( MCPE-143803 )
6. Fixed a bug where animation timeline events at 0.0 would sometimes not run in looping animations

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/4432393403149-Minecraft-1-18-12-Bedrock

1.18.10.title: Minecraft - 1.18.10 (Bedrock)
1.18.10.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.18.10 (Bedrock)**__
> It’s time for a new Minecraft game update! This time around, we’re bringing a boat load of fixes and quality of life changes. With well over 100 fixes, there’s a lot to cover. Let’s dive into the highlights!

**Fixes:**
1. Added Globe Banner Pattern
2. Iron Golems now show different degrees of cracking depending on their health
3. Updated several more textures to match Java Edition
4. New experimental features with Frogs and Tadpoles
5. A huge amount of bug fixes and parity changes
6. World settings can now be changed directly on Realms, just like local worlds
7. If you’re playing in South Korea, we added gameplay timers and notices in compliance with gaming laws to help remind players to take occasional breaks from gameplay
8. Added the Globe Banner Pattern on Bedrock
9. Raid boss bar says now displays "Raid - Victory" and Fireworks are launched from the ground after a raid is defeated ( MCPE-51267 )
10. Villagers now make a "No" sound when attempting to make a trade that they are out of stock
11. Players no longer gain a particle effect when obtaining Bad Omen from Pillager Captains
12. Iron Golems now show different degrees of cracking depending on their health. Iron Ingots can be used on damaged Iron Golems to repair them ( MCPE-74081 )
13. Removed the emerald icon above a Villager's head when trading
14. Iron Golems now only attack players that have very bad standing in a village after attacking a Villager
15. Glow Lichen now has similar brightness as Java Edition
16. Foxes now aim downwards when they pounce ( MCPE-143664 )
17. Updated trade tables for Butchers, Cartographers, Librarians, and Wandering Traders
18. Biome decoration features in cave biomes now have similar frequency as Java Edition
19. Adjusted the "otherside" music disc to give off a redstone signal of 14 to match Java Edition ( MCPE-145751 )
20. Adjusted the "Pigstep" music disc to give off a redstone signal of 13 to match Java Edition ( MCPE-74030 )
21. Updated textures for multiple blocks and items to remove bugs and achieve parity between Bedrock and Java Edition ( MCPE-127539 ) Lodestone Compass Oak Door, Dark Oak Door, Birch Door, Spruce Door, Acacia Door, and Jungle Door Oak Sign, Dark Oak Sign, Birch Sign, Spruce Sign, Acacia Sign, Jungle Sign, Warped Sign, and Crimson Sign Campfire and Soul Campfire Item Frame and Glow Item Frame Glow Berry Vines Comparator (On) Wither
22. Lodestone Compass
23. Oak Door, Dark Oak Door, Birch Door, Spruce Door, Acacia Door, and Jungle Door
24. Oak Sign, Dark Oak Sign, Birch Sign, Spruce Sign, Acacia Sign, Jungle Sign, Warped Sign, and Crimson Sign
25. Campfire and Soul Campfire
26. Item Frame and Glow Item Frame
27. Glow Berry Vines
28. Comparator (On)
29. Wither
30. Additional texture updates Updated Glass Pane top to match the new texture on Java Edition ( MCPE-148572 ) Fixed the top texture of Dark Oak Logs ( MCPE-148577 ) Updated Stripped Dark Oak side texture to match the new texture on Java Edition ( MCPE-148576 ) Updated Dirt Path side texture ( MCPE-148568 ) Changed 'door_oak' texture filename back to 'door_wood' ( MCPE-148502 ) Reversed Parrot head and wing bottom textures ( MCPE-148573 ) Moved Beetroot and Melon Seed textures 1 pixel row down to match Java Edition ( MCPE-148561 ) Removed unused pixels in Cocoa Beans stage 0 and stage 1 textures to match Java Edition Updated Smooth Stone texture in Armor Stand base ( MCPE-148565 ) Removed horizontal lines in Oak and Iron upper Door textures ( MCPE-148566 ) Removed hood in Witch, Evoker, and Vindicator textures to match Java Edition Changed alpha values of Red and Blue Stained Glass textures to match Java Edition (Vanilla Parity) Fixed the hammer icon's color palette on the Anvil screen ( MCPE-148575 ) Updated Dark Oak Planks on the Cartography table textures ( MCPE-148562 ) Updated Spruce Planks on the Barrel bottom texture Updated Planks on the Lectern base texture ( MCPE-148567 ) Fixed highlight inconsistencies in Gold and Diamond Armor textures ( MCPE-148591 ) Removed wandering pixel in the Carrot stage 3 texture ( MCPE-148563 ) Centered the back texture of Axolotls ( MCPE-148571 ) Boat oars now have the same color as the Boat ( MCPE-150492 )

50. Boat oars now have the same color as the Boat ( MCPE-150492 )
51. Frogs will spawn in Swamp biomes
52. Frogs can croak, jump, swim, and walk on land

54. Frogs can be tempted and bred using Seagrass, but this is just a placeholder food for now

56. Frog eggs that hatch spawn Tadpoles
57. Tadpoles that grow up will turn into a Frog
58. Tadpoles can swim in water
59. Tadpoles "jump around" like fishes when on land, and eventually die
60. Tadpoles grow into a different type of Frog based on the biome they are born in
61. Tadpoles can be caught in a Bucket
62. Three new Froglight blocks have been added (Pearlescent, Verdant, and Ochre)
63. The Froglight blocks emit light
64. The blocks are obtained by luring a Frog close to a small Magma Cube. The Frog will eat the Magma Cube and a Froglight block will drop. Each Frog variant will cause a different Froglight block to drop
65. Sculk block features are now accessible by enabling this toggle
66. Fixed an issue that could cause entities in a chunk to not save when exiting a world ( MCPE-144208 )
67. The game now loads certain seeds and worlds around Mesa biomes without crashing ( MCPE-149659 )
68. Fixed a crash that could occur when trading Maps with Cartographer Villagers ( MCPE-142388 )
69. Fixed a crash that could occur when shift-clicking Armor in the Crafting Table while using Pocket UI ( MCPE-144863 )
70. Fixed issue where breaking blocks, opening chests, and entering portals would be delayed/not work when there are lots of mobs nearby ( MCPE-149214 )
71. Optimized the placement of geode features in the world
72. Reduced the amount of network packets sent with the subchunk request system and packet optimizations
73. Boats no longer disappear when getting out of them after a long ride ( MCPE-108568 )

77. Players can no longer be hurt by their own armor enchantments such as Thorns

81. Pointed Dripstone clusters no longer have a chance of spawning only stalagmites of height one ( MCPE-148588 )
82. Pointed Dripstone now sometimes generate on large stalactites and stalagmites ( MCPE-128128 )
83. Lava pools now only generate in positive Y coordinates ( MCPE-146459 ) Lava pools that generate close to Y=0 will have Deepslate and Stone blocks casing
84. Lava pools that generate close to Y=0 will have Deepslate and Stone blocks casing
85. Coral now generates in the deeper depths of Warm Oceans ( MCPE-147399 )
86. The Grove biome now has more variety of Spruce Trees ( MCPE-148361 )
87. Fixed Mesa and Frozen Ocean biomes having inconsistent generation on Realms
88. The Bedrock layer in old world chunks is now replaced with Deepslate between y=0 and y=8 ( MCPE-147373 )
89. Copper Ore can now generate in Deepslate variant in Dripstone Caves ( MCPE-144800 )

91. Chests and Monster Spawners once again generate correctly in structures ( MCPE-23416 , MCPE-48622 , MCPE-97295 )
92. The bottoms of hoodoos in Eroded Badlands biomes no longer make flat ceilings in caves underneath ( MCPE-146984 )
93. Lily Pads no longer generate in aquifers under Swamp biomes ( MCPE-125913 )
94. Fossils can now be generate below Y=0, with Deepslate Diamond Ore Blocks instead of Coal Ore Blocks ( MCPE-144065 )
95. Fossils will no longer generate floating in caves or water

97. Iceberg features no longer replace Snow Blocks of Igloo structures ( MCPE-147690 )

99. Aquifers no longer generate with missing water blocks ( MCPE-146452 )
100. Villagers, Rabbits, and Foxes spawned in the Frozen and Jagged Peaks biomes now spawn as their respective snowy variants ( MCPE-119561 )
101. Goats now spawn in the Jagged Peaks and Frozen Peaks biomes ( MCPE-146886 )
102. Axolotl walk animations are now affected by speed ( MCPE-131322 )

105. When using the Education Edition toggle, Axolotls, Bees, Boats, Cats, Dolphins, Glow Squids, Goats, Hoglins, Iron Golems, Ocelots, Pandas, Parrots, Pigs, Polar Bears, Squids, Striders, Wolves, and Zoglins can now have Balloons attached to them. Wow, that’s a lot of mobs!
106. Skeleton Horsemen now pathfind correctly ( MCPE-147521 )

140. Food once again applies status effects when eaten

157. Fixed player camera perspective not being respected when changing from Immersive Mode to Living Room Mode in PS VR

1.18.2.title: Minecraft - 1.18.2 (Bedrock)
1.18.2.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.18.2 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update is now available for Minecraft that addresses some issues found since the release of Caves & Cliffs: Part II.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed an issue that affected some large world saves on PlayStation, resulting in corrupted textures and loss of data, in some cases ( MCPE-149193 )
2. Interacting with certain containers will once again properly open the inventory screen ( MCPE-148531 )
3. Fixed issue where breaking blocks, opening chests, and entering portals would be delayed/not work when there are lots of mobs nearby ( MCPE-149214 )
4. Fixed some worlds not correctly replacing Bedrock blocks with Deepslate blocks after upgrading to 1.18 ( MCPE-149251 )

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/4416080068109-Minecraft-1-18-2-Bedrock

1.18.1.title: Minecraft - 1.18.1 (Bedrock)
1.18.1.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.18.1 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update is now available for Minecraft that addresses some issues found since the release of Caves & Cliffs: Part II.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed a crash that could occur when copying a world backup in certain languages on PlayStation
2. Fixed a crash that could occur when chatting and playing on Realms
3. Decreased the amount of Diamond Ore that generates to match Java Edition
4. Fixed lighting bugs when removing light sources after returning to the Overworld from other dimensions ( MCPE-145828 )
5. Players no longer have problems moving after respawning or getting out of a Bed
6. Added a warning prompt explaining potential loss of data when setting File Storage Location to External on Android devices
7. Fixed various crashes and storage-related issues with Android multi-user functionality and Amazon Kids/Freetime ( MCPE-106524 , MCPE-107503 , MCPE-37685 )
8. Fixed simulation stopping in multiplayer sessions when other players move away from one player’s render distance ( MCPE-147391 )
9. The teleport command will no longer succeed when 'checkForBlocks' is true and the destination is obstructed
10. Fixed an issue that could cause a faulty purchase page for Realms when the maximum number of Realms are already owned
11. Optimized the Marketplace Inventory screen and improved loading of content images

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/4415394258317-Minecraft-1-18-1-Bedrock

1.18.0.title: Minecraft - Caves & Cliffs: Part II - 1.18.0 (Bedrock)
1.18.0.md:
__**Minecraft - Caves & Cliffs: Part II - 1.18.0 (Bedrock)**__
> The day has arrived and Minecraft Caves & Cliffs: Part II has officially released to the world! It is, indeed, a very special day when we all get to boot up our devices and see a new update ready to download and play. It represents years of hard work from both our team of developers, as well as the community's continued passion for creating endless worlds in Minecraft. The update is available on all Bedrock platforms right now and we can't wait for you to jump in and experience one of the biggest updates in Minecraft's history. Here's a bit of what to expect when you load into the game today:

**Fixes:**
1. Increased the world height and depth, adding 50% more vertical space to build and explore
2. New cave generation to explore below your existing worlds
3. New cave and mountain biomes like Lush Caves and Jagged Peaks
4. Drastically updated and improved biome, cave, and ore generation
5. Added several new music tracks to enjoy during gameplay
6. Fixed over 70 bugs, issues, and parity changes
7. Overworld height and depth for new and existing worlds has been extended to y320 and y-64, opening up more space to explore and build in
8. Players can now update existing worlds to include the new overworld height dimensions and world generation features. See our World Upgrading FAQ for more details
9. The bedrock layer at y0 below saved chunks will be replaced with Deepslate and feature new cave generation underneath
10. Biomes and terrain generating across new and existing chunk borders will blend seamlessly, creating natural-looking environmental transitions
11. Terrain shape and elevation is no longer always determined by biome, resulting in new biome placements such as deserts on top of hills
12. Mountains are taller than ever and can now generate up to a maximum height of 256 blocks
13. Added 3D biomes - cave biomes can now generate directly below surface biomes
14. New cave and mountain biomes added, including Jagged Peaks, Meadows, Lush Caves and Dripstone Caves
15. Added noise caves - the three primary types of noise caves are large, open Cheese Caves, wide, tunnelling Spaghetti Caves and the narrow, winding Noodle Caves
16. Added aquifers - these create local level bodies of water such as flooded caves or underground lakes
17. Added large ore veins - these long formations stretch through cave systems and contain larger deposits of ore than the clusters usually found underground
18. Ore distribution has been adjusted to compensate for the new world height
19. Monsters will now only spawn in complete darkness. Players can spawn-proof dark areas such as caves using light sources
20. Added new music by Lena Raine and Kumi Tanioka
21. Added a new music disc from Lena Raine titled "otherside". This can be found rarely in Stronghold corridor chests or much more rarely in Dungeon chests
22. Mobile players: To hear the new music, you will need to download the updated Minecraft Original Music Pack, available FREE from Marketplace
23. Caves & Cliffs - Free fall from the top of the world (build limit) to the bottom of the world and survive
24. Feels Like Home - Take a Strider for a loooong ride on a lava lake in the Overworld
25. Sound of Music - Make the Meadows come alive with the sound of music from a jukebox
26. Star trader - Trade with a villager at the build height limit
27. Added new "Vanilla Experiments" experimental toggle containing some blocks and items from The Wild Update, coming in 2022 Goat Horn Sculk Sculk Vein Sculk Catalyst Sculk Shrieker Sculk Sensor
28. Goat Horn
29. Sculk
30. Sculk Vein
31. Sculk Catalyst
32. Sculk Shrieker
33. Sculk Sensor
34. Be sure to backup your worlds before enabling experimental toggles and see our updated FAQ on how to enable Experiments
35. Removed "Old" world type from the world creation screen
36. Locked Old worlds to BaseGameVersion 1.17.40
37. Existing Old worlds are still playable but will not be updated with 1.18 features
38. For more information on Old world changes, please see the FAQ article
39. Added a new main menu panorama showing the beautiful cliffs of the Overworld
40. Players with external storage will be migrated to new location at start up, due to storage changes required by Google. You can still play if migration fails by closing the results window
41. With external storage being migrated to its new location in preparation for Google's new API requirements, you will now lose your data if you uninstall Minecraft, unless you check the box indicating you want to keep your data. We recommend checking this box if you wish to keep your worlds in the event you choose to reinstall Minecraft
42. For more information on storage changes, please see the FAQ article
43. New world generation in this release is currently incompatible with the 'Creation of Custom Biomes' experimental toggle. Expect worlds with custom biome generation to be potentially unstable and for custom biomes to only exist in currently saved out areas of the world.
44. World generation for the Minecraft Overworld has changed entirely with this release. This means old seeds will no longer spawn players in the same positions when playing 1.18. If creators are version locked to an old version of the game, their seeds will generate worlds as they were prior to 1.18.
45. Fixed several crashes that could occur during gameplay
46. Fixed a crash that could occur when loading certain world chunks ( MCPE-138139 )
47. Fixed a crash that could occur when going through portals with tamed pets ( MCPE-129738 )
48. Optimized the time it takes to place Vines in the Overworld during world generation
49. Replaced the missing "Always Day" option in world settings ( MCPE-137790 )
50. Players with higher than recommended render distance settings are now prompted to change it to the recommended value
51. Render distance default and max settings have been updated for better performance, including improvements to the slider in video settings
52. A prompt now warns players that they will be taken back to the main menu if they sign-in while in-game
53. Increased Realm upload and download timeouts to 15 minutes
54. Corrected Portal locations when the Portal was moved but the location was not updated ( MCPE-28765 )
55. Hero of the Village effect now applies to all players who helped kill a raider once a raid is defeated, and the effect remains on the players, even if they travel outside the village ( MCPE-53384 )
56. Fixed an issue where terrain could be seen through
57. Fixed player hitbox not resetting after gliding with Elytra ( MCPE-109925 )
58. Fixed player flight with Elytra being cancelled when hitting a wall and taking damage ( MCPE-54031 )
59. Mobs can now path over Trapdoors
60. Fixed issues with mobs and entities disappearing from chunks ( MCPE-144208 )
61. Mobs no longer walk through Campfires ( MCPE-142054 )
62. Axolotls now animate correctly when airborne ( MCPE-131322 )
63. Sweet Berry Bushes now damage mobs, with the exception of Foxes ( MCPE-56142 , MCPE-140012 )
64. Mobs no longer try to path through Sweet Berry Bushes
65. The riding position of Llamas no longer shifts after being tamed ( MCPE-143006 )
66. Raid mobs now despawn after a raid ends, if the player moves too far away
67. Vindicators no longer naturally spawn in Illager Patrols
68. Lightning bolts no longer have shadows ( MCPE-140689 )
69. Fish now attempt to avoid Axolotls
70. Magma Cubes are now correctly aggressive towards Iron Golems and Slimes are no longer aggressive towards Snow Golems ( MCPE-51162 )
71. Phantoms should now be able to free themselves after getting stuck when trying to pathfind into mountains ( MCPE-119773 )
72. Villagers will keep following their schedules in worlds that have been ticking for a very long time, and when game time is negative ( MCPE-98361 )
73. Education Edition: NPCs no longer have idle sounds ( MCPE-141856 )
74. Breaking a block below fire no longer creates an invisible fire block when the 'doFireTick' gamerule is disabled ( MCPE-101371 )
75. Players can once again continuously place water, lava, and Powder Snow by holding down the 'Place' button ( MCPE-139671 )
76. Light blocks no longer support blocks that need support, e.g. Beds and Paintings ( MCPE-144311 )
77. Light blocks will now survive a TNT or Creeper explosion
78. All ground vegetation can now be placed on Mycelium ( MCPE-125928 )
79. Fixed shallow water turning brighter when aimed at while holding a Small Drip Leaf ( MCPE-123373 )
80. Tall flowers will now drop only one item when broken by water placed in the upper half of the flower ( MCPE-142799 )
81. Campfires no longer drop only one Charcoal when broken by a Piston or an explosion, instead dropping two units as expected ( MCPE-139467 )
82. In the Stonecutter, a Block of Copper can now be crafted into four Cut Copper ( MCPE-144067 )
83. Copper Ore now drops 2-5 (from 2-3) Raw Copper items ( MCPE-144071 )
84. Nether Sprouts can once again generate when using Bone Meal on Warped Nylium ( MCPE-139672 )
85. Snow Grass Block and all types of Snow blocks now use similar colors ( MCPE-57022 )
86. Fixed Leaf Blocks not remaining transparent when surrounded by partial blocks such as Buttons or Slabs ( MCPE-139213 , MCPE-53731 )
87. Fixed face culling of blocks placed below Leaf blocks, fixing an x-ray effect
88. Adjusted the smoothness of movement for Primed TNT, Lingering Potions, Splash Potions, and Bottle o' Enchanting when far from players ( MCPE-101102 )
89. Fire Charges are no longer consumed when used on lit Candles, Candle Cakes, Campfires, activated Nether Portals, or on other blocks that are already on fire
90. Multiple Education Edition items no longer show the "craftingScreen.tab.none" tooltip ( MCPE-102444 )
91. Ender Pearls can no longer generate as Glow Sticks in Woodland Mansion chests ( MCPE-137440 )
92. Added missing screen reader on the "Controller lost connection" prompt
93. The Carved Pumpkin enchantment glint now only covers the item instead of the entire slot
94. Fixed a bug that could occur on older worlds where looking up in a Minecart would display the inside of the Minecart, blocking the player's view
95. Updated item rendering so enchanted are no longer be invisible in the Nether ( MCPE-116880 )
96. Fixed a visual glitch where taking a plant from a Flower Pot would result in the plant still being rendered ( MCPE-143661 )
97. Water drips now trigger splash effects
98. Shield blocking animation now plays smoothly ( MCPE-125951 )
99. Fixed Java Edition parity while lying in bed in multiplayer game. A message will now show how many players are lying in bed while waiting for all players to fall asleep
100. Updated the "out of storage" message with additional clarity when a device is out of storage for saving new worlds
101. The raid boss bar color has changed from purple to red, matching Java Edition ( MCPE-46047 )
102. Raid boss bars now decrease whenever a raider takes damage
103. Structure Blocks can now be saved and loaded properly within current dimension height limits ( MCPE-122643 )
104. All setting changes made to a new world are carried over when creating it on a new Realm
105. Renamed some occurrences of "level" in the user interface to the more accurate "world"
106. The store update prompt no longer appears for no internet connection or session start failure
107. Improved the error messaging in the Play screen when Microsoft Account permissions are set to block multiplayer
108. Fixed an issue where searching for non-existent content brought up the incorrect "1 result" message
109. Fixed overlapping text on Marketplace offerings occurring on 4:3 resolution screens
110. Fixed the rendering of the icons in text, making the colors not appear distorted
111. Updated Add-On templates for 1.18.0 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation, are available to download at aka.ms/MCAddOnPacks
112. Players are disconnected if server and client have different Runtime Block IDs
113. Fixed a rendering error that could occur when attempting to render a Vanilla mob in a base game version prior to the version that mob was introduced through JSON files
114. Most content errors and warnings will now only display once per world ( MCPE-135153 )
115. Improved performance in 'RangedAttackGoal' for mobs that do not move
116. Fixed mobs' default summonability when not specified in JSON
117. Fixed a versioning error with animation controllers that was causing the wrong schema to be utilized on Marketplace worlds with an animation controller version 1.8.0
118. The '/clone' command has been updated to properly check for overlapping source and destinations areas no longer allowing for a 1 block depth overlap on each axis. This can continue to be overridden via the force clone option
119. New Item API updates: ItemStack Exposed interfaces for accessing script-enabled ItemComponents on ItemStack. Note that these item components only work in conjunction with custom items defined via the Holiday Creator Features experiment hasComponent(componentId: string) - returns true if the ItemStack has the component [componentId] attached to it getComponent(componentId: string) - returns a handle to the component attached to this ItemStack. Returns an undefined handle if the component does not exist or if the component is yet to be exposed to script getComponents() - returns an array of all attached script-enabled components on this ItemStack
120. Exposed interfaces for accessing script-enabled ItemComponents on ItemStack. Note that these item components only work in conjunction with custom items defined via the Holiday Creator Features experiment
121. hasComponent(componentId: string) - returns true if the ItemStack has the component [componentId] attached to it
122. getComponent(componentId: string) - returns a handle to the component attached to this ItemStack. Returns an undefined handle if the component does not exist or if the component is yet to be exposed to script
123. getComponents() - returns an array of all attached script-enabled components on this ItemStack
124. Script Enabled Item Components minecraft:food Read-only property nutrition - number that describes how much nutrition this food item gives the player when eaten Read-only property saturationModifier - number that is the saturation modifier used to apply the saturation buff when eaten Read-only property canAlwaysEat - if true the player can always eat this item (even when not hungry) Read-only property usingConvertsTo - string name of the Item this will be converted to when eaten. If empty, the item will not convert to anything else minecraft:durability Read-only property maxDurability - the number amount of damage this item can take before breaking Read-only property damageRange - a NumberRange describing the chance of the item losing durability Property damage - gets or sets the current damage on the ItemStack getDamageChance(unbreaking: number = 0) - gets the maximum chance that this item would be damaged using the damageRange property if given an unbreaking level. Incoming unbreaking parameter must be greater than 0
125. minecraft:food Read-only property nutrition - number that describes how much nutrition this food item gives the player when eaten Read-only property saturationModifier - number that is the saturation modifier used to apply the saturation buff when eaten Read-only property canAlwaysEat - if true the player can always eat this item (even when not hungry) Read-only property usingConvertsTo - string name of the Item this will be converted to when eaten. If empty, the item will not convert to anything else

130. minecraft:durability Read-only property maxDurability - the number amount of damage this item can take before breaking Read-only property damageRange - a NumberRange describing the chance of the item losing durability Property damage - gets or sets the current damage on the ItemStack
131. Read-only property maxDurability - the number amount of damage this item can take before breaking

134. getDamageChance(unbreaking: number = 0) - gets the maximum chance that this item would be damaged using the damageRange property if given an unbreaking level. Incoming unbreaking parameter must be greater than 0
135. Added deltaTime read only property to TickEvent which represents the time between the last Level tick in seconds
136. Fixed content error when Molang expression has no tokens to only fire when 'min_engine_version' is 1.17.40 or higher

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/4414284658701-Minecraft-Caves-Cliffs-Part-II-1-18-0-Bedrock
