1.17.11.title: Minecraft - 1.17.11 (Bedrock)
1.17.11.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.17.11 (Bedrock)**__
> Please search for any bugs you find onbugs.mojang.comand let us know what you think atfeedback.minecraft.net.

**Fixes:**
1. Players no longer die and instantly respawn after traveling back to Overworld from the End in certain circumstances ( MCPE-135226 )
2. Players no longer die and get stuck on the respawn screen when entering an End Portal after dying in the End in certain seeds ( MCPE-132484 )
3. Fixed a crash that could occur on Xbox when suspending and resuming the title for the second time
4. Items can no longer be duplicated using Beacons
5. Horses no longer become invisible after being dismounted ( MCPE-108568 )
6. On Realms, the '/msg' command once again works when the world is in Survival mode and cheats are disabled ( REALMS-7760 )
7. After renewing an expired Realm, the Realm is now properly renewed instead of a new Realm being created ( REALMS-7263 )

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/4406729569933-Minecraft-1-17-11-Bedrock

1.17.10.title: Minecraft - 1.17.10 (Bedrock)
1.17.10.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.17.10 (Bedrock)**__
> Welcome to the Minecraft 1.17.10 update! The team has been working hard on gameplay improvements since the release Caves & Cliffs: Part I. We have also introduced some fun new additions, as well as some Caves & Cliffs: Part II features as part of Experimental Gameplay.

**Fixes:**
1. Candles are now available in the game!
2. Can be placed in clusters up to four and lit using Flint & Steel
3. Put a Candle on a Cake and make a wish!
4. Candles can be crafted using a Honeycomb and String
5. Combine with dye on a crafting grid to craft different colored Candles
6. Added potted Azalea and Flowering Azalea variants
7. Just place an Azalea in a Flower Pot!
8. Each Realm subscription now has three world upload slots
9. One world can be active at a time and Realms owners have the ability to switch the Realm's active world between the three world slots
10. World height now goes up to 320 blocks and down to -64 blocks
11. New surface biomes including Lofty Peaks, Snow Capped Peaks, Snowy Slopes, Mountain Grove, and Mountain Meadow
12. New cave biomes including Lush Caves and Dripstone Caves
13. Revamped cave generation adds cheese caves, spaghetti caves, lava aquifers, and flooded aquifer caves
14. New ore distribution
15. Skulk Sensor
16. Goat Horn
17. Fixed a crash that could occur if a structure was placed with a command in an unloaded area and that structure was deleted
18. Underwater fog is once again dependent on biome and appears as it should ( MCPE-124266 )
19. Fixed a bug that could cause Nether Portals to sometimes take players to wrong coordinates ( MCPE-115933 )
20. Fixed split-screen players not able to rename items on Anvils ( MCPE-108405 )
21. Thunderstorms now happen as often as Java Edition ( MCPE-72798 )
22. Bastion loot now closely matches Java Edition ( MCPE-104330 )
23. Players can no longer swim through the air under a platform, though it looked pretty cool ( MCPE-48958 )
24. Fixed players going through Cobwebs taking fall damage before hitting the ground ( MCPE-121550 )
25. Descending through Powder Snow with touch controls now uses the same button as descending through Scaffolding
26. Fixed an issue that was causing the player's head to not animate properly with emotes ( MCPE-126902 )
27. Empty Buckets can no longer be used to collect Fish
28. Axolotls no longer move their tails while playing dead ( MCPE-123309 )
29. Feeding Axolotls with Bucket of Tropical Fish now returns a Water Bucket instead of an empty Bucket ( MCPE-127382 )
30. Axolotls now only spawn in complete darkness to prevent spawning in unwanted places
31. The hitbox on Axolotls is now smaller to match the size of the mob
32. Drowned, Guardians, and Elder Guardians now attacks Axolotls on sight
33. Skeletons now turn into Strays after 20 seconds in Powder Snow, reduced from 45 seconds
34. Strays no longer drop Wither Skeleton Skulls when killed by Charged Creepers ( MCPE-35876 )
35. Burning mobs can no longer destroy Powder Snow when the Mob Griefing world option is disabled ( MCPE-221842 )
36. Tempted Goats now move at the same speed as goats in Java Edition, and other similar mobs that are being tempted ( MCPE-123261 )
37. When Goats are performing a ram attack, mobs no longer retaliate against the Goats ( MCPE-129619 )
38. Goat fall damage reduction is now in parity with Java Edition (-10 reduced fall damage)
39. Goats can now continue ramming when on Slime Blocks and Honey Blocks
40. Baby Sea Turtles no longer despawn after being hatched ( MCPE-70664 )
41. Baby Horses, including their variants, are now taller and no longer exhibit Z-fighting from their legs ( MCPE-92462 )
42. Iron Golems and Evokers are no longer sometimes aggressive on Peaceful difficulty ( MCPE-47012 )
43. Amphibious mobs no longer get stuck when pathing over slabs and Daylight Sensors
44. Attacked Glow Squids no longer go dark only for the aggressor in multiplayer sessions
45. Glow Squid now darkens to match the surrounding light level when hurt ( MCPE-121754 )
46. Villagers spawned from Villager spawners on Marketplace worlds that were created after version 1.11 now correctly spawn as V2 villagers
47. Fixed a warning that could appear in split-screen when encountering Guardians
48. Falling Anvils and Stalactites now deal damage to mobs when landing in liquid
49. Azaleas can now be Bone Mealed when placed on Clay
50. Using Pick Block on Azalea Leaves and Flowering Azalea Leaves now results in the correct blocks being picked ( MCPE-128092 )
51. Hanging Roots are now destroyed by water ( MCPE-121676 ) ( MCPE-127677 )
52. Lightning Rods no longer break falling blocks that land on them ( MCPE-116545 )
53. Rooted Dirt texture is now randomly rotated, matching the behavior of regular Dirt blocks ( MCPE-123197 )
54. Small Dripleaf now only drops itself when broken with Shears
55. Glow Lichen now only drops itself when broken with Shears
56. Jukeboxes now only ejects Music Disks into non-solid blocks ( MCPE-85635 )
57. Projectiles, such as Snowballs and Eggs, no longer cast shadows
58. All dropped items now have a similar floating height
59. Disenchanting an item using the Grindstone once again resets the enchantment cost penalty correctly ( MCPE-107211 )
60. Data-driven items now swing faster when not targeting blocks ( MCPE-119702 )
61. Firework Rockets obtained from '/replaceitem' command now have a flight duration ( MCPE-109037 )
62. Firework Stars obtained from '/replaceitem' command now have proper color values ( MCPE-109037 )
63. Glowing text on Signs now has an outline ( MCPE-129123 )
64. Black text on Signs can now be lit by using a Glow Ink Sac ( MCPE-128079 )
65. Tooltips are now present when holding Ink Sac and Glow Ink Sac when using a controller
66. Ink Sac and Glow Ink Sac can no longer be used indefinitely on signs in Adventure mode
67. Players can no longer dye text on Signs in Adventure mode ( MCPE-126489 )
68. Pumpkins are once again accepted by Farmer Villagers regardless of their rotation when mined ( MCPE-105540 )
69. Glow Item Frame is now placed after regular Item Frame in the Creative inventory ( MCPE-117532 )
70. Copper Ore is now placed after other Overworld ores in the Creative inventory ( MCPE-119724 )
71. Deepslate is now placed after other stones in the Creative inventory ( MCPE-127592 )
72. Hotbar item tooltip duration now scales with the length of the tooltip's text
73. Added a new Accessibility icon in the Settings menu
74. Items can now be previewed in the Character Creator and equipped using the Equip button
75. Added Equip button to Classic Skins and Capes tabs
76. The profile screen reload button is now properly localized to all supported languages
77. The "Reset to Default" button in the Accessibility settings now resets the Text Background Opacity slider
78. Fixed a typo in the "Loom" section of "How to Play" ( MCPE-128735 )
79. The counters on empty tabs of the Play screen now display zero instead of an empty, grey box ( MCPE-110535 )
80. Featured Item thumbnails now fit within the Featured Items window in Character Creator
81. When not signed into a Microsoft Account, players are now presented with a button prompting them to sign in on the Play screen so that they can view Realms
82. Realms Plus content expiration timers now appear properly
83. Realms Plus timers now only appear within 30 days of expiring
84. '/title clear' now correctly clears the title and subtitle from the HUD ( MCPE-97636 )
85. Frosted Ice can now be used in any command that accepts a block, such as '/setblock' and '/testforblock' ( MCPE-126741 )
86. Updated Add-On templates for 1.17.10 are available for download with new resources, behaviors, and documentation Resource Pack Template: aka.ms/resourcepacktemplate Behavior Pack Template (Includes documentation): aka.ms/behaviorpacktemplate
87. Resource Pack Template: aka.ms/resourcepacktemplate
88. Behavior Pack Template (Includes documentation): aka.ms/behaviorpacktemplate
89. Added better error handling for JSON parsing. Also added several new content errors for item parsing as well as for loot tables
90. Players are given a content error when custom recipes are invalid
91. Renamed "minecraft:scaffolding_climber" to "minecraft:block_climber". It now processes climbing both Scaffolding and Powder Snow
92. Loot chests with Seed=0 now correctly randomize if placed on the same coordinates. Note that Pick Blocking a Vanilla loot chest before opening it will now result in identical loot in each copy unless the seed is set to 0 in the NBT
93. Added back missing symbols for Bedrock Dedicated Server on Linux ( BDS-13482 )
94. Content creators can now create multi-page dialogues with branching narrative for NPCs using the '/dialogue' command and dialogue JSON files
95. The Ender Dragon rendering and animations are now fully data-driven
96. The Ender Crystal rendering and animations are now fully data-driven
97. The Horse rendering and animations are now fully data-driven
98. This work supports all Horse variants (Horse, Mule, Donkey, Zombie Horse, Skeleton Horse) and all Horse versions including: v1 (engine version 1.2.5 and earlier) v2 (engine version 1.2.6 to 1.17.0) v3 (engine version 1.17.10 and onward). This will be a cleaner version of the v2 model, with less confusing bone naming
99. v1 (engine version 1.2.5 and earlier)
100. v2 (engine version 1.2.6 to 1.17.0)
101. v3 (engine version 1.17.10 and onward). This will be a cleaner version of the v2 model, with less confusing bone naming
102. Updated documentation for 'DisplayNameItemComponent'
103. Updated documentation for 'BlockUnwalkableComponent'
104. Incoming client-sync properties for newly seen types will properly register with client-side Actor Property Manager groups
105. "query.wing_flap_position" now works with the Ender Dragon
106. Added "query.show_bottom" - a query for determining whether or not the entity's bottom is rendered
107. Added "query.death_time" - a query for determining the elapsed ticks since a mob started dying
108. Added "math.min_angle" - a math expression for minimizing the angle magnitude (in degrees) into the range [-180, 180]
109. Fixed experimental 'query.target' to work on client-side queries
110. Limits writing of chunks unless necessary. Chunks upgraded from older formats will not automatically save when loaded, but when modified (Through blocks or actors, for example) they will be marked for saving
111. Updated the '/clearall' command to also clear tests outside of loaded areas
112. Dimension getEntitiesAtBlockLocation(location : BlockLocation) : Entity[] - Returns an array of all entities at the given block location spawnEntity(identifier : String, location : BlockLocation) : Entity - Spawns an entity with the given identifier at the given block location [Removed] function getName() property id : String - Gets the entity's identifier property nameTag : String - Gets or sets the entity's name tag
113. getEntitiesAtBlockLocation(location : BlockLocation) : Entity[] - Returns an array of all entities at the given block location
114. spawnEntity(identifier : String, location : BlockLocation) : Entity - Spawns an entity with the given identifier at the given block location
115. [Removed] function getName()
116. property id : String - Gets the entity's identifier
117. property nameTag : String - Gets or sets the entity's name tag
118. Player property name : String - Gets the player's name
119. property name : String - Gets the player's name
120. method getPlayers() : Player[] - Returns all players in the server
121. Updates to how blocks are handled in APIs: BlockType, BlockPermutation, and Block instances replace BlockState-based updating
122. BlockType, BlockPermutation, and Block instances replace BlockState-based updating
123. Exposed chest block component and Container
124. Added location and velocity read-only properties to Entity
125. function createExplosion(location : Location, radius : number, explosionOptions : ExplosionOptions) - Creates an explosion ExplosionOptions : class - Provides additional configuration parameters for createExplosion
126. ExplosionOptions : class - Provides additional configuration parameters for createExplosion
127. method triggerEvent(eventName : string) - Triggers an event on an entity
128. Added 'thenExecuteFor' to 'GameTestSequence', which repeatedly calls the callback for the specified number of ticks
129. Events Renamed 'World.event.weatherChanged' to 'World.event.changeWeather' Added event 'World.event.addEffect' - Fires when an effect is applied to an entity. Added event 'World.event.createEntity' - Fires when an entity is added to the world. Removed function 'World.addEventListener' Changed function 'getDuration()' to property 'duration' Changed function 'getAmplifier()' to property 'amplifier' Added property 'displayName' - Gets the display name of the effect
130. Renamed 'World.event.weatherChanged' to 'World.event.changeWeather'
131. Added event 'World.event.addEffect' - Fires when an effect is applied to an entity.
132. Added event 'World.event.createEntity' - Fires when an entity is added to the world.
133. Removed function 'World.addEventListener'
134. Changed function 'getDuration()' to property 'duration'
135. Changed function 'getAmplifier()' to property 'amplifier'
136. Added property 'displayName' - Gets the display name of the effect

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/4404454406285-Minecraft-1-17-10-Bedrock

1.17.2.title: Minecraft - 1.17.2 (Bedrock)
1.17.2.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.17.2 (Bedrock)**__
> Please search for any bugs you find onbugs.mojang.comand let us know what you think atfeedback.minecraft.net.

**Fixes:**
1. Andesite, Diorite, and Diamond Ore now generate in expected amounts, as they did prior to version 1.17.0 ( MCPE-127555 , MCPE-130185 )

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/4403547028237-Minecraft-1-17-2-Bedrock

1.17.0.title: Minecraft - Caves & Cliffs: Part I - 1.17.0 (Bedrock)
1.17.0.md:
__**Minecraft - Caves & Cliffs: Part I - 1.17.0 (Bedrock)**__
> Please search for any bugs you find onbugs.mojang.comand let us know what you think atfeedback.minecraft.net.

**Fixes:**
1. Axolotls are amphibious creatures that spawn in underground water
2. Holding a Bucket of Tropical Fish will cause nearby Axolotls to follow the player on both land and in water. Axolotls cannot be tamed but can be bred by feeding them Buckets of Tropical Fish
3. Axolotl will attack Fish, Squid, Drowned, and Guardians!
4. Axolotls come in a variety of colors, all with an equal chance of spawning except for blue. Blue Axolotls have a small chance of spawning as a mutation when breeding two Axolotls
5. Axolotls can survive on dry land for a few minutes. After that they will start to dry out and take continuous damage until rehydrated
6. When taking damage, there is a chance that the Axolotl will play dead. While playing dead, the Axolotl will regenerate health and mobs will be unable to target the Axolotl
7. When a player kills a mob that the Axolotl was attacking, they are rewarded with the regeneration effect and their mining fatigue is removed, if they had it
8. Axolotls can be picked up with buckets, just like fish!
9. The winning mob of the MINECON Live 2019 mob vote!
10. For now, Goats spawn in Extreme Hills. This will change with Caves & Cliffs: Part II
11. Goats will occasionally ram into players and other mobs
12. Goats can jump high and take less fall damage than other mobs
13. Goats will avoid walking onto Powder Snow
14. Goats can be bred and tempted using Wheat
15. Use an empty Bucket to get Milk
16. Keep an ear out for the elusive Screamer Goat!
17. The winning mob of the Minecraft Live 2020 mob vote!
18. Glow squids are aquatic creatures that spawn in underground water
19. When killed, glow squid drop Glow Ink Sacs
20. Craft a Glow Item Frame by combining a glow ink sac with an item frame in a crafting table
21. Any item in a Glow Item Frame is perfectly illuminated, even at night!
22. If a Sign is interacted with a Glow Ink Sac, the text will then get a glowing effect
23. Mobs inside a block of powder snow start to freeze and eventually take damage
24. Players can protect themselves from powder snow by equipping leather armor
25. Cauldrons fill up in snowy weather, creating a renewable source of powder snow. It will also generate naturally in certain snowy biomes when Caves & Cliffs: Part II releases
26. Buckets can be used to scoop up and place powder snow
27. Most mobs cannot walk on powder snow and fall into the block instead
28. Skeletons transform into strays after standing in powder snow for awhile
29. Wearing Leather Boots allows a player or mob to walk on Powder Snow without falling in
30. A dim light source that appears on cave walls and in underground lakes
31. Use bone meal to spread it along block surfaces and harvest it using shears
32. These huge Geodes can be found anywhere underground of newly generated chunks in the Overworld
33. Amethyst Geodes have an outer layer of Smooth Basalt Blocks and a second layer of Calcite Blocks
34. Inside Geodes, there is an inner layer of various Amethyst Blocks
35. All types of Amethyst blocks (including Clusters) create beautiful sounds when you walk on them, break them, place them, or hit them with a projectile – go make some music!
36. Amethyst comes in block form inside the Geodes in two ways: Block of Amethyst Block and Budding Amethyst
37. Amethyst Clusters grow from budding Amethyst, which can be found inside Geodes
38. Clusters have four growth stages: Small Amethyst Bud, Medium Amethyst Bud, Large Amethyst Bud, and Amethyst Cluster
39. Fully-grown Amethyst clusters drop four Amethyst Shards (or more with the Fortune enchantment) when a Pickaxe is used, and drop two Amethyst Shards when broken by hand, Piston, or other means
40. Clusters can be mined with the Silk Touch enchantment at any stage of growth
41. On any side of a Budding Amethyst Block where there is air or a water source block, a Small Amethyst Bud will eventually grow
42. Amethyst Buds can only grow when attached to Budding Amethyst, and will grow until they become a full Amethyst Cluster
43. Clusters can only grow when they are placed on budding Amethyst Blocks
44. Amethyst Shards are items used in a variety of crafting recipes
45. Though visually transparent, light does not pass through Tinted Glass
46. Can be crafted by putting a Glass Block in the middle of four Amethyst Shards on a Crafting Table
47. Tinted Glass can be obtained without the Silk Touch enchantment and does not shatter when broken, like normal Glass
48. Copper Ore can now be found underground in newly generated chunks and can be smelted into Copper Ingots
49. Block of Copper and Cut Copper can be crafted, as well as stairs and slabs
50. After being placed in the world, Copper Blocks will oxidize slowly over time, turning to exposed Copper, Weathered Copper, and Oxidized Copper
51. Copper Blocks that are not fully oxidized can be waxed to prevent further oxidation, either by using a Honeycomb item on them, by using the crafting grid, or by using a Dispenser loaded with Honeycombs
52. Axes can scrape off wax and oxidation from Copper Blocks
53. All lightning strikes that happen within a radius of 64 blocks from a Lightning Rod will strike the Lightning Rod
54. Lightning rods can be crafted using Copper ingots in a Crafting Table
55. A Lightning Rod struck by lightning will emit a full Redstone signal for 8 game ticks
56. The Spyglass is used to see far away places and can be crafted with Copper Ingots and an Amethyst Shard
57. Camera movement when looking through a Spyglass is slowed to make it more comfortable to use. This is adjustable using the Spyglass Damping slider in Settings on Bedrock Edition
58. Added Raw Copper, Raw Iron, and Raw Gold items
59. Ores that are smeltable now drop raw item forms of the ore instead of the ore block, and these can be smelted just like before
60. This is to prevent cluttering the inventory and have consistency with Fortune on all ores
61. Ore blocks are still smeltable, meaning you can still smelt ore blocks you've obtained previously or with the Silk Touch enchantment
62. Added block of Raw Copper, Raw Iron, and Raw Gold
63. Just like other ore materials, you can craft a compact block with raw ore items to save inventory space or use as decoration
64. Raw ore blocks can be placed on a crafting grid to break down into the original raw ore items
65. Deepslate is generated in blobs below y = 16
66. Mining it with a Pickaxe will drop Cobbled Deepslate, which can be smelted back into Deepslate
67. When ore is generated in the same place as Deepslate, Deepslate variants of that ore are now generated instead
68. Deepslate Blocks can be crafted into Polished Deepslate, Deepslate Tile, and Deepslate Brick Blocks, including slabs, stairs, and walls
69. Deepslate Blocks also come in Cracked Tile, Cracked Brick, Chiseled, and Infested variants
70. Stone tools can be crafted using Cobbled Deepslate
71. A new decorative block
72. Blobs of Tuff Blocks generate in the world below y = 16
73. Basalt blocks can now be smelted into smooth basalt blocks as a new decorative block
74. While Lush Caves and other new cave biomes won’t generate until the Caves & Cliffs: Part II update, many new blocks are now available through the Creative mode inventory or certain aspects of Survival mode
75. Added the following trades to the Mason: Will sell 4 Dripstone Blocks for 1 Emerald
76. Will sell 4 Dripstone Blocks for 1 Emerald
77. Added the following trades to the Wandering Trader: Will sell 2 Pointed Dripstones for 1 Emerald Will sell 2 Rooted Dirt for 1 Emerald Will sell 2 Moss Blocks for 1 Emerald
78. Will sell 2 Pointed Dripstones for 1 Emerald
79. Will sell 2 Rooted Dirt for 1 Emerald
80. Will sell 2 Moss Blocks for 1 Emerald
81. Moss Blocks can be found in Shipwreck Chests
82. Glow Berries can be found in Mineshaft Chest Minecarts
83. Pointed Dripstone can be placed on the ceiling (stalactites) or ground (stalagmites)
84. Watch out! If a stalactite is broken, it will fall and cause damage to players and mobs
85. Players and mobs will take damage if landing on a stalagmite
86. If a stalactite is under a water source or lava source, it will slowly fill Cauldrons
87. If a stalactite and stalagmite touch, they will connect into a full column
88. A Dripstone Block can be crafted with four Pointed Dripstone
89. Small Dripleaf will grow into Big Dripleaf when fertilized with Bone Meal
90. Big Dripleaf is a platforming block. Players and mobs on top of the block will cause the block to tilt and drop
91. When Moss Blocks are fertilized with Bone Meal, Moss has a chance of spreading to other blocks. Moss Carpet, Azaleas, and Flowering Azaleas also have a chance of growing
92. The Hoe is the most efficient tool to harvest Moss Blocks and Moss Carpet
93. Azalea and Flowering Azaleas are new decorative plants
94. Azaleas have a chance of growing after using Bone Meal on Moss Blocks
95. Fertilizing an Azalea with Bone Meal will transform it into a tree with Azalea Leaves and Flowered Azalea Leaves, which can be harvested using Shears
96. Azalea and Flowering Azalea can also be used as Furnace fuel
97. Tilling Rooted Dirt with a Hoe turns the block to normal Dirt and drops Hanging Roots
98. Fertilizing Rooted Dirt with Bone Meal causes Hanging Roots to grow below
99. Glow Berries can be planted on the bottom of most solid blocks to grow cave vines
100. They can be eaten and are as nutritious as Sweet Berries
101. Use them to lure and breed Foxes
102. When Cave Vines grow or are fertilized with Bone Meal, they have a chance of growing Glow Berries
103. A Cave Vine that has Glow Berries emits light. So pretty!
104. Cave Vines are climbable
105. Currently, Spore Blossoms are only available in the Creative mode inventory
106. Spore Blossoms are a new decorative block that can be placed underneath any block
107. Wax On Wax Off - Apply and remove Wax from all the Copper blocks
108. Float Your Goat - Get in a boat and float with a Goat
109. The Healing Power of Friendship - Team up with an Axolotl and win a fight
110. Improved visibility when swimming in underwater caves
111. A new, beautiful main menu panorama for Caves & Cliffs: Part I
112. Updated the appearance of the initial loading screen
113. Compass and Clock item textures have been updated
114. Ore textures have been updated to better differentiate in more ways than just color
115. Added distinct damage sounds for burning, freezing, and drowning ( MCPE-111645 )
116. Bone Meal now makes a sound when used
117. Drowned now drop Copper ingots instead of Gold ingots
118. The update size on iOS is over 200MB, which exceeds the limit of downloads over cellular data. The update can be downloaded over a Wi-Fi connection
119. Players sometimes do not receive game invitations on Android devices ( MCPE-58759 )
120. Featured Servers cannot be joined by players on Nintendo Switch - we hope to have this resolved soon
121. Players on Windows 10 updating to 1.17.0 with certain graphics hardware may experience a black screen on launch - this only affects players who had changed the anti-aliasing setting from default and can be rectified by resetting that setting. Please see MCPE-129319 for more information
122. Fixed a crash that occurred when curing a Zombie Villager in another dimension if the player had not travelled back to the Overworld since entering the world ( MCPE-121559 )
123. Fixed a crash that could occur when switching between owned and non-owned Character Creator items
124. Fixed a crash on Windows 10 that can occur in ray tracing mode
125. Fixed an issue where taking dyed wool from a chest would not trigger the Rainbow Collection Trophy, presuming all wool colors were collected
126. Android players should once again see achievement notifications ( MCPE-54902)
127. Players who receive negative damage no longer generate absorption hearts ( MCPE-94178 )
128. When a player using the touch interface presses and holds the crafting output window, they can now rapidly craft items up to one stack ( MCPE-28689 )
129. Picking up part of a stack no longer picks up the entire stack and drops the excess ( MCPE-105330 )
130. Fixed the player spawning in unsafe locations when entering a random world for the first time ( MCPE-42310 )
131. Fixed the player’s hand still bobbing even when the View Bobbing setting was disabled ( MCPE-79380 )
132. First person eating animation is now centered in the frame ( MCPE-116678 )
133. First person main hand blocking animation now plays properly ( MCPE-116703 )
134. First person main hand and off-hand Shields are now symmetrical ( MCPE-116736 )
135. Tridents in players' and mobs' hands are now correctly positioned in all perspective modes ( MCPE-116681 )
136. Trident raising animation modified for first person to match the previous version more closely
137. Fixed players showing the Bow holding animation after respawning when killed by another player ( MCPE-58861 )
138. Rabbits can once again raid Carrot crops ( MCPE-113321 )
139. Animals can no longer be fed infinitely until they are bred ( MCPE-19309 )
140. Charged Creeper aura is rendered correctly in most cases now ( MCPE-65798 )
141. Zombie Villagers now properly shake while being cured
142. Bees no longer gather nectar from Sweet Berry Bushes
143. Bees can once again enter Beehives and Bee Nests ( MCPE-122705 )
144. Blazes and Endermen once again receive damage from Splash Water Bottles ( MCPE-97483 )
145. Strays no longer drop Wither Heads when killed by Charged Creepers ( MCPE-35876 )
146. Using an Axe on Wood Blocks once again turns them into Stripped Wood Blocks ( MCPE-105998 )
147. Renamed Structure Blocks no longer have the incorrect data mode on creation ( MCPE-41625 )
148. Fixed an issue that could cause certain blocks to grow too quickly when ticked
149. Water Buckets can once again be used to pick up Fish ( MCPE-94520 )
150. Switching between some items (Bow, Trident, Crossbow, Shield) in your main hand will no longer skip animations ( MCPE-116680 )
151. Boats now break when they collide with a Cactus from the side ( MCPE-106044 )
152. Changed the position of the Bow to match previous versions ( MCPE-116741 )
153. Crossbows in players' and mobs' hands are now rendered correctly in all perspective modes ( MCPE-116737 )
154. Fixed an animation issue causing an off-hand held Shield to appear to re-equip whenever the player changed their main-hand item ( MCPE-116773 )
155. Cauldrons that have been emptied after containing a potion are now correctly filled with water when it rains
156. Fixed an issue where Fireworks of all colors could be crafted from any other color of Firework Charges ( MCPE-90715 )
157. Fixed a bug where the screen reader did not read the focused button on some screens
158. Fixed a bug where English screen reader pronounced "A button" as "a button", now saying "Button A" instead
159. Fixed water flickering on PS VR
160. Colors applied to text on Signs are no longer barely visible ( MCPE-117516 )
161. Old Signs no longer glow when being dyed ( MCPE-117835 )
162. Critical hit particles now generate around a mob instead of under it ( MCPE-39599 )
163. Fixed Strider, Hoglin, Zoglin, Piglin, and Piglin Brute spawn eggs turning red when quick-moved inside any inventory in RenderDragon builds ( MCPE-110463 )
164. Fixed enchantment glint shape of charged Bow and Crossbow icons in RenderDragon builds
165. Fixed items playing "attack" and "using " animations at the same time when using touch input ( MCPE-117133 )
166. Fixed an issue that could occur on older worlds where looking up in a Minecart would display the inside of the Minecart, blocking the player's view
167. Fixed an issue that minimizing the title would disable anti-aliasing in RenderDragon builds ( MCPE-120532 )
168. Kick Player button now works again
169. Fixed a softlock when trying to set friend permissions on a Realm on initial invite
170. Updated Realms membership invite icon to be more obvious
171. Further improved Realms permission error messaging
172. Added a button to access the Realms membership invitation management screen in Profile Settings
173. Automatically close Realms invite screen if all invites are handled
174. Fixed PlayStation 4 players with Parental Control Communication and User-Generated Content restriction settings being able to join Realms through invites
175. Fixed controller cursor sensitivity scaling ( MCPE-33868 )
176. Fixed an issue where patterns in the loom with high resolution assets would not display correctly
177. Fixed an issue where cancelling joining a world while generating it caused players to get stuck on the loading screen ( MCPE-114776 )
178. PS VR players can activate the start screen VR mode toggle using a keyboard
179. PS VR players can now proceed past the VR Align screen with a keyboard
180. Chemistry item icons no longer disappear after suspend/resume in Education Edition worlds
181. On PlayStation 4, fixed keyboard bindings when using an external keyboard configured to a non-US layout
182. Clicking "Get Help Fixing This" when unable to access multiplayer features now redirects to the proper help page on the Nintendo Switch
183. Adjusted the background color of Settings screens for increased readability
184. Added controller tooltips for "Collect" and "Empty" Lava from Cauldron using Bucket
185. The panoramic main menu background no longer blinks when loading the game, loading into a world, or leaving a world ( MCPE-103842 )
186. Fixed text overlap issue on some resolutions in the Realms Plus product description page
187. The '/kick' command once again works properly if Cheats and Command Blocks are disabled, and it no longer uses target selectors
188. Fixed issue where Minecart with Command Block was not affected by the 'CommandBlocksEnabled' gamerule ( MCPE-93666 )
189. Fixed output message for '/stopsound' being incorrect ( MCPE-116772 )
190. Fixed issue where the '/structure delete' command was listed in the middle of both '/structure load' commands ( MCPE-114022 )
191. Fixed a crash that occurred when using the '/stopsound' command to stop the elytra.loop sound ( MCPE-120336 )
192. Fixed an issue where the clone command was changed and not versioned
193. The '/setworldspawn' command is now prohibited in legacy worlds, and affected worlds will reset their altered spawn positions to the original position ( MCPE-27797 )
194. Function's positional offset is no longer re-evaluated for every command inside the function when run with the '/execute' command. It is now only evaluated once for the whole function ( MCPE-124890 )
195. Fixed an issue where the Agent till command would not till blocks in Minecraft: Education Edition
196. Updated Add-On templates for 1.17 are available for download with new resources, behaviors, and documentation Resource Pack Template: aka.ms/ResourcePackTemplate Behavior Pack Template (Includes documentation): aka.ms/BehaviorPackTemplate
197. Resource Pack Template: aka.ms/ResourcePackTemplate
198. Behavior Pack Template (Includes documentation): aka.ms/BehaviorPackTemplate
199. Added two new variables to the 'biomes_client.json' file: "remove_all_prior_fog" and "inherit_from_prior_fog", which control fog merging and/or inheritance
200. "remove_all_prior_fog", when true, will clear all previous fog definitions stored on the stack, making the current pack the new "starting point" for fogs
201. "inherit_from_prior_fog", when true, will merge a biome's fog definition with matching biomes on the stack then create a new merged definition for it
202. "transparentattachable" tag should only affect rendering in first person camera perspective
203. Added a MoLang query to get default bone pivots ( MCPE-116741 )
204. Updated MoLang query to return normalized item use time remaining based off given parameters ( MCPE-116737 )
205. Fixed various cases when ray tracing textures would not be reloaded (resolution switching, upscaling mode switching, ray tracing on/off toggling) ( MCPE-124562 )
206. Fixed Enchanted Bow's textures being too dark ( MCPE-119701 )
207. Catmull-Rom animations will no longer glitch if the time for a keyframe matches its value
208. All functions run using the '/schedule' command now run from the origin they are supposed to, instead of from the server
209. Added a new field "transform_to_item" to the "minecraft:ageable" component. If the field is filled with an item name, the item will be given back when any of "feed_items" are used. Similar to "transform_to_item" in the "minecraft:breedable" component
210. Added a new optional flag "use_simplified_breeding" to "minecraft:genetics" component. When this flag is set to true, the offspring never inherits hidden alleles of parents as main alleles and main as hidden. This allows to implement simple breeding logic easier
211. Replaced "Whitelist" language use to "AllowList". Dedicated server command "whitelist" changed to "allowlist". Dedicated server "whitelist.json" file changed to "allowlist.json" file. JSON format remains the same. Modified instructions are found in bedrock_server_how_to.html
212. Fixed 'query.is_in_ui' so that it is available to use when a data-driven mob is rendering in the UI ('query.is_in_ui' returns true when the mob is rendering in the UI, such as in the inventory window)
213. Fixed a crash that could occur when an entity with a scoreboard value was removed from the world
214. Fixed a bug with the summonable property of overridden Vanilla mobs pre-JSON version 1.8.0, which caused Bees to not be summonable ( MCPE-58557 )
215. The "ImpactDamageSubcomponent" once again only prevents damage from being dealt to fire immune mobs if the 'catchFire' field is true and the projectile is on fire
216. The "has_equipment" filter now properly evaluates custom entity spawn eggs
217. Create volumes in your world: simply create a "volumes" folder in a saved world and put json files in there - one json file per volume. More information can be found in the Behavior Pack documentation
218. Can be enabled using the "Upcoming Creator Features" experimental feature toggle
219. Currently, you can attach a fog - Minecraft or your own custom fog - to a volume. When the player enters the volume, the fog will take effect
220. Added AddVolumeEntityPacket that contains information of a volume entity including its net ID and NBT containing information about the volume's definition and components, which will be added to the client's registry
221. Added RemoveVolumeEntityPacket that contains a volume entity's net ID to remove it from the client's registry
222. Renamed '/gametest runall' to '/gametest runset'
223. The default value for the tag parameter is now "suite:default"
224. Added Dimension class
225. Added World.getDimension
226. Updated the GameTest Framework interface assertContainerContains - ItemIdentifier parameter changed to ItemStack assertItemEntityNotPresent and assertItemEntityPresent APIs - ItemStack parameter changed to ItemType assertEntityNotTouching(entityIdentifier: string, position : Location) - Asserts that there is no entity of the given type at the given position assertEntityTouching(entityIdentifier: string, position : Location) - Asserts that there is an entity of the given type at the given position assertItemEntityCountIs(itemType : ItemType, position : BlockLocation, searchDistance : number, count : number) - Asserts that the entity item count in the given search area matches the expected count pulseRedstone(position : BlockLocation, duration : number) - Creates a Redstone block at the given position and destroys it after "duration" ticks function assertEntityPresentInArea(entityIdentifier : string) - Throws an Error if an entity matching the given identifier does not exist in the test region function print(text : string) - Prints the given text to the chat function assertEntityInstancePresent(entity : Entity, position : BlockLocation) - Throws an Error if the given entity is not present in the given block location [Removed] function setEntityTamed(entityIdentifier : string, position : BlockLocation) - Replaced by component function setTamed(showParticles : bool) function assertEntityData(position : BlockLocation, entityIdentifier : string, callback : function(entity: Entity)) - Asserts that the given condition is true for all entities of the given type at the given location function spawnItem(itemType : ItemStack, position : Location) - Spawns an item at the given location function assertIsWaterlogged(position : BlockLocation, isWaterlogged : bool) - Asserts that the block at the given location is waterlogged function assertRedstonePower(position : BlockLocation, power : number) - Asserts the redstone power level at the given location
227. assertContainerContains - ItemIdentifier parameter changed to ItemStack
228. assertItemEntityNotPresent and assertItemEntityPresent APIs - ItemStack parameter changed to ItemType
229. assertEntityNotTouching(entityIdentifier: string, position : Location) - Asserts that there is no entity of the given type at the given position
230. assertEntityTouching(entityIdentifier: string, position : Location) - Asserts that there is an entity of the given type at the given position
231. assertItemEntityCountIs(itemType : ItemType, position : BlockLocation, searchDistance : number, count : number) - Asserts that the entity item count in the given search area matches the expected count
232. pulseRedstone(position : BlockLocation, duration : number) - Creates a Redstone block at the given position and destroys it after "duration" ticks
233. function assertEntityPresentInArea(entityIdentifier : string) - Throws an Error if an entity matching the given identifier does not exist in the test region
234. function print(text : string) - Prints the given text to the chat
235. function assertEntityInstancePresent(entity : Entity, position : BlockLocation) - Throws an Error if the given entity is not present in the given block location
236. [Removed] function setEntityTamed(entityIdentifier : string, position : BlockLocation) - Replaced by component function setTamed(showParticles : bool)
237. function assertEntityData(position : BlockLocation, entityIdentifier : string, callback : function(entity: Entity)) - Asserts that the given condition is true for all entities of the given type at the given location
238. function spawnItem(itemType : ItemStack, position : Location) - Spawns an item at the given location
239. function assertIsWaterlogged(position : BlockLocation, isWaterlogged : bool) - Asserts that the block at the given location is waterlogged
240. function assertRedstonePower(position : BlockLocation, power : number) - Asserts the redstone power level at the given location
241. Added Commands.run
242. Entity function getComponents() - Returns an array of supported components function getComponent(componentIdentifier : string) - Returns the component matching the given identifier function hasComponent(componentIdentifier : string) - Returns true if the given component exists on the entity and is supported function getName() - Returns the name of the entity (e.g. "Horse")
243. function getComponents() - Returns an array of supported components
244. function getComponent(componentIdentifier : string) - Returns the component matching the given identifier
245. function hasComponent(componentIdentifier : string) - Returns true if the given component exists on the entity and is supported
246. function getName() - Returns the name of the entity (e.g. "Horse")
247. Add new enumerations: Minecraft.Effects & Minecraft.Items
248. Components Added additional component interfaces. movement, navigation, healable, breathable, ageable, and tameable components
249. Added additional component interfaces. movement, navigation, healable, breathable, ageable, and tameable components
250. Container - New interface for interacting with entity containers. Can be referenced via entity.getComponent("inventory").container

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/4402427632013-Minecraft-Caves-Cliffs-Part-I-1-17-0-Bedrock

1.16.221.title: Minecraft - 1.16.221 (Bedrock)
1.16.221.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.16.221 (Bedrock)**__
> The team has been hard at work fixing some top reported issues in Minecraft. Please search for any bugs you encounter onbugs.mojang.comand post feedback tofeedback.minecraft.net. Happy crafting!

**Fixes:**
1. Paintings are once again visible when placed ( MCPE-121718 )
2. Fixed some instances of the game not launching past the loading screen after updating on PS4 ( MCPE-58897 , MCPE-84790 )
3. Fixed a soft lock that occurred when trying to set friend permissions on a Realm on initial invite
4. Fixed a crash that could occur during gameplay
5. Fixed a crash that could occur when loading Behavior Packs containing GameTests

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360059800372-Minecraft-1-16-221-Bedrock

1.16.220.title: Minecraft - 1.16.220 (Bedrock)
1.16.220.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.16.220 (Bedrock)**__
> Welcome to the Minecraft 1.16.220 release! This update focuses on bug fixes, as well as some new tools for map makers. We hope you enjoy it!

**Fixes:**
1. Dye can now be used to change the color of sign text
2. Players are unable to see and join LAN sessions on Xbox without on Xbox Live Gold subscription
3. Paintings appear invisible when placed ( MCPE-121718 )
4. Fixed several crashes that could occur during gameplay
5. Fixed a crash that could occur when trying to rename a map on an anvil while its second slot was occupied ( MCPE-112905 )
6. Fixed a crash when entering a Nether Portal and throwing a Bottle o' Enchanting at the same time ( MCPE-114793 )
7. Improved input latency on Windows 10 when VSYNC is enabled ( MCPE-98861 )
8. Fixed fog in Nether biomes not rendering properly in some Resource Packs ( MCPE-111680 )
9. Players with Visitor permissions now drop inventory on death ( MCPE-47563 )
10. Fixed Drowned holding tridents backwards during attack ( MCPE-118213 )
11. Drowned will now swing their arms when throwing tridents
12. Zombie, Zombie Villager, Husk, Pillager, and Vindicator now use correct bone to attach shields ( MCPE-98606 )
13. Mobs that pick up shields now place it in their off-hand
14. Non-persistent mobs no longer despawn immediately after loading into the Nether
15. Projectiles now pass through Structure Void blocks ( MCPE-103579 )
16. Improved placement rules for placing blocks on sides of stairs, slabs, and Top Snow blocks
17. Pistons and Sticky Pistons no longer appear black when Outline Selection is disabled ( MCPE-53858 )
18. Enabled screen narration with touch input on the new achievements screen
19. Fixed a bug where the screen reader didn't read out default controller focus and checkbox state on the 'Online Play is not Rated' prompt
20. Fixed a bug where the screen reader would read the wrong text while using VR
21. Enabled "Find Friends" button on Xbox
22. Controllers are now able to select the "Button Mode" toggle in the Advanced Settings NPC screen in the Jurassic World pack ( MCPE-66446 )
23. The "Results" field for search within the marketplace inventory now updates properly between different sections within the screen
24. The death screen is now visible when behind full-screen effects (on fire, standing in a portal, etc.) while playing in VR
25. Fixed translucent rendering of occluded UI elements, also when viewing menus near blocks while playing in VR
26. Selecting the featured offer on the profile screen now properly redirects to the complete list of featured offers
27. Made the Sign In button text fit the button in Portuguese-BR
28. The Storage menu on now uses lighter text color
29. Fixed an issue where button textures weren't scaled properly when applying Resource Packs
30. Enabled navigating to the Back button using only keyboard in some screens where it was not possible
31. Entity selectors no longer allow self-selection with cheats disabled ( MCPE-92635 )
32. The '/clear' command will now apply the correct "data" argument for the sapling item ( MCPE-117889 )
33. Command blocks in a command block chain will now list the correct amount of ticking areas when a new ticking area is added before listing
34. Title command no longer duplicates % symbols in message ( MCPE-51033 )
35. Using teleport with the execute command now uses the dimension of the origin for its operations ( MCPE-44104 )
36. Steve’s Pants no longer change the color of the bottom of feet when no footwear is equipped
37. Fixed other players appearing as Steve in multiplayer
38. Changing skins while in split-screen now properly saves for all local players and update properly for remote players
39. Alex’s shirt no longer looks corrupted when equipped with different pants
40. "Hooray!" emote will now display in the emotes section if already owned ( MCPE-111165 )
41. Updated templates for 1.16.220 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation are available for download Resource Pack Template: aka.ms/resourcepacktemplate Behavior Pack Template (Includes documentation): aka.ms/behaviorpacktemplate
42. Resource Pack Template: aka.ms/resourcepacktemplate
43. Behavior Pack Template (Includes documentation): aka.ms/behaviorpacktemplate
44. Renamed all references of Actor to Entity
45. Renamed 'BlockPos' to 'BlockLocation'
46. Added 'startSequence' to GameTest, which allows finer control over advanced test sequences
47. GameTest sequence callbacks no longer take test as a parameter as the initial test object now lives as long as the whole test
48. Updated Behavior Packs to require explicit module dependencies when using other native modules
49. Identifiers within "render_controllers" will now be considered content errors if there is no render controller matching that name
50. Entity json before version 1.16.100 will no longer give a content error for the deprecated field "minecraft:foot_size"
51. modified condition in 'trident.animation_controllers.json' to allow mobs to enter  'wield_third_person_raise' ( MCPE-118213 )
52. Fixed an issue where loading into a world would cause continuous MoLang errors around "unhandled request for unknown variable"
53. A black screen no longer covers the player icon in the pause menu in some worlds. Content creators no longer need to override both focus_border_frame.png and pause_screen_border.png for correct behavior
54. Items can now have the "transparentattachable" tag applied to make attachable items not render for the player wearing them in the first person perspective
55. Fixed an issue where V2 Villagers were not properly updating their MoLang variables on initialization
56. Updated Blocks shorthand helpers to be camelCase
57. Updated Blocks shorthand to only include vanilla blocks
58. Added Blocks.get to fetch a block and return null if it doesn't exist
59. Added BlockStates to enumerate all block states
60. Added setState to Block to update its block state
61. Added BlockPos class
62. Added ItemStack class GameTest Module
63. Added Tags to enumerate all built-in tags
64. Updated all methods that took x, y, z position to take a BlockPos
65. Exposed padding when registering game test
66. Fixed issue where previous failed GameTest markers still show up in new worlds
67. Fixed projectiles on third-party servers ignoring server movement packets
68. The server will adjust the player's fall distance to take into account the client player's position when a player movement correction or anomaly is detected
69. Changed cipher algorithm to AESGCM256 for UDP stream

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360059426071-Minecraft-1-16-220-Bedrock

1.16.210.title: Minecraft - 1.16.210 (Bedrock)
1.16.210.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.16.210 (Bedrock)**__
> Another Minecraft update is upon us! New ambient sounds have been added to the Nether, making the dimension feel even more hostile. In addition to bug fixes, many that were reported by players, we’ve included some new tools for map makers and add-on creators.

**Fixes:**
1. Players now experience ambient sounds in the Nether ( MCPE-74756 ) Mobile players need to update the Minecraft Original Music Pack via the Marketplace to hear these new sounds
2. Mobile players need to update the Minecraft Original Music Pack via the Marketplace to hear these new sounds
3. Using bone meal in warm ocean biomes now only generates sea grass, coral, and coral fans ( MCPE-100085 )
4. Added F11 as a keyboard shortcut for Full Screen mode
5. Added text-to-speech volume slider in Audio Settings
6. Android Devices Our ability to support Android devices on KitKat OS or below is coming to an end. For more information, please see our help article Players running this KitKat OS or below are not able to purchase a Realm from that device
7. Our ability to support Android devices on KitKat OS or below is coming to an end. For more information, please see our help article
8. Players running this KitKat OS or below are not able to purchase a Realm from that device
9. Please be assured that we are still working on the issue that is causing some players to get stuck on the red loading screen on PS4 - to help us investigate this further, the game will now detect if it has failed to load correctly after 30 minutes, which will help us to diagnose and rectify the problem ( MCPE-84790 )
10. Player may be unable to change back from Local Network to Online Network on Nintendo Switch due to infinite loading
11. Players are unable to see and join LAN sessions on Xbox without on Xbox Live Gold subscription
12. The chest inventory menu is not visible when a chest is placed close to wall on PS VR ( MCPE-109860 )
13. There are are no animations when using items and punching at the air when playing on mobile devices
14. Fixed a number of crashes that could occur during gameplay
15. Fixed a crash that could occur when opening the achievements screen when the Anti-Aliasing setting was set to 1 ( MCPE-110164 )
16. Fixed a crash that could occur when loading '.mcstructure' files into the world that include entities ( MCPE-63387 )
17. Teleporting away from a structure animation no longer causes the game to crash
18. Fixed a crash that could occur when leaving a world
19. Fixed a crashing issue related to corrupted biomes during world load for various Marketplace worlds
20. Fixed a crash that could occur when using Code Connection ( MCPE-113355 )
21. Players are once again able to join servers when the server has view-distance set to 4 or less ( BDS-8855 )
22. Split-screen characters are now stored in memory and re-joining the game will keep the character that the player had ( MCPE-58640 )
23. Brought back capability to rejoin a server after it has been suspended and resumed
24. Sign in failures now have a more helpful error message and provide error codes
25. Clicking "Download Template" when missing required templates of an existing world now correctly downloads the required templates
26. Resolved an issue where, in certain cases, a world could not be properly synced to the cloud (Xbox only). If you are having trouble syncing worlds, please try opening the world on the original Xbox, save/quit, then wait a few moments while the world is re-synced into the cloud
27. Fixed an issue where crafting a bed with the recipe book unlocked the "Change of Sheets" trophy
28. Fixed players taking fall damage when opening Shulker Boxes ( MCPE-105490 )
29. Players will no longer dismount into liquids (lava or water) from rideables such as boats
30. In all worlds created with the same seed, the same chest will now always generate the same content in the same order ( MCPE-72432 )
31. All mobs that use a melee attack have had their ability to hit targets above and below them restored The target still must be within melee attack distance to be hit This only affects world versions greater than or equal to 1.16.210
32. The target still must be within melee attack distance to be hit
33. This only affects world versions greater than or equal to 1.16.210
34. Fixed a bug where parrots could fly upwards indefinitely
35. Fixed an issue that was causing the Ender Dragon animation to appear jittery ( MCPE-105892 )
36. Added new logic for mobs dismounting rideables This also introduces a more fine-grained entity height check allowing different dismount places for entities of different heights
37. This also introduces a more fine-grained entity height check allowing different dismount places for entities of different heights
38. Fixed a bug where foxes wouldn't knock off and eat sweet berries ( MCPE-70790 )
39. Fixed a bug that allowed players to place custom spawn eggs by default in Adventure mode
40. Minecarts now properly update their effects (looping sound, player coordinates) when the minecart is not being rendered for the rider ( MCPE-104044 )
41. Mining crimson hyphae with Silk Touch now returns a placeable block
42. Fix for certain Marketplace worlds having incorrect block data when played on Realms and multiplayer between mobile and PC
43. Fixed dried kelp block bottom and carried textures so the rope pixels are aligned ( MCPE-35476 )
44. Fixed an issue where snow accumulated in lines with certain simulation distances ( MCPE-73468 )
45. TNT submerged in water will once again launch players in Survival mode ( MCPE-47047 )
46. Ink Sacs obtained from the Wandering Trader can now be used for crafting and can be stacked ( MCPE-101087 )
47. Redstone Dust is now displayed as "Redstone Dust" instead of "Redstone"
48. Nether Brick now gives XP from being smelted ( MCPE-100030 )
49. Fixed an issue with screen resolution which could flicker when resizing a window ( MCPE-69721 )
50. Fixed an issue with maps rendering over transparent objects when attached to item frames when using ray tracing
51. Reduced ghosting of fish when viewed through the water with DLSS enabled
52. Fixed the screen reader not reading the title on the Permissions screen
53. Emote wheel now supports the screen reader on Android and iOS devices
54. Keyboard inputs can now adjust slider settings when the cursor is outside the UI frame
55. Fixed a bug where the screen reader did not read the permission toggles' titles on the Permissions Screen
56. The screen reader now reads Whisper and Announcement messages
57. The screen reader now informs the player when the "Chat Settings" menu has been opened
58. The screen reader now properly reads Edit/Create character button text for each character on the profile screen
59. The screen reader now announces the names of the A/B Button Swap and X/Y Button Swap options correctly
60. Fixed an issue where the screen reader would intermittently fail to announce some button names
61. Command blocks no longer censor numbers ( MCPE-106296 )
62. Improved the smoothness of menu transition animations ( MCPE-41772 )
63. A warning now appears when attempting to move a locked item in and from containers
64. Updated outdated loading screen tips ( MCPE-98977 , MCPE-102293 )
65. Added more helpful Video Settings messages for ray tracing on supported and non-supported platforms
66. Golden Apple and Enchanted Apple now have colored hotbar text when selecting them ( MCPE-64427 )
67. Tool and armor recipes now display the selected item background when selected in the recipe list
68. Wireframe of a structure block in the Overworld will no longer render in Nether and The End ( MCPE-75231 )
69. Audio sliders now always highlight when hovered over with a mouse
70. The durability bar is now visible when holding items with decreased durability in a window ( MCPE-105893 )
71. Fixed an issue where achievement names and descriptions would not be translated, independent of language selection ( MCPE-85813 )
72. The online status of cross-platform friends' shown on the invite screen will now update when a change has been detected ( MCPE-70004 )
73. Fixed an issue that prevented achievement rewards from showing correctly after changing the language setting
74. Owned and purchasable skins no longer get mixed into different categories while offline
75. Emote title no longer shows previously previewed emote upon re-entering the emotes tab. Emotes!
76. Updated the in-game links to the proper support pages
77. Fixed Skin Preview navigation when using a controller
78. Fixed missing Incompatible button on the Marketplace Inventory screen
79. Fixed some interface issues with scrolling and clearing store filters
80. Raised the time limit for selecting whether to download a resource pack on connect from 5 seconds to 5 minutes
81. The in-game invite screen will now refresh when you return to it from the add members screen
82. The new Achievement screens are now enabled by default (Except in VR, on PS4, or on touch devices with narration enabled)
83. Removed the input legend of the Achievement page Summary panel when narration is enabled
84. Fixed an issue where the scrollbar could be hidden behind the input legend
85. Fixed achievement details page getting its content hidden behind the Input legend
86. Updated size of achievement reward frame
87. Updated frame art for locked achievements
88. Teleport command now correctly aligns your rotation with the destination entity ( MCPE-35979 )
89. Selector argument options can again be seen and auto-completed correctly after specifying one ( MCPE-59794 )
90. Spawn events now show as suggestions for the '/summon' command ( MCPE-101112 )
91. 'SendCommandFeedback' no longer prevents display of outgoing messages ( MCPE-95217 )
92. Multiple '/tickingarea add' or '/tickingarea remove' commands performed during the same tick will no longer result in inaccurate messages about the number of ticking areas in use
93. Players can no longer overrun the maximum number of standalone ticking areas in use by adding them all in the same tick
94. Added stop action to the '/screenshake' command
95. Score values on the scoreboard now align to the right of the table ( MCPE-64973 )
96. The '/setblock' command now supports setting the connected state for Soul Lanterns ( MCPE-89609 )
97. The '/setblock' command now supports setting the rotation state for the chain block ( MCPE-105912 )
98. Fixed an issue that preventing player interaction after using the '/clone' command on a double chest block ( MCPE-109119 )
99. Using the '/clone' command to clone a block of the same type is no longer treated as a failed operation ( MCPE-83352 )
100. Updated templates for 1.16.210 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation are available for download Resource Pack Template: aka.ms/resourcepacktemplate Behavior Pack Template (Includes documentation): aka.ms/behaviorpacktemplate
101. Resource Pack Template: aka.ms/resourcepacktemplate
102. Behavior Pack Template (Includes documentation): aka.ms/behaviorpacktemplate
103. Added the "fogs" folder to the Resource Pack template
104. Added Fog documentation
105. Horses, Donkeys, Mules, Skeleton Horses, and Zombie Horses can now properly be given custom names, and identified using their respective "runtime_identifier"
106. Improved performance for actors using 'TemptGoal'
107. Zombie villagers spawned from zombie spawners on Marketplace worlds that were created after version 1.11 now correctly spawn as V2 zombie villagers. When cured, they will now correctly turn into V2 villagers
108. Fixed upgrade path for 'format_version' 1.13.0 boats to be properly upgraded to 1.16.100, which resolves a bug where boats templated worlds with a version lower than 1.16.100 had no gravity
109. Documentation for Bedrock Server Commands has been updated to show the correct commands for permission reloading and listing ( BDS-2341 )
110. Structure blocks no longer auto-save data when structure name text box is deselected ( MCPE-101055 )
111. Entities that use material state "Blending" now render correctly behind transparent parts
112. The scoreboard data of an entity is no longer removed if the entity is being teleported to an unloaded area of the world
113. Custom blocks now can only drop default state when broken, even with Silk Touch
114. Structures can now be deleted from the saved structure list using the new '/structure delete <name>' command
115. Added new slash command options for '/setblock', '/fill', and '/clone' commands for passing in a list of block states to set on the block being spawned
116. A boolean parameter called "ignore_game_mode" has been added for the block event response "decrement_stack", set to false by default. Thus "decrement_stack" no longer decreases the item stack when playing in Creative by default
117. Changing 'RideableComponent' property "rotate_rider_by" to function for custom mobs
118. 'SetBlock' and 'SetBlockAtPos' events now support custom block states ( MCPE-104747 )
119. Attachable items created in 1.16.2 and before will not render for their player in first person. Attachable items created after 1.16.2 will render for their player in first person unless they are armor
120. GameTest is server-side test automation tool that is based on pairing test code with test structures. You can trigger the tests via the '/gametest' command once you have enabled the "Enable GameTest Framework" experimental toggle for a world
121. NOTE: GameTest is not functional on console platforms
122. Disabled loading of entities in custom biome features
123. Fixed UVs of data-driven blocks to not be slightly shrunk, which caused texel warping
124. Fixed data-driven blocks being pushed by pistons not working correctly
125. Simple items, like swords or pickaxes, can have an optional offset applied to them to modify the way they are rendered. Note this component should not be added to an attachable item
126. Component Variables: main_hand - An optional object storing optional transform data for 'first_person' and 'third_person' for the player's right hand off_hand - An optional object storing optional transform data for 'first_person' and 'third_person' for the player's left hand first_person - An optional object storing 3 vectors 'position', 'rotation', 'scale' used to build the first person matrix third_person - An optional object storing 3 vectors 'position', 'rotation', 'scale' used to build the third person matrix
127. main_hand - An optional object storing optional transform data for 'first_person' and 'third_person' for the player's right hand
128. off_hand - An optional object storing optional transform data for 'first_person' and 'third_person' for the player's left hand
129. first_person - An optional object storing 3 vectors 'position', 'rotation', 'scale' used to build the first person matrix
130. third_person - An optional object storing 3 vectors 'position', 'rotation', 'scale' used to build the third person matrix
131. On server side, added protection from semicolon usage in server-name parameter in 'server.properties' config file. If semicolon symbol(s) are used by the user in server-name parameter then any semicolon(s) will be removed to provide correct client-server interactions. Additional comments are added to 'server.properties', which are not allow to use semicolon symbol(s) in server-name parameter
132. On server side, added protection from semicolon and symbols illegal for file name usage in level-name parameter in 'server.properties' config file. If semicolon or symbols illegal for file name are used by user in level-name parameter then those symbols will be removed to provide correct client-server interactions and correct level-name parameter usage on server side. Additional comments are added to 'server.properties', which are not allow semicolon or symbols illegal for file name usage in level-name parameter
133. On client side, added additional verification and correction for Unconnected Pong packet data to prevent incorrect server parameters parsing and inability of the client to connect to the server as result of that. Unit-tests are added for parsing, additional verification and correction of Unconnected Pong packet data ( BDS-6825 )
