1.16.201.title: Minecraft - 1.16.201 (Bedrock)
1.16.201.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.16.201 (Bedrock)**__
> The team has been hard at work fixing some top reported issues in Minecraft. Please report any bugs you find onbugs.mojang.comand post feedback tofeedback.minecraft.net. Happy mining and happy crafting!

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed an crash with Realms/Dedicated servers that caused world progress to roll back. This fix does not require a game update, but requires a server update if you host a Bedrock Dedicated Server ( REALMS-6812 )
2. Fixed the game failing to launch on multiple Windows 10 devices ( MCPE-102530 )
3. Double Chests placed at chunk borders no longer become partially invisible and don't crash the game when they are opened ( MCPE-106030 )
4. Shulker boxes no longer lose everything inside their inventory when undyed using a cauldron ( MCPE-108196 )
5. Fixed main menu buttons being invisible on older AMD graphics cards
6. Fixed a crash that could occur after suspending and resuming while creating new world on Android

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360053622851-Minecraft-1-16-201-Bedrock

1.16.200.title: Minecraft - 1.16.200 (Bedrock)
1.16.200.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.16.200 (Bedrock)**__
> A new update is upon us in the form of Minecraft 1.16.200! This update is loaded with graphics enhancements on Windows 10, updated volume settings, parity changes, and a swath of bug fixes. Please report any bugs you find onbugs.mojang.comand post feedback tofeedback.minecraft.net.

**Fixes:**
1. RenderDragon, the new graphics engine for Minecraft Bedrock platforms, is now available on Windows 10
2. RenderDragon was developed by the Mojang Studios graphics team to give our game greater performance, stability, and flexibility. The new architecture of RenderDragon enables our developers to bring new graphics features such as physically based rendering (PBR) and ray tracing more easily to the game
3. RenderDragon has been available for Xbox and PlayStation hardware since 2019, and we are now bringing it to Windows 10. We plan to bring RenderDragon to all Minecraft Bedrock platforms, including mobile devices, in the future
4. Enabled Ray Tracing on Windows 10 with compatible graphics hardware
5. Players can dramatically change the look and feel of the game. Immerse yourself in volumetric fog. See Minecraft in a whole new light with a cutting-edge dynamic lighting system, Ray Tracing
6. Players can also experience advanced kinds of block textures including metallic surfaces, bump maps, normal maps, and light emission (Glowy, reflective dirt blocks? Yes, please!)
7. Be sure to check out the Frequently Asked Questions article for an in-depth look at Ray Tracing features
8. Content in the Marketplace is now aware of Ray Tracing capabilities and will display a label indicating support within the user interface
9. Creators: We have some new documentation available for creating content for Minecraft with Ray Tracing! Texture Set Documentation - More information on Physically Based Rendering Fog in Resource Packs - Defining fog values within Resource Packs
10. Texture Set Documentation - More information on Physically Based Rendering
11. Fog in Resource Packs - Defining fog values within Resource Packs
12. Minecraft on Windows 10 now uses OpenXR to support Windows MR and Oculus VR
13. OpenXR is an open-source, royalty-free API standard that provides engines native access to a wide range of devices from vendors that span across VR/MR devices
14. OpenXR implementation in Minecraft brings a more unified experience across current VR/MR devices as well as support for those yet to come
15. You will still be able to launch through the Mixed Reality Portal, as well as the Oculus Store. However, there is also a URL to launch in VR: minecraft://mode/?OpenXR=true This can be made into a desktop shortcut, pinned to the start menu, bookmarked in a browser, or anything else you can do with a URL
16. minecraft://mode/?OpenXR=true
17. This can be made into a desktop shortcut, pinned to the start menu, bookmarked in a browser, or anything else you can do with a URL
18. Added a variety of volume sliders for sound categories (eg. hostile, blocks, weather etc.) These play a preview of the relevant sounds in the main settings menu, and play the default click sound when in-game
19. These play a preview of the relevant sounds in the main settings menu, and play the default click sound when in-game
20. Basalt can no longer be destroyed by Ghast fireballs ( MCPE-75252 )
21. Basalt blocks now take slightly more time to destroy
22. Dragon Egg now always drops as an item when it's destroyed by an explosion ( MCPE-52632 )
23. Right-clicking a snow block with a shovel no longer breaks the snow block
24. Dirt Paths (formerly Grass Path) can now be made by using a shovel on Dirt, Podzol, Mycelium, Coarse Dirt, and grass
25. Updated the Netherite leggings texture ( MCPE-103016 )
26. Twisting Vines can no longer be placed on Composter blocks while sneaking ( MCPE-78973 )
27. Netherite Armor now gives a ninety percent reduction in Knockback ( MCPE-77430 )
28. Bees will no longer stray more than 22 blocks from their home Beehive ( MCPE-60252 )
29. Players running Minecraft on Windows 10 N 32-bit systems may encounter a crash when loading the game if the Media Foundation Pack is not installed. This can be resolved by downloading and installing the Media Foundation Pack
30. Players are unable to rejoin a world after being disconnected from a suspended session
31. In VR, Living room hint text doesn’t change correspondingly when input method changes from gamepad to motion controller
32. Improved chunk loading speed when flying with Elytra ( MCPE-85614 )
33. Large numbers of scheduled instant updates no longer crash the game ( MCPE-94942 )
34. Fixed a crash that could occasionally occur when going through a portal or flying around in Creative mode
35. Fixed a crash that could occasionally occur while flying or moving around the game world
36. Fixed a crash that could occur when loading a local world
37. Fixed an issue where some mobile devices would lose audio after suspend and resume ( MCPE-101027 )
38. Fixed an issue that caused a crash on Nintendo Switch when trying to load a 256x resolution resource pack The system now blocks that selection and notifies the player they cannot select it
39. The system now blocks that selection and notifies the player they cannot select it
40. Players that own The Founder's Cape will once again see it within the Capes tab of the Dressing Room
41. Only preview items will be shown in crafting screen when auto crafting an item on controller. This prevents rapid updates of the Recipe Book
42. Fixed the player's hand still bobbing if View Bobbing was disabled ( MCPE-79380 )
43. Fixed mobs and other entities freezing and becoming desynced with their bodies o_O ( MCPE-71243 )
44. Villagers will no longer steal workstations from each other ( MCPE-43071 )
45. Mobs no longer randomly stop attacking and following their targets ( MCPE-48144 )
46. Piglins that are close together can no longer pick up the same item if it's dropped between them ( MCPE-95644 )
47. Update Zombified Piglin texture to remove flickering of loincloth ( MCPE-96793 )
48. Mobs no longer spawn in Wither Roses ( MCPE-97331 )
49. Bees now only exit at the front of Beehives and Bee Nests
50. Mobs are no longer teleported back and forth outside solid objects if there is not enough space for multiple entities ( MCPE-101202 )
51. Compass is no longer consumed when used on a Lodestone in Creative mode ( MCPE-96258 )
52. Glowsticks no longer use placeholder textures (Education Feature) ( MCPE-45686 , MCPE-68417 )
53. Cocoa Pods generated in Jungles now generate in the proper direction ( MCPE-102399 )
54. Signs no longer replace decorations when attempting to place in the same space as the decoration
55. Fixed a bug where End Portal blocks were not removed after an End Portal Frame block was destroyed. Filled blocks other than End Portal blocks will remain in place
56. Owned packs are now refreshed correctly after restarting the game when playing in VR
57. Fixed the screen reader not reading the screen title in-game
58. Fixed the screen reader not reading the shortcut button on the Pause Screen
59. Fixed the screen reader not reading the screen title and shortcut buttons on the Invite to Game Screen
60. Fixed the screen reader not reading the title on the Profile and Edit Character screens
61. Fixed the numbering of buttons on the Pause Screen being wrong when using text-to-speech
62. The Emote Wheel now supports the screen reader
63. Fixed an issue where the screen reader was not reading updates often enough on some devices
64. Fixed the screen reader so messages with controller icons in the Chat Screen are read correctly
65. The screen reader now reads the Open Chat Message while Text To Speech For Chat is turned off
66. Fixed several issues regarding text contrast in the user interface
67. Fixed an issue where the Servers tab would not correctly read text-to-speech prompts when not signed into a Microsoft account
68. Fixed various issues where text-to-speech indices on the start screen were not correct
69. Fixed issues where user interface controls would be improperly indexed in text-to-speech for popup modals
70. Reduced transparency on top row of buttons in Touch UI to improve readability
71. Added UI start up screen to inform players if they are running on outdated graphics drivers
72. Fixed several death messages ( MCPE-30360 ) "slain by Llama spit" --> "spitballed by Llama" "slain by shulkerBullet" --> "sniped by shulker" "slain by Blaze" --> "fireballed by Blaze" "slain by Ghast" --> "fireballed by Ghast" "shot by arrow" --> "shot by skeleton" "slain by Trident" --> "was impaled to death by Trident"
73. "slain by Llama spit" --> "spitballed by Llama"
74. "slain by shulkerBullet" --> "sniped by shulker"
75. "slain by Blaze" --> "fireballed by Blaze"
76. "slain by Ghast" --> "fireballed by Ghast"
77. "shot by arrow" --> "shot by skeleton"
78. "slain by Trident" --> "was impaled to death by Trident"
79. Fixed paperdoll such that it can now always be rotated with the mouse when in the Dressing Room ( MCPE-101210 )
80. "Classic Controls - Intense" font color now matches the surrounding text in VR Controls menu
81. Preview items in the crafting grid now have a different colored background depending on item availability in the inventory
82. The Player Permissions menu can once again be navigated using a controller regardless of the player’s permission level
83. [X] button in Chat Settings is no longer present when using a controller
84. Profile screen has been improved, now characters are visible and can be selected or modified as soon as they load
85. Avoid purchasing a Realm if the player cancels out of "Purchase History Needed" dialog screen
86. 'Strawberry Blonde' color now has correct name in the Character Creator ( MCPE-102674 )
87. Loading screen tips no longer display the "tips.game.62" (No ID)
88. Fixed the visual focus indicator disappearing in VR when hovering on tabs in VR with screen reader enabled
89. Scoreboard now displays properly on the pause screen when displaying in list mode ( MCPE-106012 )
90. '/playsound'commands now play the sound correctly for all players in range
91. '/effect' command duration is now capped at 1,000,000 seconds ( MCPE-92916 )
92. Add ticking area commands performed in the same tick now disallow adding areas with the same name twice
93. Placeholder text message for the '/titleraw' command success no longer returns to player ( MCPE-63618 )
94. FadeOut argument is no longer ignored in the '/title' times command
95. Updated templates for 1.16.200 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation are available for download Resource Pack Template: aka.ms/resourcepacktemplate Behavior Pack Template (Includes documentation): aka.ms/behaviorpacktemplate
96. Resource Pack Template: aka.ms/resourcepacktemplate
97. Behavior Pack Template (Includes documentation): aka.ms/behaviorpacktemplate
98. Turning bandwidth optimizations off to see if it fixes stationary mob problem and entity "lag" issues ( MCPE-105892 )
99. Custom projectiles once again animate properly
100. Fixed an issue where loot tables with a 'set_data' function produced incorrect loot items
101. Fixed face occlusion with data-driven blocks to properly account for unit cube transparent vs unit cube opaque
102. Data-driven blocks no longer have their top faces rotated 180 degrees when carried or in inventory ( MCPE-63134 )
103. Fixed an issue with a runaway block ticking queue that occurred on a looping data-driven block that changed itself to a different permutation. The bug could cause memory issues, increased load and save times, as well as stalling the game periodically (No ID)
104. Fixed data-driven blocks to shrink UVs the same way as actors to prevent UV bleeding (No ID)
105. Fixed some culling issues with data-driven blocks larger than 1x1x1 when placed on a chunk boundary. Also added content warnings for larger blocks
106. Changed 'set_block' and 'set_block_at_pos' to use 'BlockDescriptor' when specifying 'block_type'
107. Old command versions now use the previous position instead of current one
108. Fixed issue where 'query.cardinal_block_face_placed_on' no longer worked with 'on_player_placing'
109. Changed texture atlas padding size from 0 to 1 when disabling mipmap
110. Fixed issue of blocks listed in the "minecraft:block_placer" component not working correctly
111. Fixed player smaller hitbox while swimming and gliding from being reset after an event is sent on the player
112. Fixed custom spawn egg generation in template worlds
113. MoLang geometry, material, and texture variable names can once again contain dots
114. Items with the item lock component no longer cause the recipe book to show invalid recipe results
115. Added 'query.cardinal_facing_2d' to get a ground plane direction that doesn't return up or down
116. Added the ability to put block models into the models/blocks folder
117. Added the ability for item triggers to send events to the block they are interacting with (when there is one such as 'on_use_on')
118. Added the ability to query the interacted face for both interactions with blocks and using 'minecraft:on_use_on' in an item. Face can be queried with 'query.block_face'
119. Fixed using 'query.get_equipped_item_name' with an item that was renamed not returning the right result. We now tie this to vanilla versioning so that the old name is returned if the world is tied to a specific vanilla version
120. "add_mob_effect" and "remove_mob_effect" no longer throw content errors when valid effect names are passed in
121. Added documentation for "remove_mob_effect" to make creators aware they can use the value "all" in effect to remove all mob effects from a target
122. Fixed items not being placeable in additional horse equipment slots. Does not fix all equippable behaviors
123. Inventory size on the minecraft:inventory component has to be increased to match the equippable slots in order for the server to accept the item placement
124. The tooltip for item with item lock component will no longer show when game rule 'showtags' is disabled

1.16.100.title: Minecraft - 1.16.100 (Bedrock)
1.16.100.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.16.100 (Bedrock)**__
> It’s time for another Minecraft update! 1.16.100 brings a swath of Vanilla parity changes, bug fixes, and a massive amount of new capabilities for add-on creators and map makers. Please report any bugs you find onbugs.mojang.comand post feedback tofeedback.minecraft.net.

**Fixes:**
1. Realms and Featured Servers are now available on PlayStation®
2. Added a new Achievements screen design and brand new achievement artwork
3. Over a dozen new Character Creator items have been added and can be unlocked with achievements
4. Sea Turtles now play a sound when they lay eggs
5. Dolphins will now dry out at the same rate as they do in Java Edition; 120 seconds
6. Undamaged Mending items will no longer prevent damaged Mending items from being repaired ( MCPE-80156 )
7. Basalt can no longer be destroyed by Ghast fireballs ( MCPE-75252 )
8. Basalt blocks now take slightly more time to destroy
9. TNT no longer activates when a Redstone Torch is placed directly on it ( MCPE-81258 )
10. Experience Orbs now float in water ( MCPE-64039 )
11. Adjusted Netherite movement in lava ( MCPE-65372 )
12. Netherite armor no longer take durability loss when standing on magma blocks ( MCPE-76532 )
13. Trade discounts from Hero of the Village and Curing Zombie Villagers now match the Java Edition ( MCPE-70782 )
14. Phantom wings now make flapping sounds
15. Pistons can no longer be extended above the build height limit or into the void ( MCPE-37825 , MCPE-51067 )
16. Brewing Stands can now be crafted with Blackstone ( MCPE-90465 )
17. Players can now spawn farmland with the /give command and pick it with Pick Block ( MCPE-25691 )
18. Cod and Salmon killed by fire damage now drop cooked fish ( MCPE-30693 )
19. It's now possible to place chains so that they are aligned horizontally ( MCPE-93995 )
20. Floor and ceiling surface generation now correctly match Java Edition Soul Sand Valleys now have ceilings covered with Soul Soil and Soul Sand ( MCPE-69159 ) Basalt Deltas now have Basalt ceilings ( MCPE-79608 )
21. Soul Sand Valleys now have ceilings covered with Soul Soil and Soul Sand ( MCPE-69159 )
22. Basalt Deltas now have Basalt ceilings ( MCPE-79608 )
23. Striders with passengers can now be tempted
24. Piglins now drop their inventory when zombified ( MCPE-81503 )
25. Allow Piglins and Piglin Brutes to preserve equipment when zombified ( MCPE-83683 )
26. Piglin Brutes now give 20xp instead of 10 when killed by player ( MCPE-94089 )
27. Lanterns can now be placed underwater and do not pop when a water source block is placed on them
28. Piglins now offer similar bartering items as they do in Java Edition ( MCPE-92662 )
29. Soul Fire no longer melts snow or ice blocks ( MCPE-74901 )
30. Zombified Piglins no longer float above Striders while riding ( MCPE-80188 )
31. Warped Fungus can now grow in Crimson Forests ( MCPE-83616 )
32. Piglins now offer Nether Bricks instead of Nether Brick blocks when bartering ( MCPE-74395 )
33. Baby Zoglin and Baby Hoglin now have drops after being killed by the player
34. Baby Zoglins now have cute, oversized heads ( MCPE-65454 )
35. Wither Skeletons now automatically attack Piglins and Piglin Brutes ( MCPE-65456 )
36. Hoglins will now flee from Respawn Anchors ( MCPE-71534 )
37. Iron Golems now attack Hoglins ( MCPE-73838 )
38. Zoglins now take damage from Healing effect and heal from Harming effect ( MCPE-79314 )
39. If Ruined Portal chests contain Glistering Melon, they no longer contain only a single melon slice ( MCPE-92675 )
40. Zombified Piglins that are jockeys on Striders now hold a Warped Fungus on a Stick ( MCPE-94002 )
41. Piglin Brutes no longer have enchanted Golden Axes
42. All expected Nether plants can now be composted ( MCPE-78026 ) ( MCPE-82999 ) ( MCPE-94671 )
43. Crimson and Warped Fungus can now be placed on Mycelium ( MCPE-88588 )
44. Soul Speed enchantment found in chests is now limited to Bastion Remnant chests ( MCPE-75468 )
45. Soul Campfires now drop Soul Soil instead of Charcoal when mined ( MCPE-74709 ) ( MCPE-74709 )
46. Increased Strider health from 15 to 20 ( MCPE-76425 )
47. Piglins can now equip Shields, Elytra, Turtle Shells, and various Mob Heads ( MCPE-75863 )
48. Piglin Brutes no longer become angry from specific blocks being broken, they still always attack a player on sight though ( MCPE-94106 )
49. Baby Zombified Piglins now correctly display items held in their hands
50. Quick crafting a Piston will now work with Warped Planks and Crimson Planks ( MCPE-87659 )
51. Baby Hoglins now deal appropriate damage
52. Piglins now spawn naturally in Nether Wastes on Peaceful difficulty ( MCPE-95718 )
53. Added several new experimental toggles to enable previews of upcoming engine technology and support Add-Ons and Marketplace content
54. Added the new Mojang Studios logo splash screen on Android devices ( MCPE-79353 )
55. Xbox One controllers don’t work as expected when playing on Oculus Rift
56. Fixed a crash that could occur during gameplay
57. Fixed a crash that could occur when the player opened a Shulker Box they're standing on after rejoining a multiplayer session ( MCPE-51711 )
58. Fixed a crash that could occur if a player joined a game in a sleeping state ( MCPE-79465 )
59. Improved reliability of Nintendo Switch players joining other Nintendo Switch games
60. Adding tags to the Ender Dragon will no longer crash the game when reloading the world ( MCPE-89076 )
61. Fixed a crash that could occur when a stunned entity loaded into the world
62. Fixed a crash that could occur when Player 1 in a split-screen session disconnected their controller ( MCPE-99565 )
63. Optimized chunk loading performance ( MCPE-85614 )
64. Various bandwidth optimizations
65. Fixed worlds disappearing from the worlds list during crash at world start on Xbox One ( MCPE-84649 )
66. "The Beaconator" achievement can now be reliably unlocked
67. The "Archer" can now be reliably unlocked ( MCPE-86371 )
68. Fixed the 'Super Fuel' achievement not being awarded when using lava bucket in a furnace ( MCPE-64453 )
69. 24-bit PNGs without an alpha channel are no longer accepted as valid custom skins ( MCPE-50094 )
70. Fishing Rod will now correctly cast when close to a mob ( MCPE-65249 )
71. Custom named boats and minecarts will now save their name after placing and breaking. Their names will also be shown in the world ( MCPE-25845 )
72. Fixed empty worlds getting generated after closing a PS4 world import midway through the process
73. End City loot chests once again generate correctly ( MCPE-72920 )
74. Fixed players and mobs not taking damage when walking through berry bushes
75. Killing mobs that have armor equipped with ranged weapons now results in armor loot ( MCPE-44408 )
76. Villagers no longer get locked into the wrong profession ( MCPE-62080 )
77. Bees now leave their hive/nest after an allotted time in the End and Nether dimensions ( MCPE-58322 )
78. Hostile mobs can now spawn in thunderstorms during the day ( MCPE-34409 )
79. Foxes no longer take damage when falling on berry bushes ( MCPE-82273 )
80. Fixed Vex movement along the x and z directions ( MCPE-41879 )
81. Blaze now switch between melee attack and ranged attack based on the distance from the player ( MCPE-45469 )
82. Mob's inactivity timer is now reset when closer than 32 blocks from the nearest player
83. Shearing a Snow Golem now drops a carved pumpkin ( MCPE-66967 )
84. Turtles and Dolphins on land will now successfully move towards water ( MCPE-44918 )
85. Ghasts once again spawn in all light levels ( MCPE-85747 )
86. Mobs in lava were not able to find a path out. This fix makes it so they can enter a lava block if they are already in lava
87. Mobs can no longer move Minecarts they stand in ( MCPE-46804 )
88. Mob spawn range now scales with simulation distance ( MCPE-95568 )
89. Villagers from older versions now level up correctly when trading ( MCPE-85013 )
90. Improved performance of farmer villagers when harvesting or sowing crops
91. Fixed a bug which could prevent farmer villagers from harvesting crops
92. Player-ridden Striders now jump onto magma blocks as well as non-full blocks in front of them when guided by Fungus on a Stick ( MCPE-77096 )
93. Baby animals can once again be tamed, before growing up ( MCPE-96973 )
94. Bees can now only exit Beehives and Bee Nests through air blocks ( MCPE-97185 )
95. Slimes can now spawn in slime chunks inside frozen biomes ( MCPE-49303 )
96. Fixed issue where some walls were not correctly connected on world load
97. Walls converted from Console Edition saves are now joined properly
98. Water from bubble columns now flows as it should ( MCPE-36463 )
99. Hoppers with containers above them can no longer collect dropped items ( MCPE-80555 )
100. Fence gates now align with Blackstone Walls ( MCPE-78002 )
101. Placing blocks on Crimson Roots and Warped Roots will now properly remove the roots ( MCPE-81521 )
102. Target blocks no longer power additional blocks above them ( MCPE-85455 )
103. Beehives and Bee Nests now show the correct front-facing texture ( MCPE-92468 )
104. Lava and water textures are now visible after placing Slime block or Honey block next to or above them ( MCPE-62255 )
105. End gateways will now correctly calculate distance to the center block when searching for an exit position ( MCPE-48922 )
106. Plants and crops now grow more consistently when near chunk borders
107. Brown and Red Mushrooms can now be grown into huge mushrooms on Nylium
108. Cocoa Beans can now be placed on and survive on all jungle wood variants ( MCPE-46638 )
109. Gravity affected blocks no longer break when their supporting block is moved by a piston ( MCPE-81106 )
110. Falling blocks now break after falling for extended periods of time ( MCPE-73124 )
111. Podzol no longer generates below the top layer when spawning large spruce trees ( MCPE-71995 )
112. Observer block textures no longer get stuck in an active state after being moved by a piston ( MCPE-61175 )
113. Fixed a bug that could cause falling blocks to duplicate near a portal ( MCPE-68229 )
114. Fixed an issue that caused rails to not be powered correctly along the x-axis ( MCPE-81987 )
115. Saplings no longer incorrectly transform into a bee nest when next to a tree and flowers ( MCPE-80543 )
116. Dragon Egg no longer disappears if placed on pedestal and Ender Dragon is respawned ( MCPE-78400 )
117. Signs can no longer be placed on End Rods
118. Compass items will now point the correct direction when the player is in a boat ( MCPE-56876 )
119. Compasses with custom names now retain their names when linked to a Lodestone
120. Compasses with Curse of Vanishing now retain their enchantment when linked to a Lodestone
121. Lodestone Compasses can now be enchanted with the Curse of Vanishing using an Anvil ( MCPE-74016 )
122. Boots enchanted with Soul Speed no longer become stuck on mobs or the player after breaking ( MCPE-75375 )
123. Smelted items (prior to 1.13) no longer contain incorrect damage values and can be stacked ( MCPE-54617 )
124. Dropped items no longer float too low to the ground
125. Dragon Egg now always drops when it is destroyed by an explosion ( MCPE-52632 )
126. Totem of Undying now applies the correct effects upon dying ( MCPE-52364 )
127. Armor no longer gets stuck in the hot bar after interacting with an armor stand ( MCPE-84368 )
128. Corrected map color representation for multiple blocks ( MCPE-19228 ) ( MCPE-83797 )
129. XP orbs once again ignore world lighting, allowing it to always be at max brightness ( MCPE-67448 )
130. Banner patterns can now be crafted in the 2x2 crafting grid ( MCPE-91247 )
131. The "Thing" banner can now be crafted at the Loom ( MCPE-70449 )
132. Fixed an issue that caused item durability to not be assigned until a world was reloaded ( MCPE-62324 )
133. Spawn Eggs can now be used on an underwater Monster Spawner
134. Fixed dropped item stacks becoming invisible after merging with another item stack ( MCPE-71139 )
135. Iron pickaxes can now be dropped by mobs during raids ( MCPE-44417 )
136. Added more detailed error messages with possible solutions when a world fails to upload to a Realm ( REALMS-474 )
137. Fixed a crash that occurred when downloading large worlds from Realms ( MCPE-69269 )
138. Selecting the "Manage" button for Realms subscriptions now opens the appropriate Microsoft account page
139. Content that is owned through a Realms Plus subscription now roams across all platforms ( REALMS-5171 )
140. Fixed an issue with the skybox background graphics not rendering correctly on some devices
141. Fixed an issue with missing animation when damaging bamboo
142. Fixed a graphical issue with glass blocks on the City Living world that affected some devices on Windows 10
143. Touchscreen input "Chat and Commands" UI element now has a darker border
144. Music is no longer interrupted when entering water in ocean biomes ( MCPE-76213 )
145. Reduced raid horn sound ( MCPE-85593 )
146. Various improvements to the Crafting Screen experience when using a controller
147. Cobblestone is now shown as the default ingredient for stone tools ( MCPE-71843 )
148. Items in the inventory will no longer move into the crafting grid when hovering over recipes
149. The selected recipe will no longer be cleared when changing tabs, even if you don't have all the necessary ingredients for that recipe
150. Picking up items while the cursor is hovering over a recipe now updates to the recipe's new index
151. Crimson and Warped Stems/Hyphae are now in their correct Creative inventory groups ( MCPE-74611 )
152. Nether and Warped Wart blocks are no longer in an unfolding section in the creative menu
153. Removed the name field from the structure block 3D Export screen
154. Fixed incorrect chunk position calculation for block changes that occur during the Structure Block preview window
155. Structure loading/saving no longer affects ticking blocks in nearby chunks
156. Fixed the Reset button not re-rendering the wireframe bounding box
157. Added Noto Sans font license button and pop-up dialog to Profile section of the Settings screen
158. Updated splash texts and loading screen tips ( MCPE-85381 )
159. Fixed system language settings for Simplified and Traditional Chinese not honored by the game
160. Fixed an issue that meant the block highlight/selection box was extending above blocks
161. Time played now displays correctly on the Achievements screen ( MCPE-66331 )
162. The Beacon container interface no longer shuffles items around the inventory slots when trying to quick-move items from the inventory while the hotbar is full
163. Pressing the 'Leave Boat' button on touch devices will no longer make the player hit a passenger or destroy the Boat ( MCPE-78113 )
164. A button icon has been added to the NPC dialog screen to show which gamepad button to press to close the window (Education Feature)
165. The hovered slot data is now cleared properly whenever the cursor is moved off an item slot. This way the gamepad helpers are correct when not hovering over an item slot
166. The item name text that appears when the player changes the hotbar selection now anchors from the bottom. This way when it grows, it will not overlap with the hotbar ( MCPE-79566 )
167. Fixed the 'Profile' button in the Pause Menu not being sized correctly
168. "Ride Exit" hint now clears action bar messages ( MCPE-75097 )
169. The Smithing Table screen now contains the hammer icon and user interface elements appear correctly when using the "Pocket" UI profile setting ( MCPE-79541 )
170. Custom names now modify boss bars ( MCPE-43473 )
171. Grindstone no longer shows a result unless it changes the item ( MCPE-54256 )
172. Fixed navigation problems between Featured Items, Achievement Rewards, Emotes, and the Dressing Room ( MCPE-89179 )
173. Change Gamertag and Manage Account buttons on the Settings screen now open xbox.com URLs on iOS and Android
174. The Dressing Room now shows cached items when not connected to the internet
175. Fixed a crash could occur when using the '/fill ' command to fill huge amounts of blocks with Portal blocks
176. Text and background for the title command (Title, Subtitle, and Actionbar) have been adjusted and spaced out
177. Fixed a bug where a request queued with '/schedule' would not clear out when executed and would execute when re-entering a level
178. Added to the '/schedule on_area_loaded' command with an overload that allows you to track a circular area, by specifying a center and a radius. Also added serialization for the queue of requests
179. Fixed issues with the '/schedule' command that would consider an area loaded before it was actually loaded, and the command now respects which dimension it is queued in
180. Updated templates for 1.16.100 with new resources, behaviors, and documentation are available for download Resource Pack Template: aka.ms/resourcepacktemplate Behavior Pack Template (Includes documentation): aka.ms/behaviorpacktemplate
181. Resource Pack Template: aka.ms/resourcepacktemplate
182. Behavior Pack Template (Includes documentation): aka.ms/behaviorpacktemplate
183. Fixed particles when using animation controllers to play particles and switching to a different state that also plays particles
184. Striders now have a separate texture mapping for each leg, and their leg textures are properly mirrored
185. Pitch written in 'sound_definitions.json' is now correctly played ( MCPE-49430 )
186. FMOD music channel now sets its priority to 0 when music is played to prevent FMOD virtual channel from stealing it when a regular sound is played in game (default priority is 128)
187. Villagers/Zombie Villagers once again correctly spawn as a baby when using the summon command to summon them with the event "minecraft:entity_born"
188. Attempting to load a custom material that is not defined no longer causes a crash. A proper content error is now thrown
189. Added '/structure' command that allows saving and loading of structures without having to use Structure Blocks
190. Added the ability to animate the placement of a structure with the '/structure' command
191. Added the '/music' command, allowing creators to play and control custom music
192. Added '/playanimation' command that allows you to run a one-off animation. It assumes all variables have been setup correctly for the animation to run
193. Added '/camerashake' command to enable a camera shaking effect
194. Added '/ride' command that allows you to make entities ride other entities, stop entities from riding, make rides evict their riders, or summon rides and riders
195. Added '/clearspawnpoint' command that allows you to clear a player’s spawn point
196. Added '/event' command that can be used to trigger an event on an entity
197. Using the '/spawnpoint' command will no longer affect Players that are sleeping ( MCPE-91565 )
198. Older command versions using '/execute' now use the proper position for command selectors when calculating the radius
199. Added documentation for block event responses and re-organized block documentation
200. Blocks that have ticking components will now clear their pending ticks from the ticking queue upon removal Added the 'on_player_destroyed' trigger component
201. Added the 'on_player_destroyed' trigger component
202. Made data-driven blocks pathable with disabled collisions
203. Added the BlockDisplayNameComponent to allow display names to be configured in the localization table
204. Added support for parsing and performing the following event responses: Added the 'set_block_at_pos' event response Spawn Loot Set Block Added support for the 'on_interact' trigger component
205. Added the 'set_block_at_pos' event response
206. Spawn Loot
207. Set Block
208. Added support for the 'on_interact' trigger component
209. Added support for the 'on_player_placing' trigger component Also added MoLang queries for 'cardinal_block_face_placed_on' and 'cardinal_player_facing' for getting placement context
210. Also added MoLang queries for 'cardinal_block_face_placed_on' and 'cardinal_player_facing' for getting placement context
211. Added the first pass of the new data-driven block tessellation pipeline
212. Added the "minecraft:geometry" component to allow using a block model for rendering
213. Added the "minecraft:unit_cube" component to allow using a default unit cube for rendering. Unit cubes get some extra effects like ambient occlusion and face removal
214. Added the "minecraft:material_instances" component to allow mapping faces and material_instances in a geometry file to an actual material
215. Fixed smooth lighting and ambient occlusion with new data-driven blocks
216. Added serialization to Block Descriptor
217. Added static anyMatch functions to BlockDescriptor to compare a list of BlockDescriptors against: Block*, BlockLegacy, or BlockDescriptor
218. Added a function to compare two BlockDescriptors. This covers: matching blocks, any tag of either descriptor match, block states with matching permutations
219. Changed the BlockDescriptor BlockLegacy member variable to a Block* so we can set the block states during deferred block resolution and get the block with the states set
220. Removed all the existing Block* json parsing
221. Split 'allowed_blocks' into 'use_on' and 'dispense_on'
222. 'use_on' specifies what blocks an entity placer item is allowed to be used on, omit to allow all blocks
223. 'dispense_on' specifies what blocks an entity placer item is allowed to be dispensed on, omit to allow all blocks
224. Added support to item json events for the 'execute_command' keyword. It supports both a string and string array format, where the string is the command intended to run. Commands are compiled at load time and executed after add/remove_mob_effect and teleport actions, but before other triggers for events. Commands will be segmented in sequence and randomize nodes as expected
225. Added support to entity json events for the 'run_command' keyword alongside the current add and remove keywords. It supports both a string and string array format, where the string is the command intended to run. Commands will be run after component groups have been added and removed, and will be segmented in sequence and randomize nodes as expected
226. Updated the following components to parse and use BlockDescriptor instead of Block* BlockBreakSensorComponent BlockListEventMap BreathableComponent BreedableComponent BuoyancyComponent EntityPlacerItemComponent PreferredPathComponent SeedItemComponentLegacy

268. Squid rendering is now data-driven
269. All types of minecarts are now data-driven
270. The 'minecraft:behavior.controlled_by_player' goal is now data-driven
271. Physics component's 'has_gravity' field is now used to decide whether a mob should apply water gravity, if the mob does not have a navigation component
272. Spatial Bandwidth Optimizations are now exposed through a component, "minecraft:conditional_bandwidth_optimization"
273. Spatial Bandwidth Optimizations are now utilized by every actor using "minecraft:conditional_bandwidth_optimization"
274. Added the selector component to raw text, which can be used to print entity names in commands such as 'tellraw' and 'titleraw'
275. Pathfinding will now account for the "minecraft:scale'" component
276. Updated BrewingStand, ButtonBlock, ChestBlock, EnderChestBlock, SlabBlock, and SoulSandBlockblock types to allow path-finding and navigation ( MCPE-47075 )
277. Updated Actor Properties. Two fields that were invalid and appeared in some vanilla content will now give a content error. The field "value" on "minecraft:can_fly" and the property "minecraft:foot_size" should simply be removed from any entity files
278. The 'MoveToLiquidGoal ' has been changed to use data for its target block
279. Strider now correctly executes the 'move_to_liquid' goal
280. Made boats use the Buoyancy component. Added two new components, the "inside_block_notifier" component, which fires specified events when the actor enters or exits specified blocks, and the "out_of_control" component, which sets a corresponding actor flag, in order to make this possible
281. Exposed new data parameters to control the behavior of Drop Item For Goal. This includes: "seconds_before_pickup", "cooldown", "minimum_teleport_distance", "max_head_look_at_height", "teleport_offset", and "entity_types". Check out the new Actor component documentation!
282. Exposed new data parameters to control the behavior of Harvest Farm Block Goal, including "max_seconds_before_search", "search_cooldown_max_seconds", and "seconds_until_new_task". Check out the new Actor component documentation!
283. Added error checks to parsing of Minecraft shareables items. Displays content log if item name is invalid or the array is empty
284. Created '/fog' command for managing active fog settings for players; these fog settings override fog driven from the client such as biome location of player camera
285. Updated "biomes_client.json" to link each biome to a fog definition identifier
286. Added child object "volumetric" which contains "density" and "media_coefficients" objects. These hold the data values used for the volumetric fog
287. Items can now be made records to play music in Jukeboxes
288. Component Variables sound_event - A string value correseponding to a sound event in the game code. This string must be one these for music to play: "13", "cat", "blocks", "chirp", "far", "mall", "mellohi", "stal", "strad", "ward", "11", "wait", "pigstep" duration - A float value that determines how long particles are spawned from the JukeBox Block, should approximately match length of sound event comparator_signal - An integer value that represents the strenght of the analog signal, used by the Comparator Block
289. sound_event - A string value correseponding to a sound event in the game code. This string must be one these for music to play: "13", "cat", "blocks", "chirp", "far", "mall", "mellohi", "stal", "strad", "ward", "11", "wait", "pigstep"
290. duration - A float value that determines how long particles are spawned from the JukeBox Block, should approximately match length of sound event
291. comparator_signal - An integer value that represents the strenght of the analog signal, used by the Comparator Block
292. Examples When added to JukeBox Block this will play the sound clip of "record.chirp" Example 1: "minecraft:record": { "sound_event": "chirp", "duration": 185.0, "comparator_signal": 4 }
293. When added to JukeBox Block this will play the sound clip of "record.chirp"
294. Example 1: "minecraft:record": { "sound_event": "chirp", "duration": 185.0, "comparator_signal": 4 }
295. Renamed items to be consistent with the list of Java Edition items
296. Created RepairableItemComponent that data-drives how an item is repaired in game
297. Items can now override their display name with a localized 'value'. If a value is not supplied, the component will stay with its default name. If the value supplied is not in the localization file, the display name will be the value string
298. Added a Lock in Inventory component that can be applied to an item via the '/give' and '/replaceitem' commands. This prevents the item from being removed from the player's inventory, dropped, or crafted with Example of use: `/give @s apple 1 0 {"item_lock": {"mode": "lock_in_inventory"}}`
299. Example of use: `/give @s apple 1 0 {"item_lock": {"mode": "lock_in_inventory"}}`
300. Added a Lock in Slot component that can be applied to an item via the '/give' and '/replaceitem' commands. This prevents the item from being moved or removed from its slot in the player's inventory, dropped, or crafted with Example of use: '/give @s apple 1 0 {"item_lock": {"mode": "lock_in_slot"}}'

302. Added a Keep on Death component which can be applied to an item via the '/give' and '/replaceitem' commands. This component prevents the item from being dropped when the player dies Example of use: '/give @s apple 1 0 {"keep_on_death": {}}'

304. Items now have an easy way to set the icon for an item for displaying in the user interface
305. Component Variables "texture": Full path to icon image to use as item's icon. No default "frame": Molang script to be executed at runtime to determine the icon's current frame. Can be a constant, defaults to: 0 "legacy_texture_id": The name of the texture used on legacy items. No default "legacy_frame": Molang script to be executed at runtime to determine the icon's current frame. Can be a constant, defaults to: 0

1.16.40.title: Minecraft - 1.16.40 (Bedrock)
1.16.40.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.16.40 (Bedrock)**__
> This hotfix is being rolled out toallother platformsover the next week.Cross-play is still compatiblewithall Bedrock platforms running1.16.20 or higher.Please continue to engage with us throughbugs.mojang.comand keep the bug reports coming, we really appreciate your help!

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed the Microsoft account sign-in screen repeatedly appearing after losing internet connection on Nintendo Switch ( MCPE-95651 )
2. Fixed account linking occurring every time the game is launched after playing another game on PlayStation 4
3. Fix ed an issue with the account sign-in button becoming unresponsive after backing out of the sign-in prompt screen
4. Fixed a number of crashes on iOS devices ( MCPE-96184 )

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360048253952-Minecraft-1-16-40-Bedrock

1.16.20.title: Minecraft - 1.16.20 (Bedrock)
1.16.20.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.16.20 (Bedrock)**__
> Our developers have been hard at work to bring you another hotfix. Some of these issues were reported by players, so keep those reports coming atbugs.mojang.com!

**Fixes:**
1. Piglin Brutes are stronger versions of Piglins that live in bastion remnants and protect the treasures there
2. Unlike their cowardly and greedy counterparts, the Piglin Brutes cannot be distracted by gold and aren't afraid of anything
3. Piglin Brutes attack players on sight, no matter how the player is dressed
4. Piglin Brutes wield axes and don't need any armor because they're just that tough!
5. Recipe Select button prompt shows when hovering over a non-craftable recipe book item using controller ( MCPE-79725 )
6. Recipe selected items put in crafting input grid can now be hovered over with controller to see their tooltip names
7. On controller, hovering over recipes will show them in the crafting grid when no recipe is selected
8. On controller, you can deselect a selected recipe when hovering above that selection in the recipe book. You can also clear the crafting grid by clicking the right thumbstick
9. Performance / Stability Fixed a crash that occurred on PlayStation 4 due to other players using custom skins Fixed a crash that could occur when pressing the Manage Account button in Profile settings Loom blocks no longer cause an out of memory crash when using high resolution resource packs ( MCPE-69848 )
10. Fixed a crash that occurred on PlayStation 4 due to other players using custom skins
11. Fixed a crash that could occur when pressing the Manage Account button in Profile settings
12. Loom blocks no longer cause an out of memory crash when using high resolution resource packs ( MCPE-69848 )
13. General Worlds can once again be uploaded to Realms on Nintendo Switch ( REALMS-474 ) Players can once again host 8 max player worlds on PlayStation 4 ( MCPE-85009 ) Fixed an issue where the Hot Tourist Destination trophy would not unlock after visiting the last required Nether biome on PlayStation 4 ( MCPE-85496 ) Meeting requirements for some achievements offline will now unlock it after reconnecting Custom skins once again work properly in multiplayer ( MCPE-48207 ) Emotes can no longer be equipped before unlocking them ( MCPE-84810 ) Fixed notifications not appearing on iOS
14. Worlds can once again be uploaded to Realms on Nintendo Switch ( REALMS-474 )
15. Players can once again host 8 max player worlds on PlayStation 4 ( MCPE-85009 )
16. Fixed an issue where the Hot Tourist Destination trophy would not unlock after visiting the last required Nether biome on PlayStation 4 ( MCPE-85496 )
17. Meeting requirements for some achievements offline will now unlock it after reconnecting
18. Custom skins once again work properly in multiplayer ( MCPE-48207 )
19. Emotes can no longer be equipped before unlocking them ( MCPE-84810 )
20. Fixed notifications not appearing on iOS
21. Gameplay Breaking a Furnace will now drop the stored experience from smelting ( MCPE-71651 ) Boats are no longer slowed down by objects with no collision ( MCPE-81316 ) Legacy chunk upgrades will no longer cause chunks to become 100% air ( MCPE-58514 ) New Nether biomes, blocks, and structures no longer generates into worlds with a fixed version ( MCPE-66357 ) Parity: Fixed chests with loot tables not generating loot until opened or destroyed Local split-screen players can once again see the Ender Dragon and Ender Crystal ( MCPE-67596 ) The bounding box of the player used for spawning is now the correct size, so we don't think a player is in a dangerous spot when they are actually safe
22. Breaking a Furnace will now drop the stored experience from smelting ( MCPE-71651 )
23. Boats are no longer slowed down by objects with no collision ( MCPE-81316 )
24. Legacy chunk upgrades will no longer cause chunks to become 100% air ( MCPE-58514 )
25. New Nether biomes, blocks, and structures no longer generates into worlds with a fixed version ( MCPE-66357 )
26. Parity: Fixed chests with loot tables not generating loot until opened or destroyed
27. Local split-screen players can once again see the Ender Dragon and Ender Crystal ( MCPE-67596 )
28. The bounding box of the player used for spawning is now the correct size, so we don't think a player is in a dangerous spot when they are actually safe
29. 1.16.1.title: Minecraft - 1.16.1 (Bedrock)
1.16.1.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.16.1 (Bedrock)**__
> Our developers have been hard at work getting top issues addressed for this hotfix. Several of these were reported by players, so keep those reports coming atbugs.mojang.com! Even more fixes are already in the works for another update coming soon.

**Fixes:**
1. Implemented a workaround button combination on startup to clear the player's download cache on PS4 ( MCPE-84790 )
2. Launch Minecraft
3. When the initial loading screen appears, hold the following buttons:
4. Button combination is L1 + R1 + L2 + R2 + OPTIONS + Touch Pad , and must be held until the initial splash screen is removed
5. Fixed several issues with Netherite items being lost in f ire or l ava ( MCPE-70774 , MCPE-79753 , MCPE-84796 )
6. Recipe Select button prompt shows when hovering over a non-craftable recipe book item using controller ( MCPE-79725 )
7. Recipe selected items put in the crafting input grid can now be hovered over with the controller to see their tooltip names
8. Fixed a crash that could occur when playing an emote and suspending the game ( MCPE-73325 )
9. Fixed a crash that occurred on PlayStation 4 due to other players using custom skins
10. Emotes can no longer be equipped before unlocking them ( MCPE-84810 )
11. Custom skins once again work properly on multiplayer ( MCPE-48207 )

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360045602971-Minecraft-1-16-1-Bedrock

1.16.0.title: Minecraft - Nether Update - 1.16.0 (Bedrock)
1.16.0.md:
__**Minecraft - Nether Update - 1.16.0 (Bedrock)**__
> Welcome to the Nether Update! Minecraft’s deadliest destination just got a little spookier and a lot more dangerous. Are you ready to make your new home in the Nether? With so many new features, changes, and fixes, it’s difficult to pin the scope of this update into just a few points but here we go!

**Fixes:**
1. Four new Nether biomes including Crimson Forest, Warped Forest, Soulsand Valley, and Basalt Deltas
2. Watch out for a collection of new dangers like Piglins and Hoglins, and keep your eyes open for the ridable, lava walking Strider
3. Get building with new bricks and wood galore and get growing with eerie new vegetation
4. New music and ambient sounds fill the air, including fresh tunes from Lena Raine and includes a snappy tune called “Pigstep”
5. Keep yourself safe and take your diamond gear to the next level with Netherite
6. Over 300 bug fixes since the Buzzy Bees update, with fixes to over 180 community reported bugs
7. Be sure to check out the list of parity updates, as we address some issues regarding mob spawning, curses, villages, aquatic music, and sounds
8. Warped Nylium carpets the cave floor with all kinds of strange new vegetation
9. Huge Warped Fungi make up the "trees" of this forest, with Shroomlights lighting up the forest floor
10. Warped Wart blocks can be cleared quickly using a hoe
11. A dark blue fog covers the forest!
12. Warped spores swirl through the air
13. Twisting Vines grow from the cave floor and fungi
14. The Warped Forests are strange, but also the least hostile place of Nether
15. Crimson Nylium carpets the cave floor with all kinds of strange new vegetation
16. Huge Crimson Fungi make up the "trees" of this forest, with Shroomlights lighting up the forest floor
17. Nether Wart blocks can be cleared quickly using a hoe
18. Weeping Vines grow from the cave ceilings and fungi
19. Hoglins wander these forests
20. Crimson spores swirl through the air
21. An open space made mostly of Soul Sand and Soul Soil
22. Basalt pillars span from floor to ceiling
23. Fossile remains of unknown creatures from the past litter the valley
24. Ash falls through the air
25. A light blue glow envelopes the valley
26. Beware of Skeletons here
27. Remnants of volcanic eruptions, this biome sports a high concentration of Basalt columns and lava deltas
28. Walking through, you will be surrounded by flakes of flowing white ash
29. Magma Cubes finally have a place to call home, spawning very frequently
30. A new block, Blackstone, can be found in large patches here
31. The original Nether biome is now called Nether Wastes
32. Biome fog color smoothly blends between biomes. Smooth.
33. Piglins are an aggressive civilization that live in the Nether
34. They mostly hang around in the Crimson Forest, but you might find some in the Nether Wastes, too
35. They think of players as target practice and will attack on sight
36. However, if you dress appropriately, they will see you as a respectable figure, or tolerable at least
37. Piglins are suspicious of strangers and if they see you opening a chest or mining a block of gold, they will assume that you're stealing and will treat you accordingly
38. Piglins LOVE gold and get very distracted by gold items
39. Gold ingots are currency to piglins, and you can throw ingots at them or interact with them while holding an ingot to barter for various goods
40. Piglins sometimes get hungry and hunt hoglins for food. Or they try at least. The results... vary
41. Piglins prefer to hunt and fight in groups and when a fight is happening, everyone wants in
42. Piglins that somehow end up in the overworld become zombified fairly quickly
43. Piglins are creeped out by soul fire and zombified piglins, and will stay clear whenever possible
44. Wither skeletons are a historic enemy and piglins will attack on sight
45. Baby piglins are not as dangerous but they can be mischievous, so watch your back
46. ... and they like to play with baby hoglins
47. Hoglins are big aggressive beasts that live in Crimson Forests
48. They attack players on sight so be careful, they can easily knock you off a ledge!
49. Hoglins drop pork and sometimes leather, but not willingly
50. You can breed hoglins by feeding them crimson fungi, but do so at your own risk
51. Hoglins get hunted by piglins sometimes, but they don't go down without a fight!
52. Despite this, hoglins and piglins aren't enemies - they are more like an ecosystem
53. Baby hoglins like to pretend they are tough - but don't worry, they are more like angry puppies with no teeth
54. Want to keep hoglins off your back? Pro tip: Hoglins hate the smell of warped fungi!
55. Striders are neutral mobs that stride the Nether, preferably through lava
56. Striders can be mounted if they first get a saddle placed on them
57. Similar to pigs, they can be controlled by the player, using mushroom-on-a-stick!
58. They are not hostile
59. They spawn in lava, and are fire immune
60. When they are not in lava, they freeze, shiver, and move slower
61. You can breed striders by feeding them warped fungus
62. Baby striders follow their parents
63. Zombie pigmen are now known as zombified piglins, and they now have ears... well, at least one ear
64. Zoglins are zombified hoglins - the result of bringing a hoglin into the overworld
65. Unlike hoglins, they can't be bred or fed, and they don't care about warped fungus
66. Beware - these beasts are raving mad and attack just about everything they see!
67. Remains of ancient Nether portals can now be found in the Nether and Overworld!
68. Added 4 separate Bastion Remnant types: Bridge, Hoglin Stable, Housing Units, and Treasure Room
69. You can find these sizable structures in all biomes in the Nether, except for the ashy cliffs of Basalt Deltas
70. Explore, loot, and conquer a Bastion Remnant to call it your home...but beware, Piglins don't take kindly to intruders stealing their things
71. Added a new music disc from Lena Raine titled 'Pigstep', which can only be found in Bastion chests
72. Added a new set of stone blocks with regular, polished, and polished brick variants!
73. Added Gilded Blackstone - Blackstone which has been imbued with gold and has a chance of dropping gold nuggets when broken
74. You can find these new blocks in Bastion Remnants
75. Blackstone can be used to craft a Furnace
76. Blackstone can be used to craft stone tools
77. Added the respawn anchor that can set your respawn point in the Nether
78. Use while holding Glowstone to charge to a maximum of four charges - each respawn depletes one charge
79. You can charge the Respawn Anchor using a Dispenser
80. Netherite items float in lava so you don't lose all your gear after that unplanned lava bath
81. Netherite tools work faster and last longer than diamond
82. Netherite weapons do more damage than diamond
83. Netherite armor have higher toughness and durability than diamond
84. Netherite items have higher enchantment value than diamond (but not as high as gold)
85. Netherite armor gives you knockback resistance, so you barely get knocked back at all when hit by arrows and such- Netherite blocks can be used as the base of a beacon and netherite ingots can be used as the fuel for a beacon. Weird flex but ok
86. And it looks cool!
87. Mine ancient debris in the lower depths of the Nether. At own risk. No insurance coverage for that
88. Refine it into netherite scrap in a furnace or blast furnace
89. Combine 4 netherite scrap with 4 gold ingots in a crafting table to make a netherite ingot
90. Add one of your diamond tools or armor pieces into a Smithing Table with a netherite ingot
91. The Smithing Table will preview your new netherite item in the right slot. Take it out to craft!
92. The closer you hit to the center, the larger the redstone signal!
93. You will need one hay block and four redstone for this recipe
94. Shine your boots of choice with this soul-sucking enchantment to speed around on Soul Sand and Soul Soil!
95. There's a downside: Enchantments will slowly degrade your boots each Soul block you walk on
96. Can only be obtained by bartering with those pesky Piglins
97. Crafted from a netherite ingot and chiseled stone bricks
98. Use a compass on a lodestone to point the compass to that lodestone
99. Two new non-flammable wood-like materials - Crimson Stems and Warped Stems
100. Hyphae of Crimson and Warped Stems, including their stripped versions, can be crafted. Similar to wood from the Overworld
101. Basalt blocks - you can find them as pillars, but they can be placed in any direction
102. New ground surface blocks: Crimson Nylium and Warped Nylium
103. Using bone meal on Netherrack can spread Nylium
104. New vegetation: Nether Sprouts, Crimson Roots, and Warped Roots Warped and Crimson roots and fungi can be placed into pots
105. Warped and Crimson roots and fungi can be placed into pots
106. Two types of Fungi: Crimson and Warped - try using bone meal to grow them!
107. Warped Wart blocks
108. Weeping Vines that grow from the bottom of a block downwards! Weeping vines are climbable!
109. Weeping vines are climbable!
110. A new natural light source: Shroomlights
111. Added Soul Soil! Whenever fire burns on Soul Soil, it burns with a blue flame!
112. Soul Soil can be used to craft Soul Torches - and those can be crafted into Soul Lanterns!
113. Soul Campfire - A campfire with blue flames craftable with Soul Soil or Soul Sand
114. Added patches of Blackstone and Gravel to all Nether biomes at and below lava level
115. Nether gold ore can now spawn in the nether!
116. Nether gold ore can be mined with any pickaxe and will drop gold nuggets
117. Added Chiseled Nether Bricks, Cracked Nether Bricks, and Quartz Bricks blocks
118. We’ve added three new tracks, all composed by the very talented Lena Raine Rubedo is played in the Nether Wastes Chrysopoeia is played in Crimson Forests So Below is played in Soulsand Valleys
119. Rubedo is played in the Nether Wastes
120. Chrysopoeia is played in Crimson Forests
121. So Below is played in Soulsand Valleys
122. Added moody sounds to the Nether
123. Added underwater music
124. Added ambient cave sounds
125. A large amount of sounds have had their volume and pitch slightly changed in order to get close to Java Edition parity
126. Players can now use Emote animations in game as a fun way to express themselves! Emotes are assigned to an Emote wheel within the Dressing Room. There are Emotes available for free, purchase, and as achievement rewards
127. This feature rewards players with Dressing Room items when completing achievements. If an achievement is already unlocked, the reward can be redeemed immediately. Rewards are the full gambit of Dressing Room items, including Emotes
128. Bullseye – Hit the bullseye of a Target block (15G)
129. Cover me in debris – Wear a full set of Netherite armor (50G)
130. Oooh, shiny! – Distract a Piglin using gold (30G)
131. Hot tourist destination – Visit all Nether biomes (30G)
132. Bedrock mob despawn rules have been changed to now work similarly to Java Edition's mob despawn rules. This allows mobs to more consistently despawn around the player
133. Any mobs that have been set to persist (tempted, name-tagged, tamed, bred, etc.) will never naturally despawn
134. Almost all naturally spawning mobs will automatically despawn when they're 44 blocks or further away from the nearest players in a world with simulation distance 4. On higher simulation distances, mobs are despawned when they're in a chunk at the edge of the simulation distance up to a distance or 128 blocks from the nearest player
135. Fish automatically despawn at a max range of 40 blocks or further on all simulation distances
136. If mobs are between 32 and 44 blocks from the nearest player, they must not take damage for 30 seconds as well as succeeding a 1 in 800 chance
137. The following mobs do not follow these despawn rules: Wither Boss Ender Dragon Evocation Illager Vindicator Bee Iron Golem Snow Golem Elder Guardian Villagers Wandering Trader
138. Wither Boss
139. Ender Dragon
140. Evocation Illager
141. Vindicator
142. Bee
143. Iron Golem
144. Snow Golem
145. Elder Guardian
146. Villagers
147. Wandering Trader
148. Curse of Binding
149. Curse of Vanishing
150. Updated block sounds for Bone block, Netherrack, Soul Sand, Nether Wart, Nether Brick, Quartz Ore, Honey block, and Honeycomb block
151. Tools now make noise when they break ( MCPE-32355 )
152. Villager trade values have been changed to closely match Java Edition ( MCPE-47141 )
153. Players more reliably raise their popularity within a village Trading with villagers now correctly increases popularity Curing a Zombie Villager now grants additional popularity Popularity will become more neutral over time
154. Trading with villagers now correctly increases popularity
155. Curing a Zombie Villager now grants additional popularity
156. Popularity will become more neutral over time
157. Increased golem spawn rate and modified spawn rules ( MCPE-47157 ) At least 75% of the villagers must have worked in the past day Minimum 20 beds and every villager has a bed Only 1 golem will spawn for every 10 villagers
158. At least 75% of the villagers must have worked in the past day
159. Minimum 20 beds and every villager has a bed
160. Only 1 golem will spawn for every 10 villagers
161. Villagers no longer close powered iron doors ( MCPE-44621 )
162. Villagers no longer run around their houses during raids
163. The raid boss bar now reappears when returning to a raid from another dimension
164. Dropped items are now three-dimensional objects and spin
165. Passive mobs now spawn on blocks they are supposed to ( MCPE-47596 )
166. Pufferfish now have a middle inflation state when approached We will update the missing sounds in a future update
167. We will update the missing sounds in a future update
168. Planting an oak or birch sapling next to a flower now has a chance of spawning a bee nest, once the sapling has grown
169. Water now freezes from the edges, matching the Java Edition
170. Players now receive Conduit Power effect when in the rain ( MCPE-35941 )
171. Podzol is now generated under large Spruce trees when grown by the player
172. The Wither no longer breaks obsidian during its spawning animation ( MCPE-59502 )
173. Fence Gates can now be placed without supporting blocks underneath ( MCPE-31026 )
174. Oak and Birch saplings grown within 2 block radius of a flower now have a 5% chance to grow a tree with a Beehive
175. Updated the texture of Nether Brick blocks
176. Damaged Bows can again be used to craft Dispensers ( MCPE-55861 )
177. Flowers can now be removed from flower pots using interact/right-click
178. Changed Eye of Ender explode particles to match Java Edition
179. Tweaked the texture of the Iron Bars item so they match Java Edition ( MCPE-25802 )
180. Pumpkins can be placed without a support block underneath ( MCPE-35761 )
181. Boats placed on top of Cactus blocks will now take damage and break
182. Observer blocks no longer immediately detect a state change when placed
183. All mobs (including the player) will no longer drown in lava. This means that a potion of water breathing is no longer required for swimming in lava! ( MCPE-17073 )
184. Blocks moving underneath top snow now correctly cause top snow to be destroyed
185. Top snow can now be placed on composters and cauldrons
186. Corrected book render location on lecterns to match Java Edition ( MCPE-43109 )
187. Grindstone now removes repair penalty when removing enchantments ( MCPE-45130 )
188. Particle color for Bad Omen is now dark green
189. Woodland Mansion 'arena' room had incorrect slab type floor ( MCPE-41335 )
190. Cocoa Pods now break when in water ( MCPE-36335 )
191. The Ender Dragon fireball no longer causes excessive damage ( MCPE-40344 )
192. Carrot on a stick, shield, and shovel now lose durability consistently in Bedrock
193. Knockback resistance is now a scale instead of a probability
194. Entities now get pushed by flowing lava
195. The Wither can now be summoned using Soul Soil as a base
196. Creepers now deal damage when in a boat on the water
197. Mobs that panic now do so for all damage types
198. Hoe is now a digger-item and can dig Nether Wart Block, Warped Wart Block, Hay Block, Dried Kelp Block, Target Block and Shroomlight. Hoes can be enchanted like other diggable items
199. Created a new server tab play screen layout to provide more information about third-party servers: Description, screenshots, available games, and news/updates
200. Removed colors from third-party server messages for accessibility purposes
201. Fixed ping latency clarity for players, now provides latency value separate from player count
202. Added messaging to explain what adding a server does
203. Kicking Problem players can be now be removed from your world by pausing and going to the Player Permissions screen Anyone with Operator permissions will be able to kick players. Trusted players can help moderate your world Kicked players will not be able to rejoin LAN games while the world is open
204. Problem players can be now be removed from your world by pausing and going to the Player Permissions screen
205. Anyone with Operator permissions will be able to kick players. Trusted players can help moderate your world
206. Kicked players will not be able to rejoin LAN games while the world is open
207. Kick Command Problem players can also be kicked with the new /kick command, optionally including a reason for kicking The kick command can use target selectors, such as /kick @a [c=-2]
208. Problem players can also be kicked with the new /kick command, optionally including a reason for kicking
209. The kick command can use target selectors, such as /kick @a [c=-2]
210. Banning and Realms Permissions Realm owners can also ban problem players by pausing and going to the Player Permissions screen Realm owners can now change permissions of players in their Realm from the Player Permissions screen The name of the Realm is now shown on the pause screen
211. Realm owners can also ban problem players by pausing and going to the Player Permissions screen

502. The PickupItemsGoal only considers items that the mob can reach When determining whether the goal can be used, we now check whether the mob can reach an item it’s interested in, before committing to it as the target of the goal. This is to avoid mobs getting stuck in this goal after deciding to pick up an item they cannot reach
503. When determining whether the goal can be used, we now check whether the mob can reach an item it’s interested in, before committing to it as the target of the goal. This is to avoid mobs getting stuck in this goal after deciding to pick up an item they cannot reach
504. PickupBasedOnChance variable This new variable was added to be used for monsters that can pick up items sometimes but also preserve mobs that used this goal in the past like Villagers. If this variable is true, the mob will have a calculation done (based on things like time played by the player, game difficulty, and moon brightness) to determine if this is a mob that is allowed to pick up items. That value is only calculated on the mob’s first spawn, which means it is forever saved on that mob and doesn’t change. If the variable is false (which it is by default), the mob will always be able to pick up items using the goal
505. This new variable was added to be used for monsters that can pick up items sometimes but also preserve mobs that used this goal in the past like Villagers. If this variable is true, the mob will have a calculation done (based on things like time played by the player, game difficulty, and moon brightness) to determine if this is a mob that is allowed to pick up items. That value is only calculated on the mob’s first spawn, which means it is forever saved on that mob and doesn’t change. If the variable is false (which it is by default), the mob will always be able to pick up items using the goal
506. CanPickupAnyItem variable The PickupItemsGoal is dependent on the ShareableComponent and the items that are added to its items list. This new variable overrides that list and tells the component that this mob can pick up any item even if it isn’t in the list. Items picked up because of this variable still honor the priority set to items in the list of items, however. This means that any items with a set priority in the list will still be picked up over any item that may be picked up because of this variable. By default, it is set to false
507. The PickupItemsGoal is dependent on the ShareableComponent and the items that are added to its items list. Items picked up because of this variable still honor the priority set to items in the list of items, however. This means that any items with a set priority in the list will still be picked up over any item that may be picked up because of this variable. By default, it is set to false
508. CooldownAfterBeingAttacked variable The variable cooldown_after_being_attacked has been added to the goal, specifying for how many seconds after being attacked the goal should be unavailable. The default value is 0
509. The variable cooldown_after_being_attacked has been added to the goal, specifying for how many seconds after being attacked the goal should be unavailable. The default value is 0

511. Specifying if the mob can equip items that it picks up or put items in its hand, or if it belongs in the inventory
512. Component Variables item/barter - If true the mob will try to activate the barter goal after picking up the item, default value is false item/admire - If true the mob will try to activate the admire goal after picking up the item, default value is false item/consume_item - Specifies if an item should be consumed, for instance Piglins consume (eat) porkchop. Default value is false item/stored_in_inventory - Specifies if the item is desired to be picked up and stored in the mob’s inventory. Default value is false
513. item/barter - If true the mob will try to activate the barter goal after picking up the item, default value is false
514. item/admire - If true the mob will try to activate the admire goal after picking up the item, default value is false
515. item/consume_item - Specifies if an item should be consumed, for instance Piglins consume (eat) porkchop. Default value is false
516. item/stored_in_inventory - Specifies if the item is desired to be picked up and stored in the mob’s inventory. Default value is false
517. The Splash Text loading code has been augmented to allow splash text JSON files to be additive, rather than replacing them completely, and to allow some conditional statements to disable splash text entries. Use a field called "canMerge" that sits next to the "splashes" field, it is a bool that defaults to 'false'. Also, another sibling of "splashes" is "conditional", which is an array of objects. Those objects contain a "requires" field and a "splashes" field. The "splashes" field is an array of strings like the original "splashes" field, and the "requires" field contains three fields - "platforms", "treatments", and "stores", each of which is an array of strings that is compared with the relevant data
518. Made several Bedrock Dedicated Server documentation updates and fixes ( BDS-1084 , BDS-1085 , BDS-2341 , BDS-3051 , BDS-3141 )
519. The "minecraft:density_limit" component is now documented in the Spawn Rules documentation section ( MCPE-61126 )
520. Item tags can now be toggled in the UI using '/gamerule' showtags
521. Added a new loop mode to animations - Now instead of omitting "loop" to have it stop playing when finished, or setting "loop": true to have it loop when finished, you can now say "loop": "hold_on_last_frame" to keep applying the last frame of animation ( MCM-675 )
522. Optimized sound loading - "load_on_low_memory" is now deprecated in sound_definitions.json, as all audio can now play on low memory devices
523. Removed type property from "minecraft:shooter" as it was never used
524. Updated "minecraft:spawn_entity" to have an internal entities object or array
525. Added "attack_chance" to the "minecraft:behavior.defend_village_target" goal
526. Fixed removed or destroyed entities querying as valid in script
527. Invalid items in the "spawn_item" field of a "minecraft:spawn_entity" now display an error
528. "StompEggGoal" no longer uses "search_count" as it now searches all blocks in the specified area
529. Implemented 'AvoidMobTypeDefinition' and converted hardcoded properties to be data-driven
530. A content error will now appear if you provide an invalid item name to 'minecraft:interact' in the 'transform_to_item' field
531. Added documentation for 'minecraft:density_limit' ( MCPE-61126 )
532. Adding a new subject to filters so damage sensors can filter on projectiles
533. Custom brewing recipes can now output non-potion items
534. Implemented a fix to the player's mount that ensures consistent, smooth rotation for all riders
535. Custom bones in geometry now respect their custom parent bones' transformations
536. The 'delayed_attack' behavior no longer causes mobs to freeze when they lose their target
537. Fixed the "MeleeAttackGoal" to allow entities to hit target entities beneath them
538. A content error will now show up if you provide an invalid item name to "minecraft:interact" in the "transform_to_item" field
539. The 'on_unleash' event is now triggered correctly when unleashing from a fence
540. The 'Create New World' button text is now using the global color component
541. Custom entities that use the runtime identifier field now use the custom entity's name rather than the vanilla entity's name ( MCPE-56229 )
542. Fixed collision boxes not updating from the 'collision_box' scripting component
543. Functions with any invalid commands (E.g. incorrect selector syntax) will no longer register and cannot be called ( MCPE-64770 )
544. Fixed an issue where sounds would sometimes have incorrect settings applied to them, causing 2D sounds to play as 3D and vice versa
545. Comments in JSON arrays no longer cause an error ( MCPE-40873 )
546. Entities no longer freeze when a component group containing a navigation component is removed
547. The 'damage_sensor' component will now work on non-mob actors (Such as Ender Crystals)
548. Dispensed splash and lingering potions now have potion effects in their projectile component
549. 'pre_effect_script' no longer runs when an entity is despawning with 'minecraft:despawn'
550. Fixed a bug where custom mobs with the 'runtime_identifier' field set would not return a custom mob spawn egg, if one was available
551. A mob spawned in the air will no longer think it's on the ground once its movement is ticked and the 'on_ground' filter no longer always returns true
552. Bee spawn eggs can now be edited
553. Fixed an issue that could cause the 'minecraft:timer' component to fire prematurely in some conditions
554. Fixed an issue that was causing particle animations to become inverted
555. Using the 'minecraft:pushable' component will no longer break older content
556. Fixed an issue that was preventing animation controllers in Behavior Packs from running on dedicated servers and Realms ( MCPE-59881 )
557. Fixed "navigation.walk" to handle the case where it is used on a flying entity, so that the flying entity will not cause lag while it is touching the ground

> New Features:

**Fixes:**
1. PlayStation®4 Welcome PlayStation®4 players to the Bedrock version of Minecraft! All Bedrock platforms can now cross-play with PS4™ consoles. More information can be found in the Minecraft for PlayStation®4 FAQ .
2. Welcome PlayStation®4 players to the Bedrock version of Minecraft! All Bedrock platforms can now cross-play with PS4™ consoles. More information can be found in the Minecraft for PlayStation®4 FAQ .
3. Bees! Bees are cute, fuzzy, neutral mobs Don’t hurt them, they don’t want to hurt you Bees love pretty flowers and spend their lives gathering pollen from them After gathering pollen, bees fly back to their nest If a bee can't find pollen, it will return home If a bee doesn’t have a home nest, it will wander around until it finds one it can use Bees don’t like the rain and they sleep at night. They will return to their nest in these cases
