1.13.0.title: Minecraft - 1.13.0 (Bedrock)
1.13.0.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.13.0 (Bedrock)**__
> New Features:

**Fixes:**
1. Foxes!
2. Keep your chickens safe and your belongings close, otherwise you’ll find them dead or gone - especially come nightfall. Foxes are more active at night and seek shade to sleep during the day. However, if you’re patient enough to feed two of them Sweet Berries, you can end up with a trusty one!
3. Brown Mooshroom
4. Transforms whenever a red Mooshroom is struck by lightning
5. Feed them flowers and use a bowl to harvest Suspicious Stew!
6. Suspicious Stew
7. Craft stew with different flowers to grant different potion effects for a short period of time
8. Share the suspiciousness with your friends and see how they like Suspicious Stew!
9. Wither Rose
10. A new, scary looking flower that is planted wherever a living entity dies to the Wither
11. Might be useful when crafting Suspicious Stew?
12. Item Frames can now be placed on the floor and ceiling!
13. Added abandoned villages
14. Added a celebration event that occurs if Pillagers successfully raid a village
15. New Note Block instruments
16. Make some sweet new jams by placing certain blocks under Note Blocks!
17. Discover the new instruments with Glowstone, Haybale, Block of Emerald, Pumpkin, Soul Sand, Block of Iron, Bone Block, Wool, Packed Ice, Clay, and Block of Gold
18. Added five dead coral types
19. Added the Light Block for mapmakers
20. Supports auxiliary data from 0 to 15 for light level
21. Light blocks are supported via /give, /fill, and /setblock
22. The invisible End Rod (variant 6) is now automatically updated to the new Light Block
23. Added new in-game chat settings to improve accessibility
24. Added game credits
25. A way to see all the lovely people that work on the game!
26. The credits can be viewed after defeating the Ender Dragon, and also through a new button found in the Settings menu
27. Personalize your character in a number of ways, including body size and shape, limb replacement and tweaking of eyes, mouth, hairstyles and colors, facial hair, and skin tones
28. More than 100 items will be available for free. There will also be a range of custom accessories, created by the Minecraft team, available for purchase
29. Traditional custom skins can still be imported as before, on Windows 10 and mobile, using the following steps: Profile > Edit Character > Classic Skins tab > Owned > Import > Choose New Skin
30. For even more details, check out the Character Creator FAQ
31. New and improved Structure Blocks Structure Blocks give creators the ability to copy and save out sections of their world into structures. Saved structures can then be pasted back into the world To get a Structure Block, you must use the ‘/give’ command When a structure is being loaded in, it can also be mirrored or rotated Structure Void blocks can be placed in an area to not copy air into the target area See How to Play in the game for more details and tips!
32. Structure Blocks give creators the ability to copy and save out sections of their world into structures. Saved structures can then be pasted back into the world
33. To get a Structure Block, you must use the ‘/give’ command
34. When a structure is being loaded in, it can also be mirrored or rotated
35. Structure Void blocks can be placed in an area to not copy air into the target area
36. See How to Play in the game for more details and tips!

339. Changes to Pack Manifests Summary As of 1.13, we have made some changes to the pack manifest with a new format version of "2". We recommend that any new packs or world templates that you create use format version of 2 from now on. With this new format, there are a few additional changes to be aware of, detailed below All Pack Types The 'name' field in the header is now required for all pieces of content World Templates The 'lock_template_options' field is now required. This Boolean field determines whether the world options for your template should be locked to default values when a player creates a world from the template. They can still choose to unlock and modify the options, but will be warned that doing so could affect gameplay The 'base_game_version' field is required (see below for more info) The 'min_engine_version' field should no longer be used as it isn't parsed on world templates and produces a warning on import Resource and Behavior Packs The 'min_engine_version' field is now required. This affects how the game interprets some of the assets loaded from Resource and Behavior Packs. We recommend using the latest available version of the game for this field (e.g. '[1, 13, 0]') to ensure your pack works correctly Base Game Version Field For this field, we recommend using the value "*". This will ensure that anyone using your content in their Minecraft worlds will always get the latest base game (Vanilla) content when an update is available. In the case that your content relies on specific base game behavior, you can use this field to specify a base game version, starting with 1.13. If you choose to do this, you should omit the third octet; for example, if the version of the game you are targeting is '[1, 14, 2]', you would specify a version of '[1, 14, 0]'). If you specify a version this way, any worlds using your custom content will not get new base game content when it becomes available in future releases, which could help prevent unwanted changes to behavior in your content caused by updates to the base game. However, we still recommend using the "*" value to ensure players can continue to enjoy your content in their Minecraft worlds long-term while also receiving updates to the base game

1.12.1.title: Minecraft - 1.12.1 (Bedrock)
1.12.1.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.12.1 (Bedrock)**__
> If you missed a previous update, check outaka.ms/MCChangelogsfor a full list of updates.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed several crashes that could occur during gameplay
2. Fixed players getting stuck on "Generating World" when loading into a world while located in The End ( MCPE-49778 )
3. Fixed an issue that caused many players on Nintendo Switch not being able to sign in to their Microsoft Account ( MCPE-34662 )
4. Multiple Ender Dragons can no longer spawn at once in The End ( MCPE-37590 )

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360032928992-Minecraft-1-12-1-Bedrock

1.12.0.title: Minecraft - 1.12.0 (Bedrock)
1.12.0.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.12.0 (Bedrock)**__
> 

**Fixes:**
1. Increased the frequency and volume of the ambient mob sounds made during raids, to make them easier to locate
2. Added new Wandering Trader sounds ( MCPE-41191 )
3. Updated the main menu splash text
4. Updated the default main menu panorama from Aquatic to Village & Pillage
5. The "Store" button on the main menu has been renamed to "Marketplace"
6. Realm owners can now set relevant permissions for players invited to their Realm
7. Default settings can be set for all new members entering a Realm
8. The owner can set permissions for an invited player to either visitor, member or operator
9. When resetting a world, or uploading a new world, already set permissions stay in place
10. Crashes Fixed several crashes that could occur during gameplay Fixed a crash that could occur when launching the game on some Windows 10 devices Fixed a crash that could occur when certain interactive blocks are loading in when joining a Realm (e.g. beds, chests, furnaces) Fixed a crash that could occur when switching players on Xbox One Fixed a crash that could occur when engaging in a fight with an Elder Guardian in an Ocean Monument Fixed a crash that could occur when loading the game Fixed a crash that could occur when throwing an Egg or Snowball ( MCPE-40435 ) Fixed a crash that could occur when trading with a Villager Fixed a crash that could occur when throwing a trident with Loyalty enchantment Fixed a crash that could occur on Nintendo Switch when the game was saving or loading ( MCPE-45862 ) Fixed a crash on Nintendo Switch that could occur when suspending and resuming the game Fixed a crash that could occur when exiting the game Fixed a crash that could occur when signing into Xbox Live Fixed a crash that could occur when choosing a skin on first launch of the game Fixed a Marketplace issue that could result in the game getting stuck or crashing when loading in items Fixed a crash that could occur when the game was checking for previously downloaded content
11. Fixed several crashes that could occur during gameplay
12. Fixed a crash that could occur when launching the game on some Windows 10 devices
13. Fixed a crash that could occur when certain interactive blocks are loading in when joining a Realm (e.g. beds, chests, furnaces)
14. Fixed a crash that could occur when switching players on Xbox One
15. Fixed a crash that could occur when engaging in a fight with an Elder Guardian in an Ocean Monument
16. Fixed a crash that could occur when loading the game
17. Fixed a crash that could occur when throwing an Egg or Snowball ( MCPE-40435 )
18. Fixed a crash that could occur when trading with a Villager
19. Fixed a crash that could occur when throwing a trident with Loyalty enchantment
20. Fixed a crash that could occur on Nintendo Switch when the game was saving or loading ( MCPE-45862 )
21. Fixed a crash on Nintendo Switch that could occur when suspending and resuming the game
22. Fixed a crash that could occur when exiting the game
23. Fixed a crash that could occur when signing into Xbox Live
24. Fixed a crash that could occur when choosing a skin on first launch of the game
25. Fixed a Marketplace issue that could result in the game getting stuck or crashing when loading in items
26. Fixed a crash that could occur when the game was checking for previously downloaded content
27. Performance Made further performance improvements when opening inventory screens ( MCPE-27167 ) Made several performance improvements related to various UI screens and interactions Significantly reduced bandwidth usage by allowing the client to reuse chunks it has already seen Improved chunk loading performance in multiplayer Improved performance around new villages and villager job sites Several other performance improvements, included some related to mob AI pathfinding Frosted ice blocks no longer drops performance while they’re melting ( MCPE-39698 ) Endermen teleporting particles no longer cause consistent performance drops, especially during boss fights Reduced the amount of memory required to load textures Cached resource packs no longer decrease performance on Nintendo Switch ( MCPE-36976 )
28. Made further performance improvements when opening inventory screens ( MCPE-27167 )
29. Made several performance improvements related to various UI screens and interactions
30. Significantly reduced bandwidth usage by allowing the client to reuse chunks it has already seen
31. Improved chunk loading performance in multiplayer
32. Improved performance around new villages and villager job sites
33. Several other performance improvements, included some related to mob AI pathfinding
34. Frosted ice blocks no longer drops performance while they’re melting ( MCPE-39698 )
35. Endermen teleporting particles no longer cause consistent performance drops, especially during boss fights
36. Reduced the amount of memory required to load textures
37. Cached resource packs no longer decrease performance on Nintendo Switch ( MCPE-36976 )
38. General
39. Removed an unnecessary Xbox Live sign-in notification
40. Fixed an issue where consuming the last item in a stack to unlock an achievement could cause the achievement not to unlock
41. The Haggler achievement once again unlocks when requirements are met
42. The Zombie Doctor achievement now unlocks when curing a zombie villager ( MCPE-46271 )
43. Marketplace resource packs are now immediately applied after downloading in the world edit menu ( MCPE-33121 )
44. Player permissions now apply correctly when more than one operator tries to adjust them
45. Made improvements to roaming skins, which should apply correctly after reloading or reinstalling the game and signing in
46. Custom skins are now applied correctly without needing to restart the game to see them (On compatible platforms) ( MCPE-37926 , MCPE-45476 )
47. Skins equipped from the ‘Recent’ section are once again applied when selected
48. World settings now sync correctly between different Xbox One devices
49. Resource packs are now applied correctly after downloading through the world or global settings
50. Newly purchased Realms are now always visible after finalizing the purchase
51. Fixed an issue that would show an error message when attempting to renew a Realm subscription on Xbox One ( REALMS-1686 )
52. Gameplay
53. Fixed several related issues with End Gateway portals. These should now teleport the player to the correct safe location when used ( MCPE-19699 , MCPE-43176 , MCPE-43177 )
54. Villager trading now properly takes away items from the second slot, when applicable ( MCPE-45506 )
55. Only players who fought in a raid now receive the Hero of the Village effect in Realms
56. The Bad Omen effect is now only received when killing an Illager Captain, not when dealing non-fatal damage with a bow or potion
57. Players no longer see through the world when clipping into blocks after leaving a boat ( MCPE-42593 )

1.11.4.title: Minecraft - 1.11.4 (Bedrock)
1.11.4.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.11.4 (Bedrock)**__
> Additional Fixes from 1.11.3:

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed several crashes on Nintendo Switch that could occur during gameplay, especially surrounding villager job site blocks
2. Fixed issues with Marketplace maps so 'villager_v2' works in command selectors again, targeting both V1 and V2 villagers
3. Fixed the screen flashing white after relaunching the game on Oculus Rift
4. Fixed a crash that could occur when mobs found the nearest attackable mob
5. When converting from V1 to V2, villagers now keep their XP level
6. Villagers cured of zombification can no longer change their profession if they have enough XP ( MCPE-42348 )
7. Another fix for villagers changing their professions when they're not supposed to
8. Fixed pathfinding so when an entity can't float, swim, or be amphibious, it can still walk at the bottom of water
9. Fixed gamertags and gamerpics of Realms members not appearing on the members list
10. The Realms members list no longer returns to the first page when navigating to another page
11. When using commands, the villager and zombie_villager target selectors now target both V1 and V2 mob types

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360028691471-Minecraft-1-11-4-Bedrock

1.11.0.title: Minecraft - Village & Pillage - 1.11.0 (Bedrock)
1.11.0.md:
__**Minecraft - Village & Pillage - 1.11.0 (Bedrock)**__
> Village:

**Fixes:**
1. Updated Villages Many new building types and enhanced village generation Biome specific architecture for plains, desert, savannah, and taiga
2. Many new building types and enhanced village generation
3. Biome specific architecture for plains, desert, savannah, and taiga
4. New Villagers Villagers have new clothing to indicate their level, profession, and biome Added Mason and Nitwit villagers Villagers now sleep in beds Villagers now visit their job sites during the day and go home at night Greatly improved villager pathfinding Villagers in existing worlds will convert to new villagers (if they are not part of a template world) Zombie Villagers now have biome-specific and profession skin layers
5. Villagers have new clothing to indicate their level, profession, and biome
6. Added Mason and Nitwit villagers
7. Villagers now sleep in beds
8. Villagers now visit their job sites during the day and go home at night
9. Greatly improved villager pathfinding
10. Villagers in existing worlds will convert to new villagers (if they are not part of a template world)
11. Zombie Villagers now have biome-specific and profession skin layers
12. Village Job Sites Villagers can now take on a new profession when near a job site block While villagers claim these sites, they also have functions for players Cartography Table - Provides an easier way to copy and enlarge maps. Maps can be locked by using glass panes Grindstone - Used to repair weapons and tools, plus disenchanting Barrel - Stores items like a chest but can still be opened with blocks on top of it Smoker - Cooks food much faster than a furnace Blast Furnace - Faster ore smelting Composter - Adding enough crops will produce bone meal Stonecutter - Easy crafting for stone and cobblestone items Smithing Table and Fletching Table - Functionality coming in a later update

16. Grindstone - Used to repair weapons and tools, plus disenchanting
17. Barrel - Stores items like a chest but can still be opened with blocks on top of it
18. Smoker - Cooks food much faster than a furnace
19. Blast Furnace - Faster ore smelting
20. Composter - Adding enough crops will produce bone meal
21. Stonecutter - Easy crafting for stone and cobblestone items
22. Smithing Table and Fletching Table - Functionality coming in a later update
23. Villager Trading Added brand new villager trades (169044) Villagers now have a visual based trading system and will hold up an item they wish to trade if the player is holding something they want When villagers make trades, they gain experience. When they gain enough experience, they level up. Leveling up unlocks new trades Villagers will resupply their trades when arriving at their job site (172559)

54. Works great as a fireplace in a home, with no fire spread to worry about
55. Throw some food on it and become a campfire cooking pro!
56. Sweet Berries
57. A new source of food
58. Sweet Berry Bushes can be found in Taiga biomes
59. Watch out for thorns!
60. Bamboo Jungle
61. Bamboo is now generated in Jungles and more densely in the new Bamboo Jungle biome
62. New Achievements
63. Plethora of Cats - Befriend twenty stray cats (20G)
64. Kill the Beast! - Defeat a Ravager (30G)
65. Buy Low, Sell High - Trade for the best possible price (50G)
66. Disenchanted - Use a Grindstone to get experience from an enchanted item (20G)
67. We're being attacked - Trigger a Pillager Raid (20G)
68. Sound the Alarm! - Ring the bell with a hostile enemy in the village (20G)
69. I've got a bad feeling about this - Kill a Pillager Captain (20G)
70. Roaming Skin Choice
71. When choosing a skin from a skin pack, the selected skin will now be selected automatically on other Bedrock devices using the same account
72. Some skin packs may not be eligible for roaming selection
73. Accessibility Features
74. Text to Speech can now be enabled to read in-game chat
75. UI Screen Reader can be enabled to say the name of interface controls and their current state
76. Accessibility features can be enabled in Settings
77. Note on World Generation: In order to deliver the coolest generated villages possible, some world seeds may have villages generate in different areas than they used to before this update
78. A fresh new batch of seeds are now available in the Seed Picker when creating a new world
79. Added even more new textures to blocks and items, including stained glass
80. Increased the amount of scaffolding that can be placed out from its initial support
81. Changes to the way cats spawn in villages:
82. Cats now respawn based on number of beds in the village
83. The number of cats = 1/4 the number of beds
84. Cat total caps at 10 cats per village
85. Lecterns now emit a redstone signal when turning pages
86. Darkened portions of the game's menus to provide stronger contrast for accessibility
87. 1.10.0.title: Minecraft - 1.10.0 (Bedrock)
1.10.0.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.10.0 (Bedrock)**__
> Highlights from the 1.10 Update:

**Fixes:**
1. Shields have arrived!
2. New features including the Texture Update, crossbows, lanterns, and the loom
3. Many experimental features coming in the Village & Pillage Update (1.11)
4. The ability to create new entities using Add-Ons
5. Several gameplay tweaks
6. Hundreds of bug fixes
7. Shields! Shields! Shields! A long-requested community feature has made its way to Minecraft Shields can be used to block enemy attacks Sneaking activates the shield when equipped in either hand
8. A long-requested community feature has made its way to Minecraft
9. Shields can be used to block enemy attacks
10. Sneaking activates the shield when equipped in either hand
11. Texture Update Many items, blocks, and more have fresh new textures! More updates to textures and tweaks will be arriving in the upcoming 1.11 update
12. Many items, blocks, and more have fresh new textures!
13. More updates to textures and tweaks will be arriving in the upcoming 1.11 update
14. Crossbow weapon with new enchantments Multishot Piercing Quick Charge
15. Multishot
16. Piercing
17. Quick Charge
18. New Wood blocks and Stripped Wood blocks Known to many players as Bark blocks Existing wood blocks have been renamed to Logs and Stripped Logs
19. Known to many players as Bark blocks
20. Existing wood blocks have been renamed to Logs and Stripped Logs
21. Lantern A new light source that can be placed above or below blocks
22. A new light source that can be placed above or below blocks
23. Lectern Place a Book and Quill or Written Book on the lectern, which will allow multiple players to read it together A Book and Quill can be read, but not edited when placed on a lectern Redstone functionality will come in a later update
24. Place a Book and Quill or Written Book on the lectern, which will allow multiple players to read it together
25. A Book and Quill can be read, but not edited when placed on a lectern
26. Redstone functionality will come in a later update
27. Loom A much easier method to create banners! The Loom only uses one dye to apply a pattern. It can also use Banner Patterns to apply special patterns Banner Patterns can be crafted using Paper and various items Pressing the help button links to the relevant How to Play section for more information
28. A much easier method to create banners!
29. The Loom only uses one dye to apply a pattern. It can also use Banner Patterns to apply special patterns
30. Banner Patterns can be crafted using Paper and various items
31. Pressing the help button links to the relevant How to Play section for more information
32. Jellie Winner of the community cat contest! A new cat variant that can be found in villages
33. Winner of the community cat contest!
34. A new cat variant that can be found in villages
35. Pillagers A new illager mob that engages players and villagers with ranged attacks In the 1.10 update, pillagers are only available in Creative Mode Further functionality and spawning in Survival Mode will be released in the 1.11 update
36. A new illager mob that engages players and villagers with ranged attacks
37. In the 1.10 update, pillagers are only available in Creative Mode
38. Further functionality and spawning in Survival Mode will be released in the 1.11 update
39. New Achievement: Fruit on the Loom Make a banner using a Enchanted Apple Stencil (20G)
40. Make a banner using a Enchanted Apple Stencil (20G)
41. New Villages Many new building types and enhanced village generation Villagers have new clothing to indicate their level, profession, and biome Villagers can now take on a new profession when near a job site block Villagers now have their own schedules throughout the day Villagers now mingle together around bells in a village Villagers now sleep in beds Improved villager pathfinding Added Mason and Nitwit villagers Villagers will attempt to find a door when it rains during the day, but will navigate to their bed at night Villagers now have a visual based trading system and will hold up an item they wish to trade if the player is holding something they want Zombie Villagers now have biome-specific and profession skin layers Bells may spawn in villages, with more functionality coming in a future update

Minecraft Script Engine The Minecraft Script Engine uses the JavaScript language Several bug fixes and updates are listed at the end of this changelog Scripts can be written and bundled with Behavior Packs to listen and respond to game events, get and modify data in components that entities have, and affect different parts of the game. See the Minecraft Wiki for reference guides and sample packs This functionality is currently only available on Windows 10 PCs when using Experimental Gameplay

1.9.0.title: Minecraft - 1.9.0 (Bedrock)
1.9.0.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.9.0 (Bedrock)**__
> Changes:

**Fixes:**
1. Added new flowers: Lily of the Valley and Cornflower
2. Added new signs for spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, and dark oak
3. Added new stair, slab, and wall variants: Stone stairs and slabs Granite stairs, slabs, and walls Polished Granite stairs and slabs Diorite stairs, slabs, and walls Polished Diorite stairs and slabs Andesite stairs, slabs, and walls Polished Andesite stairs and slabs Sandstone walls Smooth Red Sandstone stairs and slabs Smooth Quartz stairs and slabs Brick walls Stone Brick walls Mossy Stone Brick stairs, slabs, and walls Nether Brick walls End Stone Brick stairs, slabs, and walls Prismarine walls Red Sandstone walls Red Nether Brick stairs, slabs, and walls Smooth Sandstone stairs and slabs Mossy Cobblestone stairs and slabs
4. Stone stairs and slabs
5. Granite stairs, slabs, and walls
6. Polished Granite stairs and slabs
7. Diorite stairs, slabs, and walls
8. Polished Diorite stairs and slabs
9. Andesite stairs, slabs, and walls
10. Polished Andesite stairs and slabs
11. Sandstone walls
12. Smooth Red Sandstone stairs and slabs
13. Smooth Quartz stairs and slabs
14. Brick walls
15. Stone Brick walls
16. Mossy Stone Brick stairs, slabs, and walls
17. Nether Brick walls
18. End Stone Brick stairs, slabs, and walls
19. Prismarine walls
20. Red Sandstone walls
21. Red Nether Brick stairs, slabs, and walls
22. Smooth Sandstone stairs and slabs
23. Mossy Cobblestone stairs and slabs
24. Added a new option to the /gamerule commands called 'showDeathMessages' which allows players to select whether a message appears in chat when a player or tamed mob dies
25. Added new "Immediate Respawn" option with associated /gamerule
26. New feedback button in the pause menu - shows links to the Minecraft feedback site, MoJira bug tracker, and Mojang support
27. Added several new loading screen tips and trivia suggested by the community!
28. Added several new splash texts to the main menu
29. Added the ability to delete expired Realms from your worlds list
30. Cauldrons can now hold Lava
31. Tripwires are now activated when broken, unless broken with shears
32. A notification is now sent to chat when a tamed animal dies ( MCPE-35138 )
33. How to Play button is now visible from the in-game settings menu
34. Minecraft Script Engine The Minecraft Script Engine uses the JavaScript language Scripts can be written and bundled with Behavior Packs to listen and respond to game events, get and modify data in components that entities have, and affect different parts of the game. See the Minecraft Wiki for reference guides and sample packs This functionality is currently only available on Windows 10 PCs
35. The Minecraft Script Engine uses the JavaScript language
36. Scripts can be written and bundled with Behavior Packs to listen and respond to game events, get and modify data in components that entities have, and affect different parts of the game.
37. See the Minecraft Wiki for reference guides and sample packs
38. This functionality is currently only available on Windows 10 PCs
39. Pillagers
40. Bamboo is now generated in Jungle biomes
41. Lanterns
42. New block placeholders: (Functionality will come in a later update) Cartography Table Fletching Table Grindstone Bell Barrel Smithing Table Smoker Blast Furnace
43. Cartography Table
44. Fletching Table
45. Grindstone
46. Bell
47. Barrel
48. Smithing Table
49. Smoker
50. Blast Furnace
51. Crossbow weapon with new enchantments: Multishot Piercing Quick Charge
52. Multishot
53. Piercing
54. Quick Charge
55. Updated templates for 1.9.0 with new resources and behaviors can be downloaded from net/addons
56. Added tags - Custom tags can be applied to entities and players to create more flexible selector groupings
57. Added "has_tag" filter in components to allow checks to see if an entity has a specified tag
58. Autocomplete in chat can be used for Tags
59. The number of commands run through functions can be limited with the new gamerule 'functioncommandlimit' (default 10k) to limit performance issues
60. Functions can now be run every tick, creating an update loop
61. Template worlds with locked world settings now will also lock player permissions. As a reminder, either can be unlocked from the world settings screen
62. Added an option in the manifest for any world template to lock the world settings and player permissions (previously only available to Adventure templates). The new field is `lock_template_options` which has a default value of `true` for an Adventure template and a default value of `false` for other template types
63. Implemented support for raw JSON text in commands, signs, titles, and books
64. Implemented 'Translate' parameter for Raw JSON text, allowing creators to define strings in multiple languages and serve the correct string to the player based on their set language (if the string is defined in that language)
65. Crashes/Performance Fixed several crashes that occurred during gameplay Fixed a crash that could occur when replacing a wooden door with an iron door ( MCPE-37941 ) Fixed a crash that could occur when using Pick Block on a chest filled with written books Fixed a crash that could occur when pistons pushed blocks Fixed a crash that could happen when changing network modes on Nintendo Switch Fixed a crash that could occur when removing Gear VR headset during gameplay Fixed a crash that could occur when quickly signing in and out of Xbox Live Fixed a crash that could occur when resuming the game on mobile devices Fixed a crash that occurred when resuming the game on Windows 10 Mobile devices Fixed a crash that could occur after exiting the settings screen Fixed a bug where the game could become unresponsive after being disconnected from a multiplayer game Shulker boxes in item frames no longer cause the game to crash Optimizations to chunk synchronization between client and server

69. Fixed a crash that could occur when pistons pushed blocks

77. Shulker boxes in item frames no longer cause the game to crash
78. Optimizations to chunk synchronization between client and server
79. General Players can now join and play games with a minor version mismatch ( MCPE-38945 ) Players can no longer change their customized player permissions while playing multiplayer games
80. Players can now join and play games with a minor version mismatch ( MCPE-38945 )

82. Gameplay Fixed players spawning in mid-air and falling to their death when loading a world ( MCPE-38374 ) Fixed touch controls so players no longer get stuck in sneak position when underwater ( MCPE-38212 ) Fixed an issue that could cause a sudden change in direction on touch screen devices ( MCPE-35910 ) End gateway portals now work correctly, even if the destination area has already been generated ( MCPE-19699 ) Fixed an issue with End gateway portals which could generate too closely, preventing travel back to the main island Defeating the Ender Dragon now drops the correct amount of XP and generates a Dragon Egg in converted worlds ( MCPE-28864 ) Auto-jump now works when trying to walk through scaffolding ( MCPE-38342 ) Fixed breaking blocks when trying to fire a crossbow on touch screen devices ( MCPE-38465 ) Touch controls now work correctly with scaffolding when using the 'swap jump and sneak' setting ( MCPE-38063 ) Fixed a rare instance of players being teleported into a boat while traveling near water

Items Fixed a bug that could result in lost items when crafting from the recipe book with a full inventory ( MCPE-39621 ) Vines collected with silk touch tools can be used correctly in banner designs ( MCPE-35134 ) Dropped items are now correctly displaced by slabs and glass ( MCPE-12025 ) Dragon's Breath can now be quickly collected reliably in multiplayer games ( MCPE-37815 ) Crossbows no longer fire accidentally when interacting with blocks or mobs on touch screen devices ( MCPE-38321 ) Charged crossbows can now be used to melee attack mobs ( MCPE-38314 )

100. Mobs Cats now spawn in villages generated prior to the 1.8.0 update Shulker boxes now push mobs when opening ( MCPE-22480 ) Pandas now panic when set on fire Slimes will once again spawn in slime chunks as expected ( MCPE-38388 ) Endermen now make the scream sound when angered ( MCPE-26719 ) Phantoms now drop membranes correctly if killed with a fire aspect sword ( MCPE-38493 ) Skeleton jockeys now sit correctly on spiders and skeleton horses ( MCPE-40057 ) Fixed the position of riders on mounts that allow multiple passengers

1.8.0.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.8.0 (Bedrock)**__
> (Only available when Experimental Gameplay is enabled in world settings)

**Fixes:**
1. Pandas now spawn in jungles where they roll, lounge, and laze around!
2. Stray cats now spawn in villages Cats can be tamed using fish Ocelots are no longer tameable Players can now feed ocelots to gain their trust
3. Cats can be tamed using fish
4. Ocelots are no longer tameable
5. Players can now feed ocelots to gain their trust
6. Bamboo can now be found while fishing in jungles and will appear in some chests (Spawning naturally in the world will come in a future update)
7. Scaffolding - A climbable block that can be crafted using bamboo
8. New Achievements Where have you been? - Receive a gift from a tamed cat in the morning (20G) Top of the World - Place scaffolding to the word limit (20G) Zoologist - Breed two pandas with bamboo (40G)
9. Where have you been? - Receive a gift from a tamed cat in the morning (20G)
10. Top of the World - Place scaffolding to the word limit (20G)
11. Zoologist - Breed two pandas with bamboo (40G)
12. Added randomTickSpeed game rule
13. Updated templates for 1.8.0 with new assets and behaviors can be downloaded from minecraft.net/addons
14. Updates to Add-Ons that allow players to add new entities, particles, and animations. See aka.ms/MinecraftAddons for more details and enable Experimental Gameplay in your world!
15. Functions have come to Bedrock! Functions allow players to write the commands their worlds use in an external file, not just Command Blocks. See the Minecraft Wiki for more information
16. Crossbow weapon with new enchantments Multishot Piercing Quick Charge
17. Multishot
18. Piercing
19. Quick Charge
20. Phantoms are now afraid of cats and will not swoop down while cats are around
21. Increased the size of Tropical fish ( MCPE-35877 )
22. Skeleton Horse and Zombie Horse foals now have a chance of being spawned using a spawn egg
23. Added a crafting recipe for Packed Ice
24. Separated Bone Meal, Ink Sac, Cocoa Beans, and Lapis Lazuli into their own dyes and unified all dye names
25. The splash screen now has an animated loading bar
26. The following commands can now be run in-game without enabling cheats: /gamerule showcoordinates /gamerule dofiretick /gamerule tntexplodes /gamerule domobloot /gamerule naturalregeneration /gamerule dotiledrops /gamerule pvp
27. /gamerule showcoordinates
28. /gamerule dofiretick
29. /gamerule tntexplodes
30. /gamerule domobloot
31. /gamerule naturalregeneration
32. /gamerule dotiledrops
33. /gamerule pvp
34. A warning now appears when attempting to change settings on a world template, as it could change the creator's intended experience
35. Command blocks now have the default name of ! instead of @
36. More skin packs are now shown in the skin picker menu, and each pack can be opened and viewed in its own page
37. The autocomplete list for player mentions now works in slash commands
38. The Remix3D upload service on Windows 10 is no longer available, but creations can still be exported as .glb 3D Object files
39. Text-to-Speech can now be enabled on Nintendo Switch
40. Minecraft Marketplace: Content can now be sorted by 'Updates Available' in your inventory Content can now be sorted and filtered by rating when browsing the Marketplace Bundles of content can now be purchased
41. Content can now be sorted by 'Updates Available' in your inventory
42. Content can now be sorted and filtered by rating when browsing the Marketplace
43. Bundles of content can now be purchased
44. Crashes/Performance Fixed several crashes that occurred during gameplay Fixed a crash that would occur if the player was disconnected while loading resource packs Fixed a crash that would occur on Xbox One if the player signed out too quickly after signing in Fixed a crash that could occur during the splash loading screen on Windows 10 Mobile Fixed a crash that could occur on startup for Gear VR Fixed a crash that could occur due to a recent Windows 10 update ( MCPE-36274 ) Fixed a crash that occurred when hovering over a renamed firework charge ( MCPE-37822 ) Using a bucket of fish in a dispenser no longer crashes the game ( MCPE-38194 ) Fixed a crash that would occur when using lava buckets on fish Fixed a crash that could occur when kelp grows Fixed a crash that could occur when suspending and resuming the game on the main menu (154576) Fixed a crash that could occur in worlds that contained locator maps Fixed a crash that could occur when leaving the Realms settings screen Fixed a crash that could occur when downloading or saving data on Nintendo Switch Fixed a crash that could occur on Switch when split screen players broke a large chest Fixed a crash that occurred when killing and summoning a salmon with its navigation component removed Improved performance on some devices with less available memory Fixed a bug where multiple UI screens could be opened at once, causing the game to crash Shulker boxes that contain tropical fish buckets no longer cause performance issues ( MCPE-27167 ) Fixed a bug that caused a significant performance drop when rendering chunks ( MCPE-37192 ) Improved the loading time of various game files Fixed delayed touch response on the bottom of the screen on iOS ( MCPE-29718 )

1.7.1.title: Minecraft - 1.7.1 (Bedrock)
1.7.1.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.7.1 (Bedrock)**__
> This hotfix is available only on Xbox One and Windows 10, as the fixes only apply to those platforms. It is still multiplayer compatible with other devices running version 1.7.0.

**Fixes:**
1. Fixed several crashes that occurred during gameplay
2. Fixed a crash that occurred when attempting to launch Code Connection with Minecraft for Windows 10

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360019026771-Minecraft-1-7-1-Bedrock

1.7.0.title: Minecraft - 1.7.0 (Bedrock)
1.7.0.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.7.0 (Bedrock)**__
> 

**Fixes:**
1. Added basic Scoreboard functionality - More Scoreboard features will be coming in later releases
2. Food can now be eaten in Creative mode and Peaceful difficulty
3. Mentions of player names are now highlighted yellow in chat
4. Typing "@" in chat will show an autocomplete list of player names
5. Command Block functionality can now be toggled using the 'commandblocksenabled' game rule
6. Made it easier to find purchased content, search, and go home from the top of the Marketplace screen
7. You can now send links to your favourite Marketplace content using the share button
8. Improved search results, sorting, and filtering in the Marketplace
9. Crashes/Performance Fixed the cause of over 20 crashes that could occur during gameplay Fixed a crash that occurred when a Trident with Channeling was shot from a Dispenser and hit a mob or player during a thunderstorm Fixed a crash that occurred when breaking a door that many Villagers were trying to open or enter ( MCPE-34742 ) Fixed a crash that occurred when using a 128x Resource Pack on Nintendo Switch Fixed a crash that occurred when attempting to stack Explorer Maps when trading with a Cartographer Villager Fixed a crash that occurred when loading the settings screen right after loading a resource pack Fixed a crash that occurred when backing out of a Realm's edit menu after attempting to download a world but not having enough free space
10. Fixed the cause of over 20 crashes that could occur during gameplay
11. Fixed a crash that occurred when a Trident with Channeling was shot from a Dispenser and hit a mob or player during a thunderstorm
12. Fixed a crash that occurred when breaking a door that many Villagers were trying to open or enter ( MCPE-34742 )
13. Fixed a crash that occurred when using a 128x Resource Pack on Nintendo Switch
14. Fixed a crash that occurred when attempting to stack Explorer Maps when trading with a Cartographer Villager
15. Fixed a crash that occurred when loading the settings screen right after loading a resource pack
16. Fixed a crash that occurred when backing out of a Realm's edit menu after attempting to download a world but not having enough free space
17. General Fixed an exploit that allowed custom skins with custom and invisible geometry, causing unfair advantages in multiplayer sessions ( MCPE-37343 ) Added additional messaging to disable Multiplayer in world settings to play split-screen without a Nintendo Switch Online membership Guests rejoining in a different order than they joined for the first time no longer generate different progress during split-screen gameplay Synced cloud worlds on Xbox One now display the proper date on the Worlds list Fixed player permission issues that prevented players from building or mining Fixed Super Mario Mash-up Pack worlds not opening if created before version 1.6.0 ( MCPE-37327 ) Fixed textures not applying on Nintendo Switch when the world is hosted on another platform Fixed split-screen players not being able to join Local Network games on Nintendo Switch Fixed Microsoft Account sign-in failures on Nintendo Switch
18. Fixed an exploit that allowed custom skins with custom and invisible geometry, causing unfair advantages in multiplayer sessions ( MCPE-37343 )
19. Added additional messaging to disable Multiplayer in world settings to play split-screen without a Nintendo Switch Online membership
20. Guests rejoining in a different order than they joined for the first time no longer generate different progress during split-screen gameplay
21. Synced cloud worlds on Xbox One now display the proper date on the Worlds list
22. Fixed player permission issues that prevented players from building or mining
23. Fixed Super Mario Mash-up Pack worlds not opening if created before version 1.6.0 ( MCPE-37327 )
24. Fixed textures not applying on Nintendo Switch when the world is hosted on another platform
25. Fixed split-screen players not being able to join Local Network games on Nintendo Switch
26. Fixed Microsoft Account sign-in failures on Nintendo Switch
27. Gameplay Crouching on ladders will no longer stop when opening the pause menu or inventory screen ( MCPE-33209 ) Swimming while moving the camera with touch controls no longer breaks blocks ( MCPE-33470 ) Items can once again be dropped while in a boat The Looting III enchantment once again increases mob loot drop chances ( MCPE-35307 ) When a player equips a carved pumpkin as a helmet, that player's marker now disappears from the Locator Maps of other players Players no longer teleport to vehicles/mobs that are hit by an Ender Pearl when the vehicle/mob is in the player's render distance Fixed players getting stuck in the edges of Old Worlds at 128 or in the Void When dealing a killing blow to mobs using Knockback, they now actually get knocked back! ( MCPE-19222 )
28. Crouching on ladders will no longer stop when opening the pause menu or inventory screen ( MCPE-33209 )
29. Swimming while moving the camera with touch controls no longer breaks blocks ( MCPE-33470 )
30. Items can once again be dropped while in a boat
31. The Looting III enchantment once again increases mob loot drop chances ( MCPE-35307 )
32. When a player equips a carved pumpkin as a helmet, that player's marker now disappears from the Locator Maps of other players
33. Players no longer teleport to vehicles/mobs that are hit by an Ender Pearl when the vehicle/mob is in the player's render distance
34. Fixed players getting stuck in the edges of Old Worlds at 128 or in the Void
35. When dealing a killing blow to mobs using Knockback, they now actually get knocked back! ( MCPE-19222 )
36. Items Enchantment Books are no longer lost after using an Anvil to rename an item and adding an incompatible enchantment Tridents with Loyalty no longer get lost in the void when used in the End Raw Cod and Cooked Cod items are now properly named Phantom spawn eggs can now be obtained using Pick Block Players using controllers can again drop held items while in a minecart Leads no longer detach and disappear when reentering a world ( MCPE-33263 ) Infinity Bow arrows are no longer picked up immediately after being fired when the Bow is slightly drawn ( MCPE-35821 ) Renamed spawn eggs now produce renamed mobs Flaming arrows once again ignite Minecarts with TNT ( MCPE-35776 )

93. Autofill commands now recognize a player name in brackets and places it between quotes ( MCPE-34913 )
94. The '/teleport' command now reliably teleports riders with entities
95. The '/subtitle' command can now run whilst a title is visible on screen ( MCPE-25685 )
96. Updated templates for 1.7.0 with new assets and behaviors can be downloaded from minecraft.net/addons
97. Using behavior files to change the shooting location of a projectile no longer makes the projectile shoot and miss the target
98. Mobs now stop moving when all movement components are removed from their behavior
99. The 'can_float' component now works properly with 'minecraft:navigation.float' on flying mobs

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360017865652-Minecraft-1-7-0-Bedrock

**Fixes:**

> We are releasing an early access alpha of the dedicated server for Minecraft. Download the server binaries ataka.ms/MinecraftBDSfor either Windows or Linux and go host your own servers and play with your friends.

**Fixes:**
1. Added a button to clear login credentials if a Microsoft Account sign-in fails on Nintendo Switch
2. Phantoms now definitely swoop down and attack people so watch out! ( MCPE-36673 )
3. Fixed blocks often disappearing after being placed or reappearing after being destroyed ( MCPE-31596 )
4. Increased performance on iOS devices
5. Several fixes to reduce lag in multiplayer games and Realms
6. Updated templates for 1.6.1 with new assets and behaviors can be downloaded from minecraft.net/addons , including fixes to the Phantom's swooping behavior

1.6.0.title: Minecraft - 1.6.0 (Bedrock)
1.6.0.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.6.0 (Bedrock)**__
> 

**Fixes:**
1. Phantom mobs will now spawn in the night skies if a player hasn't slept in over three in-game days. (Please note that there is a bug currently where phantoms may not swoop down- we will be fixing this bug as soon as we can!)
2. Barrier Blocks
3. Great for map makers to limit players and mobs to certain areas of the world
4. Can be placed in Creative mode and are invisible in Survival and Adventure modes
5. Can only be obtained using commands and do not appear in the Creative inventory
6. Menu and inventory tabs can now be navigated using the [ and ] keys (Can be remapped in Settings)
7. Pages can now be turned in the Book & Quill using the controller bumper buttons
8. Personal Game Mode is now set to the Default Game Mode option when first joining a world
9. Added the 'doinsomnia' game rule to toggle Phantom spawning when commands are enabled
10. Added fresh new icons to game invite and achievement notifications on Nintendo Switch
11. Adjusted mouse input sensitivity for slower turning at lower values
12. Crashes/Performance
13. Fixed several crashes that occurred during gameplay
14. Fixed a crash that occurred when using Pick Block in a spot where a mob just died
15. Fixed a crash that occurred when players were spawning and the spawn point was getting set every tick
16. Fixed a crash that occurred when joining a game and downloading Greek Mythology textures
17. Increased performance for menu load times
18. General
19. Fixed the "Ahoy” and "Atlantis" achievements not unlocking on Nintendo Switch
20. Fixed an issue that caused touch screen actions to repeat after touch release
21. Fixed controls becoming unresponsive after resuming the game from standby ( MCPE-22195 )
22. Operator permissions are now granted to players when the host creates a world with Trust Player Permissions set to Operator
23. Fixed the upload failure that occurred when exporting to Remix3D
24. Gameplay
25. Firework Rockets once again give the proper boost when using Elytra ( MCPE-30821 )
26. Crouching on ladders will no longer stop when opening the pause menu or inventory screen
27. Fixed the speed boost given by Dolphins being too slow when wearing armor with Depth Strider
28. The Resistance effect will now protect against the Wither effect ( MCPE-21515 )
29. Players no longer clip through blocks and suffocate while swimming ( MCPE-34112 )
30. Players are now able to return to the Overworld if an End Portal is on their spawn point (96153)
31. Items
32. Buckets now stack properly when getting ejected from crafting output
33. Fixed an exploit that allowed players to obtain a 'Water' item ( MCPE-28883 )
34. Fixed an exploit that allowed items to be duplicated using the Recipe Book ( MCPE-36167 )
35. Mobs
36. Guardians no longer attack fish (125705)
37. Fixed Guardians spawning even when Mob Spawning is disabled ( MCPE-34027 )
38. Fixed issues with the Ender Dragon disappearing or dying for little to no reason
39. Drowned now have a much easier time attacking players that are swimming above them
40. Fixed Strays and Skeletons having trouble leaving the water to attack players
41. Wolves no longer get stuck attacking Skeletons that are underwater
42. Fixed a bug where Parrots could ride Donkeys and Mules ( MCPE-25737 )
43. Blazes now attack Snow Golems ( MCPE-13191 )
44. Elder Guardians now drop Wet Sponges when killed
45. Fixed monster spawners appearing empty on converted Console Edition worlds
46. Hostile mobs in boats can no longer attack from every angle ( MCPE-16938 )
47. Dolphins can no longer attack players through solid blocks
48. Baby Horses, Donkeys and Mules can no longer be pushed through solid blocks ( MCPE-20114 )
49. Creepers no longer remain white or quickly flash when killed
50. Entities following a target entity will now navigate properly over slabs
51. Used chests can now be equipped to Mules and Llamas ( MCPE-32152 )
52. Blocks
53. Underwater plants can now be placed in water columns that originate from the top water source blocks
54. Kelp now mimics Seagrass in its placement and can be placed on most blocks underwater ( MCPE-33747 )
55. Kelp that is planted by players will now grow over time
56. Chemistry blocks in a world uploaded to a Realm are no longer corrupted
57. Observers will now detect changes with Droppers, Dispensers, Brewing Stands, Farmland, Saplings, Sugar Cane, Fire, and Grass blocks
58. The amount of fuel in Brewing Stands now converts from Console Edition worlds ( MCPE-34677 )
59. Activating an End Portal will now replace any blocks inside the portal ( MCPE-28344 )
60. Fixed certain variants of Rails having an incorrect hitbox size
61. Land plants can no longer be placed underwater ( MCPE-34124 )
62. Command Blocks now correctly conduct Redstone power ( MCPE-33021 )
63. Fixed an issue that allowed rails to be duplicated ( MCPE-18230 )
64. Fixed the Cactus hitbox being displayed too low
65. Realms
66. The owner of a Realm, once again, no longer counts towards the player limit of a Realm
67. Improved error messaging when attempting to join a Realm via invite link with an outdated version of the game
68. World Generation
69. Fixed floating Rails that generated in abandoned mineshafts ( MCPE-23189 )
70. Graphical
71. Improved the Trident throwing animation
72. Visibility now increases over time when submerged in flowing water
73. Cocoa Beans now display correctly when using HD Resource Packs ( MCPE-30552 )
74. Field of View can once again be adjusted when the "FOV Can Be Altered by Gameplay" option is disabled ( MCPE-32403 )
75. Redstone dust now renders on the sides of Glass blocks ( MCPE-21542 )
76. Resource packs once again apply when joining a multiplayer game that has a pack enabled ( MCPE-33770 )
77. Fixed Texture Packs having a placeholder icon on the Pack Validation screen on Android devices
78. The Ender Dragon is no longer missing the texture on its neck when playing the Norse Mythology Mash-up Pack ( MCPE-33966 )
79. Food particles no longer gradually change position after swimming and will always come out of the player's mouth area ( MCPE-33984 )
80. Fixed a rare case of Ender Chests from Console Edition worlds converting to normal Chests with Ender particles ( MCPE-26717 )
81. Leads no longer flicker when playing in split-screen multiplayer
82. Particles from Enchanted Arrows no longer drift in flowing water
83. Water Bottle icons no longer have red liquid on Android devices. It wasn't creepy or anything ( MCPE-34167 )
84. Players no longer appear to be floating above Minecarts ( MCPE-33787 )
85. Swimming through certain waterlogged blocks no longer removes underwater fog ( MCPE-33917 )
86. Oculus Rift mirror screen view now displays properly on monitors with 4K resolution
87. Audio
88. Lowered the volume of the 'punching air' and 'punching mobs' sound effects
89. Fixed the sounds of items breaking twice for Boats, Minecarts, Paintings, and Armor Stands
90. User Interface
91. Items can once again be crafted from the Recipe Book while the Craftable filter is disabled and the player only has enough materials to craft a single recipe
92. Quickly moving a stack of items in the inventory with a controller no longer leaves items behind ( MCPE-34694 )
93. Fixed the Cancel button not appearing on Windows 10 devices when joining a cross-platform world
94. Opening Book & Quill on touch devices no longer causes blocks to break ( MCPE-29752 )
95. The gamepad cursor can now be used to navigate Villager trades ( MCPE-33330 )
96. Multiple items can now be collected from the Villager trading output slot ( MCPE-32635 )
97. Fixed overlapping issues with the Dragon Head equipped on the inventory screen
98. The Crafting Table's output field hover state now matches the field's size
99. Quick moving items from the hotbar to a container now works as intended ( MCPE-19952 )
100. Hitting the Enter key in the inventory no longer moves the cursor in/out of the text field or grabs/drops items
101. Selecting the output of an uncraftable recipe no longer causes the output item to disappear
102. Fixed inconsistent behavior when Attack/Destroy is mapped to Right-Click on the mouse ( MCPE-23383 )
103. Levers now have a "Use" controller hint
104. Commands
105. Using '/fill doors' now fills the chosen area with doors instead of air blocks
106. Using the '/setblock' command on Redstone components will now properly update and power the mechanism ( MCPE-21218 )
107. Cloning containers no longer removes their custom names
108. Slabs with 'can_place_on' tags can once again be placed by players in Adventure mode
109. Updated templates for 1.6.0 with new assets and behaviors can be downloaded from minecraft.net/addons
110. Fixed several issues with Fish textures that pertained to Resource Packs
111. 'minecraft:behavior.player_ride_tamed' will now override all other AI goals
112. 'movement.sway' once again allows mobs to move properly

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360015202451-Minecraft-1-6-0-Bedrock

1.5.3.title: Minecraft - 1.5.3 (Bedrock)
1.5.3.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.5.3 (Bedrock)**__
> Some players may have lost their item inventories and character progress after updating to 1.5.0. To recover inventory from a player that was lost, you will need to:

**Fixes:**
1. Have had a Microsoft account or Nintendo account tied to that player when you last saw the player with its previous inventory. Without this, your data cannot be recovered
2. Do not uninstall/reinstall the game on the machine you last saw your old inventory on – this will destroy the cached data needed to recover your lost inventory. Merely updating the game should be fine
3. Log in to the same server, which has been upgraded to 1.5.3, from the same machine you last saw your old player/inventory on
4. Be in an area which allows for chests to safely spawn. If you aren’t, the game should inform you, and try again the next time you log in
5. Xbox One worlds that were not appearing after updating to 1.5 will once again appear on the Worlds screen ( MCPE-35364 )
6. Fixed several crashes that occurred during gameplay
7. Fixed a crash that could occur for the host when another player leaves the game
8. Fixed a crash that could occur when joining a world that was converted from Xbox One Edition
9. Fixed a crash that occurred when placing renamed items in an Anvil's output slot
10. Fixed an exploit that allowed custom skins with custom and invisible geometry, causing unfair advantages in multiplayer sessions

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360012149892-Minecraft-1-5-3-Bedrock

1.5.0.title: Minecraft - 1.5.0 (Bedrock)
1.5.0.md:
__**Minecraft - 1.5.0 (Bedrock)**__
> New Features:

**Fixes:**
1. Realms are now available on Nintendo Switch
2. The Drowned - These dangerous, underwater zombies lurk in dark, deep water and will come up to the shore at night
3. Sea Turtles - These gentle creatures can be found swimming in oceans and tanning on beaches. Protect their eggs so more can hatch!
4. Turtle Shell and Scute items
5. Potion of the Turtle Master
6. Nautilus Shells - Can be found while fishing or held by the Drowned
7. Conduits can now be constructed underwater and give players the Conduit Power effect. Craft them with Nautilus Shells & Heart of the Sea
8. Bubble Columns - Magma Blocks create downward flowing columns and Soul Sand creates upward flowing bubbles
9. New Achievements
10. One Pickle, Two Pickle, Sea Pickle, Four - Place four Sea Pickles in a group (20G)
11. Echolocation - Feed a dolphin fish to have it lead you to treasure (20G)
12. Do a Barrel Roll! - Use Riptide to give yourself a boost (30G)
13. Moskstraumen - Activate a Conduit (50G)
14. Added new commands that only affect worlds with Education Edition enabled:
15. /ability - Sets a player's ability
16. /immutableworld - Sets the immutable state of the world
17. /worldbuilder - Toggle World Builder status of caller
18. Changed the menu background to be themed for Update Aquatic
19. Undead mobs will now sink in water and can walk on the bottom
20. Improved the steering of Boats when using keyboard and mouse by pressing W to move forward and S to reverse
21. Dolphins can now be given Raw Fish or Raw Salmon and will swim towards the nearest Ocean Ruins or Shipwreck
22. Husks that have sunk in water will now transform into Zombies and Zombies will transform into Drowned
23. Skeleton Horses can now be ridden underwater
24. Skeletons and Strays will switch from ranged to melee attacks while underwater and switch back when out of water
25. Coral blocks will no longer die as long as one side is touching water
26. Improved player swimming at the surface of water
27. Tridents can now be enchanted with Mending and Unbreaking
28. Added an animation when using Riptide in first person perspective
29. Slightly decreased the friction of Blue Ice
30. Updated the texture of the top of Kelp
31. Updated the texture of Cooked Fish
32. Updated the Riptide spin texture
33. Default Field of View has been reduced from 70 to 60 and can be adjusted in Video Settings
34. Tridents will no longer break blocks in Creative mode
35. The Inventory button has been moved to the top of the Store page
36. Crashes/Performance
37. Fixed several crashes that occurred during gameplay
38. Fixed a crash that occurred when suspending the game during world generation
39. Fixed a crash that occurred when a Piston moved a Cauldron underwater
40. Fixed a crash that occurred when playing Truffletop Town and dying while using Elytra and Fireworks
41. Fixed a crash that occurred when searching the Store on Oculus Rift and Gear VR
42. Increased performance when viewing particles from the Ender Dragon's attack and lingering potions
43. Improved performance around Ocean Monuments on Android devices ( MCPE-32523 )
44. General
45. Personal Game Mode is now fully applied in Game Settings when switched from Survival to Creative
46. The first mouse click after re-mapping an action to a key is now recognized
47. Players will no longer inherit the host's spawn, inventory, and location when rejoining a world with a Resource Pack removed
48. Fixed players not able to join worlds hosted by players who previously joined another player's world
49. Fixed the controller not being detected when resuming the game from suspended state after changing profiles
50. Changes made to the 'Trust Player Permissions' setting during world creation will now persist after loading into the world
51. Fixed an issue with saved worlds not syncing properly between Xbox One consoles
52. Players without an Xbox Live Gold membership can once again join and host LAN games on Xbox One
53. Resource and Behavior Packs are now properly enabled/disabled on Realms when restoring backups or replacing worlds
54. The Mob Griefing game rule now converts properly from Console Edition worlds
55. The 'Castaway' achievement no longer unlocks before completing the requirement
56. Gameplay
57. Flying speed now stays constant while descending in Creative mode
58. Players will no longer gradually drift up or down when swimming straight ahead
59. Fixed experience orbs not always being picked up by players
60. Bone Meal is now depleted when used on Kelp from a Dispenser
61. Dropped items can once again pass under top slabs ( MCPE-25100 )
62. Tall birch trees will once again generate in Mutated Birch Forests ( MCPE-29698 )
63. Fixed water flow being inconsistent and suspended around caves and ravines
64. Splash Water Bottles will now keep Dolphins hydrated on land
65. Pick Block now works in Survival mode ( MCPE-12456 )
66. Pick Block now selects the proper variant of Buttons and Pressure Plates ( MCPE-31887 )
67. Players can no longer refill breath and breathe underwater by swimming into ice blocks
68. Sneaking and jumping into water no longer prevents jumping or swimming upwards ( MCPE-32478 )
69. Riptide can no longer be used while riding a mount
70. Fixed entering a Minecart from another Minecart ( MCPE-32074 )
71. Passengers in boats will now take damage when falling from a high place
72. Fire Resistance once again protects players from Blaze ranged attacks
73. Fixed an exploit that allowed players to get infinite lava buckets ( MCPE-33280 )
74. Fixed an exploit that generated unlimited items and XP from furnaces
75. Players without permission can no longer attack mobs shooting arrows at them
76. Protection enchantments once again protects players from all types of damage ( MCPE-32945 )
77. The Friendly Fire game rule now prevents damage from players using Fire Aspect, Flame, and Channeling enchantments
78. Decreased the damage given by standing in lava when armor with Fire Protection and Protection enchantments is equipped
79. TNT exploding underwater no longer deals damage to players and other entities
80. Activating a Dispenser with its exit covered and a bucket of fish inside will now drop the bucket of fish as an item
81. Items
82. The Trident will now be thrown the direction the cursor is pointing when playing in VR
83. Fixed Tridents damaging multiple mobs in a single throw
84. Tridents can no longer be destroyed by explosions
85. Tridents thrown into Soul Sand now land properly and no longer prevent Loyalty from working ( MCPE-32412 )
86. Tridents thrown underwater will no longer produce infinite bubbles
87. Tridents fired from a Dispenser no longer have the exact same trajectory and will now lose durability
88. Woodland Explorer Maps once again point players correctly to Woodland Mansions ( MCPE-33534 )
89. Items will no longer get stuck in flowing water source blocks ( MCPE-32389 )
90. Dropped items no longer float against the water current ( MCPE-33628 )
91. Fixed received items disappearing after trading a renamed item with a Villager ( MCPE-33830 )
92. Throwable items will no longer hit the player when there is a Parrot riding on their shoulder
93. It's once again possible to eat Raw Fish
94. Leather Horse Armor no longer loses its dyed color after world conversion
95. Arrows fired by Skeletons can no longer be picked up by players
96. Leads and Balloons can no longer be attached to Horses being ridden by players
97. Banners are no longer consumed from the inventory when placed in Creative mode
98. Mobs
99. The Ender Dragon will no longer get stuck if the player moves too far away. Silly dragon! ( MCPE-31765 )
100. Dolphins and Cod no longer get the jitters when swimming in groups
101. Silverfish can once again enter Stone blocks
102. Increased the collision size of fish mobs
103. Donkeys and Mules no longer become Horses after Console Edition world conversion
104. Mobs will no longer rotate their heads 360 degrees while in Boats
105. Baby animals will no longer take damage in boats
106. Zombie Villagers created during world generation are no longer super-fast and scary
107. Fixed issues with Zombie pathfinding and not attacking players
108. Guardians once again spawn in valid water source blocks ( MCPE-29520 )
109. Fixed two Elder Guardians sometimes spawning in each chamber of an Ocean Monument
110. Arrows fired by Skeletons and Strays can now damage the Wither
111. Dolphins can no longer fully clip through Magma Blocks
112. Mobs will no longer spawn on top of Redstone components ( MCPE-27122 )
113. Pumpkins are now consumed when creating an Iron Golem
114. Salmon will no longer get stuck on the edges of Old Worlds
115. Blocks
116. Fixed the hitbox of Coral Fans
117. Blocks can no longer be placed with no other block to support it when sprint-flying underwater in Creative mode
118. Command Blocks can now be modified when set to 'Repeat' and 'Always Active'
119. Fixed blocks that were removed underwater not creating source water blocks
120. Ice placed on Magma blocks in the Nether no longer create water source blocks when melted
121. Powered Observers now convert properly from Console Edition worlds
122. Cauldrons with varying levels of water now convert properly from Console Edition worlds
123. TNT can no long deal damage or destroy blocks underwater when placed on non-full blocks
124. Crops will no longer grow by repeatedly placing a full size, non-transparent block on top of them
125. Blocks can once again be repeatedly placed when flying sideways in Creative mode
126. Decreased the time is takes to break Coral Fans in Survival
127. Redstone, Torches, and Redstone Torches can no longer be placed on Seagrass underwater
128. Lava falling onto a water block with Seagrass or Kelp from will now become Stone
129. Armor Stands can now be destroyed by thrown Tridents
130. Fixed water flowing incorrectly from stairs that contained water source blocks
131. Blocks can no longer be placed underwater without highlighting another block while sprint-swimming in Creative mode
132. Top Snow will now break once it hits water
133. Top Snow falling on a Snow block no longer loses one layer
134. World Generation
135. Ice bergs, Sea Grass, and Kelp can no longer replace blocks of an Ocean Monument when generated
136. Mutated Savanna Plateau and Mutated Mesa Plateau biomes now convert properly from old worlds
137. All overhangs and floating islands will once again generate with grass or snow under them ( MCPE-32572 )
138. Bryce Mesa biomes will now generate correctly ( MCPE-30612 )
139. Graphical
140. The surface of water can now be seen when viewing from behind glass underwater
141. Fixed water not rendering when swimming against the bottom of a block
142. Fixed water not rendering when viewed at certain angles near the surface
143. Rain no longer severely limits view distance
144. Entities no longer become invisible based on the position of the observing player
145. Fixed the mining cracking animation being out of sync when mining from a boat
146. Particles now appear when player jump into water
147. Particles now appear when Tropical Fish flop into the water
148. Double doors once again display correctly
149. Fixed the texture of Dark Prismarine Stairs
150. Fixed water coloring in mutated biomes
151. Fixed the glint on enchanted Tridents in first person
152. F ixed the rotation of Tridents while charging in first person
153. Fixed some chunk rendering that caused players to see through the ground at certain angles ( MCPE-30626 )
154. Minimized animation delays with large stacks of falling blocks
155. The Lead attach point no longer appears in front of the player when swimming
156. Fixed some visual issues with Kelp
157. Lava will now render when the player's perspective is right below the surface
158. Fixed Bows not appearing in the right hand when being charged ( MCPE-31990 )
159. Fixed the texture of the Wither's armor not appearing properly with several Texture Packs
160. Fixed the rotation of Oak Trapdoor textures
161. Fixed seam lines appearing between Cactus blocks on the City Texture Pack
162. Improved swimming motion when using full VR mode
163. Players can no longer see through blocks while swimming against blocks in Virtual Living Room mode on Oculus Rift and Gear VR
164. Fixed missing water textures while underwater and a block is placed above the water ( MCPE-33264 / MCPE-32927 )
165. Glass once again renders properly at further distances and certain angles
166. All Button items now display properly in the hotbar and when placed in an Item Frame
167. Fixed the cracking animation not appearing when mining blocks through the water surface
168. Fixed textures on low-end devices when the Education toggle was enabled
169. Fixed the delay in Ice textures appearing when using the Frost Walker enchantment
170. Enchanted Tridents no longer flash red when entering fire
171. Fixed helmets being visible after being destroyed by taking damage from a mob
172. Water now appears properly around Ladders ( MCPE-32600 )
173. Flowing water now angles properly when flowing down
174. Flowing water touching Stairs that contains a water source no longer causes water to flow from the solid face of the Stairs
175. Hay Bales now have the correct bottom texture when held or seen in Item Frames
176. Audio
177. Fixed some Update Aquatic sound effects not playing on low memory devices ( MCPE-30843 )
178. Beacons now have sound effects
179. The drinking sound is no longer played twice when drinking a potion or Milk
180. User Interface
181. The 'Sign In' button will now disappear from the main menu after signing in
182. Pressing the 'Default Settings' button will now only affect the control scheme that is selected
183. Improved messaging when there are no Old Worlds to sync
184. A controller tooltip will now appear when it is possible to place blocks underwater
185. Fixed the Marker on Treasure Maps disappearing when another player quits and rejoins a world
186. Cached Data once again appears on the Storage screen
187. Enchantment names can now be seen on the Enchantment Table screen with Pocket UI when using keyboard and mouse
188. Image thumbnails and game modes for worlds and world templates will now appear when searching on the Storage screen
189. The book on the Enchantment Table screen no longer overlaps the suggested enchantment's name
190. Fixed spelling errors for Anemone and Red Lipped Blenny Tropical Fish
191. The "Manage who can send you invites" button in Profile settings now points to the proper location ( MCPE-28270 )
192. Pressing down on the controller no longer loses focus on the chat field
193. Changes to a world's name when it is initially created from a template will now update properly after saving and quitting
194. The paper doll no longer sticks out of the frame on the inventory screen while swimming
195. Fixed Slowness levels over 4 not appearing on the Mob Effects screen
196. The player model in the skin picker no longer covers the rotate icons in certain GUI scales ( MCPE-32545 )
197. Commands
198. The coordinates of Buried Treasure are now accurate when using the '/locate' command
199. Seagrass obtained by commands is now functional and stackable
200. Special symbols in a player’s nickname no longer cause a syntax error when trying to teleport that player from the Host Options tab
201. Using the '/spreadplayers' command will no longer set entities or players at y=255
202. Ladders no longer appear as invisible blocks with collision when placed using '/setblock'
203. Map items now have the proper name displayed in chat for players when using commands
204. Replacing or moving containers no longer causes the items from the container to drop to the ground
205. Updated templates for 1.5.0 with new assets and behaviors can be downloaded at minecraft.net/addons
206. Humanoid mobs can now hold items in their offhand. See 'drowned.json' for an example

**Update:** https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360007164271-Minecraft-1-5-0-Bedrock
